original: @8a # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @8a # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: su ga ta ma to bi bhi ga bh'a shryam /
analyzed: su ga ta ma to bi bhi ga bh'a shryam /
translated: SugatamatavibhangabhƒÅ·π£ya

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i gzhung rnam par 'byed pa'i bshad pa /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i gzhung rnam par 'byed pa'i bshad pa /
translated: Explanation of the Differentiation of the Sugata's Texts

original: 'phags pa 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the noble Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, the youthful one.

original: rtag tu shar zhing rgyun 'phel ba yi yon tan mnga' //
analyzed: rtag tu shar zhing rgyun 'phel ba yi yon tan mnga' //
translated: You possess qualities that always shine and increase,

original: nyes pa rjes 'brel spangs shing dri med mdzes pa'i sku //
analyzed: nyes pa rjes 'brel spangs shing dri med mdzes pa'i sku //
translated: Your stainless and beautiful body is free from the pursuit of faults,

original: rmongs sel gsung gi 'od mnga' sngon med zla ba ste //
analyzed: rmongs sel gsung gi 'od mnga' sngon med zla ba ste //
translated: You are the unprecedented moon possessing the light of speech that dispels delusion,

original: gsung gi dbang phyug la ni rtag par mgos phyag 'tshal //
analyzed: gsung gi dbang phyug la ni rtag par mgos phyag 'tshal //
translated: I constantly bow my head to the lord of speech.

original: thub dbang zhabs kyi padma la //
analyzed: thub dbang zhabs kyi padma la //
translated: At the lotus feet of the lord of sages,

original: brten pa rnams kyi rnam dbye ni //üîΩblo dman rnams kyis rab rtogs par //
analyzed: brten pa rnams kyi rnam dbye ni // blo dman rnams kyis rab rtogs par //
translated: The distinctions of those who rely on himüîΩShould be explained by one who wishes to accomplish

original: bsgrub par 'dod pas bshad par bya //
analyzed: bsgrub par 'dod pas bshad par bya //
translated: So that those of lesser intelligence may fully understand.

original: 'dir chos mngon pa nyi 'og gi yul pa la sogs pa'i bye brag sangs rgyas pa'i dbye ba shin tu mang mod kyi /
analyzed: 'dir chos mngon pa nyi 'og gi yul pa la sogs pa'i bye brag sangs rgyas pa'i dbye ba shin tu mang mod kyi /
translated: Here, although there are a great many divisions of Buddhists, such as the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas of AparƒÅntaka and so on,

original: gtso bo ji lta bur kha che bye brag tu smra ba dang / mdo sde pa dang / rnal 'byor spyod pa dang / dbu ma pa'i dbye bas sangs rgyas pa bzhi po tsam bla chos su rtogs par 'dod pa'i skye bo rjes su gzung bar bzhed pa'i gzhung rtsom pa pos /
analyzed: gtso bo ji lta bur kha che bye brag tu smra ba dang / mdo sde pa dang / rnal 'byor spyod pa dang / dbu ma pa'i dbye bas sangs rgyas pa bzhi po tsam bla chos su rtogs par 'dod pa'i skye bo rjes su gzung bar bzhed pa'i gzhung rtsom pa pos /
translated: The author of this text, who wishes to guide those who assert that the four schools of Buddhism‚Äîthe VaibhƒÅ·π£ika, SautrƒÅntika, YogƒÅcƒÅra, and Madhyamaka‚Äîare the four main tenets, states that he will present the tenets in just that way.

original: de kho na bzhin du rnam par 'jog pa @8b gsungs pa /
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du rnam par 'jog pa @8b gsungs pa /
translated: He says:

original: nam mkha' dang ni 'gog pa gnyis //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang ni 'gog pa gnyis //
translated: Space and the two cessations

original: 'dus ma byas gsum rtag pa ste //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas gsum rtag pa ste //
translated: are the three unconditioned phenomena that are permanent.

original: kha che ba de dag ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi dbye bas dngos po rnams tshogs gnyis su smra bar grag go //
analyzed: kha che ba de dag ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi dbye bas dngos po rnams tshogs gnyis su smra bar grag go //
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ika say that phenomena are divided into two groups: conditioned and unconditioned.

original: de la 'dus ma byas ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la 'dus ma byas ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three types of unconditioned phenomena:

original: nam mkha' dang 'gog pa gnyis so //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang 'gog pa gnyis so //
translated: space and the two cessations.

original: nam mkha' zhes bya ba 'di ci zhe na /
analyzed: nam mkha' zhes bya ba 'di ci zhe na /
translated: What is space?

original: gang 'ga' la yang sgrib par mi byed cing gang gis kyang bsgrib par bya ba ma yin pa de ni go 'byed pas na nam mkha' zhes bya ste /üîΩde la nam mkha' mi sgrib pa zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang 'ga' la yang sgrib par mi byed cing gang gis kyang bsgrib par bya ba ma yin pa de ni go 'byed pas na nam mkha' zhes bya ste / de la nam mkha' mi sgrib pa zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Space is called ‚Äúnonobstructive‚Äù because it does not obstruct anything and is not obstructed by anything.

original: 'gog pa gnyis ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa dang / so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa gnyis ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa dang / so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa'o //
translated: The two cessations are analytical cessation and nonanalytical cessation.

original: de la so sor rtog pa ni so sor brtags pa shes rab yin la /
analyzed: de la so sor rtog pa ni so sor brtags pa shes rab yin la /
translated: Discernment is analytical wisdom.

original: des thob par bya ba'i 'gog pa ni nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: des thob par bya ba'i 'gog pa ni nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: Cessation that is attained by that is freedom from affliction.

original: de yang spang bar bya ba so sor tha dad pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang spang bar bya ba so sor tha dad pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, that which is to be abandoned is individually distinct.

original: ldan pa'i rdzas rnams ji snyed pa //
analyzed: ldan pa'i rdzas rnams ji snyed pa //
translated: As many substances there are of possession,

original: bral ba'i rdzas kyang de snyed do //
analyzed: bral ba'i rdzas kyang de snyed do //
translated: there are that many substances of freedom.

original: rgyu'i tshogs pas stong pa'i dngos po skye ba la gtan du gegs byed pa'i chos gang yin pa de ni so sor brtags pas thob par bya ba ma yin pas na /
analyzed: rgyu'i tshogs pas stong pa'i dngos po skye ba la gtan du gegs byed pa'i chos gang yin pa de ni so sor brtags pas thob par bya ba ma yin pas na /
translated: That which is a permanent obstruction to the arising of a thing that is empty of the collection of causes is not attained by analysis.

original: so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa zhes brjod de /
analyzed: so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa zhes brjod de /
translated: It is called nonanalytical cessation.

original: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa gang //
analyzed: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa gang //
translated: What is analytical cessation?

original: bral ba'o so so so so yin ;
analyzed: bral ba'o so so so so yin ;
translated: It is freedom, which is individual.üîΩWhat is the other cessation?

original: / skye la gtan du gegs byed pa //
analyzed: / skye la gtan du gegs byed pa //
translated: It is the permanent obstruction of arising.

original: 'gog gzhan so sor brtags min pas //üîΩzhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gog gzhan so sor brtags min pas // zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is nonanalytical cessation.

original: 'dus ma byas gsum po 'di ni 'dus byas las bzlog pa skye ba dang 'jig pa dang bral bas na rtag pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas gsum po 'di ni 'dus byas las bzlog pa skye ba dang 'jig pa dang bral bas na rtag pa yin gyi /
translated: These three unconditioned things are permanent because they are free from arising and destruction, which are the opposites of conditioned things.

original: gzhan dag gi spyi la sogs pa lta bu ni ma yin no ;
analyzed: gzhan dag gi spyi la sogs pa lta bu ni ma yin no ;
translated: They are not like the universals and so on of other schools.

original: / gsum po 'di las gzhan pa phung po lnga'i bdag nyid kyi /üîΩ'dus byas thams cad skad cig ma /üîΩrgyu dang rkyen tshogs shing 'dus nas byas pa'i dngos po'i rnam pa mtha' dag ni skad cig ma yin te /
analyzed: / gsum po 'di las gzhan pa phung po lnga'i bdag nyid kyi / 'dus byas thams cad skad cig ma / rgyu dang rkyen tshogs shing 'dus nas byas pa'i dngos po'i rnam pa mtha' dag ni skad cig ma yin te /
translated: All conditioned things other than these three are momentary.

original: skyes pa'i skad cig ma tsam kho na yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes pa'i skad cig ma tsam kho na yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: All things that are produced by the assembly and aggregation of causes and conditions are momentary because they exist for just a moment after they arise.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i 'dus byas ni 'jig pa'i khongs su 'jug par mthong la /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i 'dus byas ni 'jig pa'i khongs su 'jug par mthong la /
translated: Conditioned things such as form are seen to be included in destruction.

original: de ngo bo gang gi sgo nas mthar 'jig par 'gyur ba de ni de skyes pa tsam kha na yod pas na /
analyzed: de ngo bo gang gi sgo nas mthar 'jig par 'gyur ba de ni de skyes pa tsam kha na yod pas na /
translated: Whatever is the essence of that which is ultimately destroyed, that is merely a name.üîΩ

original: skye ba'i de ma thag kho nar 'dir 'jig par 'gyur ba'i phyir /üîΩ'di skad cig ma yin par gsal lo //üîΩskye ba'i ngo bo gzhan yin la mtha' yang gzhan @9a * //
analyzed: skye ba'i de ma thag kho nar 'dir 'jig par 'gyur ba'i phyir / 'di skad cig ma yin par gsal lo // skye ba'i ngo bo gzhan yin la mtha' yang gzhan @9a * //
translated: Since that which is essentially subject to ultimate destruction exists merely by being arisen, it is clear that it is momentary, because it is destroyed immediately after it arises.

original: yin no zhes kyang brjod par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yin no zhes kyang brjod par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not possible to say that the nature of arising is one thing and the nature of destruction is another.

original: ngo bo de las tha mi dad pa na de dag 'dra bar tha mi dad par thal ba'i phyir dang / de ngo bo las tha dad pa na de dang 'dra bar tha dad par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo de las tha mi dad pa na de dag 'dra bar tha mi dad par thal ba'i phyir dang / de ngo bo las tha dad pa na de dang 'dra bar tha dad par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If they are not different from that nature, it follows that they are not different in being similar to it. If they are different from that nature, it follows that they are different in being similar to it.

original: ji ste dus re zhig gnas nas ldog pa gang yin pa 'di nyid de dag gi rang gi rgyus bskyed pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ji ste dus re zhig gnas nas ldog pa gang yin pa 'di nyid de dag gi rang gi rgyus bskyed pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is the very reversal of that which endures for a while that is generated by the intrinsic nature produced by its cause,

original: de ltar de skyes pa tsam gyi rang bzhin ji lta bu yin pa de kho na lta bu mthar yang yin pas na /
analyzed: de ltar de skyes pa tsam gyi rang bzhin ji lta bu yin pa de kho na lta bu mthar yang yin pas na /
translated: then just as it is the intrinsic nature of that which is arisen, so it is the intrinsic nature of that which is ultimately destroyed.

original: yang dus de srid kho nar gnas par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: yang dus de srid kho nar gnas par 'gyur zhing /
translated: It would endure for just that duration.

original: slar yang de lta bu yin pas na nam yang ni gnas par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: slar yang de lta bu yin pas na nam yang ni gnas par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And since it would be like that again, it would never disintegrate.

original: de'i phyir skad cig gnyis su gnas skyes pa yin na skad cig dang po bzhin du skad cig gnyis pa la yang skad cig gnyis su gnas pa yin pas na /
analyzed: de'i phyir skad cig gnyis su gnas skyes pa yin na skad cig dang po bzhin du skad cig gnyis pa la yang skad cig gnyis su gnas pa yin pas na /
translated: Therefore, if it endures for two moments, like the first moment, it would endure for a second moment.

original: skad cig gzhan du gnas par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: skad cig gzhan du gnas par 'gyur zhing /
translated: It would endure for another moment.

original: der yang de lta bu yin pas na nam yang 'jig par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: der yang de lta bu yin pas na nam yang 'jig par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And since it would be like that again, it would never disintegrate.

original: 'di snyam du dngos po de ni brtan pa kho nar rang gi rgyu las skyes pa yin te ;
analyzed: 'di snyam du dngos po de ni brtan pa kho nar rang gi rgyu las skyes pa yin te ;
translated: If you think that thing is stable and arises from its own cause,

original: de ni mthar yang ngo bo gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin la /
analyzed: de ni mthar yang ngo bo gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin la /
translated: and that it does not transform into another entity in the end,

original: 'on kyang 'gog byed kyi nan gyis 'jig par byed pa yin no snyam na de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'gog byed kyi nan gyis 'jig par byed pa yin no snyam na de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: and that it is destroyed by the force of an agent that causes cessation, that is not correct.

original: 'di ltar gal te de 'gog byed nye yang snga ma kho na bzhin du 'jig pa'i ngang can ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te de 'gog byed nye yang snga ma kho na bzhin du 'jig pa'i ngang can ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na ni /
translated: Thus, if it is not a nature that is subject to destruction, even though the cause of its cessation is near, it would not be subject to destruction, just as it was before.

original: 'o na de'i tshe yang 'jig par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na de'i tshe yang 'jig par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is so, then it would not be subject to destruction even at that time.

original: de 'jig pa'i ngang can ma yin yang des 'jig par byed do zhe na /
analyzed: de 'jig pa'i ngang can ma yin yang des 'jig par byed do zhe na /
translated: If it is not subject to destruction, but it is destroyed by that,

original: de ni mi 'jig go //
analyzed: de ni mi 'jig go //
translated: then it would not be destroyed.

original: de la 'jig pa ni yod do zhes bya ba 'di ltar rigs par 'gyur te /üîΩlhas byin ni gson no //
analyzed: de la 'jig pa ni yod do zhes bya ba 'di ltar rigs par 'gyur te / lhas byin ni gson no //
translated: It would be reasonable to say that it exists in this way: ‚ÄúIts destruction exists.‚ÄùüîΩIt is not possible to say, ‚ÄúDevadatta is alive,‚Äù

original: 'di 'chi bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ni srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di 'chi bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ni srid pa ma yin no //
translated: and ‚ÄúHe will die.‚Äù

original: ji ste 'jig par 'gyur na mi 'jig pa'i ngang can ji ltar yin te /
analyzed: ji ste 'jig par 'gyur na mi 'jig pa'i ngang can ji ltar yin te /
translated: If it is destroyed, how could it be a nature that is not subject to destruction?

original: 'chi bar ni 'gyur la mi 'chi ba'i chos can yin pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'chi bar ni 'gyur la mi 'chi ba'i chos can yin pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that it is subject to death, but it is not subject to destruction.

original: 'gog byed nye ba na 'jig pa'i ngang can gyi ngo bo nyid du skyed do zhe na /
analyzed: 'gog byed nye ba na 'jig pa'i ngang can gyi ngo bo nyid du skyed do zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is produced as a nature that is subject to destruction when the cause of its cessation is near,

original: ci sngar gyi 'jig pa'i ngang can ma yin pa'i ngo bo rjes su 'jug pa yod dam /
analyzed: ci sngar gyi 'jig pa'i ngang can ma yin pa'i ngo bo rjes su 'jug pa yod dam /
translated: is the previous nature that is not subject to destruction still present?

original: 'on te med /
analyzed: 'on te med /
translated: Or is it not?

original: gal te yod na 'o na de 'jig pa yang ma yin mi 'jig pa yang ma yin pas na /
analyzed: gal te yod na 'o na de 'jig pa yang ma yin mi 'jig pa yang ma yin pas na /
translated: If it does exist, then it is neither destroyed nor not destroyed.

original: rgal bar dka' ba'i sdug bsngal nyam nga bar chud pa yin no //
analyzed: rgal bar dka' ba'i sdug bsngal nyam nga bar chud pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is immersed in a terrible suffering that is difficult to cross over.

original: gal te med na ni de dang tha mi dad pas na sngar gyi dngos po de yang med pa'i phyir gang la 'jig pa'i ngang can skyed par byed /
analyzed: gal te med na ni de dang tha mi dad pas na sngar gyi dngos po de yang med pa'i phyir gang la 'jig pa'i ngang can skyed par byed /
translated: If it does not exist, then because it is not different from that, the previous entity also does not exist. Therefore, what is produced that has the nature of destruction?

original: de nas 'jig pa'i ngang can ma yin na @9b 'ga' yang 'jig par mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang / 'jig pa yang mthong bas na /
analyzed: de nas 'jig pa'i ngang can ma yin na @9b 'ga' yang 'jig par mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang / 'jig pa yang mthong bas na /
translated: If it does not have the nature of destruction, then it is not tenable that anything is destroyed.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rang gi rgyu las 'jig pa'i ngang can kho nar skye bas na /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rang gi rgyu las 'jig pa'i ngang can kho nar skye bas na /
translated: Since destruction is also seen, form and so on are produced from their own causes as having the nature of destruction.

original: skyes pa tsam kho na 'jig pa yin zhing /
analyzed: skyes pa tsam kho na 'jig pa yin zhing /
translated: Therefore, mere production is itself destruction.

original: de lta na yang skad cig ma 'jig pa 'grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang skad cig ma 'jig pa 'grub pa yin no //
translated: In this way, the destruction of momentary entities is established.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi tshe 'jig pa'i ngang can yin pa de ni de'i tshe de ma thag tu mi gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi tshe 'jig pa'i ngang can yin pa de ni de'i tshe de ma thag tu mi gnas pa yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever is the nature of destruction is not present at that time, because it does not remain immediately after that.

original: dper na mtha'i skad cig la gnas pa'i ngo bo bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mtha'i skad cig la gnas pa'i ngo bo bzhin no //
translated: For example, like the entity that endures in the final moment.

original: gzugs la sogs pa yang skye ba'i dus na 'jig pa'i ngang can yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa yang skye ba'i dus na 'jig pa'i ngang can yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: And form, etc., also, at the time of arising, have the nature of destruction. This is a reason based on nature.

original: gal te dngos po rnams skad cig mas 'jig pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po rnams skad cig mas 'jig pa yin na /
translated: If things are destroyed moment by moment,

original: 'o na de nyid 'di yin no snyam pa'i ngo shes pa ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de nyid 'di yin no snyam pa'i ngo shes pa ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: then how is it that one recognizes, ‚ÄúThis is that very thing‚Äù?

original: rgyun mi 'chad par 'dra bas gzhan dang gzhan 'byung ba dang / ma rig pa dang rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad par 'dra bas gzhan dang gzhan 'byung ba dang / ma rig pa dang rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the similarity of the uninterrupted continuum, another and another arises, and because of the connection with ignorance.

original: skad cig ma 'jig pa'i dus kho na de dang 'dra ba'i skad cig ma gzhan 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: skad cig ma 'jig pa'i dus kho na de dang 'dra ba'i skad cig ma gzhan 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: At the very time of the destruction of the moment, another moment like it arises.

original: des ni rnam pa mi 'dra ba med pa'i phyir dang dngos po med pas bar du ma chod pa'i phyir dang / ma rig pas g-yer bag bcos pa rnams la tha dad pa yin yang de nyid 'di yin no snyam du tha dad pa med par zhen pa'i rtog pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: des ni rnam pa mi 'dra ba med pa'i phyir dang dngos po med pas bar du ma chod pa'i phyir dang / ma rig pas g-yer bag bcos pa rnams la tha dad pa yin yang de nyid 'di yin no snyam du tha dad pa med par zhen pa'i rtog pa 'byung ste /
translated: Because it is not different in aspect, because it is not an object, because it is not obstructed, and because it is confused by ignorance, the thought that conceives the nondifferent as different arises.üîΩJust as when hair and nails grow again after being cut off, the thought that they are the same arises, even though they are completely different.

original: dregs nas slar skyes pa'i skra dang sen mo la sogs pa shin tu tha dad pa la yang de nyid 'di yin no snyam pa'i shes pa mthong ba de bzhin du 'dir yang ji ste mi srid /
analyzed: dregs nas slar skyes pa'i skra dang sen mo la sogs pa shin tu tha dad pa la yang de nyid 'di yin no snyam pa'i shes pa mthong ba de bzhin du 'dir yang ji ste mi srid /
translated: Why is it impossible to think that the self is like that?

original: ci 'o na 'dus byas 'di ji ltar gzhan dag 'dod pa bzhin du bdag gis byin gyis brlabs pa yin nam /
analyzed: ci 'o na 'dus byas 'di ji ltar gzhan dag 'dod pa bzhin du bdag gis byin gyis brlabs pa yin nam /
translated: Well then, is this compounded phenomenon blessed by me in the way that others assert?

original: de dag ni 'di skad du lus la sogs pa las tha dad pa dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyis byed pa de'i 'bras bu'i myong ba po rtog pa dang khyab pa'i ngo bo bdag ces bya ba rdzas gzhan yod pa yin la /
analyzed: de dag ni 'di skad du lus la sogs pa las tha dad pa dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyis byed pa de'i 'bras bu'i myong ba po rtog pa dang khyab pa'i ngo bo bdag ces bya ba rdzas gzhan yod pa yin la /
translated: They say that the self is a different substance from the body and so on, that it is the experiencer of the result of the karma of virtue and nonvirtue created by it, and that it is the nature of thought and pervasion.

original: des sna tshogs la khyab pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: des sna tshogs la khyab pa yin mod kyi /
translated: It is true that it pervades the various parts of the body,

original: 'on kyang nye bar longs spyod pa'i gnas nyid du yongs su bzung ba'i gson po'i lus gang yin pa de kho na bdag dang bcas pa zhes brjod do zhes smra'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang nye bar longs spyod pa'i gnas nyid du yongs su bzung ba'i gson po'i lus gang yin pa de kho na bdag dang bcas pa zhes brjod do zhes smra'o zhe na /
translated: but the body that is the basis of the experience of pleasure and pain is the self.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: This is not so, because the verse says,

original: bdag gis stong zhing zhes smos te /
analyzed: bdag gis stong zhing zhes smos te /
translated: ‚Äúit is empty of self.‚Äù

original: bdag gis stong zhing bral te byin gyis ma brlabs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gis stong zhing bral te byin gyis ma brlabs pa'o //
translated: It is empty of self, devoid of self, and not empowered by self.

original: 'di ltar re zhig bdag sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar re zhig bdag sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, first of all, there is no valid cognition that establishes the self.

original: mngon sum gyis bdag rtog pa ma yin te /üîΩmig la sogs pa'i shes pa ni gzugs la @10a * //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis bdag rtog pa ma yin te / mig la sogs pa'i shes pa ni gzugs la @10a * //
translated: The self is not cognized by direct perception,üîΩbecause the five sense consciousnesses, such as visual consciousness, are restricted to their own objects, such as visible form.

original: sogs pa'i yul lngar nges pa'i phyir dang / bdag tu rtog pa'i yid kyi shes pa'i yul yang lus la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sogs pa'i yul lngar nges pa'i phyir dang / bdag tu rtog pa'i yid kyi shes pa'i yul yang lus la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The object of the mental consciousness that conceives a self is the body.

original: bdag dkar sham mo bdag sbom mo bdag 'gro'o snyam pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas bdag tu shes pa 'byung la /
analyzed: bdag dkar sham mo bdag sbom mo bdag 'gro'o snyam pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas bdag tu shes pa 'byung la /
translated: The cognition of the self occurs in the form of thoughts such as ‚Äúthe self is fair,‚Äù ‚Äúthe self is fat,‚Äù and ‚Äúthe self is walking.‚Äù

original: lus las tha dad pa 'di la ni lus de'i chos dkar sham nyid dang sbom pa nyid yod pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: lus las tha dad pa 'di la ni lus de'i chos dkar sham nyid dang sbom pa nyid yod pa ma yin zhing /
translated: But this, which is different from the body, does not have the qualities of the body, such as its whiteness and its plumpness.

original: khyab byed lus can ma yin pa la lus can gyi rdzas kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i 'gro ba'i bya ba 'thad pa dang ldan pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: khyab byed lus can ma yin pa la lus can gyi rdzas kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i 'gro ba'i bya ba 'thad pa dang ldan pa yang ma yin no //
translated: And it is not tenable that the nonpervading, which is not embodied, should follow the embodied substance, the action of going.

original: 'di bram ze'i khye'u la seng ge zhes pa bzhin du brtags par rtog pa yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'di bram ze'i khye'u la seng ge zhes pa bzhin du brtags par rtog pa yang mi rigs te /
translated: It is also not reasonable to imagine that this is like the case of the young brahmin Si·πÖgha,

original: g-yo ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: g-yo ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not moving.

original: g-yo ba med pa la btags pa bar rtog pa yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: g-yo ba med pa la btags pa bar rtog pa yang mi rigs te /
translated: It is also not reasonable to imagine that it is imputed to the unmoving,

original: dngos kyi tha snyad rgyun chad par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos kyi tha snyad rgyun chad par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that the conventional term would be interrupted.

original: rjes su dpag pas rtogs pa yang yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas rtogs pa yang yin te /
translated: It is also not understood through inference,

original: rang bzhin dang 'bras bu'i rtags med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang 'bras bu'i rtags med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no evidence of nature or effect.

original: rtag tu lkog tu gyur cing yul dang dus su ldog pa med pa'i bdag dang 'ga' yang rjes su 'gro ba dag ldog pa'i bdag nyid can gyi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo ma grub pas na 'bras bu'i rtags mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang / chos can yod pa nyid ma grub pas na rang bzhin gyi rtags mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag tu lkog tu gyur cing yul dang dus su ldog pa med pa'i bdag dang 'ga' yang rjes su 'gro ba dag ldog pa'i bdag nyid can gyi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo ma grub pas na 'bras bu'i rtags mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang / chos can yod pa nyid ma grub pas na rang bzhin gyi rtags mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since the self is always hidden, and since it is not possible to reverse the object and time, the nature of cause and effect is not established as having the nature of following and reversing. Therefore, the reason of effect is not tenable. And since the existence of the subject is not established, the reason of nature is not tenable.

original: gang gis rjes su dpog par 'gyur ba yod par sgrub par dbang ba'i rtags gzhan yang yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: gang gis rjes su dpog par 'gyur ba yod par sgrub par dbang ba'i rtags gzhan yang yod pa ma yin la /
translated: There is no other reason that is able to prove the existence of the self that is to be inferred.

original: rtags gzhan yod na yang bsgrub byas khyab par 'gyur dgos la /üîΩde ni 'gar yang ma grub pas na khyab par byed pa nyid du ma nges pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rtags gzhan yod na yang bsgrub byas khyab par 'gyur dgos la / de ni 'gar yang ma grub pas na khyab par byed pa nyid du ma nges pa'i phyir /
translated: Even if there were another reason, it would have to pervade the probandum.üîΩBut since that is not established anywhere, the pervader is not ascertained.

original: gang du yang gang gis kyang gang yang des khyab par nges par mi 'gyur bas na 'di la rtags 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: gang du yang gang gis kyang gang yang des khyab par nges par mi 'gyur bas na 'di la rtags 'ga' yang med do //
translated: Therefore, nowhere is anything ascertained to be pervaded by anything through anything. Thus there is no reason at all.

original: 'di snyam du gal te gson pa'i lus ni bdag dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gal te gson pa'i lus ni bdag dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: If you think that the living body is associated with a self,

original: rtags 'di'i phyir ro zhes sgrub na skyon 'dir 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: rtags 'di'i phyir ro zhes sgrub na skyon 'dir 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: because of this reason, then this is the error.

original: 'on kyang 'dod pa la sogs pa ni rten dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'dod pa la sogs pa ni rten dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: But if you think that desire and so on are associated with a support,

original: dngos po yin no zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po yin no zhe na /
translated: because they are things,

original: 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir na gzugs la sogs pa bzhin no zhes sgrub pa yin la /
analyzed: 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir na gzugs la sogs pa bzhin no zhes sgrub pa yin la /
translated: then we prove that they are like form and so on, because they are results.

original: 'dod pa la sogs pa'i rten gang yin pa 'di ni kho bo cag gi bdag yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: 'dod pa la sogs pa'i rten gang yin pa 'di ni kho bo cag gi bdag yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that whatever is the support of desire and so on is our self,

original: 'di la yang gal te rgyu la brten du 'dod na /
analyzed: 'di la yang gal te rgyu la brten du 'dod na /
translated: then if you assert that it is a cause,

original: de'i tshe kho bo cag kyang 'dod pa la sogs pa rgyu med par mi 'dod pas na @10b kho bo cag la grub pa yin pas na gtan tshigs don med pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe kho bo cag kyang 'dod pa la sogs pa rgyu med par mi 'dod pas na @10b kho bo cag la grub pa yin pas na gtan tshigs don med pa yin no //
translated: then we also do not assert that desire and so on are without a cause, so this is established for us, and therefore the reason is pointless.

original: 'on te rten gzhi yin na de'i 'bras bu yang yin la /
analyzed: 'on te rten gzhi yin na de'i 'bras bu yang yin la /
translated: But if it is a basis, then it is also a result.

original: gzhi dang mi ldan pa yang yin pa zhes bya ba'i bzlog pa la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma med pas na /
analyzed: gzhi dang mi ldan pa yang yin pa zhes bya ba'i bzlog pa la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma med pas na /
translated: Since there is no valid cognition that contradicts the reversal of the predicate,

original: ldog pa la the tshom za ba nyid kyis ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: ldog pa la the tshom za ba nyid kyis ma nges pa yin no //
translated: the reason is indeterminate because there is doubt about the reversal.

original: 'bras bu 'ga' yang gzhi dang mi ldan par mthong ba yin pas na thams cad de lta bur 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'bras bu 'ga' yang gzhi dang mi ldan par mthong ba yin pas na thams cad de lta bur 'gyur te /
translated: Since no effect is seen to be without a basis, all would be like that,

original: nges pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no cause for certainty.

original: gang yang gson pa'i lus ni bdag med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang yang gson pa'i lus ni bdag med pa ma yin te /
translated: Also, the body of a living being is not without a self,üîΩbecause it follows that it would not possess life and so on.

original: srog la sogs pa dang mi ldan par thal ba'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa de yang bdag sgrub par nus pa ma yin te ;
analyzed: srog la sogs pa dang mi ldan par thal ba'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa de yang bdag sgrub par nus pa ma yin te ;
translated: That is not capable of proving a self,

original: bdag med pa'i bum pa la sogs pas stong par mthong zhes te /
analyzed: bdag med pa'i bum pa la sogs pas stong par mthong zhes te /
translated: because a pot and so on that are without a self are seen to be empty.üîΩThe body of a living being would have to be like that now.

original: gson pa'i lus kyang da lta bur 'gyur dgos so zhes bya ba 'di la nges pa'i rgyu ni yod pa yin no //
analyzed: gson pa'i lus kyang da lta bur 'gyur dgos so zhes bya ba 'di la nges pa'i rgyu ni yod pa yin no //
translated: This is because there is a cause for certainty.

original: 'di ltar gang zhig gang dang bdag nyid 'ga' zhig gis mtshungs pa yang de dang de bdag nyid thams cad kyis mtshungs par mthong ba'am mi 'dod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang zhig gang dang bdag nyid 'ga' zhig gis mtshungs pa yang de dang de bdag nyid thams cad kyis mtshungs par mthong ba'am mi 'dod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Thus, when something is similar to something else in some respects, it is not that one does not see or accept that it is similar to that in all respects.

original: bum pa dang snam bu byas pa nyid dang bdag med pa nyid du mtshungs kyang bum pa dang bum pa ma yin pa nyid du mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bum pa dang snam bu byas pa nyid dang bdag med pa nyid du mtshungs kyang bum pa dang bum pa ma yin pa nyid du mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Although a pot and a cloth are similar in being produced and in being selfless, a pot is not similar to a cloth in being a pot.

original: bdag ni srog la sogs pa'i rgyu yang ma yin la khyab par byed pa'i rang bzhin yang ma yin pa'i ngo bo zhig yin grang /
analyzed: bdag ni srog la sogs pa'i rgyu yang ma yin la khyab par byed pa'i rang bzhin yang ma yin pa'i ngo bo zhig yin grang /
translated: The self is not the cause of life and so on, nor is it a pervading entity.

original: de la phyogs dang po la ni mig la sogs pa 'bras bu med par thal ba bzlog par dka' ste /
analyzed: de la phyogs dang po la ni mig la sogs pa 'bras bu med par thal ba bzlog par dka' ste /
translated: In the first case, it is difficult to avoid the consequence that the eyes and so on would be pointless.

original: 'di ltar gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa'i bdag nyid can gyi bdag rtag pa yod na /üîΩmig la sogs pa la nye bar mkho ba ci yang med la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa'i bdag nyid can gyi bdag rtag pa yod na / mig la sogs pa la nye bar mkho ba ci yang med la /
translated: If the permanent self that has the nature of observing form and so on existed,üîΩthere would be no need for the eyes and so on.

original: gang 'di dag nye bar mkho bar 'gyur ba ;
analyzed: gang 'di dag nye bar mkho bar 'gyur ba ;
translated: If the eyes and so on were needed,

original: bdag shes pa'i ngo bor smra ba rnams la dmigs pa mi brtag pa ni srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag shes pa'i ngo bor smra ba rnams la dmigs pa mi brtag pa ni srid pa ma yin no //
translated: It is impossible for those who assert the self to be the nature of consciousness to not conceive the object.üîΩEven if it is possible that the object is impermanent, the self that is the nature of the object is permanent and always exists.

original: de dmigs pa mi rtag pa 'ga' zhig srid kyang dmigs pa'i bdag nyid kyi bdag rtag pa rtag tu yod pas de srid du chug kyang dmigs pa'i bdag nyid kyi bdag rtag pa yod pa na dbang po rnams nye bar mkho ba dang bral ba'i gnas skabs deüîΩnyid yin te /
analyzed: de dmigs pa mi rtag pa 'ga' zhig srid kyang dmigs pa'i bdag nyid kyi bdag rtag pa rtag tu yod pas de srid du chug kyang dmigs pa'i bdag nyid kyi bdag rtag pa yod pa na dbang po rnams nye bar mkho ba dang bral ba'i gnas skabs de nyid yin te /
translated: But if the self that is the nature of the object is permanent, then the self would be devoid of the need for the sense faculties.

original: de'i tshe dmigs pa mi rtag par khas blangs pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: de'i tshe dmigs pa mi rtag par khas blangs pas ci zhig bya /
translated: In that case, what is the point of asserting that the object is impermanent?

original: mi rtag pa med na ma bcos pa'i rtag pa de dngos por 'dzin pa ma yin pa na de lta ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: mi rtag pa med na ma bcos pa'i rtag pa de dngos por 'dzin pa ma yin pa na de lta ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If the impermanent object does not exist, the permanent unfabricated self is not apprehended as a thing.

original: ma yin te /üîΩmi rtag pa'i sems pa dang bral yang sems pa can @11a * //
analyzed: ma yin te / mi rtag pa'i sems pa dang bral yang sems pa can @11a * //
translated: But if you say that is not so, that is not so.üîΩEven though the self that possesses consciousness is devoid of impermanent consciousness, it is untenable that it remains as the self that possesses consciousness.

original: gyi bdag de la sdod par ma 'thad pa'i phyir dang / sdod na yang thug pa med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gyi bdag de la sdod par ma 'thad pa'i phyir dang / sdod na yang thug pa med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it remains, it follows that it would be endless.

original: gzhan gyi tshe yang dngos po mi 'dzin pa na bdag rang nyid ni sems pa med pa kho na yin la /üîΩsems pa dang ldan pas na sems par byed do zhes bya bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshe yang dngos po mi 'dzin pa na bdag rang nyid ni sems pa med pa kho na yin la / sems pa dang ldan pas na sems par byed do zhes bya bar 'gyur la /
translated: But if it does not grasp things at the time of others, then it is certainly not a thinker.

original: mo gsham la ma nyid bzhin du rang nyid sems pa med pa ni sems pa'i bdag nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mo gsham la ma nyid bzhin du rang nyid sems pa med pa ni sems pa'i bdag nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And if it is a thinker, then it is not tenable that it is a thinker that is not a thinker by itself, like a barren woman‚Äôs son.

original: 'di rtag pa sems can du yang 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di rtag pa sems can du yang 'dod pa yin te /
translated: And it is asserted that this self is permanent and a sentient being.

original: de'i phyir nam yang mi sems par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: de'i phyir nam yang mi sems par mi 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore it would never not think.

original: de lta na yang mig la sogs pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de lta na yang mig la sogs pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur zhing /
translated: But in that case, the eye and so on would be pointless.

original: 'di dag don med par ni mthong ba'am 'dod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag don med par ni mthong ba'am 'dod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: And it is not seen or asserted that they are pointless.

original: 'di dag don dang ldan pa nyid 'di ni gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa rtag pa yin pa sel bar byed do //
analyzed: 'di dag don dang ldan pa nyid 'di ni gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa rtag pa yin pa sel bar byed do //
translated: The fact that they are not pointless refutes the idea that form and so on are permanent objects.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang med par gang dmigs pa dang ldan /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang med par gang dmigs pa dang ldan /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever is observed to be absent in the absence of something else

original: de ni dmigs pa na de la ltos pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni dmigs pa na de la ltos pa ma yin te /
translated: is not dependent on that other thing when it is observed.

original: dper na byi la byi ba dmigs pa na snang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na byi la byi ba dmigs pa na snang ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the appearance of a cat when a mouse is observed.

original: gzhan gyi lugs ltar na rtog pa po mig la sogs pa med par gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyi lugs ltar na rtog pa po mig la sogs pa med par gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: According to the other system, it is said that the one who conceives, without eyes, etc., possesses the observation of form, etc.

original: khyab byed 'gal ba dmigs pa'i thal ba yin la /
analyzed: khyab byed 'gal ba dmigs pa'i thal ba yin la /
translated: This is the consequence of the observation of the contradiction of the pervader.

original: de lta na yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta na yang ma yin te /
translated: However, it is not like that.

original: de na bzlog pa ni /
analyzed: de na bzlog pa ni /
translated: The reversal is this:

original: gang zhig gang dmigs pa na gang la ltos pa de ni de med par de dmigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang dmigs pa na gang la ltos pa de ni de med par de dmigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: When one observes something, that which depends on it does not possess the observation of it without that.

original: dper na mig nang na gnas pa'i dngos po dmigs pa na sgron ma la ltos pa dang bcas pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mig nang na gnas pa'i dngos po dmigs pa na sgron ma la ltos pa dang bcas pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, when the thing that is located in the eye is observed, it possesses the dependence on the lamp.

original: rtog pa po yang gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa na mig la sogs pa la ltos pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rtog pa po yang gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa na mig la sogs pa la ltos pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Also, when the one who conceives observes form, etc., he possesses the dependence on the eye, etc.

original: 'gal bas khyab pa dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'gal bas khyab pa dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is the observation of the contradiction of the pervaded.

original: 'di snyam du dbang po nye bar mi sbyor na gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa mi 'dod pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'di snyam du dbang po nye bar mi sbyor na gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa mi 'dod pa nyid de /
translated: If one thinks that when the sense faculty is not applied, the observation of form, etc., is not desired,

original: dmigs pa tsam ni gnas skabs thams cad du rjes su 'gro ba nyid 'dod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dmigs pa tsam ni gnas skabs thams cad du rjes su 'gro ba nyid 'dod pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is asserted that mere focal object is concomitant with all states.üîΩAs it is said:üîΩWhen the state of pleasure and so on of my person

original: kho bo'i skyes bus bde ba dang // bde sogs gnas skabs 'gro na yang //üîΩsems pa rdzas dang sems can sogs //üîΩngo bo 'dod par byed pa min //
analyzed: kho bo'i skyes bus bde ba dang // bde sogs gnas skabs 'gro na yang // sems pa rdzas dang sems can sogs // ngo bo 'dod par byed pa min //
translated: passes,üîΩI do not assert that the substance of mind and sentient beings

original: zhes gang smras pa yin no //üîΩdes na thal ba sgrub pa la gtan tshigs ma grub cing /
analyzed: zhes gang smras pa yin no // des na thal ba sgrub pa la gtan tshigs ma grub cing /
translated: and so on are the nature of that.

original: bzlog pa ni grub pa sgrub pa yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: bzlog pa ni grub pa sgrub pa yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: Thus you may think that the reason is not established in the proof of the reductio and that the reversal of the reason is established.

original: 'di la brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di la brjod par bya ste /
translated: In response to this, we say:

original: gal te dbang po nye bar mi sbyor ba na gzugs la @11b sogs pa dmigs par mi 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te dbang po nye bar mi sbyor ba na gzugs la @11b sogs pa dmigs par mi 'dod na /
translated: If you do not assert that form and so on are observed when the sense faculties do not engage them,

original: 'o na de nye bar sbyor ba na 'dod par 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'o na de nye bar sbyor ba na 'dod par 'gyur la /
translated: then you must assert that they are observed when they do engage them.

original: de lta na yang de'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa rnams de'i 'bras bu nyid las mi mnga' zhing /
analyzed: de lta na yang de'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa rnams de'i 'bras bu nyid las mi mnga' zhing /
translated: But even so, the things that are concomitant with and reverse with the sense faculties are not necessarily the effects of the sense faculties.

original: de dag de'i 'bras bu yin na yang /
analyzed: de dag de'i 'bras bu yin na yang /
translated: And even if they are the effects of the sense faculties,

original: gang zhig gnas skabs ma lus par rjes su 'gro bar 'gyur ba gzhan dmigs pa tsam lhag lus pa ci yod /
analyzed: gang zhig gnas skabs ma lus par rjes su 'gro bar 'gyur ba gzhan dmigs pa tsam lhag lus pa ci yod /
translated: What other object is there that is not included in all these states?

original: dmigs pa tsam des gal te ci yang mi dmigs na de ji ltar dmigs pa'i ngo bo yin /
analyzed: dmigs pa tsam des gal te ci yang mi dmigs na de ji ltar dmigs pa'i ngo bo yin /
translated: If it is the mere object that is not observed, then how can it be the nature of observation?

original: gal te dmigs na 'o na de ni gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: gal te dmigs na 'o na de ni gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa nyid yin te /
translated: If it is observed, then it is the observation of form and so on.

original: de bas na dbang po nye bar mi sbyor ba ni gzugs la sogs pa dmigs par mi 'dod do zhes ci'i phyir brjod /
analyzed: de bas na dbang po nye bar mi sbyor ba ni gzugs la sogs pa dmigs par mi 'dod do zhes ci'i phyir brjod /
translated: Therefore, why do you say that the nonengagement of the sense faculties is not the observation of form and so on?

original: khas len na thal ba'i gtan tshigs ma grub na bzlog pa la 'dod pa'i skabs ci yod /
analyzed: khas len na thal ba'i gtan tshigs ma grub na bzlog pa la 'dod pa'i skabs ci yod /
translated: If you accept this consequence, then the reason is not established. If you reject this consequence, then what is the point of your position?

original: de ltar rjes su dpag pas dmigs pa rtag pa bkag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar rjes su dpag pas dmigs pa rtag pa bkag pa'i phyir /
translated: In this way, because observation is refuted through inference as being permanent,

original: de'i rang bzhin can gyi bdag dgag pa byas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin can gyi bdag dgag pa byas par 'gyur te /
translated: the self that has that nature is refuted.

original: dgos pa mi rtag pa la bdag tu 'dogs na rtsod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgos pa mi rtag pa la bdag tu 'dogs na rtsod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If you designate the impermanent as the self, there is no dispute.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i dmigs pa rtag pa nyams su myong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i dmigs pa rtag pa nyams su myong ba'i phyir /
translated: Because the permanent observation of form and so on is experienced,

original: sems can gyi bdag nyid kyi bdag rtag pa ni mngon sum gyis kyang bzod pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: sems can gyi bdag nyid kyi bdag rtag pa ni mngon sum gyis kyang bzod pa ma yin zhing /
translated: The self of sentient beings is not accepted even by direct perception.

original: rtogs pa'i ngo bo ma yin pa'i bdag yod par mi dmigs pas mi bzod de /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i ngo bo ma yin pa'i bdag yod par mi dmigs pas mi bzod de /
translated: Since the self that is not the nature of cognition is not observed to exist, it is not accepted.

original: gang zhig gang du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa ma dmigs pa de ni der med pa'i tha snyad du bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa ma dmigs pa de ni der med pa'i tha snyad du bya ba yin te /
translated: That which is not observed to have the character of being observed in a certain way is said to not exist in that way,

original: dper na rta'i mgo la rva bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rta'i mgo la rva bzhin no //
translated: like the horn of a donkey, for example.

original: lus la sogs pa la yang dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa'i bdag ma dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa la yang dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa'i bdag ma dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The self that has the character of being observed in the body and so on is not observed.

original: 'o na lus la sogs pa bdag gi rten du smra ba rnams mi 'dod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'o na lus la sogs pa bdag gi rten du smra ba rnams mi 'dod pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it unacceptable to say that the body and so on are the basis of the self?üîΩThe Buddha said:

original: gang gi lus la bdag yod min //üîΩzhes gang smras pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi lus la bdag yod min // zhes gang smras pa yin te /
translated: The self does not exist in the body.üîΩIf you say that it is unacceptable to refute such a self,

original: de lta bur gyur pa de bkag pa na mi 'dod pa ci yang med do zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa de bkag pa na mi 'dod pa ci yang med do zhe na /
translated: we reply that there is nothing unacceptable about refuting it.

original: bden te / kho bo cag gis kyang 'dir brten pa yin pa dgag par bya ba ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: bden te / kho bo cag gis kyang 'dir brten pa yin pa dgag par bya ba ni ma yin gyi /
translated: We agree that it is unacceptable to refute the self that is the basis of the conventions of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: 'on kyang bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang bstan pa yin no //
translated: However, we do refute the self that is the object of the view of the self.

original: thams cad du yang mi dmigs pas ldan pa kho na dgag par bya ba kho na yin te /
analyzed: thams cad du yang mi dmigs pas ldan pa kho na dgag par bya ba kho na yin te /
translated: Since it is not perceived anywhere, it is only a non-possession.

original: dgag par bya ba bum pa la sogs pa yang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgag par bya ba bum pa la sogs pa yang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And the object of negation, such as a pot, is also a non-possession.

original: brten pa kho na ni ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: brten pa kho na ni ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not only a non-possession that is supported,

original: brten pa ma yin pa dang de lta bu yod pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde lta ma yin na brten pa ma yin pa'i @12a * //
analyzed: brten pa ma yin pa dang de lta bu yod pa'i phyir ro // de lta ma yin na brten pa ma yin pa'i @12a * //
translated: because there is a non-supported and that kind of existence.

original: bdag dang ldan pa'i phyir lus la sogs pa bdag dang bcas par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag dang ldan pa'i phyir lus la sogs pa bdag dang bcas par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, because of possessing a non-supported self, the body and so on would not be endowed with a self.

original: 'dir lus la sogs pa dgag bya'i rten du gzung ba ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dir lus la sogs pa dgag bya'i rten du gzung ba ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Here, the body and so on are not taken as the basis of the object of negation.

original: 'on kyang mi dmigs pa dang med pa'i tha snyad dag gi rten yin pas na skyon med do //
analyzed: 'on kyang mi dmigs pa dang med pa'i tha snyad dag gi rten yin pas na skyon med do //
translated: However, since they are the basis of non-perception and the convention of non-existence, there is no fault.

original: 'o na mi dmigs pa 'di re zhig dmigs pa med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na mi dmigs pa 'di re zhig dmigs pa med pa ma yin te /
translated: Now, this non-perception is not, for the time being, the absence of perception,

original: de sgrub par byed pa nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de sgrub par byed pa nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not tenable as the proof of that.

original: shes pa gcig la 'dre ba'i dngos po gzhan dmigs pa'i rang bzhin yang ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa gcig la 'dre ba'i dngos po gzhan dmigs pa'i rang bzhin yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the nature of the perception of another thing mixed into a single cognition,üîΩbecause it is not tenable that a single cognition has a dual nature.

original: bdag dang shes pa gcig la 'dre ba gang yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag dang shes pa gcig la 'dre ba gang yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no mixing of the self and consciousness at all.

original: shes pa tha dad pa dmigs pa'i dngos po dmigs pa'i rang bzhin yang ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa tha dad pa dmigs pa'i dngos po dmigs pa'i rang bzhin yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is the object of observation of a different consciousness the nature of the object of observation of that consciousness,

original: de med par sgrub pa la mi mkho ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med par sgrub pa la mi mkho ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not necessary to establish that it does not exist.

original: nye bar mkho na ni sgra dmigs pas kyang gzugs med pa sgrub par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar mkho na ni sgra dmigs pas kyang gzugs med pa sgrub par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were necessary, it would follow that even the observation of sound would establish the nonexistence of form.

original: rnam pa gzhan yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no other way of being.

original: de bas mi dmigs pa 'di ci'i bdag nyid yin pa mi shes so zhe na /
analyzed: de bas mi dmigs pa 'di ci'i bdag nyid yin pa mi shes so zhe na /
translated: Therefore, since it is not known what the nature of this nonobservation is,

original: brjod pa / phyogs bar ma nyid kho bo cag gi 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: brjod pa / phyogs bar ma nyid kho bo cag gi 'dod pa yin te /
translated: we respond: The middle position is what we assert.

original: bdag tu shes pa ni bdag gi yul can du pha rol gyis btags pa yin la /
analyzed: bdag tu shes pa ni bdag gi yul can du pha rol gyis btags pa yin la /
translated: The consciousness of the self is imputed by the opponent to be the subject of the self.

original: de yang lus su gtogs pa yin la dmigs bzhin par shin tu gsal bar myong ste /
analyzed: de yang lus su gtogs pa yin la dmigs bzhin par shin tu gsal bar myong ste /
translated: Moreover, it is included in the body and is clearly experienced as observed.

original: de'i phyir lus la sogs pa nyid bdag dang shes pa gcig la 'dre ba yin zhing /
analyzed: de'i phyir lus la sogs pa nyid bdag dang shes pa gcig la 'dre ba yin zhing /
translated: Therefore, the body and so on are mixed with the self and consciousness.

original: bdag gi shes pa'i yul du gyur pa de las tha dad pa ni nyams su myong ba med pas na lus de dmigs pa kho na de mi dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag gi shes pa'i yul du gyur pa de las tha dad pa ni nyams su myong ba med pas na lus de dmigs pa kho na de mi dmigs pa yin no //
translated: Since there is no experience of anything different from that which is the object of one‚Äôs consciousness, that body is only an object of perception, not a non-object.

original: gal te lus la sogs pa tha dad pa'i bdag gi don can gyi shes pa'i yul med pa na /
analyzed: gal te lus la sogs pa tha dad pa'i bdag gi don can gyi shes pa'i yul med pa na /
translated: If there is no object of consciousness that has a different meaning than the body, etc.,

original: bdag gi lus la sogs pa zhes bya bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: bdag gi lus la sogs pa zhes bya bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: it would not be called ‚Äúmy body,‚Äù etc.

original: shes pa 'di ni yod pa yin te /
analyzed: shes pa 'di ni yod pa yin te /
translated: But this consciousness exists.

original: de bas bdag gi don can ni lus la sogs pa las tha dad par rtogs par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bas bdag gi don can ni lus la sogs pa las tha dad par rtogs par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of ‚Äúmine‚Äù should be understood as different from the body, etc.

original: des na ma dmigs so zhes ci'i phyir brjod ce na /
analyzed: des na ma dmigs so zhes ci'i phyir brjod ce na /
translated: So why is it said that it is not perceived?

original: de ni mi bden te /
analyzed: de ni mi bden te /
translated: That is not correct.

original: tha dad pa med kyang mngon par zhen pa'i shes pa skye ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: tha dad pa med kyang mngon par zhen pa'i shes pa skye ba'i phyir te /
translated: Even though there is no difference, a consciousness that conceives of difference arises.

original: dper na mchi gu'i lus zhes bya ba bzhin no//
analyzed: dper na mchi gu'i lus zhes bya ba bzhin no//
translated: For example, it is like the body of a lump of clay.

original: 'dir dmigs pa shes pa tsam yang ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dir dmigs pa shes pa tsam yang ma yin gyi /
translated: Here, it is not just the mere consciousness that is the object,

original: 'on kyang mngon sum du 'dod pa'i shes pa yin la /
analyzed: 'on kyang mngon sum du 'dod pa'i shes pa yin la /
translated: but rather it is the consciousness that is asserted to be direct perception.

original: 'di nyid kyang mngon sum gyi shes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyang mngon sum gyi shes pa ma yin te /
translated: And this is also not a consciousness of direct perception.

original: mchi gu'i lus las gzhan pa'i shes pa mngon sum ma yin pa dang khyad par med pa'i phyir dang / de dang khyad par med pa'i mngon sum yin na @12b de yang mngon sum du thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mchi gu'i lus las gzhan pa'i shes pa mngon sum ma yin pa dang khyad par med pa'i phyir dang / de dang khyad par med pa'i mngon sum yin na @12b de yang mngon sum du thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would be no different from a consciousness that is not a direct perception, and because if it were a direct perception, it would be no different from that, and it would also be a direct perception.

original: mngon sum yin yang dngos po tha dad par rnam par 'jog pa'i yan lag tu thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum yin yang dngos po tha dad par rnam par 'jog pa'i yan lag tu thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and because it would follow, absurdly, that it would be a direct perception, even though it is a direct perception, it would be a part that posits different entities.

original: ji ltar bdag gi lus la sogs pa'o snyam du shes pa de bzhin du nga'i bdag go snyam du yang 'gyur ba kho na ste /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag gi lus la sogs pa'o snyam du shes pa de bzhin du nga'i bdag go snyam du yang 'gyur ba kho na ste /
translated: Just as it is known that it is my body and so on, it would also be known that it is my self.

original: des na 'dis ni lha rnams dga' ba yin no //üîΩbdag don can las tha dad pa'i shes pa gzhan tshad mar byed na khyad par med pa'i phyir 'di yang tshad mar bya bar 'os la /
analyzed: des na 'dis ni lha rnams dga' ba yin no // bdag don can las tha dad pa'i shes pa gzhan tshad mar byed na khyad par med pa'i phyir 'di yang tshad mar bya bar 'os la /
translated: Therefore, this is what delights the gods.üîΩIf a consciousness that is different from the one that has the self as its object were to be taken as valid, then since there would be no difference, it too would be suitable to be taken as valid.

original: tshad mar byed na yang dag gzhan yang rnam par gzhag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshad mar byed na yang dag gzhan yang rnam par gzhag par 'gyur ro //
translated: And if it were taken as valid, then the self would be posited as something other.

original: ji ste nga'i lus la sogs pa'o snyam pa'i shes pa 'di mchi gu'i lus las tha dad pa'i rtogs pa'i phyogs su 'jog na ni /
analyzed: ji ste nga'i lus la sogs pa'o snyam pa'i shes pa 'di mchi gu'i lus las tha dad pa'i rtogs pa'i phyogs su 'jog na ni /
translated: If you posit the cognition ‚Äúmy body‚Äù as the cognizing aspect that is different from the body of the worm, then in that case, the self would be posited in the same way.

original: de lta na bdag kyang 'jog par 'gyur te /üîΩmangs pas bzhag go //
analyzed: de lta na bdag kyang 'jog par 'gyur te / mangs pas bzhag go //
translated: But you do not posit the self in that way.üîΩTherefore, the self is not the body.

original: nges rtogs pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i bdag mi dmigs pas bzod do zhes bya ba ni gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: nges rtogs pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i bdag mi dmigs pas bzod do zhes bya ba ni gnas pa yin no //
translated: The assertion that the self is not the object of the cognition ‚Äúmy body‚Äù is untenable.

original: gzhan yang bdag de ni shes pa por 'dod pa yin na /üîΩrtogs pa'i ngo bo ma yin pa ni ci ltar yang shes pa po nyid du rigs par ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzhan yang bdag de ni shes pa por 'dod pa yin na / rtogs pa'i ngo bo ma yin pa ni ci ltar yang shes pa po nyid du rigs par ma mthong ngo //
translated: If the self is the object of the cognition ‚ÄúI am,‚Äù then the self would be the object of the cognition ‚Äúmy body.‚ÄùüîΩIf you say that the self is not the object of the cognition ‚Äúmy body,‚Äù then the self would not be the object of the cognition ‚ÄúI am.‚ÄùüîΩIf you say that the self is the object of the cognition ‚ÄúI am,‚Äù then the self would be the object of the cognition ‚Äúmy body.‚ÄùüîΩIf you say that the self is not the object of the cognition ‚Äúmy body,‚Äù then the self would not be the object of the cognition ‚ÄúI am.‚ÄùüîΩIf you say that the self is the object of the cognition ‚ÄúI am,‚Äù then the self would be the object of the cognition ‚Äúmy body.‚Äù

original: shes pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pa yang shes pa dang 'brel pas shes pa nyid du mi 'gal lo zhe na /üîΩ'o na mig la sogs pa yang shes pa po nyid du mi 'gal ba nyid do //
analyzed: shes pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pa yang shes pa dang 'brel pas shes pa nyid du mi 'gal lo zhe na / 'o na mig la sogs pa yang shes pa po nyid du mi 'gal ba nyid do //
translated: If you say that the self is not the object of the cognition ‚Äúmy body,‚Äù then the self would not be the object of the cognition ‚ÄúI am.‚ÄùüîΩIf you say that the self is the object of the cognition ‚ÄúI am,‚Äù then the self would be the object of the cognition ‚Äúmy body.‚ÄùüîΩIf you say that the self is not the object of the cognition ‚Äúmy body,‚Äù then the self would not be the object of the cognition ‚ÄúI am.‚Äù

original: shes pa dang 'du shes pa po nyid yin te /üîΩdes na thal ba 'di med do zhe na /
analyzed: shes pa dang 'du shes pa po nyid yin te / des na thal ba 'di med do zhe na /
translated: If you say that the self is the object of the cognition ‚ÄúI am,‚Äù then the self would be the object of the cognition ‚Äúmy body.‚Äù

original: de lta na yang thal ba ji ltar med /
analyzed: de lta na yang thal ba ji ltar med /
translated: If you say that the self is not the object of the cognition ‚Äúmy body,‚Äù then the self would not be the object of the cognition ‚ÄúI am.‚Äù

original: mig la sogs pa la shes pa dang 'du ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa la shes pa dang 'du ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no contact of consciousness with the eye, etc.

original: 'o na bdag kyang shes pa po nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na bdag kyang shes pa po nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: Well, then, the self would not be the experiencer,

original: de la yang de mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yang de mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is not tenable in regard to it.

original: de ni brten pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir dang / lus can ma yin pa ni brten pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni brten pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir dang / lus can ma yin pa ni brten pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it has the characteristic of being supported, and because that which is not embodied is not supported.

original: 'du ba gcig yin pa na 'ga' las shes pa dang 'du ba med pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / 'du ba gcig yin pa nyid kyis 'gar yang shes pa dang 'du ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang / gnyis pa khas len na thug pa med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du ba gcig yin pa na 'ga' las shes pa dang 'du ba med pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / 'du ba gcig yin pa nyid kyis 'gar yang shes pa dang 'du ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang / gnyis pa khas len na thug pa med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when there is a single contact, there is no contact of consciousness with anything, because when there is a single contact, it is not tenable that there is contact of consciousness with anything, and because if a second is accepted, there would be an infinite regress.

original: de med na yang 'di na'o zhes bya ba'i 'du ba'i don med pa'i phyir dang / shes pa bdag la 'dus pa yin la /
analyzed: de med na yang 'di na'o zhes bya ba'i 'du ba'i don med pa'i phyir dang / shes pa bdag la 'dus pa yin la /
translated: Because even without that, there is no object of contact that can be said to be here, and because this understanding, that the contact of consciousness is with the self,

original: de la shes pa dad 'du ba ni med do zhes bya ba'i rtogs pa 'di yang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la shes pa dad 'du ba ni med do zhes bya ba'i rtogs pa 'di yang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and that there is no contact of consciousness with that, is contradictory.

original: shes pa'i byed pa po yin pas na bdag kho na shes pa po yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: shes pa'i byed pa po yin pas na bdag kho na shes pa po yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Since it is the agent of consciousness, only the self is the knower, not anything else.

original: 'bras bu tshogs pa las skye ba ni 'di'i byed pa po yin @13a * //
analyzed: 'bras bu tshogs pa las skye ba ni 'di'i byed pa po yin @13a * //
translated: What is this that is called ‚Äúagent‚Äù of the effect that arises from the assemblage?

original: no zhes bya ba 'di ci yin ma rig go //
analyzed: no zhes bya ba 'di ci yin ma rig go //
translated: We do not understand.

original: rgyu yin pa tsam gyis ni byed pa po ma yin pas ba lang log pa na rta la sogs pa bzhin du /
analyzed: rgyu yin pa tsam gyis ni byed pa po ma yin pas ba lang log pa na rta la sogs pa bzhin du /
translated: If one is an agent merely by being a cause, then when a cow is not, a horse and so on would be.

original: de log pa na srog la sogs pa ji ltar ldog par 'gyur /üîΩdes na / de lta min na gcig log pas //
analyzed: de log pa na srog la sogs pa ji ltar ldog par 'gyur / des na / de lta min na gcig log pas //
translated: So how could the life faculty and so on cease when it ceases?üîΩIf it were not so, then how could the cessation of one

original: ji ltar gzhan ni ldog par 'gyur //üîΩmi la rta mi ldan zhes te //üîΩphyugs kyang ldan pa min nam ci //
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan ni ldog par 'gyur // mi la rta mi ldan zhes te // phyugs kyang ldan pa min nam ci //
translated: cause the cessation of another?üîΩIs it not the case that a man is not endowed with a horse,

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: but is endowed with cattle?

original: 'di ni gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ni gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya ste /
translated: This must be accepted without doubt.

original: de lta ma yin na gson po'i lus 'di ni nam mkha'i padma dang mi ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gson po'i lus 'di ni nam mkha'i padma dang mi ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: Otherwise, this living body would not be devoid of a sky-flower.

original: srog la sogs pa dang mi ldan par thal ba'i phyir na bum pa bzhin no zhes nam mkha'i padma yang rjes su dpog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srog la sogs pa dang mi ldan par thal ba'i phyir na bum pa bzhin no zhes nam mkha'i padma yang rjes su dpog par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even a sky flower would be inferred.

original: nam mkha' padma dang srog la sogs pa la 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: nam mkha' padma dang srog la sogs pa la 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúIt is not because there is no relation between life and so on and the sky flower,‚Äù

original: bdag dang yang 'brel ba ci yod /
analyzed: bdag dang yang 'brel ba ci yod /
translated: then what is the relation between the self and life and so on?

original: bdag ldog pa la srog la sogs pa ldog par mthong ba'i phyir 'brel ba med kyang skyon med do zhe na /
analyzed: bdag ldog pa la srog la sogs pa ldog par mthong ba'i phyir 'brel ba med kyang skyon med do zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúThere is no error because when the self is eliminated, life and so on are seen to be eliminated,‚Äù

original: nam mkha'i padma ldog pa la yang de mthong bas na der yang 'brel pa med par ci'i phyir brjod /
analyzed: nam mkha'i padma ldog pa la yang de mthong bas na der yang 'brel pa med par ci'i phyir brjod /
translated: then since that is also seen in the elimination of a sky flower, why do you not say that there is no relation there?

original: gzhan yang bdag ldog pa na srog la sogs pa ldog par mthong ba 'di gang du yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang bdag ldog pa na srog la sogs pa ldog par mthong ba 'di gang du yin /
translated: Moreover, where is this seen, that when the self is eliminated, life and so on are eliminated?

original: bum pa la sogs pa la'o zhe na /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa la'o zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúIn a pot and so on,‚Äù

original: de la yang bdag ldog par tshad ma gang las rtogs /
analyzed: de la yang bdag ldog par tshad ma gang las rtogs /
translated: then from what valid knowledge is the elimination of the self in that pot ascertained?

original: mi dmigs pa las so zhe na /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa las so zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúIt is ascertained from nonobservation,‚Äù

original: 'di ni tshig gcig tsam yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni tshig gcig tsam yin te /
translated: this is just a single word.

original: gal te mi dmigs pa las bdag ldog pa grub par 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te mi dmigs pa las bdag ldog pa grub par 'dod na /
translated: If you maintain that the self is refuted by non-apprehension,

original: gson po'i lus la yang ci ste mi 'dod /
analyzed: gson po'i lus la yang ci ste mi 'dod /
translated: why do you not maintain that it is refuted in the case of a living body?

original: gzhan gyi lus dang 'brel pa'i bdag ni dmigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la rtsod pa med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi lus dang 'brel pa'i bdag ni dmigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la rtsod pa med pa kho na'o //
translated: There is no dispute that the self is not apprehended in connection with another‚Äôs body.

original: gal te bdag gi lus dang 'brel pa yang dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te bdag gi lus dang 'brel pa yang dmigs pa yin no //
translated: If it is apprehended in connection with one‚Äôs own body,

original: ldog pa can gyi gtan tshigs bkod pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: ldog pa can gyi gtan tshigs bkod pas ci zhig bya /
translated: what is the use of positing a reason that is inconclusive?

original: des na gal te mi dmigs pa 'di 'ga' zhig tu bdag dang 'brel ba med pa sgrub par byed pa yin na gson po'i lus la yang sgrub par 'gyur la /
analyzed: des na gal te mi dmigs pa 'di 'ga' zhig tu bdag dang 'brel ba med pa sgrub par byed pa yin na gson po'i lus la yang sgrub par 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore, if this non-apprehension establishes the non-existence of the self in some cases, it would also establish it in the case of a living body.

original: yang na 'gar yang ma yin no zhes nges pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na 'gar yang ma yin no zhes nges pa yin no //
translated: Or else, it would be certain that it does not exist anywhere.

original: mi dmigs pa tsam gyis don med par 'grub pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa tsam gyis don med par 'grub pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But it is not established that something is non-existent merely by non-apprehension,

original: yod pa 'ga' zhig kyang ci zhig ltar mi dmigs pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa 'ga' zhig kyang ci zhig ltar mi dmigs pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is possible that something existent is not apprehended in some way.

original: de'i phyir 'gar yang bdag ldog par mthong ba med pas na /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gar yang bdag ldog par mthong ba med pas na /
translated: Therefore, since the self is not seen to be refuted anywhere,

original: de ldog pa na srog la sogs pa ldog pa yang 'gar yang ma mthong bas ldog pa'i sgo nas kyang srog @13b la sogs pa bdag rjes su dpog par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ldog pa na srog la sogs pa ldog pa yang 'gar yang ma mthong bas ldog pa'i sgo nas kyang srog @13b la sogs pa bdag rjes su dpog par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: But since it is never seen that when the life faculty ceases, the life faculty ceases, it is not the case that the life faculty is inferred from the self on the ground of their cessation.

original: gal te bdag med par gzhan la srog la sogs pa dang ldan par ma mthong ba'i phyir na /
analyzed: gal te bdag med par gzhan la srog la sogs pa dang ldan par ma mthong ba'i phyir na /
translated: If, because one does not see life faculty, etc. in another without a self,

original: gson pa'i lus la yang bdag med na de med par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gson pa'i lus la yang bdag med na de med par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: then since there is no self in the living body, it follows that there is no self.

original: de'i phyir de la bdag dang bcas pa nyid rjes su dpog na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de la bdag dang bcas pa nyid rjes su dpog na /
translated: Therefore, if one infers that it has a self,

original: bum pa la bum pa yin pa nyid kyi rjes su dpog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bum pa la bum pa yin pa nyid kyi rjes su dpog par 'gyur te /
translated: then one would infer that a pot has a pot,

original: bdag med par gzhan la bum pa nyid ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag med par gzhan la bum pa nyid ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because one does not see a pot in another without a pot.

original: de la yang bdag med na de med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yang bdag med na de med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And if it has no self, it follows that it does not exist.

original: ji ltar srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir gson po'i lus la bdag dang bcas pa rjes su dpog pa de bzhin du lag pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir shi ba'i lus la yang de rjes su dpog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir gson po'i lus la bdag dang bcas pa rjes su dpog pa de bzhin du lag pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir shi ba'i lus la yang de rjes su dpog par 'gyur te /
translated: Just as you infer the existence of a self in a living body because it possesses life, etc., so you would also infer the existence of a self in a dead body because it possesses hands, feet, etc.

original: de la yang bdag med na bum pa bzhin du lag pa la sogs pa dang mi ldan par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yang bdag med na bum pa bzhin du lag pa la sogs pa dang mi ldan par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If there were no self, then, like a pot, it would not possess hands, feet, etc.

original: 'on te bdag med par khyad par med kyang chos can 'ga' zhig kho na la bum pa nyid dang lag pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid yod pa la 'gal ba med do zhes brjod na /
analyzed: 'on te bdag med par khyad par med kyang chos can 'ga' zhig kho na la bum pa nyid dang lag pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid yod pa la 'gal ba med do zhes brjod na /
translated: But if you say that although there is no difference in the absence of self, there is no contradiction in the existence of the mere possession of a pot and of hands, etc. in some particular subject,

original: srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa la yang de skad du smra ba'i kha yon por mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa la yang de skad du smra ba'i kha yon por mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then we would not be at fault in saying that the mere possession of life, etc. exists in some particular subject.

original: gang yang kha cig gis mig la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi don yin te /
analyzed: gang yang kha cig gis mig la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi don yin te /
translated: Some say that the eyes, etc. are for the sake of another,

original: 'dus pa yin pa'i phyir mal cha dang stan la sogs pa'i yan lag bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dus pa yin pa'i phyir mal cha dang stan la sogs pa'i yan lag bzhin no //
translated: because they are aggregates, like the parts of a bed and chair.

original: zhes bdag gis sgrub byed brjod pa de yang snying po med pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bdag gis sgrub byed brjod pa de yang snying po med pa yin te /
translated: The reason I have stated is also pointless.

original: gzhan gyi don tsam sgrub na grub pa sgrub pa'i phyir dang / 'dus pa rnams gzhan gyi don nyid yin pa'i nges pa med pas na mi mthun phyogs la ldog pa la the tshom za ba'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don tsam sgrub na grub pa sgrub pa'i phyir dang / 'dus pa rnams gzhan gyi don nyid yin pa'i nges pa med pas na mi mthun phyogs la ldog pa la the tshom za ba'i yang phyir ro //
translated: If you are establishing mere benefit for others, then it is established, and if you are establishing the assembly, then it is uncertain that the assembly is for the benefit of others, and so you are doubtful about the reversal of the counter position.

original: gzhan gyi don nyid kyi khyad par sgrub na gtan tshigs la rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir dang / dpe'i yang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos ma grub pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don nyid kyi khyad par sgrub na gtan tshigs la rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir dang / dpe'i yang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos ma grub pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If you are establishing the distinction of benefit for others, then the reason is not concomitant, and the example is not established as having the property to be proven.

original: rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo'am /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo'am /
translated: The door of concomitance

original: log pa'i sgo nas bdag gis sgrub byed rab tu sbyar ba gzhan yang brjod zin pa'i sun 'byin pa thun mong yin pas na /
analyzed: log pa'i sgo nas bdag gis sgrub byed rab tu sbyar ba gzhan yang brjod zin pa'i sun 'byin pa thun mong yin pas na /
translated: or the door of reversal, I have already stated the reason, and since the refutation is shared,

original: gud du sun dbyung bas brtags zin pa brtag par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gud du sun dbyung bas brtags zin pa brtag par mi bya'o //
translated: it is not necessary to investigate what has already been investigated.

original: des na de ltar sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma med pas na bdag 'di yod pa'i tha snyad bya bar 'os pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na de ltar sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma med pas na bdag 'di yod pa'i tha snyad bya bar 'os pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since there is no valid cognition that establishes it in that way, it is not suitable to make the convention that this self exists.

original: gnod par byed pa'i tshad mas lam du byas pa na 'di med pa'i tha snyad kho nar bya ba'i dus la bab par mthong ste /
analyzed: gnod par byed pa'i tshad mas lam du byas pa na 'di med pa'i tha snyad kho nar bya ba'i dus la bab par mthong ste /
translated: When one takes as the path the valid cognition that refutes it, one sees that the time has come to make the convention that it does not exist.

original: bdag yod na rtogs pa'i ngo bo @14a * //
analyzed: bdag yod na rtogs pa'i ngo bo @14a * //
translated: If the self exists, it is not the nature of the realization

original: 'am ; rtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'am ; rtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: or the nonrealization

original: gzhan yang der thal ba'i phyir ro //
