analyzed: gzhan yang der thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: of anything else, because the consequence of that would be that it is different.

original: rgyu'i tshogs pa'i rab sbyor ba po nyid kyis rang dbang can gyi sgo nas kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu'i tshogs pa'i rab sbyor ba po nyid kyis rang dbang can gyi sgo nas kyang ma yin te /
translated: It is also not the case that the mere combination of causes is the creator, because it is not independent.

original: bems po la de mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //üîΩmngon par rlom pa tsam gyis ni lus la sogs pa nyid byed pa por rigs te /
analyzed: bems po la de mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro // mngon par rlom pa tsam gyis ni lus la sogs pa nyid byed pa por rigs te /
translated: That is not tenable for an inanimate thing.

original: ngas shes so snyam du shes pa de nyid snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngas shes so snyam du shes pa de nyid snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is reasonable that the body itself is the creator, because of the mere conceit ‚ÄúI know.‚Äù That consciousness itself appears.

original: rtag pa dang khyab pa la ni ldog pa zhes bya ba yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: rtag pa dang khyab pa la ni ldog pa zhes bya ba yod pa ma yin la /
translated: For a permanent and pervasive thing, there is no such thing as ‚Äúcessation.‚Äù

original: ldog pa med pa yang rgyu zhes bya ba ma yin zhing /
analyzed: ldog pa med pa yang rgyu zhes bya ba ma yin zhing /
translated: Also, that which is not reversed is not called a cause.

original: rgyu ma yin pa yang byed pa po zhes bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu ma yin pa yang byed pa po zhes bya ba ma yin te /
translated: And that which is not a cause is not called an agent.

original: de'i phyir bdag ni bems po yin la shes pa dang ldan pas na shes pa po yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni g-yar po'i rgyan yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag ni bems po yin la shes pa dang ldan pas na shes pa po yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni g-yar po'i rgyan yin no //
translated: Therefore, this statement, ‚ÄúThe self is matter, but because it possesses consciousness, it is a knower,‚Äù is a fool‚Äôs ornament.

original: 'di ni 'di'i dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyis byed pa po nyid dang de'i 'bras bu longs spyod pa po nyid kyang bsal ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni 'di'i dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyis byed pa po nyid dang de'i 'bras bu longs spyod pa po nyid kyang bsal ba yin te /
translated: This also refutes the self being the agent of virtuous and nonvirtuous actions and the experiencer of their effects.

original: shes pa med pa 'ong ba la sogs pa dang khyad par med pa la de mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa med pa 'ong ba la sogs pa dang khyad par med pa la de mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is untenable that that which is devoid of consciousness and is not distinct from that which is coming and going is the agent and experiencer.

original: shes pa dang 'brel pa yang 'brel pa gzhan med par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa dang 'brel pa yang 'brel pa gzhan med par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Also, that which is related to consciousness does not exist without another relation.

original: rtogs pa'i bdag nyid can gyi bdag la yang de gnyi ga mi srid de /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i bdag nyid can gyi bdag la yang de gnyi ga mi srid de /
translated: Also, for a self that is the nature of cognition, both of those are impossible.

original: gcig po de dang tha dad pa med pas na bya ba dang / longs spyod pa dag gcig tu thal ba'i phyir la /
analyzed: gcig po de dang tha dad pa med pas na bya ba dang / longs spyod pa dag gcig tu thal ba'i phyir la /
translated: Because it is not distinct from that single self, it follows that the agent and the experiencer are the same.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu ni de dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu ni de dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because cause and effect are contradictory.

original: tha dad na yang longs spyod pa po dang byed pa po nyid nyams par thal ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: tha dad na yang longs spyod pa po dang byed pa po nyid nyams par thal ba'i phyir te /
translated: If they are different, then the experiencer and the agent would be undermined.

original: dmigs pa'i ngo bo bya ba dang longs spyod pa dag las ni tha dad pa dag ni med pa'i phyir dang / tha dad pa med pa dag yin na yang bems po'i ngo bo bzhin du bdag la bya ba dang longs spyod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i ngo bo bya ba dang longs spyod pa dag las ni tha dad pa dag ni med pa'i phyir dang / tha dad pa med pa dag yin na yang bems po'i ngo bo bzhin du bdag la bya ba dang longs spyod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not different from the entities of the object, action, and experience, and if they are not different, then like the nature of an inanimate thing, the self would not have action or experience.

original: gzhan yang bdag ni rtag pa dang khyab par de smra ba rnams 'dod la /
analyzed: gzhan yang bdag ni rtag pa dang khyab par de smra ba rnams 'dod la /
translated: Moreover, those who assert the self say that it is permanent and pervasive.

original: de snang rung yin na rtag pa dang khyab pa nyid du mi srid de /
analyzed: de snang rung yin na rtag pa dang khyab pa nyid du mi srid de /
translated: If it is suitable to appear, then it is not possible for it to be permanent and pervasive.

original: de'i ngo bo yin na kho na bzhin du mngon sum yin pa na sngon dang phyi ma'i 'jig rten gzhan dang gzhan 'brel pa nyid dang yul thams cad na gnas pa'i lus dang ldan pas rdzas ma lus pa dang 'brel pa'i rang bzhin du 'dzin par thal ba'i
analyzed: de'i ngo bo yin na kho na bzhin du mngon sum yin pa na sngon dang phyi ma'i 'jig rten gzhan dang gzhan 'brel pa nyid dang yul thams cad na gnas pa'i lus dang ldan pas rdzas ma lus pa dang 'brel pa'i rang bzhin du 'dzin par thal ba'i
translated: If it were the entity of the self, then just like the self, it would be directly perceived. It would also be directly perceived as related to other past and future worlds, and as the nature related to all substances, since it would possess a body that exists in all places.

original: phyir la / de ltar 'dzin na 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa yang 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyir la / de ltar 'dzin na 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa yang 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were directly perceived in that way, then other worlds and so on would also be directly perceived.

original: bdag rang gi ngo bo tsam gyi sgo nas mngon sum yin gyi /
analyzed: bdag rang gi ngo bo tsam gyi sgo nas mngon sum yin gyi /
translated: The self is directly perceived in terms of its mere nature,

original: rtag pa dang khyab pa'i sgo nas ma yin te /
analyzed: rtag pa dang khyab pa'i sgo nas ma yin te /
translated: but not in terms of its permanence and pervasiveness.

original: des na thal ba 'di med do zhe na /
analyzed: des na thal ba 'di med do zhe na /
translated: Therefore, this reductio is not entailed.

original: de'i rtag pa dang khyab pa yang 'di'i ngo bo ma yin nam /
analyzed: de'i rtag pa dang khyab pa yang 'di'i ngo bo ma yin nam /
translated: But aren‚Äôt its permanence and pervasiveness its nature?

original: @14b de dag chos gzhan yin pas na de lta bu yin no zhe na /
analyzed: @14b de dag chos gzhan yin pas na de lta bu yin no zhe na /
translated: Since they are other phenomena, they are like that.

original: de lta na 'di rtag pa dang khyab pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na 'di rtag pa dang khyab pa yin no //
translated: In that case, it is permanent and pervasive.

original: de dag dang 'brel pas de lta bu yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de dag dang 'brel pas de lta bu yin no zhe na /
translated: It is like that because it is related to them.

original: 'o na rang gi ngo bo rtag pa dang khyab pa ma yin pa bum pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs pa de dag dang ji ltar 'brel /
analyzed: 'o na rang gi ngo bo rtag pa dang khyab pa ma yin pa bum pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs pa de dag dang ji ltar 'brel /
translated: But if they are not permanent and pervasive, like a pot, etc., how are they related to the self?

original: ci ste 'brel pa nyid kyis na bdag rtag pa yang ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: ci ste 'brel pa nyid kyis na bdag rtag pa yang ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin /
translated: If you assert that because of the relation, the self is neither permanent nor impermanent,

original: khyab pa yang ma yin ma khyab pa yang ma yin par 'dod na /
analyzed: khyab pa yang ma yin ma khyab pa yang ma yin par 'dod na /
translated: neither pervasive nor nonpervasive,

original: de'i tshe de la ngo bo ci yang med pas rang bzhin med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe de la ngo bo ci yang med pas rang bzhin med par 'gyur te /
translated: then it would be essenceless, since it would have no nature at all.

original: ngo bo dang ldan pa la phan tshun spangs par gnas pa'i rnam pa gnyis las phyi rol du gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo dang ldan pa la phan tshun spangs par gnas pa'i rnam pa gnyis las phyi rol du gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it would be neither of the two modes that are mutually exclusive and exhaustive.

original: nam mkha'i padma dang mtshungs pa'i ngo bo med pa la ni rtag pa nyid la sogs pa dang 'brel pa yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: nam mkha'i padma dang mtshungs pa'i ngo bo med pa la ni rtag pa nyid la sogs pa dang 'brel pa yang mi 'thad do //
translated: It is not tenable that that which is essenceless, like a sky flower, is related to permanence, etc.

original: de'i ngo bo dang ldan pa kho na yin la rang gi bdag nyid kyis ni rtag pa la sogs pa'i tha snyad kyi yul ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo dang ldan pa kho na yin la rang gi bdag nyid kyis ni rtag pa la sogs pa'i tha snyad kyi yul ma yin te /
translated: It is only that which has an essence that is the object of conventions such as permanence.

original: tha snyad rnams ni don gzhan du gyur pa'i chos dang 'brel pa'i rgyu mtshan can yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na ;
analyzed: tha snyad rnams ni don gzhan du gyur pa'i chos dang 'brel pa'i rgyu mtshan can yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na ;
translated: Because the terms are based on the reason of being related to a phenomenon that is a different object.

original: rtag pa la sogs pa'i tha snyad med mod /
analyzed: rtag pa la sogs pa'i tha snyad med mod /
translated: Reply: Granted that there is no term such as permanent.

original: de'i rang gi ngo bo yul dus thams cad du khyab pa yin nam 'on te ma yin /
analyzed: de'i rang gi ngo bo yul dus thams cad du khyab pa yin nam 'on te ma yin /
translated: But is its nature pervasive in all places and times, or is it not?

original: phyogs dang po la ni tha dad pa'i chos mi 'dzin kyang gzung bzhin pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'dzin dgos pas thal ba mi ldog go //
analyzed: phyogs dang po la ni tha dad pa'i chos mi 'dzin kyang gzung bzhin pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'dzin dgos pas thal ba mi ldog go //
translated: In the first case, although it does not apprehend a different phenomenon, it must apprehend the nature of that which is apprehended, and so the reductio is not avoided.

original: phyi ma la ni bum pa la sogs pa bzhin du de'i chos can du mi 'thad pa de nyid yin no //
analyzed: phyi ma la ni bum pa la sogs pa bzhin du de'i chos can du mi 'thad pa de nyid yin no //
translated: In the latter case, just like a pot, it is not tenable that it is the subject of that.

original: des na snang rung gi bdag la ni rtag pa dang khyab pa nyid mi srid pa kho na'o //
analyzed: des na snang rung gi bdag la ni rtag pa dang khyab pa nyid mi srid pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, it is impossible for a self that is suitable to appear to be permanent and pervasive.

original: snang du mi rung ba nyid yin na yang de la de gnyis mi srid de /
analyzed: snang du mi rung ba nyid yin na yang de la de gnyis mi srid de /
translated: Even if it is not suitable to appear, it is impossible for it to be both.

original: rtag pa yin na 'di'i bde ba dang 'brel pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de nyid sdug bsngal dang 'brel pa yin pa na /
analyzed: rtag pa yin na 'di'i bde ba dang 'brel pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de nyid sdug bsngal dang 'brel pa yin pa na /
translated: If it is permanent, then whatever is its nature related to pleasure is itself related to pain.

original: cig car du bde ba dang sdug bsngal du 'brel par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cig car du bde ba dang sdug bsngal du 'brel par 'gyur ro //
translated: Happiness and suffering would be related simultaneously.

original: de'i 'jig rten pha rol gyi lus dang ldan pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de nyid 'jig rten 'di'i lus dang ldan pa'i ngo bo yang yin pas na dus gcig tu 'jig rten gnyis la yod pa'i lus dang 'brel par thal te ;
analyzed: de'i 'jig rten pha rol gyi lus dang ldan pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de nyid 'jig rten 'di'i lus dang ldan pa'i ngo bo yang yin pas na dus gcig tu 'jig rten gnyis la yod pa'i lus dang 'brel par thal te ;
translated: Since the entity that possesses the body in the next world is the very same entity that possesses the body in this world, it follows that the self would be related to the body in both worlds simultaneously.

original: de dang 'brel pa can gyi ngo bo rjes su 'jug pa na nges par de yang rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de dang 'brel pa can gyi ngo bo rjes su 'jug pa na nges par de yang rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir te /
translated: This is because when the entity that is related to it comes into existence, it definitely comes into existence as well.

original: lcags su bcug pa'i skyes bu drangs pas lcags kyang 'dren pa bzhin no //
analyzed: lcags su bcug pa'i skyes bu drangs pas lcags kyang 'dren pa bzhin no //
translated: This is just like the iron that is drawn when a person holding iron is drawn.

original: de ngo bo gcig pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ngo bo gcig pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is the same entity.

original: ngo bo tha dad pa la brten pa'i nyams su myong ba dran pa dang ngo shes pa dang mthong ba'i don la ngo bo mtshan dang bral ba dang rang gis gtams pa @15a * //
analyzed: ngo bo tha dad pa la brten pa'i nyams su myong ba dran pa dang ngo shes pa dang mthong ba'i don la ngo bo mtshan dang bral ba dang rang gis gtams pa @15a * //
translated: The entity that is the basis of the experience of the body in this world would be devoid of the characteristics of the entity that is the basis of the experience of the body in the next world.

original: slar len pa dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bor 'dzin pa dang bcings pa dang grol ba la sogs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa r 'gyur byur ro //
analyzed: slar len pa dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bor 'dzin pa dang bcings pa dang grol ba la sogs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa r 'gyur byur ro //
translated: and then again, the appropriator, and the grasping of the nature of cause and effect, and bondage and liberation, and so on, would be established.

original: khyab pa yin na yang de'i lho phyogs na yod pa'i dngos po la khyab par byed pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de nyid byang phyogs na yod pa'i dngos po la khyab par byed pa yin pas na /
analyzed: khyab pa yin na yang de'i lho phyogs na yod pa'i dngos po la khyab par byed pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de nyid byang phyogs na yod pa'i dngos po la khyab par byed pa yin pas na /
translated: If it is pervasive, then the entity that is the nature of the pervader in the south would be the entity that is the pervader in the north.

original: de dag yul gcig pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag yul gcig pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore they would have the same location.

original: gal te byang phyogs dang lho phyogs na gnas pa'i dngos po med na de'i khyab par byed pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te byang phyogs dang lho phyogs na gnas pa'i dngos po med na de'i khyab par byed pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: But if the entity that exists in the north and the entity that exists in the south do not exist, they would not be the pervader.

original: khyab par bya ba med na khyab par byed pa yod par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyab par bya ba med na khyab par byed pa yod par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not tenable that the pervader exists if the pervaded does not exist.

original: khyab par byed pa med na khyab par bya ba yod par mi dbang ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: khyab par byed pa med na khyab par bya ba yod par mi dbang ba ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it the case that if the pervader does not exist, the pervaded does not exist?

original: khyab par bya ba de med par khyab par byed pa yod pa la 'gal ba ci yod ce na 'o na khyab par bya ba med na des gang la khyab par byed de /
analyzed: khyab par bya ba de med par khyab par byed pa yod pa la 'gal ba ci yod ce na 'o na khyab par bya ba med na des gang la khyab par byed de /
translated: But if the pervaded does not exist, by what would the pervader pervade?

original: khyab par mi byed pa ni khyab par byed pa zhes bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: khyab par mi byed pa ni khyab par byed pa zhes bya ba ma yin no //
translated: That which does not pervade is not called a pervader.

original: des na khyab par byed pa la ltos la'i khyab par bya ba de med par med pa de bzhin du khyab par bya ba la ltos pa'i khyab par byed pa yang yin no zhes bya ba ni nges pa yin no //
analyzed: des na khyab par byed pa la ltos la'i khyab par bya ba de med par med pa de bzhin du khyab par bya ba la ltos pa'i khyab par byed pa yang yin no zhes bya ba ni nges pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, just as the pervaded does not exist without depending on the pervader, so too the pervader does not exist without depending on the pervaded.

original: rtsol ba las byung ba med pa'i yod pa'i mi rtag pa de'i khyab byed yin pa kho na ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: rtsol ba las byung ba med pa'i yod pa'i mi rtag pa de'i khyab byed yin pa kho na ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Isn‚Äôt impermanence that is not produced by effort the pervaded of that?

original: kva'i rtag pa zhes bya ba rtsol ba las byung ba dang / cig shos thun mong ba spyi gcig ni yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: kva'i rtag pa zhes bya ba rtsol ba las byung ba dang / cig shos thun mong ba spyi gcig ni yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Oh! That which is called permanent is not a single common generality that is produced by effort and the other.

original: 'on kyang dngos po mi rtag pa rnams kyi mi gnas pa'i rang bzhin kho na la khyad par gzhan spangs nas de skad du brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang dngos po mi rtag pa rnams kyi mi gnas pa'i rang bzhin kho na la khyad par gzhan spangs nas de skad du brjod pa yin no //
translated: However, in the case of impermanent things, it is only their nature of nonendurance that is referred to as ‚Äúimpermanence,‚Äù without any other distinction.

original: de lta yin pa na don dam par na rtsol ba las byung ba nyid kyis khyab par byed pa mi rtag pa ni rtsol ba'i de ma thag tu skye ba'i skye ba can rnams kyi bdag nyid du gyur pa kho na yin gyi /üîΩgzhan na ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin pa na don dam par na rtsol ba las byung ba nyid kyis khyab par byed pa mi rtag pa ni rtsol ba'i de ma thag tu skye ba'i skye ba can rnams kyi bdag nyid du gyur pa kho na yin gyi / gzhan na ma yin no //
translated: If that is so, then ultimately, impermanence, which is pervaded by being produced by effort, is the nature of things that arise immediately after the effort, and it is not anything else.

original: nges pas ni rtag pa las ldog pa tsam nye bar bzung nas dngos po mi rtag pa thams cad kyi thun mong ba mi rtag pa gcig tu ston par byed la /
analyzed: nges pas ni rtag pa las ldog pa tsam nye bar bzung nas dngos po mi rtag pa thams cad kyi thun mong ba mi rtag pa gcig tu ston par byed la /
translated: By the word ‚Äúonly,‚Äù it is taught that impermanence is common to all impermanent things, merely excluding permanence.

original: de'i ngor khyab par bya ba med kyang de yod par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i ngor khyab par bya ba med kyang de yod par brjod pa yin no //
translated: In that case, even though there is no pervaded thing, it is said that there is.

original: de'i phyir yul gzhan na yod pa'i dngos po la khyab par byed pa'i ngo bo de las gzhan pa'i yul na yod pa'i dngos po la khyab par byed pa yin na /
analyzed: de'i phyir yul gzhan na yod pa'i dngos po la khyab par byed pa'i ngo bo de las gzhan pa'i yul na yod pa'i dngos po la khyab par byed pa yin na /
translated: Therefore, if the nature of the pervader exists in another place, and the pervaded thing exists in another place, then the pervader would not pervade the pervaded thing.

original: de dag yul gcig par thal ba bzlog par mi nus pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de dag yul gcig par thal ba bzlog par mi nus pa kho na'o //
translated: It is impossible to avoid the consequence that they would occupy the same place.

original: ji ltar 'bras bu gcig yul du ma na gnas pa'i rgyu dang 'brel pa yin la /
analyzed: ji ltar 'bras bu gcig yul du ma na gnas pa'i rgyu dang 'brel pa yin la /
translated: How could an effect be related to causes that exist in different places?

original: de dag yul gcig pa nyid du yang mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: de dag yul gcig pa nyid du yang mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: And how could they not occupy the same place?

original: @15b 'dir yang yin no zhe na /
analyzed: @15b 'dir yang yin no zhe na /
translated: The same is true here.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: mi mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not similar.

original: gang gi yul tha dad pa nyid yin na 'bras bu dang 'brel pa las 'gal bas na yul gcig pa nyid du 'gyur ba 'bras bu ni de'i yul na nye ba'i rang bzhin nyid kyi rgyu dang 'brel ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi yul tha dad pa nyid yin na 'bras bu dang 'brel pa las 'gal bas na yul gcig pa nyid du 'gyur ba 'bras bu ni de'i yul na nye ba'i rang bzhin nyid kyi rgyu dang 'brel ba ma yin gyi /
translated: If the object were different, it would be contradictory for it to be related to the effect, and it would occupy the same place. The effect is not related to the cause that is the nature of what is near its object.

original: 'on kyang de yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed pa nyid kyi yin la /
analyzed: 'on kyang de yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed pa nyid kyi yin la /
translated: However, it is related to the cause that is the nature of what is distant from its object.

original: de ni rgyu rnams yul tha dad pa yin yang mi 'gal ba nyid do //
analyzed: de ni rgyu rnams yul tha dad pa yin yang mi 'gal ba nyid do //
translated: That is not contradictory even if the causes have different objects.

original: sbyor ba'i 'brel pas sbyor ba can rnams dang 'brel pa yin pas de kho na la thal ba 'dir 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i 'brel pas sbyor ba can rnams dang 'brel pa yin pas de kho na la thal ba 'dir 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The consequence applies only to those that are related by the connection of conjunction.

original: rtag pa dang khyab pa med pas kyang bdag med par grub pa yin no //
analyzed: rtag pa dang khyab pa med pas kyang bdag med par grub pa yin no //
translated: And because it is neither permanent nor all-pervading, it is established that there is no self.

original: bdag med na gzhan gyi myong ba gzhan gyi dran pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: bdag med na gzhan gyi myong ba gzhan gyi dran pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If there is no self, then the experience of one person would be remembered by another.

original: mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi 'gyur te /
translated: This is not so.

original: myong ba dang dran pa 'di dag ni 'ga' zhig dang 'brel pa can du sgrub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: myong ba dang dran pa 'di dag ni 'ga' zhig dang 'brel pa can du sgrub pa ma yin te /
translated: These experiences and memories are not established as being related to anything,

original: byed pa po ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa po ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the agent is not established.

original: 'on kyang gsal bar myong ba la dran pa'i sa bon gzhag pa sad pa'i rim pas dran pa skye ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang gsal bar myong ba la dran pa'i sa bon gzhag pa sad pa'i rim pas dran pa skye ba yin no //
translated: However, the seed of memory is planted in the experience of the clear consciousness, and memory arises through the process of being awakened.

original: 'on te byed pa po brtags nas 'di dag gis byed pa po tha dad par brjod na 'gal ba ci yod de /
analyzed: 'on te byed pa po brtags nas 'di dag gis byed pa po tha dad par brjod na 'gal ba ci yod de /
translated: But if the agent is examined, what contradiction is there in saying that these experiences and memories are the activities of a different agent?

original: gzhan gyi dran dang sbyong sogs pa'i //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dran dang sbyong sogs pa'i //
translated: The consequence of another‚Äôs memory and so on

original: thal ba gnod byed ma yin te //
analyzed: thal ba gnod byed ma yin te //
translated: does not undermine our position.

original: des ni 'ga' zhig mi dran phyir //
analyzed: des ni 'ga' zhig mi dran phyir //
translated: Because it is not the case that anything is not remembered,

original: myong las dran par 'byung ba yin //
analyzed: myong las dran par 'byung ba yin //
translated: memory arises from experience.

original: zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes gang gsungs pa yin te /
translated: This is what is stated.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nges pa'i phyir rgyud gzhan gyi myong ba la sogs pa las rgyu gzhan gyi dran pa la sogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nges pa'i phyir rgyud gzhan gyi myong ba la sogs pa las rgyu gzhan gyi dran pa la sogs pa ma yin te /
translated: because the nature of cause and effect is certain, memory, etc., are not caused by the experience of another continuum, etc.

original: mang du smras pas chog go //
analyzed: mang du smras pas chog go //
translated: Enough of this extensive discussion.

original: 'dus byas kyi grangs nges pas bdag bkag pa'i phyir 'dus byas bdag med pa grub kyi dngos su khyad par du byas pa ni /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi grangs nges pas bdag bkag pa'i phyir 'dus byas bdag med pa grub kyi dngos su khyad par du byas pa ni /
translated: Since the self is refuted by the ascertainment of the number of conditioned forces, the nonself of conditioned forces is established.

original: skyes bu'i don gyi mchog la nye bar mkho bas gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu'i don gyi mchog la nye bar mkho bas gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The nonself of the person is primary because it is necessary for the highest purpose of human life.

original: ji ste 'dus byas 'di kha cig smra ba bzhin du 'ga' zhig blo sngon du btang nas bkod pa yin nam /
analyzed: ji ste 'dus byas 'di kha cig smra ba bzhin du 'ga' zhig blo sngon du btang nas bkod pa yin nam /
translated: If this conditioned force is arranged by some intellect as some philosophers claim,

original: 'on te ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te ma yin zhe na /
translated: or is it not?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: It is not.

original: byed po med ces smos so //
analyzed: byed po med ces smos so //
translated: It is said, ‚Äúwithout an agent.‚Äù

original: 'di la byed pa po med pas na byed pa po yod pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la byed pa po med pas na byed pa po yod pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Since there is no agent in this case, there is no existent agent.

original: 'di ltar 'gro ba 'di la byed pa po yod na rtag pa yin nam mi rtag pa yin grang de la re zhig rtag pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'gro ba 'di la byed pa po yod na rtag pa yin nam mi rtag pa yin grang de la re zhig rtag pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Thus, if there were an agent in this world, would it be permanent or impermanent?

original: de yin na 'byung ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa rnams nges par cig car bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de yin na 'byung ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa rnams nges par cig car bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: If that were so, then emergence, enduring, and destruction would definitely occur simultaneously,

original: byed pa po de'i ngo bo gang gnas pa dang / 'jig pa'i rkyen nyid du 'gyur ba /
analyzed: byed pa po de'i ngo bo gang gnas pa dang / 'jig pa'i rkyen nyid du 'gyur ba /
translated: because the nature of that agent would be the very conditions of enduring and destruction.

original: de ni 'byung ba'i dus su yang nye ba yin pas na /
analyzed: de ni 'byung ba'i dus su yang nye ba yin pas na /
translated: Since it is near at the time of emergence,

original: de nyid kyi tshe de dag kyang byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshe de dag kyang byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: at that time it would also perform those two.

original: @16a * // lhan cig byed pa mtshang ba'i phyir mi byed do zhe na /
analyzed: @16a * // lhan cig byed pa mtshang ba'i phyir mi byed do zhe na /
translated: If you say that it does not perform them because the co-arisen conditions are incomplete,

original: 'di ni gtam rgyud yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni gtam rgyud yin te /
translated: this is a story.

original: re zhig lhan cig byed pa rtag pa rnams la ni rang gi ngo bo ma tshang ba mi srid cing /
analyzed: re zhig lhan cig byed pa rtag pa rnams la ni rang gi ngo bo ma tshang ba mi srid cing /
translated: First, for permanent co-arisen conditions, it is impossible for their nature to be incomplete.

original: de la ltos nas nye ba rnams kyi nye ba dang bral ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de la ltos nas nye ba rnams kyi nye ba dang bral ba yang ma yin no //
translated: And in dependence on that, it is not that the near are sometimes separated from the near.

original: mi rtag pa rnams yin na yang skye ba la sogs pa de la ltos pa rnams la ma tshang ba zhes bya ba ga la yod /
analyzed: mi rtag pa rnams yin na yang skye ba la sogs pa de la ltos pa rnams la ma tshang ba zhes bya ba ga la yod /
translated: And if they are impermanent, how could there be incompleteness in those that depend on emergence and so on?

original: ci ste yang gal te 'di rkyen gzhan yod pa dang med pa gang la bdag gi de kho na tha dad par ma gyur byed pa po yin na /
analyzed: ci ste yang gal te 'di rkyen gzhan yod pa dang med pa gang la bdag gi de kho na tha dad par ma gyur byed pa po yin na /
translated: But if the self is the agent when the other conditions exist or do not exist,

original: de dang bral ba na yang ci ste mi byed /
analyzed: de dang bral ba na yang ci ste mi byed /
translated: then why does it not act when it is devoid of those conditions?

original: de ni tshogs pa na yang gzhan gyi ngo bos ni byed pa po ma yin la /
analyzed: de ni tshogs pa na yang gzhan gyi ngo bos ni byed pa po ma yin la /
translated: When the self is in the assembly of conditions, it is not the agent by virtue of another‚Äôs entity.

original: 'di'i rang gi ngo bo yang gzhan gyi tshe yang de nyid yin pas na ji ltar 'ga' zhig gi tshe bya ba rgyun chad pa yin /
analyzed: 'di'i rang gi ngo bo yang gzhan gyi tshe yang de nyid yin pas na ji ltar 'ga' zhig gi tshe bya ba rgyun chad pa yin /
translated: And since its own entity is just that even when it is devoid of the other conditions, how could the continuity of its action be interrupted at any time?

original: 'o na dbang phyug blo dang ldan pa'i phyir skyon 'di med pa ma yin nam blos stong pa ni rang yod pa tsam gyis bskyed par bya ba'i 'bras bu rim pa med pa nyid du byed par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: 'o na dbang phyug blo dang ldan pa'i phyir skyon 'di med pa ma yin nam blos stong pa ni rang yod pa tsam gyis bskyed par bya ba'i 'bras bu rim pa med pa nyid du byed par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: But isn‚Äôt this fault not present for ƒ™≈õvara because he is intelligent? If the empty mind were to generate the effect that is to be arisen by its mere existence, it would do so in a nonsequential manner.

original: blo dang ldan pa ni bya bar nus kyang mi 'dod na mi byed pa'i phyir de la skyon ci yod ce na /
analyzed: blo dang ldan pa ni bya bar nus kyang mi 'dod na mi byed pa'i phyir de la skyon ci yod ce na /
translated: But if the intelligent one is able to act but does not wish to act, then what is the fault in that?

original: rang yod pa tsam gyis rgyu can gyi 'dod pa de dag kyang ci'i phyir mi byed ces bya ba de nyid de'i rkyen yin no //
analyzed: rang yod pa tsam gyis rgyu can gyi 'dod pa de dag kyang ci'i phyir mi byed ces bya ba de nyid de'i rkyen yin no //
translated: Why wouldn‚Äôt it produce the desired effect simply by its own presence? That is the very condition of its effect.

original: gzhan yang de dag lhan cig byed pa ma yin na de dag dang bral ba na yang ci'i phyir mi byed de /
analyzed: gzhan yang de dag lhan cig byed pa ma yin na de dag dang bral ba na yang ci'i phyir mi byed de /
translated: Moreover, if they are not co-operating causes, why wouldn‚Äôt it produce the effect even when it is not associated with them?

original: lhan cig byed pa ma yin pa ma tshang bas kyang 'bras bu mi byed na thams cad kyi tshe der 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa ma yin pa ma tshang bas kyang 'bras bu mi byed na thams cad kyi tshe der 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If an incomplete co-operating cause does not produce an effect, then it would always be so.

original: lhan cig byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if they are co-operating causes,

original: de lta na yang de dag med kyang nus pa ci'i phyir mi byed /
analyzed: de lta na yang de dag med kyang nus pa ci'i phyir mi byed /
translated: why wouldn‚Äôt it produce the effect even when they are not present?

original: lhan cig byed pa tshang ba nus pa yin pa'i phyir 'ga' zhig nus pa med pa byed pa po ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa tshang ba nus pa yin pa'i phyir 'ga' zhig nus pa med pa byed pa po ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the complete co-operating cause is the capacity, then some without capacity would not be agents.

original: de ci 'di gzhan ngo bos byed pa po yin nam /
analyzed: de ci 'di gzhan ngo bos byed pa po yin nam /
translated: But is this capacity something else that is essentially an agent?

original: de lta ma yin na ni byed pa po ma yin pa kho na ste /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni byed pa po ma yin pa kho na ste /
translated: If not, then it is not an agent.

original: rang gi ngo bos byed pa po ma yin pa ni byed pa po zhes bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos byed pa po ma yin pa ni byed pa po zhes bya ba ma yin no //
translated: That which is not an agent by its very nature is not called an agent.

original: 'di'i rang gi ngo bo yang rang gi nus pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba 'bras bu la nye bar sbyor ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'di'i rang gi ngo bo yang rang gi nus pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba 'bras bu la nye bar sbyor ba yin no zhe na /
translated: And its own nature is the object of the term ‚Äúpotential,‚Äù which is applied to the effect.

original: nga ni glo bur ba'i nus pa la ltos la zhog shig /'di nus pa yin yang rang bzhin gyis lhan cig byed pa mi byed pa mi nye ba na byed pa po ma yin pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: nga ni glo bur ba'i nus pa la ltos la zhog shig /'di nus pa yin yang rang bzhin gyis lhan cig byed pa mi byed pa mi nye ba na byed pa po ma yin pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: But it is dependent on adventitious potential, and even though it has potential, it does not function as an intrinsic cooperative condition, and when it is not near, it is not a creator.

original: 'o na ni ma yin yang rang bzhin gyis mo gsham yin no zhes bya ba 'di yang lha rnams dga' bas brjod par bya ba 'am /
analyzed: 'o na ni ma yin yang rang bzhin gyis mo gsham yin no zhes bya ba 'di yang lha rnams dga' bas brjod par bya ba 'am /
translated: But if it is not a creator, then it is intrinsically a barren woman‚Äôs son. This is something that the gods would not rejoice in saying.

original: yang na ni khyad par brjod dgos so //
analyzed: yang na ni khyad par brjod dgos so //
translated: Or else you must state the difference.

original: 'on te ji ltar khyed kyi ltar na rgyu gcig la yang @16b dus gcig tu ngo bo tha dad pa'i 'bras bu byed pa mi 'gal ba de bzhin du kho bo cag gis yang dus tha dad pa'i bskyed par bya ba du ma skyed pa po nyid yinüîΩno snyam du sems na /
analyzed: 'on te ji ltar khyed kyi ltar na rgyu gcig la yang @16b dus gcig tu ngo bo tha dad pa'i 'bras bu byed pa mi 'gal ba de bzhin du kho bo cag gis yang dus tha dad pa'i bskyed par bya ba du ma skyed pa po nyid yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: But if you think that just as it is not contradictory for a single cause to produce different effects at different times, in the same way, we maintain that a single cause produces many different effects at different times,

original: legs par sems pa ma yin te /
analyzed: legs par sems pa ma yin te /
translated: then you are not thinking clearly.

original: gang gi phyir dus tha dad pa du ma gcig gis skyed par byed do zhes smra ba la ci /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dus tha dad pa du ma gcig gis skyed par byed do zhes smra ba la ci /
translated: Because it is said that many different times are produced by one,üîΩwhat is the point of this?

original: ci lan cig gi tshe byed pa'i nus pa yod kyang dus tha dad pa'i 'bras bu rnams skyed pa yin nam /
analyzed: ci lan cig gi tshe byed pa'i nus pa yod kyang dus tha dad pa'i 'bras bu rnams skyed pa yin nam /
translated: Is it that at one time, although the potency exists, it produces effects at different times?

original: 'on te rim gyis nus pa thob pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rim gyis nus pa thob pa yin zhe na /
translated: Or is it that the potency is obtained gradually?

original: brgal zhing brtag par 'os pa yin no //
analyzed: brgal zhing brtag par 'os pa yin no //
translated: It is suitable to investigate and analyze this.

original: phyogs dang po la ni de nyid kyi tshe 'bras bu gzhan byed par thal ba bzlog par dka'o //
analyzed: phyogs dang po la ni de nyid kyi tshe 'bras bu gzhan byed par thal ba bzlog par dka'o //
translated: In the first case, it is difficult to reverse the consequence that it produces other effects at that very time.

original: dus tha dad pa'i 'bras bu byed pa'i rang bzhin yin pas na ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: dus tha dad pa'i 'bras bu byed pa'i rang bzhin yin pas na ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say it is not so because it has the nature of producing effects at different times,

original: kye ma dngos po nyon mongs 'di don ma yin pa'i nyams pa chen por ltung ste /
analyzed: kye ma dngos po nyon mongs 'di don ma yin pa'i nyams pa chen por ltung ste /
translated: alas, this afflicted thing has fallen into a great loss of meaning.

original: gang zhig nus pas ni 'bras bu la bya ba byed la /
analyzed: gang zhig nus pas ni 'bras bu la bya ba byed la /
translated: Because it is potent, it performs its function with regard to the effect,

original: rim gyis byed pa ma yin pas na zlog par yang byed pa ste /
analyzed: rim gyis byed pa ma yin pas na zlog par yang byed pa ste /
translated: but it does not perform it gradually, so it is reversed.

original: 'di gnyis ka phan tshun 'gal ba yang bsgrub par mi nus la ;
analyzed: 'di gnyis ka phan tshun 'gal ba yang bsgrub par mi nus la ;
translated: Both of these are mutually exclusive and cannot be established.

original: gnyis la rag lus pa na gcig gi yang ma yin zhing /
analyzed: gnyis la rag lus pa na gcig gi yang ma yin zhing /
translated: If it depends on two, it does not depend on either one.

original: 'gal ba rnams gzhan med na gzung bar yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'gal ba rnams gzhan med na gzung bar yang ma yin te /
translated: If they are contradictory, it is not apprehended when the other is absent.

original: de bas na 'di ci zhig sgrub par byed ces bya bar mi shes so //
analyzed: de bas na 'di ci zhig sgrub par byed ces bya bar mi shes so //
translated: Therefore, it is not understood how it is established.

original: phyogs gnyis pa la yang nus pa dang ldan pa dag tha dad pa med pa'i phyir dang / de yang thams cad kyi tshe rang bzhin gcig yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa la yang nus pa dang ldan pa dag tha dad pa med pa'i phyir dang / de yang thams cad kyi tshe rang bzhin gcig yin pa'i phyir /
translated: In the second case, since those with potential are not different, and that is the same nature at all times,

original: ji ltar rim gyis des de thob pa yin zhes brjod dgos so //
analyzed: ji ltar rim gyis des de thob pa yin zhes brjod dgos so //
translated: how could it be said that it gradually obtains that?

original: tha dad na yang 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pas na ji ltar gcig nyid yin /
analyzed: tha dad na yang 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pas na ji ltar gcig nyid yin /
translated: If they are different, how could they be the same, since they possess contradictory attributes?

original: gzhan yang dus tha dad pa'i 'bras bu med pa ni gang gi tshe 'bras bu gcig skyed par byed pa de'i tshe de skyed bar byed pa'i rang bzhin yin zhing gzhan skyed par byed pa ma yin la /
analyzed: gzhan yang dus tha dad pa'i 'bras bu med pa ni gang gi tshe 'bras bu gcig skyed par byed pa de'i tshe de skyed bar byed pa'i rang bzhin yin zhing gzhan skyed par byed pa ma yin la /
translated: Moreover, if the effect does not exist at a different time, when it produces one effect, at that time it has the nature of producing that, but it does not produce another.

original: gnyi ga skyed par byed pa yang yin no zhes bya ba 'di gdon mi za bar 'dod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: gnyi ga skyed par byed pa yang yin no zhes bya ba 'di gdon mi za bar 'dod par bya dgos so //
translated: But it must be accepted that it is the producer of both.

original: gzhan bskyed pa yin na de ma skyes par thal ba'i phyir ro //üîΩgnyi ga skye na dus gcig tu du ma bskyed pa ni dus gzhan du yang rang bzhin de nyid kyis bya ba byed pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan bskyed pa yin na de ma skyes par thal ba'i phyir ro // gnyi ga skye na dus gcig tu du ma bskyed pa ni dus gzhan du yang rang bzhin de nyid kyis bya ba byed pa ni /
translated: If it produces the other, then it follows that it is not produced.

original: de nyid kyi tshe skyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshe skyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: If both are produced, then it produces many at one time, and it would produce them at another time as well, because it has that nature.

original: rang bzhin gzhan gyi bya ba byed na ji ltar gcig du ma la dus tha dad pa bya ba byas par 'gyur /
analyzed: rang bzhin gzhan gyi bya ba byed na ji ltar gcig du ma la dus tha dad pa bya ba byas par 'gyur /
translated: If it produces another nature, then how could one produce many at different times?

original: dus mtshungs pa du ma skyed par byed pa la ni 'gal ba ci yang med pas na /
analyzed: dus mtshungs pa du ma skyed par byed pa la ni 'gal ba ci yang med pas na /
translated: There is no contradiction at all in producing many at the same time.

original: de 'di nyid du 'gyur bar rigs so //üîΩgang gis de gcig la du ma @17a * //
analyzed: de 'di nyid du 'gyur bar rigs so // gang gis de gcig la du ma @17a * //
translated: Therefore it is reasonable that it is just that.

original: 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By what is it contradictory for one to produce many?

original: kho bo cag gi ltar na 'bras bur 'gyur ba rgyu'i rgyu nyid ma yin gyi /
analyzed: kho bo cag gi ltar na 'bras bur 'gyur ba rgyu'i rgyu nyid ma yin gyi /
translated: According to us, the cause of the effect is not the cause of the effect,

original: 'on kyang 'bras bu bas sngar yod pa yin la /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'bras bu bas sngar yod pa yin la /
translated: but rather it exists prior to the effect.

original: de ni ji ltar gcig cig las yin pa de bzhin du du ma las kyang yin pa rigs pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ni ji ltar gcig cig las yin pa de bzhin du du ma las kyang yin pa rigs pa nyid do //
translated: Just as it is reasonable that a single cause produces a single effect, so too it is reasonable that many causes produce a single effect.

original: 'di snyam du gang zhig du ma bskyed pa de ni nges pa de'i khongs su gtogs pa gcig skyed par byed de /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gang zhig du ma bskyed pa de ni nges pa de'i khongs su gtogs pa gcig skyed par byed de /
translated: If you think that whatever produces many effects produces a single effect that is included in that,

original: du ma ni gcig bsags pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: du ma ni gcig bsags pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because many are the nature of an accumulation of one.

original: de lta na yang de skyed par byed pa de las gzhan pa skyed par byed par mi rigs te /
analyzed: de lta na yang de skyed par byed pa de las gzhan pa skyed par byed par mi rigs te /
translated: Even so, it is unreasonable that what produces that produces something else,

original: gang gis 'bras bu gzhan byed pa /
analyzed: gang gis 'bras bu gzhan byed pa /
translated: because that which produces another effect

original: de la ngo bo gnyis yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la ngo bo gnyis yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: does not have two natures.

original: ngo bo gcig pa 'bras bu gcig pa nye bar sbyor ba na de nyid gzhan la ji ltar nye bar sbyor snyam na /
analyzed: ngo bo gcig pa 'bras bu gcig pa nye bar sbyor ba na de nyid gzhan la ji ltar nye bar sbyor snyam na /
translated: If a single nature is applied to a single effect, how could it be applied to another?

original: 'di khyed kyi nye bar sbyor ba ci yin par mthong /
analyzed: 'di khyed kyi nye bar sbyor ba ci yin par mthong /
translated: What do you see as the application here?

original: ci bya ba yin nam /
analyzed: ci bya ba yin nam /
translated: Is it an action?

original: 'on te yod pa'i khyad par yin /
analyzed: 'on te yod pa'i khyad par yin /
translated: Or is it a particular existent?

original: de la phyogs dang po ni legs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la phyogs dang po ni legs pa ma yin te /
translated: The first position is not good.

original: skyes ma thag tu 'gag pa'i dngos po rnams la byed pa med pa'i phyir dang / skad cig ma ma yin pa rnams la yang thug pa med pa dang don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes ma thag tu 'gag pa'i dngos po rnams la byed pa med pa'i phyir dang / skad cig ma ma yin pa rnams la yang thug pa med pa dang don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because things that cease as soon as they are born are devoid of activity, and because things that are not momentary are devoid of activity and are endless.

original: ji ltar byed pa med na 'bras bu mi skyed pa de bzhin du 'di yang 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir byed pa med par mi skye la /
analyzed: ji ltar byed pa med na 'bras bu mi skyed pa de bzhin du 'di yang 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir byed pa med par mi skye la /
translated: Just as that which is devoid of activity does not generate an effect, so too, since this is an effect, it does not arise devoid of activity.

original: de la yang tshul de nyid yin pas na thug pa med pa na ji ltar med par 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: de la yang tshul de nyid yin pas na thug pa med pa na ji ltar med par 'grub par 'gyur /
translated: And since the same principle applies to that, how could it be established as nonexistent?

original: rgyu ni 'bras bu la bya ba byed pa yin la /
analyzed: rgyu ni 'bras bu la bya ba byed pa yin la /
translated: A cause performs its activity in relation to an effect.

original: de yang yod pa'i dus so sor nges pa yin pas na bya ba rnams thog ma med par rtogs pa yang legs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang yod pa'i dus so sor nges pa yin pas na bya ba rnams thog ma med par rtogs pa yang legs pa ma yin te /
translated: And since that is ascertained in relation to the time of its existence, it is not reasonable to understand that activities are beginningless.

original: ji ltar rgyu 'bras bu la bya ba byed pa na rgyu nyid yin pa de bzhin du byed pa yang yin pas na /
analyzed: ji ltar rgyu 'bras bu la bya ba byed pa na rgyu nyid yin pa de bzhin du byed pa yang yin pas na /
translated: Just as a cause is a cause when it performs its activity in relation to an effect, so too, it is an activity.

original: bya ba gzhan dang gzhan yod pa na yang thug pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: bya ba gzhan dang gzhan yod pa na yang thug pa med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, even when there are other activities, there is no infinite regress.

original: de lta na yang 'bras bu skye ba'i gtam yang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang 'bras bu skye ba'i gtam yang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, there would be no such thing as the arising of an effect.

original: ji ste byed pa med par byed par skye zhing /
analyzed: ji ste byed pa med par byed par skye zhing /
translated: If an effect arose without a cause,

original: 'bras bu gzhan gyi rgyur yang 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'bras bu gzhan gyi rgyur yang 'gyur na /
translated: and if a cause were the cause of another effect,

original: 'o na brjod par 'dod pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gi yang gnas skabs de nyid yin pas byed pa don med do //
analyzed: 'o na brjod par 'dod pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gi yang gnas skabs de nyid yin pas byed pa don med do //
translated: then the cause and effect that are intended would be meaningless, because they would be in the same state.

original: ji ste phyogs phyi ma la brten na /
analyzed: ji ste phyogs phyi ma la brten na /
translated: But if you rely on the second position,

original: de'i tshe du ma la sbyor ba zhes bya ba gcig du ma la ltos nas nges pa dang ldan pa'i yod pa nyid brjod par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de'i tshe du ma la sbyor ba zhes bya ba gcig du ma la ltos nas nges pa dang ldan pa'i yod pa nyid brjod par 'gyur la /
translated: then the so-called application of the many to the one would be stated as the existence that is ascertained in reliance on the many.

original: 'di la ni gnod pa byed pa ci yang med do //
analyzed: 'di la ni gnod pa byed pa ci yang med do //
translated: And there is no refutation of this.

original: 'di snyam du gal te ngo bo gzugs bskyed pa de nyid kyis ro la sogs pa yang yin na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gal te ngo bo gzugs bskyed pa de nyid kyis ro la sogs pa yang yin na /
translated: If you think that the very nature of form that is generated is also taste and so on,

original: de las skye na de yang @17b gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de las skye na de yang @17b gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: then if it arises from that, it would also be the intrinsic reality of form.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gzugs kyi rgyu las skyes pa de ni gzugs yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gzugs kyi rgyu las skyes pa de ni gzugs yin te /
translated: The application is this: Whatever is generated from the cause of form is form,

original: dper na kha dog sngon po bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na kha dog sngon po bzhin no //
translated: like the color blue.

original: ro la sogs pa yang gzugs med par byed pa'i rgyu las skyes pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyis thal ba'o //
analyzed: ro la sogs pa yang gzugs med par byed pa'i rgyu las skyes pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyis thal ba'o //
translated: And the reason is: ‚Äúbecause it arises from a cause that produces form.‚ÄùüîΩThis is a consequence that is established by the opponent‚Äôs intrinsic assertion.

original: de lta yang ma yin pa de'i phyir na bzlog pa gang zhig gzugs ma yin pa de ni gzugs skyed par byed pa'i rgyu las skyes pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta yang ma yin pa de'i phyir na bzlog pa gang zhig gzugs ma yin pa de ni gzugs skyed par byed pa'i rgyu las skyes pa yin te /
translated: If you say that this is not so, then the reverse of the probandum would follow: ‚ÄúThat which is not form arises from a cause that produces form.‚Äù

original: dper na rlung gis reg pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rlung gis reg pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the contact of wind.üîΩAnd the reason is: ‚Äúbecause it is not form.‚Äù

original: ro la sogs pa 'di yang gzugs ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: ro la sogs pa 'di yang gzugs ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa yin no snyam na /
translated: This is an inference based on the nonobservation of a pervader.

original: 'di ni ma bslabs pa'i brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni ma bslabs pa'i brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is the statement of an untrained person.

original: 'di ltar gzugs tsam skyed pa'i rgyu las skye ba thal ba'i gtan tshigs nyid du 'dod dam /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs tsam skyed pa'i rgyu las skye ba thal ba'i gtan tshigs nyid du 'dod dam /
translated: For, is it maintained that the reason is the mere arising from a cause that produces form?

original: de skyed par byed pa ma yin pa las log pa'i rgyu las skyes pa yin grang /
analyzed: de skyed par byed pa ma yin pa las log pa'i rgyu las skyes pa yin grang /
translated: Or is it the arising from a cause that is the opposite of not producing that?

original: phyogs dang po la ni /
analyzed: phyogs dang po la ni /
translated: In the first case,

original: sgrub byed ma grub pa yin te /
analyzed: sgrub byed ma grub pa yin te /
translated: the reason is not established.

original: kho bo cag ni gzugs tsam skyed par byed pa'i rgyu las ro la sogs pa skyes par mi 'dod kyi /
analyzed: kho bo cag ni gzugs tsam skyed par byed pa'i rgyu las ro la sogs pa skyes par mi 'dod kyi /
translated: We do not maintain that the cause that generates mere form generates taste, etc.

original: 'on kyang de dang de ma yin pa skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin las yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang de dang de ma yin pa skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin las yin te /
translated: but rather that it generates that which is not that, because it generates that which is not that, because it generates that which is other than that, from a cause that has the nature of generating that which is other than that.

original: de ni rnam pa du mas bskyed par bya ba sgrub pa la bzo ba'i khyad par dang ldan pa'i rang gi rgyu las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rnam pa du mas bskyed par bya ba sgrub pa la bzo ba'i khyad par dang ldan pa'i rang gi rgyu las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For that is generated by a cause that is its own, which has the particularity of an agent in the accomplishment of that which is to be generated in many ways.

original: gnyis pa la ni ldog pa la the tshom za ba nyid kyis gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin te /
analyzed: gnyis pa la ni ldog pa la the tshom za ba nyid kyis gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin te /
translated: In the second, the reason is inconclusive, because the reversal is doubtful.

original: bzlog pa la gnod pa byed pa'i tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzlog pa la gnod pa byed pa'i tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no valid cognition that refutes the reversal.

original: bzlog pa la snga ma bzhin du dgag par bya ba brtags pa na phyogs dang po yongs su 'dzin na grub pa yin la /
analyzed: bzlog pa la snga ma bzhin du dgag par bya ba brtags pa na phyogs dang po yongs su 'dzin na grub pa yin la /
translated: When the object of negation is imagined in the reversal, as before, if one accepts the first position, it is established.

original: phyogs gnyis pa la brten na snga ma brten du ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa la brten na snga ma brten du ma nges pa yin no //
translated: If one relies on the second position, the former is not ascertained.

original: gzhan yang ngo bo tha dad pa'i 'bras bu byed pa nyid ni tshad mas grub par skad cig mar smra ba dang / skad cig ma yin par smra ba yang 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang ngo bo tha dad pa'i 'bras bu byed pa nyid ni tshad mas grub par skad cig mar smra ba dang / skad cig ma yin par smra ba yang 'dod pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, the assertion that different entities produce effects is established by valid cognition, for both those who advocate momentariness and those who do not advocate momentariness accept that.

original: rtsod pa'i gzhi mi rigs so //
analyzed: rtsod pa'i gzhi mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, the basis of the dispute is illogical.

original: dus tha dad pa'i 'bras bu byed pa nyid ni nus pa yod pa dang med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gal ba'i chos kyis khyab pa yin pas na /
analyzed: dus tha dad pa'i 'bras bu byed pa nyid ni nus pa yod pa dang med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gal ba'i chos kyis khyab pa yin pas na /
translated: The production of effects at different times is pervaded by the contradictory attributes of having and not having the capacity to produce effects.

original: bdag cag gi blos mi mthun pa'i gzhi yin pa na de dag gis de nyid sgrub par 'os pa yin na /
analyzed: bdag cag gi blos mi mthun pa'i gzhi yin pa na de dag gis de nyid sgrub par 'os pa yin na /
translated: Therefore, when our intellects are the basis of the dispute, it is appropriate for them to establish that.

original: de ma khyab pas rang gi 'dod pa yang 'gog par byed pa 'di ni de dag gi rang gi phyogs bsrung ba'i rnam pa sngon ma byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de ma khyab pas rang gi 'dod pa yang 'gog par byed pa 'di ni de dag gi rang gi phyogs bsrung ba'i rnam pa sngon ma byung ba yin no //
translated: Since that is not pervaded by the capacity to produce effects, the refutation of their assertions is a previously unknown way of protecting their own position.

original: ngo bo tha dad pa'i 'bras bu byed pa bzhin du /
analyzed: ngo bo tha dad pa'i 'bras bu byed pa bzhin du /
translated: Like the production of effects that are different entities,

original: @18a * // dus tha dad pa'i 'bras bu byed pa yang mthong bas na 'gal ba med do zhes bya ba 'di tsam yin pas na 'dod pa'i don dang 'gal ba med do zhe na /
analyzed: @18a * // dus tha dad pa'i 'bras bu byed pa yang mthong bas na 'gal ba med do zhes bya ba 'di tsam yin pas na 'dod pa'i don dang 'gal ba med do zhe na /
translated: But since it is seen that it produces effects at different times, there is no contradiction.üîΩSince this is all that is said, there is no contradiction with what you assert.

original: 'o na gal te khyad par med par dus tha dad pa'i 'bras bu byed pa 'gal bar byed na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te khyad par med par dus tha dad pa'i 'bras bu byed pa 'gal bar byed na /
translated: If you say that it is contradictory for something to produce effects at different times without being different,

original: de'i tshe 'di yang brjod pa zhig na gcig la de brjod pa na brjod pa des ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'di yang brjod pa zhig na gcig la de brjod pa na brjod pa des ci zhig bya ste /
translated: then you should say this, but what is the point of saying it in this way?

original: gang gi phyir dus tha dad pa'i 'bras bu rnams dus gcig po dang 'brel par mthong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dus tha dad pa'i 'bras bu rnams dus gcig po dang 'brel par mthong ba ma yin te /
translated: Because effects that are different in time are not seen to be related to a single cause.

original: mthong ba ni rgyu tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med pa dag la rtag tu gzu bo yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mthong ba ni rgyu tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med pa dag la rtag tu gzu bo yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: This is because seeing is always dependent on different or nondifferent causes.

original: gnas ma yin pa la brnag pas chog go //
analyzed: gnas ma yin pa la brnag pas chog go //
translated: Enough of this digression!

original: de'i phyir byed pa po rtag pa yin na 'bras bu rnams cig car ba yin pa bzlog tu med do zhes bya ba 'di gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir byed pa po rtag pa yin na 'bras bu rnams cig car ba yin pa bzlog tu med do zhes bya ba 'di gnas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, if the agent is permanent, it is undeniable that its effects would be simultaneous. This is the point.

original: sbyor ba ni gang dag lan cig gi tshe rgyu ma tshad ba med par nye bar de dag gi lan cig gi tshe kho na 'byung ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang dag lan cig gi tshe rgyu ma tshad ba med par nye bar de dag gi lan cig gi tshe kho na 'byung ste /
translated: The application is that when the causes of those are not incomplete at one time, they arise at just that time.

original: dper na sgron ma yod pa snang ba dang sdong bu'i rnam 'gyur dang 'bru mar zad pa dang rang gi yul can gyi rtog pa rnams bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sgron ma yod pa snang ba dang sdong bu'i rnam 'gyur dang 'bru mar zad pa dang rang gi yul can gyi rtog pa rnams bzhin no //
translated: For example, when a lamp exists, there is light, the shape of the wick, and the exhaustion of the oil, and there is the thought that has its own object.

original: byed pa po rtag pa can du 'dod pa'i 'byung ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa yang lan cig gi tshe rgyu ma tshang ba med par nye ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi thal ba'i gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: byed pa po rtag pa can du 'dod pa'i 'byung ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa yang lan cig gi tshe rgyu ma tshang ba med par nye ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi thal ba'i gtan tshigs so //
translated: The arising, enduring, and disintegrating of the elements, which are asserted to be permanent agents, are also when the causes are not incomplete at one time. This is a logical argument of natural consequence.

original: de lta yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta yang ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: de'i phyir bzlog pa na /
analyzed: de'i phyir bzlog pa na /
translated: Therefore, when the reverse is stated,

original: gang dag rim gyis 'byung ba de dag ni cig car rgyu ma tshang ba med par nye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gang dag rim gyis 'byung ba de dag ni cig car rgyu ma tshang ba med par nye ba ma yin te /
translated: those that arise sequentially are not when the causes are not incomplete at one time.

original: dper na myu gu dang sdong bu dang / yal ga la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na myu gu dang sdong bu dang / yal ga la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like a sprout, a stem, and a branch, and so on.

original: 'byung ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa yang rim gyis 'byung ba yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab byed 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa yang rim gyis 'byung ba yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab byed 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is the observation of a contradictory pervasion.

original: lhan cig byed pa ma tshang ba la bsams nas sgrub byed ma grub par yang brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa ma tshang ba la bsams nas sgrub byed ma grub par yang brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: One should not say that the proof is not established because of the incompleteness of the cooperating conditions.

original: mtha' dag byed pa yin pa na ma tshang ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang / rtag pa ni lhan cig byed pa la ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtha' dag byed pa yin pa na ma tshang ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang / rtag pa ni lhan cig byed pa la ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when something is a complete cause, it is not tenable that it is incomplete, and because a permanent thing does not depend on cooperating conditions.

original: de skad du rig pa'i dbang phyug mchog gis /
analyzed: de skad du rig pa'i dbang phyug mchog gis /
translated: The supreme lord of reasoning [Dharmakƒ´rti] says:

original: byed pa dang ni mi byed pa'i //
analyzed: byed pa dang ni mi byed pa'i //
translated: At the time of producing or not producing,

original: dus su 'dra ba'i bdag nyid can //
analyzed: dus su 'dra ba'i bdag nyid can //
translated: the nature of a permanent thing is the same.

original: rtag la ltos pa med pa'i phyir //üîΩrim gyis skye ba 'gal ba yin //
analyzed: rtag la ltos pa med pa'i phyir // rim gyis skye ba 'gal ba yin //
translated: Because it does not depend on anything else,

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is contradictory for it to arise in sequence.

original: 'di ni bdag la sogs pa rtag pa rnams dang skad cig ma yin pa bum pa la sogs pa rim gyis 'bras bu skyed pa la bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni bdag la sogs pa rtag pa rnams dang skad cig ma yin pa bum pa la sogs pa rim gyis 'bras bu skyed pa la bsal ba yin no //
translated: This refutes the production of effects in sequence by permanent things such as a self and by impermanent things such as a pot.

original: 'di la mngon sum dang @18b 'gal ba yang med de /
analyzed: 'di la mngon sum dang @18b 'gal ba yang med de /
translated: Here there is also no contradiction with direct perception.

original: mngon sum gyi skad cig ma ma yin pa 'dzin pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi skad cig ma ma yin pa 'dzin pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not tenable that a nonmomentary cognition apprehends a momentary object.

original: mngon sum skad cig mas skad cig ma ma yin pa 'dzin par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum skad cig mas skad cig ma ma yin pa 'dzin par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: A momentary cognition cannot apprehend a nonmomentary object.

original: skad cig ma ma yin pa ni skad cig ma du ma la khyab par byed pa yin na /
analyzed: skad cig ma ma yin pa ni skad cig ma du ma la khyab par byed pa yin na /
translated: If a nonmomentary object pervades many moments,

original: skad cig gcig yin pa'i mngon sum gyis de de'i ngo bor ji ltar gzung bar nus /
analyzed: skad cig gcig yin pa'i mngon sum gyis de de'i ngo bor ji ltar gzung bar nus /
translated: how can a cognition that is a single moment apprehend it?

original: sngar dang phyi gnas pa ni da lta bsal ba ma yin te /
analyzed: sngar dang phyi gnas pa ni da lta bsal ba ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that what exists previously and later is eliminated in the present,

original: de yang da lta yod par thal ba'i phyir dang / skye ba dang 'jig pa'i bar du snang bar thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang da lta yod par thal ba'i phyir dang / skye ba dang 'jig pa'i bar du snang bar thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that it would exist in the present and because it would follow that it would appear between arising and disintegration.

original: gzhan na yod pa'i mngon sum gzhan la yang tshul 'di nyid yin pas na /
analyzed: gzhan na yod pa'i mngon sum gzhan la yang tshul 'di nyid yin pas na /
translated: This is also the case for a cognition that exists elsewhere.

original: mngon sum gyis ni sngon dang phyi ma'i dus la khyab pa'i don 'ga' yang bzung bar nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis ni sngon dang phyi ma'i dus la khyab pa'i don 'ga' yang bzung bar nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, a cognition cannot apprehend an object that pervades the past and future.

original: 'dis ni ngo shes pa mngon sum ma yin par bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni ngo shes pa mngon sum ma yin par bshad pa yin te /
translated: This explains that recognition is not a form of direct perception.

original: mngon du byed pa'i shes pa ni mngon sum yin na /
analyzed: mngon du byed pa'i shes pa ni mngon sum yin na /
translated: If the consciousness that perceives is direct perception,

original: sngar gyi gnas skabs ni da lta mngon sum du bya ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sngar gyi gnas skabs ni da lta mngon sum du bya ba ma yin gyi /
translated: then the previous state is not now being perceived.

original: 'on kyang dran par bya ba yin na ;
analyzed: 'on kyang dran par bya ba yin na ;
translated: But if it is being remembered,

original: mngon sum ni dran pa'i ngo bo ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum ni dran pa'i ngo bo ma yin no //
translated: then direct perception is not by nature memory.

original: 'on te gal te da lta yod pa'i gnas skabs mngon sum du mi byed na 'di dran pa yin du chug mod /
analyzed: 'on te gal te da lta yod pa'i gnas skabs mngon sum du mi byed na 'di dran pa yin du chug mod /
translated: But if you say that it is not perceiving the present state, then let it be memory.

original: de mngon sum du byed pa la gzhol ba 'di ji ltar dran pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de mngon sum du byed pa la gzhol ba 'di ji ltar dran pa zhes bya ste /
translated: But how can it be called memory when it is directed to perceiving that state?

original: gzhon nu ma len gyis /üîΩsngon du gzhal ba tsam la ni //
analyzed: gzhon nu ma len gyis / sngon du gzhal ba tsam la ni //
translated: Kumarila says:

original: de'o snyam pa'i dran pa 'byung //üîΩde nyid 'di zhes bya ba 'di //üîΩngo shes yin te lhag pa can //
analyzed: de'o snyam pa'i dran pa 'byung // de nyid 'di zhes bya ba 'di // ngo shes yin te lhag pa can //
translated: Memory arises from the mere prior evaluationüîΩwith the thought ‚ÄúThat is it.‚Äù

original: zhes gang smras pa'o snyam na /
analyzed: zhes gang smras pa'o snyam na /
translated: This is recognition, which is more.

original: 'o na ngo shes pa dran pa dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo can du 'gyur gyi 'dzin pa nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na ngo shes pa dran pa dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo can du 'gyur gyi 'dzin pa nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: If you think that, then recognition would be by nature memory and apprehension, but it is not apprehension.

original: dran bzhin pa la 'dzin pa dang / 'dzin bzhin pa la dran pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dran bzhin pa la 'dzin pa dang / 'dzin bzhin pa la dran pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not tenable that memory is of that which is being remembered, nor that apprehension is of that which is being apprehended.

original: gcig pa ni dran pa 'dzin pa mi srid de /
analyzed: gcig pa ni dran pa 'dzin pa mi srid de /
translated: If they were identical, it would be impossible for memory to apprehend itself,

original: phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are mutually exclusive.

original: ngo bo gang gis dran pa yin pa de'i sgo nas 'dzin pa yin par smyon pa ma yin pas brjod par mi nus pa la /
analyzed: ngo bo gang gis dran pa yin pa de'i sgo nas 'dzin pa yin par smyon pa ma yin pas brjod par mi nus pa la /
translated: One who is not insane cannot say that memory is that by means of which it is remembered, and that it is that which is apprehended.

original: ngo bo gzhan gyi sgo nas 'dzin na ni gcig la dran pa dang 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ngo bo gzhan gyi sgo nas 'dzin na ni gcig la dran pa dang 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is apprehended by means of something else, then it would not be the case that memory is of that which is being remembered.

original: 'gyur na yang mngon sum dang mngon sum ma yin par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'gyur na yang mngon sum dang mngon sum ma yin par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If it were, then it would be both direct perception and not direct perception.

original: mngon sum nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not direct perception,

original: dran bzhin pa la mngon sum nyid du mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dran bzhin pa la mngon sum nyid du mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not tenable that that which is being remembered is direct perception.

original: 'di snyam du mngon sum ni dran pa las phyis kyi dus na yod pa yin gyi dran pa'i bdag nyid la ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di snyam du mngon sum ni dran pa las phyis kyi dus na yod pa yin gyi dran pa'i bdag nyid la ma yin la /
translated: If you think that direct perception exists at a later time than memory, and that it is not of the nature of memory,

original: 'di tsam gyis mngon sum ma yin par mi 'gyur te /üîΩ'gal ba med @19a * //
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis mngon sum ma yin par mi 'gyur te / 'gal ba med @19a * //
translated: then it is not the case that it is not direct perception,

original: pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no contradiction.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: As it has been said:

original: dran las sngar yod gang yin pa //
analyzed: dran las sngar yod gang yin pa //
translated: What existed previously as a memory

original: de ni mngon sum zhes bya ba //üîΩ'di 'dra'i tshig ni rgyal po'am //
analyzed: de ni mngon sum zhes bya ba // 'di 'dra'i tshig ni rgyal po'am //
translated: Is called ‚Äúperception.‚ÄùüîΩSuch words are not found

original: rig byed la yang yod ma yin //üîΩzhes gang smras pa'o snyam na /üîΩ'di nyid do snyam pa kho nar rtogs mod /
analyzed: rig byed la yang yod ma yin // zhes gang smras pa'o snyam na / 'di nyid do snyam pa kho nar rtogs mod /
translated: In the scriptures of the Buddha or the Vedas.üîΩYou may think, ‚ÄúThe object of memory is the object of perception.‚Äù

original: de nyid 'di yin no zhes bya bar ga las /üîΩde dang tha dad pa med par rtogs pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid 'di yin no zhes bya bar ga las / de dang tha dad pa med par rtogs pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na /
translated: But how can you know that the object of memory is the object of perception?

original: de ni mi rtogs so //
analyzed: de ni mi rtogs so //
translated: You cannot know that the object of memory is the object of perception.

original: 'di de dang tha dad pa med par rtogs so zhes bya ba 'di yang ji ltar rigs par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di de dang tha dad pa med par rtogs so zhes bya ba 'di yang ji ltar rigs par 'gyur /
translated: How can you know that the object of memory is not different from the object of perception?üîΩYou may say, ‚ÄúThe object of memory is the object of perception.‚Äù

original: de yang rtogs pa nyid do zhe na /üîΩci rtogs pa de nyid kyis sam /üîΩ'on te rtogs pa gzhan gyis yin ;
analyzed: de yang rtogs pa nyid do zhe na / ci rtogs pa de nyid kyis sam / 'on te rtogs pa gzhan gyis yin ;
translated: Is it the object of perception that is known by memory?üîΩOr is it the object of memory that is known by perception?

original: de nyid kyis so zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid kyis so zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is the object of perception that is known by memory,

original: lha rnams dga' ba brjed ngas can gyi skabs ma rtogs te /
analyzed: lha rnams dga' ba brjed ngas can gyi skabs ma rtogs te /
translated: then the gods will rejoice, for you have forgotten the point at issue.

original: rtogs pa de dran pa dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo yin pa nyid kyis mngon sum dang der snang ba ma gyur cig snyam ste /
analyzed: rtogs pa de dran pa dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo yin pa nyid kyis mngon sum dang der snang ba ma gyur cig snyam ste /
translated: You may think, ‚ÄúThe object of memory is the object of perception.‚Äù But how can you know that the object of memory is the object of perception?

original: khyed kyis 'dzin pa tsam gyi ngo bo nyid du brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: khyed kyis 'dzin pa tsam gyi ngo bo nyid du brjod pa yin la /
translated: You say that it is the nature of the object to be perceived,

original: de la kho bo cag ni rtogs pa ma rtogs pa dang / tha dad med par ji ltar rtogs zhes smra ba yin na /
analyzed: de la kho bo cag ni rtogs pa ma rtogs pa dang / tha dad med par ji ltar rtogs zhes smra ba yin na /
translated: but we say that it is not tenable that what is not realized is realized without being different from it.

original: de ci gzhan zos pa skyug gam /
analyzed: de ci gzhan zos pa skyug gam /
translated: What do you say to that?

original: rtogs pa gzhan gyis so zhe na /
analyzed: rtogs pa gzhan gyis so zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is realized by another realization,

original: rtogs pa gzhan gyis rtogs su chug mod /
analyzed: rtogs pa gzhan gyis rtogs su chug mod /
translated: let it be realized by another realization.

original: rtogs pa ma yin pa 'dis rtogs pa gzhan gyi yul la de dang tha dad pa med par rang gis ji ltar rtogs /
analyzed: rtogs pa ma yin pa 'dis rtogs pa gzhan gyi yul la de dang tha dad pa med par rang gis ji ltar rtogs /
translated: But how can this nonrealization realize the object of another realization without being different from it?

original: don dam par gcig yin pas na 'gal ba mi byed do zhe na /
analyzed: don dam par gcig yin pas na 'gal ba mi byed do zhe na /
translated: If you say that there is no contradiction because they are ultimately one,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: gcig nyid la rtogs pa dang ma rtogs pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang / sngar ma mthong ba la yang de ltar rtogs pa yod par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig nyid la rtogs pa dang ma rtogs pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang / sngar ma mthong ba la yang de ltar rtogs pa yod par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not tenable that one thing is both realized and not realized, and because it would follow that there would be realization of what was not seen before.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: If you say that it is not so,

original: sngar ma mthong ba la dran pa'i 'du byed med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: sngar ma mthong ba la dran pa'i 'du byed med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because there is no application of memory to what was not seen before,üîΩthen we reply:

original: 'o na dran nas rtogs pa yin pas na gcig don dam pa ma yin la /
analyzed: 'o na dran nas rtogs pa yin pas na gcig don dam pa ma yin la /
translated: But if it is remembered and then realized, then the first is not ultimately existent.

original: brtags pa 'di'i rgyu brjod dgos na /
analyzed: brtags pa 'di'i rgyu brjod dgos na /
translated: If it is necessary to state the cause of this investigation,

original: brjod zin pa'i rigs pas de yang 'thad pa ma yin pas na /
analyzed: brjod zin pa'i rigs pas de yang 'thad pa ma yin pas na /
translated: then that is not tenable, as has been explained by the previous reasoning.

original: ci spangs shing spangs shing khas len pas byis pa'i g-yo bag la brten nam /
analyzed: ci spangs shing spangs shing khas len pas byis pa'i g-yo bag la brten nam /
translated: So why rely on the childish deception of abandoning and abandoning again?

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: rtog ge ba'i tshogs kyi gtsug gi nor bus /
analyzed: rtog ge ba'i tshogs kyi gtsug gi nor bus /
translated: The crest jewel of the assembly of logicians

original: sngon myong ba ni dran pa las //
analyzed: sngon myong ba ni dran pa las //
translated: Remembers what was previously experienced.

original: de chos sgro 'dogs med par ni //
analyzed: de chos sgro 'dogs med par ni //
translated: Without superimposing phenomena

original: de ltar 'di snyam shes pa med //
analyzed: de ltar 'di snyam shes pa med //
translated: There is no such cognition.

original: dbang skyes la ni de ga las //üîΩzhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang skyes la ni de ga las // zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: How could that arise from sense faculties?

original: des na ngo shes pa mngon sum nyid du mi 'thad pas na de sgrub pa'i skad @19b cig ma ma yin pa na /üîΩmngon sum gyis grub pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na ngo shes pa mngon sum nyid du mi 'thad pas na de sgrub pa'i skad @19b cig ma ma yin pa na / mngon sum gyis grub pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, since recognition is not tenable as a direct perception, it is not established by direct perception.

original: skad cig ma ma yin pa rim gyis bya ba mi byed pa na mngon sum dang 'gal ba ma yin te /
analyzed: skad cig ma ma yin pa rim gyis bya ba mi byed pa na mngon sum dang 'gal ba ma yin te /
translated: Since it is not established by direct perception, it is not contradictory to direct perception when a nonmomentary thing that does not perform its function gradually is not established by direct perception.

original: zhar la byung ba'i don la brnag pas chog ste /
analyzed: zhar la byung ba'i don la brnag pas chog ste /
translated: The point that has been incidentally made is sufficient.

original: byed pa po rtag pa med do zhes bya ba 'di gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: byed pa po rtag pa med do zhes bya ba 'di gnas pa yin no //
