translated: The point that is being made is this: there is no permanent creator.

original: mi rtag pa ni de smra ba rnams mi 'dod pa kho na ste /
analyzed: mi rtag pa ni de smra ba rnams mi 'dod pa kho na ste /
translated: The impermanent is not accepted by those who advocate the permanent,

original: rtag pa blo rtag pa'i byed pa po nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa blo rtag pa'i byed pa po nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they accept that the permanent is the creator of the permanent.

original: ji ste 'ga' zhig 'di skad du /
analyzed: ji ste 'ga' zhig 'di skad du /
translated: But if someone says,

original: de'i 'di yang mi rtag pa nyid kyi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i 'di yang mi rtag pa nyid kyi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause this is also the effect of the impermanent,

original: 'bras bu gzhan bzhin du byed pa po gzhan sngon du song ba yin no zhes smra na /
analyzed: 'bras bu gzhan bzhin du byed pa po gzhan sngon du song ba yin no zhes smra na /
translated: like any other effect, the creator must be another, prior impermanent being,‚Äù

original: de lta na yang byed pa po'i gzhan dbang can 'di la de las gzhan pa'i skye bo bzhin du byed pa po nyid dang dbang phyug nyid ga la yod /
analyzed: de lta na yang byed pa po'i gzhan dbang can 'di la de las gzhan pa'i skye bo bzhin du byed pa po nyid dang dbang phyug nyid ga la yod /
translated: then, in that case, how could this impermanent creator be a creator and an almighty lord, like any other person?

original: gnyis pa la sogs pa yang mi rtag pa yin pa na tshul 'di nyid yin pas na /
analyzed: gnyis pa la sogs pa yang mi rtag pa yin pa na tshul 'di nyid yin pas na /
translated: The second and so on are also impermanent, and the same method applies.

original: 'ga' la yang dbang phyug nyid dang byed pa po nyid med do //
analyzed: 'ga' la yang dbang phyug nyid dang byed pa po nyid med do //
translated: Therefore, no one is a creator or an almighty lord.

original: de'i phyir 'di 'bras bu yin yang byed pa po med pa nyid du brtag dgos la /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di 'bras bu yin yang byed pa po med pa nyid du brtag dgos la /
translated: Therefore, although it is an effect, it must be considered to be without an agent.

original: de lta yin na yang de bzhin du gzhan yang de lta bu'i ngo bor khas len pa legs so //
analyzed: de lta yin na yang de bzhin du gzhan yang de lta bu'i ngo bor khas len pa legs so //
translated: And if that is so, then it is good to accept that in the same way, the other is also of that nature.

original: sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni /
translated: The syllogism is as follows:

original: gang 'bras bu yin pa de byed pa po bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: gang 'bras bu yin pa de byed pa po bcas pa yin te /
translated: Whatever is an effect is necessarily accompanied by an agent,

original: dper na nam mkha' bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' bzhin no //
translated: like space.

original: dbang phyug kyang gzhan gyi lugs kyi 'bras bu yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi thal ba'i gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: dbang phyug kyang gzhan gyi lugs kyi 'bras bu yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi thal ba'i gtan tshigs so //
translated: And God is an effect according to the other schools. This is a logical argument of the kind called ‚Äúthe reductio ad absurdum that exposes the opponent‚Äôs thesis to the same fault as the one the opponent has urged against the proponent.

original: gang zhig byed pa po dang bcas pa ma yin pa de ni 'bras bu ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig byed pa po dang bcas pa ma yin pa de ni 'bras bu ma yin te /
translated: Whatever is not accompanied by an agent is not an effect,

original: dper na nam mkha' bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' bzhin no //
translated: like space.

original: dbang phyug kyang byed pa po dang bcas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bzlog pa ste /
analyzed: dbang phyug kyang byed pa po dang bcas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bzlog pa ste /
translated: And God is not accompanied by an agent. This is the reversal of the original argument.

original: khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is a case of the non-apprehension of the pervasion.

original: sbyor ba gnyis po 'di ni gzhan la grub pa'i khyab pa khas blangs pa'i sgo nas yin pas na 'di la nges par dogs par mi bya'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba gnyis po 'di ni gzhan la grub pa'i khyab pa khas blangs pa'i sgo nas yin pas na 'di la nges par dogs par mi bya'o //
translated: Since these two syllogisms are established for the opponent, one should not doubt them.

original: de ltar na byed pa po mi rtag pa yang med pas na sna tshogs byed pa po med par grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na byed pa po mi rtag pa yang med pas na sna tshogs byed pa po med par grub pa yin no //
translated: Thus, since there is no permanent agent, it is established that the creator of the world does not exist.

original: 'di las kyang thams cad byed pa po med yin te /
analyzed: 'di las kyang thams cad byed pa po med yin te /
translated: Also, everything is without an agent.

original: gang zhig nad la sogs pa rnam pa du mas sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ba'i dud 'gro la sogs pa'i bye brag gis 'di tha dad par dmigs pa gang yin na 'di byed pa po yod na ni ji ltar yang ma 'thad de /
analyzed: gang zhig nad la sogs pa rnam pa du mas sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ba'i dud 'gro la sogs pa'i bye brag gis 'di tha dad par dmigs pa gang yin na 'di byed pa po yod na ni ji ltar yang ma 'thad de /
translated: That which is observed to be different in terms of the various types of animals, such as those that suffer in many ways from disease and so on, is not tenable in any way if it has an agent.

original: 'di ltar gal te 'di snying rjes snying brlan pa zhig yin na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te 'di snying rjes snying brlan pa zhig yin na /
translated: If it is one whose heart is moistened with compassion,

original: ci'i phyir ci ltar 'jig rten ngal @20a * //
analyzed: ci'i phyir ci ltar 'jig rten ngal @20a * //
translated: why does it create the world, which is a source of suffering?

original: bar byed ; snying rje ni sdug bsngal sel bar byed 'dod pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: bar byed ; snying rje ni sdug bsngal sel bar byed 'dod pa nyid yin na /
translated: If compassion is the desire to eliminate suffering,

original: de dang ldan pa sdug bsngal bar byed do zhes bya ba 'di la su zhig yid ches par 'gyur /
analyzed: de dang ldan pa sdug bsngal bar byed do zhes bya ba 'di la su zhig yid ches par 'gyur /
translated: Who would believe that one who possesses that would cause suffering?

original: 'di snyam du gang gis sdug bsngal myong ba gang yin pa ni 'jig rten nyid kyis de lta bur gyur pa'i mi dge ba'i las byas pa yin na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gang gis sdug bsngal myong ba gang yin pa ni 'jig rten nyid kyis de lta bur gyur pa'i mi dge ba'i las byas pa yin na /
translated: If you think that the world itself would not do such a thing, since it is the one who experiences the suffering,

original: che ba'i bdag nyid can de dag la nyes pa cung zad kyang ga la yod snyam na /
analyzed: che ba'i bdag nyid can de dag la nyes pa cung zad kyang ga la yod snyam na /
translated: then how could those who are great and powerful have any fault?

original: nyes pa ji ltar med de /
analyzed: nyes pa ji ltar med de /
translated: How could they not have a fault?

original: gang gi phyir de nyid sdug bsngal skyed par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de nyid sdug bsngal skyed par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the ones who create suffering.

original: gzhan du na de bzhin du gzhan yang de'i bskyed par bya ba ma yin pa nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na de bzhin du gzhan yang de'i bskyed par bya ba ma yin pa nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would follow, absurdly, that they would not create it in the same way.

original: ji ste 'jig rten nyid kyis rang gi las kyi 'bras bu nges par myong dgos te /
analyzed: ji ste 'jig rten nyid kyis rang gi las kyi 'bras bu nges par myong dgos te /
translated: If you say that the world itself must experience the results of its own karma,

original: byas pa chud zos pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byas pa chud zos pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is unacceptable that what has been done should perish,

original: des na 'di brtse ba can yin yang de grogs su 'gyur ba na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: des na 'di brtse ba can yin yang de grogs su 'gyur ba na nyes pa med do //
translated: then even though he is compassionate, there is no fault if he does not help, because he is powerless to do so.

original: de ci nga  ni de bya ba mi byed pa na yang 'jig rten la sdug bsngal 'byung ngam /
analyzed: de ci nga  ni de bya ba mi byed pa na yang 'jig rten la sdug bsngal 'byung ngam /
translated: If I do not act, would suffering arise in the world?

original: de lta ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ni ma yin te /
translated: No, it would not.

original: byed pa pos bya ba ma byas na 'bras bu mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: byed pa pos bya ba ma byas na 'bras bu mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because an effect does not arise if the agent does not act.

original: 'o na de lta na brtse ba can 'di de la btang snyoms su bya ba nyid rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'o na de lta na brtse ba can 'di de la btang snyoms su bya ba nyid rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: Well then, it is not reasonable for the compassionate one to be indifferent to that.

original: sems can rnams kyi mi dge ba'i mthus btang snyoms su bya ba yang mi 'thob po zhe na /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi mi dge ba'i mthus btang snyoms su bya ba yang mi 'thob po zhe na /
translated: If you say that he does not attain indifference through the power of the nonvirtue of sentient beings,

original: 'dir rang gi bdag nyid la yang dbang med pas na gsal bar dbang phyug yin no //
analyzed: 'dir rang gi bdag nyid la yang dbang med pas na gsal bar dbang phyug yin no //
translated: then he is clearly God, since he is not independent with regard to himself.

original: rang gi las rigs par spyod pa can gyi 'jig rten ci ste dbang phyug ma yin /
analyzed: rang gi las rigs par spyod pa can gyi 'jig rten ci ste dbang phyug ma yin /
translated: Why is the world, which acts according to its own nature, not God?

original: gang gi tshe 'di 'jig rten gyi chos ma yin pas de tshar bcad pa'i phyir bya ba byed pa de nyid kyi tshe snying rjes ldog par yang byed pas na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'di 'jig rten gyi chos ma yin pas de tshar bcad pa'i phyir bya ba byed pa de nyid kyi tshe snying rjes ldog par yang byed pas na /
translated: When he acts to refute that, which is not a worldly thing, he also turns away from it out of compassion.

original: 'jug par yang mi bya ldog par yang mi bya bas nyam nga ba chen por chud do //
analyzed: 'jug par yang mi bya ldog par yang mi bya bas nyam nga ba chen por chud do //
translated: He does not engage in it, nor does he turn away from it.

original: 'di'i snying rjes ni shin tu gces pa yin zhing de yang nang gi yan lag yin pas na 'di de dang mthun par 'jug pa kho na legs so //
analyzed: 'di'i snying rjes ni shin tu gces pa yin zhing de yang nang gi yan lag yin pas na 'di de dang mthun par 'jug pa kho na legs so //
translated: Since compassion is the most precious thing for him, and since it is an internal factor, it is good that he engages in it in a manner that is consistent with it.

original: gzhan yang skye ba dang ldan pa thams cad kyi rgyu mtshan nyid kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir 'di nyid chos ma yin pa yang sprul pa yin no ;
analyzed: gzhan yang skye ba dang ldan pa thams cad kyi rgyu mtshan nyid kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir 'di nyid chos ma yin pa yang sprul pa yin no ;
translated: Moreover, since he is the cause of the characteristics of the origination of all things, he is the creator of even non-dharmas.

original: / des na gal te 'di brtse ba can yin na de'i tshe re zhig 'jig rten la gnod par byed pa'i las ci'i phyir byed ces bya ba'i brgal zhing brtag pa 'di las ma thar ro //
analyzed: / des na gal te 'di brtse ba can yin na de'i tshe re zhig 'jig rten la gnod par byed pa'i las ci'i phyir byed ces bya ba'i brgal zhing brtag pa 'di las ma thar ro //
translated: Thus, if he is compassionate, then why does he engage in actions that harm the world? He has not escaped this objection.

original: ci ste 'di la snying rje med pa de lta na yang 'di 'dod chags la sogs pa dang bral ba yin nam ma yin /üîΩgal te 'dod @20b chags la sogs pa dang bral ba shin tu yin na /
analyzed: ci ste 'di la snying rje med pa de lta na yang 'di 'dod chags la sogs pa dang bral ba yin nam ma yin /üîΩgal te 'dod @20b chags la sogs pa dang bral ba shin tu yin na /
translated: If he is not compassionate, then is he free from attachment and so on?üîΩIf he is free from attachment and so on, then why does he engage in actions that harm the world?

original: brtse ba dang bral bas na phan mi 'dogs su chug / ci'i phyir tshar gcod par byed /
analyzed: brtse ba dang bral bas na phan mi 'dogs su chug / ci'i phyir tshar gcod par byed /
translated: Why do they destroy others?

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dbang gis 'ga' zhig tshar gcod pa yin na /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dbang gis 'ga' zhig tshar gcod pa yin na /
translated: If they destroy others due to the power of attachment and so on,üîΩthen they do not have attachment and so on.

original: de dag kyang 'di la med pas na ji ltar tshar gcod par byed /
analyzed: de dag kyang 'di la med pas na ji ltar tshar gcod par byed /
translated: Why do they destroy others?

original: rtsed mo'i ched du ji ltar byed do zhe na /
analyzed: rtsed mo'i ched du ji ltar byed do zhe na /
translated: If they engage in play and so on,

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba rtsed mo la sogs pa'i ched du 'jug go zhes bya ba 'di la 'chal ba las gzhan su zhig yid ches par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba rtsed mo la sogs pa'i ched du 'jug go zhes bya ba 'di la 'chal ba las gzhan su zhig yid ches par 'gyur /
translated: who other than a degenerate person would believe that they are free of attachment?

original: re zhig 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan yang tshul dang ldan pa rnams la rtsed mo'i don du 'jug pa 'di 'dra ba mi snang na /
analyzed: re zhig 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan yang tshul dang ldan pa rnams la rtsed mo'i don du 'jug pa 'di 'dra ba mi snang na /
translated: If those who are endowed with attachment and so on do not appear to engage in play and so on,

original: de'i 'dod chags dang bral ba la 'di yod dam /
analyzed: de'i 'dod chags dang bral ba la 'di yod dam /
translated: how much less would those free of attachment?

original: ji ste 'di 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: ji ste 'di 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa kho na yin te /
translated: If they are endowed with attachment and so on,üîΩthen they are not free of attachment.

original: de'i phyir 'jig rten gyi dbang phyug bzhin du 'ga' zhig tshar gcod pa la 'ga' zhig phan 'dogs so zhe na /üîΩdon gnyer nyes pa mthong ma yin //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig rten gyi dbang phyug bzhin du 'ga' zhig tshar gcod pa la 'ga' zhig phan 'dogs so zhe na / don gnyer nyes pa mthong ma yin //
translated: Therefore, like the Lord of the World, he helps some and harms others.

original: zhes bya ba 'di legs par brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di legs par brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is well said, for

original: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa 'di dbang phyug byed pa po nyid du gzhung gzugs pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan par smra ba yin na /
analyzed: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa 'di dbang phyug byed pa po nyid du gzhung gzugs pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan par smra ba yin na /
translated: if this affliction were the Lord, the creator, and were endowed with attachment and so on,

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i bran po 'khor ba'i btson rar bcings pa la ni da las gzhan pa'i skye bo bzhin du dbang phyug nyid med cing /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i bran po 'khor ba'i btson rar bcings pa la ni da las gzhan pa'i skye bo bzhin du dbang phyug nyid med cing /
translated: then like an ordinary person, he would not be the Lord, since he is a slave of the afflictions such as attachment and is bound in the prison of cyclic existence.

original: 'gro ba mtha' dag 'god pa la bzo ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi byed pa po nyid mi srid do //
analyzed: 'gro ba mtha' dag 'god pa la bzo ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi byed pa po nyid mi srid do //
translated: It is impossible for him to be the creator who fashions all transmigrating beings.

original: dbang phyug 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa yin bzhin du dbang phyug dang byed pa po nyid yin du chug mod /
analyzed: dbang phyug 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa yin bzhin du dbang phyug dang byed pa po nyid yin du chug mod /
translated: Even if the Lord were endowed with attachment and so on and were the Lord and creator,

original: ci rnal 'byor du gnas pa yin nam /
analyzed: ci rnal 'byor du gnas pa yin nam /
translated: is he a yogi?

original: rnal 'byor du mi gnas pa yin /
analyzed: rnal 'byor du mi gnas pa yin /
translated: He is not a yogi.

original: gal te rnal 'byor du gnas pa yin na ci'i phyir glo bur du nyes pa med pa'i skye bo la gnod pa byed /
analyzed: gal te rnal 'byor du gnas pa yin na ci'i phyir glo bur du nyes pa med pa'i skye bo la gnod pa byed /
translated: If he were a yogi, why would he suddenly harm innocent people?

original: lam log par 'gro ba'i nyes pa can la gnod pa byed do zhe na /
analyzed: lam log par 'gro ba'i nyes pa can la gnod pa byed do zhe na /
translated: He harms those who are guilty of going astray on the wrong path.

original: 'di lam gol bar 'gro ba yang rang nyid byed pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di lam gol bar 'gro ba yang rang nyid byed pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: But it is not he who makes them go astray on the wrong path.

original: de nyid byed du 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid byed du 'jug pa yin no //
translated: He makes them do what they want to do.

original: 'jig pa'i phyug po ni rang gi 'dod pas nyes pa byas pa la nyes pa dang mthun par tshar gcod pa yin na /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i phyug po ni rang gi 'dod pas nyes pa byas pa la nyes pa dang mthun par tshar gcod pa yin na /
translated: The Lord of the universe punishes those who sin by their own desire in accordance with their crimes.

original: rang nyid kyi skye bo nyes pa byed du bcug nas tshar gcod pa na /
analyzed: rang nyid kyi skye bo nyes pa byed du bcug nas tshar gcod pa na /
translated: But when he makes his own people sin and then punishes them,

original: kye ma dbang phyug dam pa'i tshar gcod pa'i tshul 'di ni @21a * //
analyzed: kye ma dbang phyug dam pa'i tshar gcod pa'i tshul 'di ni @21a * //
translated: alas, this is a way of punishing the good

original: sngar ma byung ba yin no //
analyzed: sngar ma byung ba yin no //
translated: that has never been seen before.

original: che ba'i bdag nyid can gyi spyod pa 'di 'jig rten las 'das pa yang yin te /
analyzed: che ba'i bdag nyid can gyi spyod pa 'di 'jig rten las 'das pa yang yin te /
translated: This conduct of the great Lord is also beyond the world,

original: gti mug gi dbang gi shes pas stong pa'i phyir stong pa bzhin du rtogs so //
analyzed: gti mug gi dbang gi shes pas stong pa'i phyir stong pa bzhin du rtogs so //
translated: because it is understood to be empty, like emptiness, because it is empty of consciousness due to the power of delusion.

original: gang gi phyir rnal 'byor du gnas pa'i bdag nyid can 'jig rten lam log par 'jug par byed de zhes bya ba 'di la kho bo cag mthong rgya chung bas rgyu cung zad kyang ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnal 'byor du gnas pa'i bdag nyid can 'jig rten lam log par 'jug par byed de zhes bya ba 'di la kho bo cag mthong rgya chung bas rgyu cung zad kyang ma mthong ngo //
translated: Why would one who is a master of yoga enter the wrong path in the world? We see no reason at all for this.

original: ji ste phyogs gnyis pa yin na de'i tshe mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa don du gnyer ba rnams kyis de mgu bar bya ba la sogs pa'i cho ga don med pa yin te /
analyzed: ji ste phyogs gnyis pa yin na de'i tshe mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa don du gnyer ba rnams kyis de mgu bar bya ba la sogs pa'i cho ga don med pa yin te /
translated: But if the second alternative is true, then the rites of pleasing and so on are meaningless for those who seek high status and definite goodness.

original: gang gi phyir de las 'dod pa'i 'bras bu mi srid pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de las 'dod pa'i 'bras bu mi srid pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is impossible for them to have the desired result.

original: rnam pa gzhan du yang srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du yang srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is possible in another way.

original: mngon par 'byung ba la brten pa slar ltung ba bzhin du grol ba yang slar srid par 'ching ba srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par 'byung ba la brten pa slar ltung ba bzhin du grol ba yang slar srid par 'ching ba srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Just as one who has gone forth may fall back, so too it is possible that one who is liberated may fall back into cyclic existence.

original: rnam pa thams cad du de la rag las pa 'di dag de mi byed par yang mi dbang bas na nyon mongs pa rnams kyis bcom pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du de la rag las pa 'di dag de mi byed par yang mi dbang bas na nyon mongs pa rnams kyis bcom pa ma yin nam /
translated: Since they are completely dependent on him, they are not destroyed by the afflictions, even if they do not perform rites.

original: thal ba'i sbyor pa rnams ni /
analyzed: thal ba'i sbyor pa rnams ni /
translated: The reductio arguments

original: gang zhig gang rjes su gzung bar 'dod pa de ni de la phan gang zhig gang rjes su gzung bar 'dod pa de ni de la pan 'dogs bzhin no //
analyzed: gang zhig gang rjes su gzung bar 'dod pa de ni de la phan gang zhig gang rjes su gzung bar 'dod pa de ni de la pan 'dogs bzhin no //
translated: are as follows: Whoever wishes to help someone will benefit that person.

original: dbang phyug kyang 'jig rten rjes su gzung bar 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang phyug kyang 'jig rten rjes su gzung bar 'dod pa yin no //
translated: And God wishes to help the world.

original: gang zhig gang la yid du 'ong ba dang phan pa 'dod pa de ni shes pa de yod na de yang dag pa'i lam kho nar 'jug par byed de /
analyzed: gang zhig gang la yid du 'ong ba dang phan pa 'dod pa de ni shes pa de yod na de yang dag pa'i lam kho nar 'jug par byed de /
translated: Whoever wishes to benefit someone and to make that person happy will, when he knows the means, cause that person to enter only the correct path.

original: dper na bu la byams pa'i pha bu la yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bu la byams pa'i pha bu la yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, a father who loves his son will, when he knows the means, cause his son to enter only the correct path.

original: dbang phyug kyang 'jig rten la yid du 'ong ba dang phan pa 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang phyug kyang 'jig rten la yid du 'ong ba dang phan pa 'dod pa yin no //
translated: And God wishes to benefit and to make the world happy.

original: gang zhig gang la sdang ba ma yin pa de ni de la gnod pa byed pa la rgyab kyis phyogs pa yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang la sdang ba ma yin pa de ni de la gnod pa byed pa la rgyab kyis phyogs pa yin te /
translated: Whoever is not hostile to someone will turn away from harming that person.

original: dper na 'dod pa can gyis shin tu sdug pa la bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'dod pa can gyis shin tu sdug pa la bzhin no //
translated: For example, a lustful man will turn away from harming a very beautiful woman.

original: dbang phyug kyang srog chags rnams la sdang ba ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang phyug kyang srog chags rnams la sdang ba ma yin no //
translated: And God is not hostile to living beings.

original: gang zhig rnal du gnas pa de ni nyes pa tshar gcod pa'am gnod pa las log pa yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig rnal du gnas pa de ni nyes pa tshar gcod pa'am gnod pa las log pa yin te /
translated: One who is in a normal state either destroys faults or turns away from harm,

original: dper na smyon pa ma yin pa 'ga' zhig bzhin no ;
analyzed: dper na smyon pa ma yin pa 'ga' zhig bzhin no ;
translated: like some who are not insane.üîΩAnd I≈õvara is in a normal state.

original: / dbang phyug kyang rnal du gnas pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs rnams yin no //
analyzed: / dbang phyug kyang rnal du gnas pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs rnams yin no //
translated: These are the natural reasonings.

original: bzlog pa rnams ni khyab byed mi dmigs par go bar bya'o //
analyzed: bzlog pa rnams ni khyab byed mi dmigs par go bar bya'o //
translated: The reverse reasonings should be understood as the nonobservation of the omnipresent.

original: thal ba'i gtan tshigs rnams gzhi ma grub par ni brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: thal ba'i gtan tshigs rnams gzhi ma grub par ni brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: The reductio arguments should not be said to have an unestablished basis,

original: rtsa ba'i gtan tshigs kyi khyab par bya ba dang @21b khyab par byed pa'i dngos po sgrub par byed pa'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i gtan tshigs kyi khyab par bya ba dang @21b khyab par byed pa'i dngos po sgrub par byed pa'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are a type of proof that establishes the pervasion of the root reason.

original: rtsa ba'i gtan tshigs kyi khyab par byed pa med pa'i yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i gtan tshigs kyi khyab par byed pa med pa'i yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor are they the nonexistence of the pervader of the root reason,

original: med kyang 'gal ba med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: med kyang 'gal ba med pa'i phyir te /
translated: because even if it does not exist, there is no contradiction.

original: dper na mo gsham gyi bu ni smra ba po ma yin te /
analyzed: dper na mo gsham gyi bu ni smra ba po ma yin te /
translated: For example, the son of a barren woman is not a speaker,üîΩbecause he does not exist.

original: sems pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di la yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sems pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di la yin pa bzhin no //
translated: because they are devoid of thought.üîΩThus, it is not established that the compassionate one and the one who is not compassionate, the one who is free from attachment and the one who is attached, the one who is calm and the one who is not calm, the one who is permanent and the one who is not permanent are the agent.üîΩIf the remainder of the insane is not refuted, this cannot be refuted.üîΩIf the one who is not insane is the agent, the insane one is the agent.üîΩIf the insane one is the agent, the one who is not insane is the agent.

original: de'i phyir de ltar snying rje can dang de las bzlog pa'am 'dod chags dang bral ba dang chags can nam rnal du gnas pa'am rtag pa dang rtag pa'i sa gzhan pa'i byed pa po med do zhes bya ba grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar snying rje can dang de las bzlog pa'am 'dod chags dang bral ba dang chags can nam rnal du gnas pa'am rtag pa dang rtag pa'i sa gzhan pa'i byed pa po med do zhes bya ba grub pa ma yin no //
translated: If the one who is not insane is the agent, the insane one is the agent.üîΩIf the insane one is the agent, the one who is not insane is the agent.üîΩIf the one who is not insane is the agent, the insane one is the agent.üîΩIf the insane one is the agent, the one who is not insane is the agent.üîΩIf the one who is not insane is the agent, the insane one is the agent.

original: smyon pa lhag lus pa yin na 'di ni bye brag tu dgag par mi nus so ;
analyzed: smyon pa lhag lus pa yin na 'di ni bye brag tu dgag par mi nus so ;
translated: If the insane one is the agent, the one who is not insane is the agent.üîΩIf the one who is not insane is the agent, the insane one is the agent.

original: / de la brten pa ltar byed pa rnams de smyo ba yin par smra na bdag nyid kho na smyon par smra ba yin no //
analyzed: / de la brten pa ltar byed pa rnams de smyo ba yin par smra na bdag nyid kho na smyon par smra ba yin no //
translated: If the insane one is the agent, the one who is not insane is the agent.üîΩIf the one who is not insane is the agent, the insane one is the agent.üîΩIf the insane one is the agent, the one who is not insane is the agent.üîΩIf the one who is not insane is the agent, the insane one is the agent.üîΩIf the insane one is the agent, the one who is not insane is the agent.üîΩIf the one who is not insane is the agent, the insane one is the agent.üîΩIf the insane one is the agent, the one who is not insane is the agent.

original: gang gi phyir smyon pa ma yin pa rnams kyi ni smyon pa mgu bar bya ba mi 'thad la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir smyon pa ma yin pa rnams kyi ni smyon pa mgu bar bya ba mi 'thad la /
translated: If the one who is not insane is the agent, the insane one is the agent.üîΩIf the insane one is the agent, the one who is not insane is the agent.üîΩIf the one who is not insane is the agent, the insane one is the agent.üîΩIf the insane one is the agent, the one who is not insane is the agent.üîΩIf the one who is not insane is the agent, the insane one is the agent.

original: smyon pa mgu bar byed na yang gang gis de mgu bar mi byed pa tha mal pa'i smyon pas nyes pa ci byas ;üîΩde dag la mthu phul du byung ba med pas mgu bar mi byed do zhe na /
analyzed: smyon pa mgu bar byed na yang gang gis de mgu bar mi byed pa tha mal pa'i smyon pas nyes pa ci byas ;üîΩde dag la mthu phul du byung ba med pas mgu bar mi byed do zhe na /
translated: If the insane one is the agent, the one who is not insane is the agent.üîΩIf the one who is not insane is

original: 'di mthu dang ldan pa yin no zhes te /
analyzed: 'di mthu dang ldan pa yin no zhes te /
translated: But it is powerful.

original: 'ga' yang mgu bar bya ba ma yin gyis /
analyzed: 'ga' yang mgu bar bya ba ma yin gyis /
translated: It is not pleased by anything,

original: 'on kyang mgu bar byas na 'bras bu ster bar byed do snyam pas yin na /
analyzed: 'on kyang mgu bar byas na 'bras bu ster bar byed do snyam pas yin na /
translated: but if it is pleased, it grants the fruit.

original: de yang yod pa ma yin no zhes brjod zin to //
analyzed: de yang yod pa ma yin no zhes brjod zin to //
translated: But that does not exist, as has been previously explained.

original: smyon pa yin yang 'gro ba mtha' dag las phul du byung ba'i nus pa yod do zhes bya ba 'di smyon pa ma yin pa su zhig smra bar spro /
analyzed: smyon pa yin yang 'gro ba mtha' dag las phul du byung ba'i nus pa yod do zhes bya ba 'di smyon pa ma yin pa su zhig smra bar spro /
translated: Even if he is insane, who but a madman would say that he has the power to surpass all beings?

original: 'di snyam du tshad mas grub pa'i dbang phyug la nye bar 'tshe ba phra mo 'di dag gis zil gyis mi gnon te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du tshad mas grub pa'i dbang phyug la nye bar 'tshe ba phra mo 'di dag gis zil gyis mi gnon te /
translated: But if you think that this subtle harm does not overpower the powerful one who is established by valid cognition,

original: 'di ltar 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir dang sems pa med pa'i nye bar len pa can yin pa'i phyir dang skye ba dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir dang sems pa med pa'i nye bar len pa can yin pa'i phyir dang skye ba dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir na /
translated: because he is the result, because he is the appropriator of the mindless, and because he is the appropriator of birth,

original: bum pa la sogs pa bzhin du lus dang sa dang byed pa la sogs pa blo dang ldan pa'i rgyu can du grub pa na byed pa po dbang phyug gi ming gzhan can nye bar 'jog go snyam na /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa bzhin du lus dang sa dang byed pa la sogs pa blo dang ldan pa'i rgyu can du grub pa na byed pa po dbang phyug gi ming gzhan can nye bar 'jog go snyam na /
translated: If you think that, like a pot, the body, earth, and action are established as having a mind as their cause, then you posit the name of the creator, God, as a mere designation.

original: nye bar mi 'jog ste /
analyzed: nye bar mi 'jog ste /
translated: You do not posit it.

original: rtag pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo'i dbang phyug gnod par byed pas bkag pa'i phyir dang / de lta bur gyur pa la yang sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma mi 'thad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rtag pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo'i dbang phyug gnod par byed pas bkag pa'i phyir dang / de lta bur gyur pa la yang sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma mi 'thad pa'i phyir te /
translated: This is because you refute the existence of God, whose nature is permanent and so on, and because it is not tenable that there is a valid cognition that establishes such a God.

original: gtan tshigs the tshom la brjod phyir //
analyzed: gtan tshigs the tshom la brjod phyir //
translated: Because the reason is stated in terms of doubt,

original: bsal ba gtan tshigs rten ma yin //
analyzed: bsal ba gtan tshigs rten ma yin //
translated: the exclusion is not the basis of the reason.

original: zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is what is stated.

original: 'o na med par smra bar yang mi rigs @22a * //
analyzed: 'o na med par smra bar yang mi rigs @22a * //
translated: Now, suppose someone said that it is not tenable that the LokƒÅyatas areüîΩnihilists because their position is established by a proof, and that even if it

original: te ; 'di sgrub byed kyis grub pa'i phyir dang / grub pa yang gnod byed kyis tshad ma mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes na /
analyzed: te ; 'di sgrub byed kyis grub pa'i phyir dang / grub pa yang gnod byed kyis tshad ma mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes na /
translated: were established, it is not tenable that there is a valid cognition that refutes it.

original: byed kyi nus pas yod pa nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: byed kyi nus pas yod pa nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: Since they have the capacity to act, they exist.

original: gnod byed kyi nus nus pas yod pa nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gnod byed kyi nus nus pas yod pa nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the power to harm exists,

original: gnong byed kyi nus pa med pa nyid ci'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: gnong byed kyi nus pa med pa nyid ci'i phyir ma yin /
translated: why is the power to harm not nonexistent?

original: de ltar ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not like that.

original: gnod byed tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gnod byed tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you say that the power to harm is not a valid cognition,

original: 'di tshad ma ma yin pa ji ltar yin /
analyzed: 'di tshad ma ma yin pa ji ltar yin /
translated: how is it not a valid cognition?

original: sgrub byed kyis gnod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: sgrub byed kyis gnod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is harmed by a proof,

original: 'o na sgrub byed kyang tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na sgrub byed kyang tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: then the proof is not a valid cognition,

original: gnod byed kyis gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnod byed kyis gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is harmed by the power to harm.

original: sngar bsgrubs pa'i gnod byed kyis gnod pa'i yul can gyi sgrub byed 'jug par yang mi rigs na /
analyzed: sngar bsgrubs pa'i gnod byed kyis gnod pa'i yul can gyi sgrub byed 'jug par yang mi rigs na /
translated: If it is not correct for a proof whose object is harmed by a previously established power to harm to engage,

original: gnod byed sel ba lta ci smos so //
analyzed: gnod byed sel ba lta ci smos so //
translated: what need is there to mention dispelling the power to harm?

original: mtshan nyid dang ldan pa la gnod pa srid na de'i mtshan nyid sun phyung ba kho nar 'gyur bas na thams cad la yid brtag tu med do //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang ldan pa la gnod pa srid na de'i mtshan nyid sun phyung ba kho nar 'gyur bas na thams cad la yid brtag tu med do //
translated: Since it is possible for a characteristic to be harmed, it is only the characteristic that is refuted. Therefore, there is no certainty in anything.

original: 'o na gang gi tshe dang por dbang phyug smra bas sgrub byed brjod pa de'i sun 'byin pas kyang gnong byed kyis tshad ma brjod par mi bya bar 'gyur ro zhe na bden te /
analyzed: 'o na gang gi tshe dang por dbang phyug smra bas sgrub byed brjod pa de'i sun 'byin pas kyang gnong byed kyis tshad ma brjod par mi bya bar 'gyur ro zhe na bden te /
translated: But when the proponent of ƒ™≈õvara first states a proof, then the opponent should not state a proof that refutes it.

original: de'i tshe des gnong byed brjod par bya ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i tshe des gnong byed brjod par bya ba ma yin gyi /
translated: It is true that at that time the opponent should not state a proof,

original: 'on kyang sgrub byed sun 'byin pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang sgrub byed sun 'byin pa nyid yin no //
translated: but he should state a refutation of the proof.

original: sgrub byed 'di dag ni sgrub byed kyi mtshan nyid rgyas par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sgrub byed 'di dag ni sgrub byed kyi mtshan nyid rgyas par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: These proofs do not extensively define proofs,

original: khyab pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyab pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not pervasives.

original: 'di ltar re zhig sgrub byed dang po la 'bras bu tsam la rgyu tsam gyis khyab pa grub pa ni 'dod de /
analyzed: 'di ltar re zhig sgrub byed dang po la 'bras bu tsam la rgyu tsam gyis khyab pa grub pa ni 'dod de /
translated: Thus, first, with regard to the first proof, it is accepted that the mere effect is pervaded by the mere cause.üîΩBut since the intelligent proponent does not establish the pervasion, how can he prove that?üîΩThe object of nondeceptive is the pervaded.üîΩThe object of nondeceptive is the pervaded.

original: 'di sgrub byed blo dang ldan pas ni khyab pa ma grub pas ji ltar de sgrub par nus /üîΩkhyab par bya ba ni mi 'khrul pa'i yul yin no //
analyzed: 'di sgrub byed blo dang ldan pas ni khyab pa ma grub pas ji ltar de sgrub par nus / khyab par bya ba ni mi 'khrul pa'i yul yin no //

original: khyab par byed pa ni spyi la mi 'khrul pa yin la /
analyzed: khyab par byed pa ni spyi la mi 'khrul pa yin la /
translated: The object of nondeceptive is the pervaded.üîΩThe object of nondeceptive is the

original: khyab par la khyab par mi 'khrul pa yin gyi spyi ni ma yin te /
analyzed: khyab par la khyab par mi 'khrul pa yin gyi spyi ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not a universal.üîΩ

original: de med pas kyang mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med pas kyang mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: But it is not a universal, because it is not contradictory that it not exist.

original: 'di ltar du ba tsam dang du ba'i khyad par las me tsam rtogs la /
analyzed: 'di ltar du ba tsam dang du ba'i khyad par las me tsam rtogs la /
translated: Thus, one understands mere fire from mere smoke and from the particular of smoke.

original: khyad par las khyad par yin no //
analyzed: khyad par las khyad par yin no //
translated: But from the particular of smoke, one understands the particular of fire.

original: de'i phyir 'bras bu tsam blo dang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rgyu'i khyad par la mi 'khrul par sems pa dang ldan pas ji ltar smra bar byed /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu tsam blo dang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rgyu'i khyad par la mi 'khrul par sems pa dang ldan pas ji ltar smra bar byed /
translated: Therefore, how can one who is endowed with the understanding of mere effect, who is endowed with the thought that is not in error with regard to the particular of cause, speak in this way?

original: gal te 'bras bu tsam blo dang ldan pa'i rgyu la 'khrul pa ma mthong mod /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu tsam blo dang ldan pa'i rgyu la 'khrul pa ma mthong mod /
translated: If one does not see that one is in error with regard to the cause that is endowed with the understanding of mere effect,

original: 'on kyang khyad par gzhan la 'khrul pa dmigs pa de kho na 'di la 'khrul pa dogs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang khyad par gzhan la 'khrul pa dmigs pa de kho na 'di la 'khrul pa dogs par byed pa yin no //
translated: nevertheless, one sees that one is in error with regard to another particular. One should suspect that one is in error in this case.

original: ma mthong ba tsam gyis ni 'khrul pa dang bral bar rtogs par nus pa ma @22b yin te ;
analyzed: ma mthong ba tsam gyis ni 'khrul pa dang bral bar rtogs par nus pa ma @22b yin te ;
translated: But one cannot understand that one is free from error merely by not seeing error.

original: de kho na bzhin du bsgrub bya med pa yang rtogs par thal ba'i phyir dang / tshad ma log kyang don med par mi 'grub pa'i phyir dang / 'khrul pa dang bcas pa'i gtan tshigs kyang 'khrul pa ma mthong ba'i skyes bu la ltos nas 'khrul pa med par thal ba'i phyir dang /
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du bsgrub bya med pa yang rtogs par thal ba'i phyir dang / tshad ma log kyang don med par mi 'grub pa'i phyir dang / 'khrul pa dang bcas pa'i gtan tshigs kyang 'khrul pa ma mthong ba'i skyes bu la ltos nas 'khrul pa med par thal ba'i phyir dang /
translated: Because it follows that the object to be established would be understood even when it does not exist, because it is not established that the object is nonexistent even when the valid knowledge is refuted, and because it follows that even a mistaken reason would be non mistaken in reliance on a person who does not see the mistake.

original: skyes bu la ltos nas gtan tshigs dang gtan tshigs ltar snang ba yin na /
analyzed: skyes bu la ltos nas gtan tshigs dang gtan tshigs ltar snang ba yin na /
translated: If a reason and a seeming reason are in reliance on a person,

original: de'i dngos po'i rnam par gzhag pa 'jig par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dngos po'i rnam par gzhag pa 'jig par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: then it follows that the presentation of the entities of those two would be destroyed.

original: 'o na du ba la sogs pa yang me la sogs pa la yang 'khrul 'khrul pa ma mthong yang de la mi 'khrul ba mi 'grub pa kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na du ba la sogs pa yang me la sogs pa la yang 'khrul 'khrul pa ma mthong yang de la mi 'khrul ba mi 'grub pa kho na'o zhe na /
translated: Well then, even smoke and so on are not established as non mistaken with respect to fire and so on, even though one does not see them being mistaken.

original: mi 'grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mi 'grub pa ma yin te /
translated: They are not not established.

original: gang gi phyir 'di dag mi mthun phyogs la 'jug la ma mthong ba tsam gyis mi 'khrul ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di dag mi mthun phyogs la 'jug la ma mthong ba tsam gyis mi 'khrul ba ma yin gyi /
translated: Because they do not engage in the discordant class, and nonmistakenness is not due to merely not seeing them being mistaken.

original: 'on kyang rang gi bsgrub par bya ba dang 'brel pa'i phyir yin la /
analyzed: 'on kyang rang gi bsgrub par bya ba dang 'brel pa'i phyir yin la /
translated: But it is because it is related to what is to be established.

original: de yang bsgrub par bya ba'i don las skyes pa'i rgyu mtshan can gyi /
analyzed: de yang bsgrub par bya ba'i don las skyes pa'i rgyu mtshan can gyi /
translated: Moreover, it is a reason that arises from the object to be established,

original: ma mthong ba'i rgyu mtshan can ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ma mthong ba'i rgyu mtshan can ni ma yin no //
translated: not a reason that is not seen.

original: 'o na ma mthong ba tshad mar mi byed na de las byung ba yang mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: 'o na ma mthong ba tshad mar mi byed na de las byung ba yang mi 'grub ste /
translated: If nonseeing is not a valid means of knowledge, then arising from that is not established,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo ni mthong ba dang ma mthong ba'i sgrub byed can yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo ni mthong ba dang ma mthong ba'i sgrub byed can yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because the nature of cause and effect is established by seeing and not seeing.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not so.

original: de dang ma 'brel pa ni de la mi 'khrul pa'i nges pa med pa'i phyir dang / de las byung ba ma yin na yang don dngos po gzhan la 'brel pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang ma 'brel pa ni de la mi 'khrul pa'i nges pa med pa'i phyir dang / de las byung ba ma yin na yang don dngos po gzhan la 'brel pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if it is not related to that, there is no certainty that it is nonerroneous with respect to that, and because if it does not arise from that, it is not tenable that it is related to an actual object that is different.

original: gal te de dang 'brel par 'dod pa gzhan gyi rgyu can yin nam rgyu med pa yin na ni de'i tshe de med kyang rgyu gzhan las sam glo bur du byung ba na /
analyzed: gal te de dang 'brel par 'dod pa gzhan gyi rgyu can yin nam rgyu med pa yin na ni de'i tshe de med kyang rgyu gzhan las sam glo bur du byung ba na /
translated: If it is asserted that it is related to that, but it is caused by another or is causeless, then at that time, even if it does not exist, it arises from another cause or suddenly.

original: 'dod pa'i 'brel pa'i yul la 'brel pa zhes bya bar ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'brel pa'i yul la 'brel pa zhes bya bar ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How could the object of desire be called ‚Äúrelated‚Äù to the desire?

original: ci ste de med par mi 'byung ba de yod na ;
analyzed: ci ste de med par mi 'byung ba de yod na ;
translated: If it is said that the object of desire does not occur without the desire,

original: 'byung na ni de las byung ngo zhes bya bar nan gyis sgrub pa yin na /
analyzed: 'byung na ni de las byung ngo zhes bya bar nan gyis sgrub pa yin na /
translated: and if it occurs when the desire exists, then it is established by force that it arises from the desire.

original: de ji ltar gzhan gyi rgyu can nam rgyu med pa yin zhing de las byung ba med par 'brel pa yang ji ltar yin /
analyzed: de ji ltar gzhan gyi rgyu can nam rgyu med pa yin zhing de las byung ba med par 'brel pa yang ji ltar yin /
translated: How could it be dependent on another or independent? And how could there be a relation when it does not arise from it?

original: gzhan yang re zhig yul gcig tu bsgrub bya med pa la gtan tshigs ma mthong zhes te /
analyzed: gzhan yang re zhig yul gcig tu bsgrub bya med pa la gtan tshigs ma mthong zhes te /
translated: Moreover, it is not the case that the reason is not seen in the absence of the object of inference in one place.

original: de tsam gyis de la mi 'khrul ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de tsam gyis de la mi 'khrul ba ma yin te /
translated: It is not that the reason is nonerroneous merely by that.

original: mi mthun phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la 'jug pa'i thun mong yang rang gi bsgrub par bya ba la mi 'khrul par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi mthun phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la 'jug pa'i thun mong yang rang gi bsgrub par bya ba la mi 'khrul par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it follows that the common reason that engages one part of the discordant side is nonerroneous with regard to its own object of inference.

original: de'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba med pa thams cad du ma dmigs pa de la 'khrul pa'i rgyu brjod par bya ba ma yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba med pa thams cad du ma dmigs pa de la 'khrul pa'i rgyu brjod par bya ba ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, it is not to be said that the cause of error is the nonobservation of the absence of the object of inference in all places.

original: de yang mi @23a * //
analyzed: de yang mi @23a * //
translated: And that is not observed.

original: dmigs pa tsam yin pas na /
analyzed: dmigs pa tsam yin pas na /
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that the reason is nonerroneous merely by that.

original: de las byung ba la sdang srid pa ma yin no //üîΩgzhan yang ci mthong ba dag gis mi 'khrul ma yin no //üîΩgzhan yang ci mthong ba dag gis mi 'khrul pa byed pa yin nam /
analyzed: de las byung ba la sdang srid pa ma yin no // gzhan yang ci mthong ba dag gis mi 'khrul ma yin no // gzhan yang ci mthong ba dag gis mi 'khrul pa byed pa yin nam /
translated: It is not the case that one hates the world because of that.üîΩMoreover, is it the case that what is seen is non-erroneous?

original: 'on te shes par byed pa yin /
analyzed: 'on te shes par byed pa yin /
translated: Or is it the case that what is seen causes non-erroneous knowledge?

original: byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If it causes,

original: ci rang gi ngo bos mi 'khrul pa zhig gi 'am 'on te 'khrul pa zhig gis yin grang /
analyzed: ci rang gi ngo bos mi 'khrul pa zhig gi 'am 'on te 'khrul pa zhig gis yin grang /
translated: is it non-erroneous by its very nature or is it erroneous?

original: de las gal te de rang gi ngo bo mi 'khrul pa yin na de la bya ba gzhan ci zhig yod /
analyzed: de las gal te de rang gi ngo bo mi 'khrul pa yin na de la bya ba gzhan ci zhig yod /
translated: If it is non-erroneous by its very nature, what other action does it have?

original: 'khrul pa zhig ma 'khrul par byed pa yin na ni ma nges pa rgyun chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa zhig ma 'khrul par byed pa yin na ni ma nges pa rgyun chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is erroneous and causes non-erroneous knowledge, then the continuity of the erroneous would be terminated.

original: 'on te shes par byed pa yin na ji ltar 'di mi 'khrul pa yin zhes brjod dgos so //
analyzed: 'on te shes par byed pa yin na ji ltar 'di mi 'khrul pa yin zhes brjod dgos so //
translated: But if it causes knowledge, then it must be said that it is non-erroneous.

original: 'di rgyu mtshan med pa nyid du yin par ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di rgyu mtshan med pa nyid du yin par ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable that it is without a reason,

original: thams cad du yin par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad du yin par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that it would be so in all cases.

original: de las byung ba las gzhan pa'i rgyu mtshan ni btsal yang ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: de las byung ba las gzhan pa'i rgyu mtshan ni btsal yang ma mthong ngo //
translated: But we do not see any reason other than that.

original: rgyu mtshan nges pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan nges pa yin zhe na /
translated: If you say that the reason is ascertained,

original: 'di ni gtam rgyud yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni gtam rgyud yin te /
translated: this is a story.

original: mi 'khrul ba'i ming gzhan can med na mi 'byung ba de nyid kyi rgyu mtshan 'dir spyod pa yin na /
analyzed: mi 'khrul ba'i ming gzhan can med na mi 'byung ba de nyid kyi rgyu mtshan 'dir spyod pa yin na /
translated: If the reason is the non-erroneous name, which is the invariable concomitant, then it is used here.

original: de nyid ni de nyid kyi rgyu mtshan du rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid ni de nyid kyi rgyu mtshan du rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not logical that that is the reason for that.

original: de'i phyir de las byung ba'i rgyu mtshan gyi mi 'khrul ba dang ldan pa'i du ba la sogs pa smad par 'os pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de las byung ba'i rgyu mtshan gyi mi 'khrul ba dang ldan pa'i du ba la sogs pa smad par 'os pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not right to criticize smoke, etc., which have non-erroneous arising from that as a reason.

original: 'bras bu de nyid ni mthong ba tsam gyis mi 'khrul bar ci ltar brjod par nus /
analyzed: 'bras bu de nyid ni mthong ba tsam gyis mi 'khrul bar ci ltar brjod par nus /
translated: How can it be said that the effect itself is non-erroneous merely by being seen?

original: 'o na 'bras bu nyid kyang de las byung ba'i 'brel pa nyid kyis go bar byed pa yin mod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na 'bras bu nyid kyang de las byung ba'i 'brel pa nyid kyis go bar byed pa yin mod ce na /
translated: If you say that the effect itself is understood by the relation of arising from that,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.üîΩüîΩ

original: 'bras bu tsam skyes bu dang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bor ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu tsam skyes bu dang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bor ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the mere arising of the effect is not established as the nature of the person and cause and effect.

original: bum pa la sogs pa 'bras bu'i khyad par rnams kho na skyes bu'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed par mthong gi 'bras bu tsam ni ma yin la /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa 'bras bu'i khyad par rnams kho na skyes bu'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed par mthong gi 'bras bu tsam ni ma yin la /
translated: One sees that specific effects such as a vase follow and conform to the presence or absence of a person, but not mere effects.

original: bum pa la sogs pa la 'bras bu nyid kyang mthong zhes te /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa la 'bras bu nyid kyang mthong zhes te /
translated: And one sees that a vase, etc. is an effect.

original: de yang skyes bu sngon du 'gro bar ni ma grub pa ste /
analyzed: de yang skyes bu sngon du 'gro bar ni ma grub pa ste /
translated: But it is not established that a vase, etc. is preceded by a person.

original: de lta yin na ni de la dngos po tsam yang mthong bas na /
analyzed: de lta yin na ni de la dngos po tsam yang mthong bas na /
translated: If that were so, then since one sees mere things,

original: dngos po tsam yang de lta bu nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po tsam yang de lta bu nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: mere things would be like that.

original: de ltar ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar ni ma yin te /
translated: But that is not so.

original: dngos po nyid ni nam mkha' la sogs pa rtag pa la yang yod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po nyid ni nam mkha' la sogs pa rtag pa la yang yod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because things exist even in permanent things such as space.

original: skyes bus khyab pa'i dngos po nyid kyi gzhi ni nges par skyes bus byas pa nyid myong ba na /
analyzed: skyes bus khyab pa'i dngos po nyid kyi gzhi ni nges par skyes bus byas pa nyid myong ba na /
translated: When the basis of the nature of things that is pervaded by a person is definitely experienced as created by a person,

original: de la rtag pa zhes bya @23b ba ci ltar yod /
analyzed: de la rtag pa zhes bya @23b ba ci ltar yod /
translated: how could it be called permanent?

original: gal te dngos po nyid rtag pa la yang mthong bas na dngos po tsam skyes bu sngon du 'gro bar mi 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po nyid rtag pa la yang mthong bas na dngos po tsam skyes bu sngon du 'gro bar mi 'dod na /
translated: If you do not accept that mere entity is the antecedent of a person, because you see that entity itself is permanent,

original: 'o na 'bras bu nyid kyang sa gzhi la sogs pa skyes bus ma byas pa la yang yod pas na 'bras bu tsam yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'o na 'bras bu nyid kyang sa gzhi la sogs pa skyes bus ma byas pa la yang yod pas na 'bras bu tsam yang ma yin no //
translated: then, since even the effect itself exists without being made by a person, such as the earth, etc., you cannot accept that mere effect is the antecedent of a person.

original: sa gzhi la sogs pa phyogs su byas pas na des ma nges pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: sa gzhi la sogs pa phyogs su byas pas na des ma nges pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not indeterminate because the earth, etc., are made into a part,

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa yang phyogs su byed pa la 'gog par byed pa su yod /
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa yang phyogs su byed pa la 'gog par byed pa su yod /
translated: who would prevent you from making space, etc., into a part?

original: dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i rjes su dpag pa ni lung dang 'gal ba la mi 'jigs so //
analyzed: dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i rjes su dpag pa ni lung dang 'gal ba la mi 'jigs so //
translated: Inference based on the power of fact is not afraid of contradiction with scripture.

original: lung dang 'gal ba bsal bar bya ba yin na sa la sogs pa phyogs su byed pa yang lung gzhan dang 'gal bas na spang bar bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lung dang 'gal ba bsal bar bya ba yin na sa la sogs pa phyogs su byed pa yang lung gzhan dang 'gal bas na spang bar bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you say that contradiction with scripture must be eliminated, then making the earth, etc., into a part contradicts another scripture, so that must be eliminated.

original: rang gi lung dang 'gal ba kho na spang bar bya ba kho na yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rang gi lung dang 'gal ba kho na spang bar bya ba kho na yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that only contradiction with one‚Äôs own scripture must be eliminated,

original: rang gi lung gang yin /
analyzed: rang gi lung gang yin /
translated: what is one‚Äôs own scripture?

original: 'di ltar / skye bo ring bur skyes gyur cing //
analyzed: 'di ltar / skye bo ring bur skyes gyur cing //
translated: People are born as short or tall,

original: yon tan nyes pa ma mthong la //üîΩkye ma grub mtha' mi bzad pa'i //
analyzed: yon tan nyes pa ma mthong la // kye ma grub mtha' mi bzad pa'i //
translated: and do not see good qualities or faults.üîΩAlas! Who has smeared this

original: gdon 'di su yis bsgos pa yin //
analyzed: gdon 'di su yis bsgos pa yin //
translated: terrible poison of tenets?

original: 'o na 'bras bu nyid ni ma byung ba las byung ba'i mtshan nyid can ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'o na 'bras bu nyid ni ma byung ba las byung ba'i mtshan nyid can ma yin nam /
translated: But is not the effect characterized by arising from what has not arisen?

original: de ni bum pa la sogs pa dang sa gzhi la sogs pa la yang khyad par cung zad med do //
analyzed: de ni bum pa la sogs pa dang sa gzhi la sogs pa la yang khyad par cung zad med do //
translated: There is not the slightest difference between that and such things as a pot and such things as the earth.

original: des na gal te 'bras bu 'ga' zhig skyes bus byas pa yin na thams cad de lta bu kho nar 'gyur la yang 'ga' yang ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: des na gal te 'bras bu 'ga' zhig skyes bus byas pa yin na thams cad de lta bu kho nar 'gyur la yang 'ga' yang ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, if any effect is produced by a person, all would be just like that, but some are not.

original: de ni mi bden te /
analyzed: de ni mi bden te /
translated: That is not correct,

original: 'di dngos po nyid la yang mtshungs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di dngos po nyid la yang mtshungs pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it is similar with respect to things.

original: 'di ltar 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di skad du /
translated: Thus, one can say:

original: gal te dngos po 'ga' zhig skyes bus byas pa yin na thams cad kyang de lta bu kho nar 'gyur la yang na 'ga' yang ma yin no zhes brjod par nus so ;
analyzed: gal te dngos po 'ga' zhig skyes bus byas pa yin na thams cad kyang de lta bu kho nar 'gyur la yang na 'ga' yang ma yin no zhes brjod par nus so ;
translated: If any thing is produced by a person, all would be just like that, but some are not.

original: / bum pa la sogs pa la dngos po nyid gzhan yin la /
analyzed: / bum pa la sogs pa la dngos po nyid gzhan yin la /
translated: A pot, etc. is a different entity from space, etc.

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa la gzhan yin pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa la gzhan yin pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but is not a different entity from a pot, etc.

original: 'dis ni mkhas par rlom pa 'ga' zhig gis /
analyzed: 'dis ni mkhas par rlom pa 'ga' zhig gis /
translated: This also refutes the claim of some who are conceited with the pride of being learned,

original: gang las 'bras bu'i khyad par la khyab cing 'bras bu tsam la ma khyab po zhes brjod pa 'dir bu gnyis yod dam zhes gang brjod pa de yang bsal ba yin te /
analyzed: gang las 'bras bu'i khyad par la khyab cing 'bras bu tsam la ma khyab po zhes brjod pa 'dir bu gnyis yod dam zhes gang brjod pa de yang bsal ba yin te /
translated: that the pervasion is based on the difference of the effect, but not on the effect itself.

original: de la kho bo cag kyang smra ste /
analyzed: de la kho bo cag kyang smra ste /
translated: We also say this:

original: gang gis dngos po'i khyad par la khyab po //
analyzed: gang gis dngos po'i khyad par la khyab po //
translated: The pervasion is based on the difference of the entity,üîΩbut not on the entity itself.

original: dngos po tsam la ma khyab po zhes brjod pa 'dir dngos po gnyis yod dam /
analyzed: dngos po tsam la ma khyab po zhes brjod pa 'dir dngos po gnyis yod dam /
translated: In this case, is there a double entity?

original: kho bo cag ni 'bras bu gnyis la khyab pa yod par mi @24a * //üîΩsmra'i ; 'on kyang 'bras bu rnams la yin no //
analyzed: kho bo cag ni 'bras bu gnyis la khyab pa yod par mi @24a * // smra'i ; 'on kyang 'bras bu rnams la yin no //
translated: We do not claim that there is a pervasion of two effects,üîΩbut rather of all effects.

original: ma ba las byung ba tsam gyis ni 'bras bu'i bdag nyid thams cad chos mtshungs par ma grub ste /
analyzed: ma ba las byung ba tsam gyis ni 'bras bu'i bdag nyid thams cad chos mtshungs par ma grub ste /
translated: The mere fact that something comes from milk does not establish that all effects have the same properties.

original: de lta bu nyid du yang gzugs la sogs pa tha dad dang rgyu tha dad pa yang mngon sum du grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bu nyid du yang gzugs la sogs pa tha dad dang rgyu tha dad pa yang mngon sum du grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because form and so on are established as different and their causes are also established as different.

original: 'dis ni 'bras bu 'ga' zhig skyes bu sngon du 'gro bar mthong nas de dag dang rigs mi mthun pa rnams kyang 'bras bu tsam du mtshungs pas de ltar rnam par 'jog pa na /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'bras bu 'ga' zhig skyes bu sngon du 'gro bar mthong nas de dag dang rigs mi mthun pa rnams kyang 'bras bu tsam du mtshungs pas de ltar rnam par 'jog pa na /
translated: This is because when one sees that some effects are preceded by a person, and those that are not similar in type are also similar in being mere effects, then

original: rig pa ngal ba'i 'bras bu shin tu thob pa yin te /
analyzed: rig pa ngal ba'i 'bras bu shin tu thob pa yin te /
translated: one has attained the fruit of great weariness,

original: gang gi bud med dang dmangs rigs dang thun mong ba'i khyad par yang mi rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi bud med dang dmangs rigs dang thun mong ba'i khyad par yang mi rtogs pa'o //
translated: for one does not understand the difference between a woman and a ≈õ≈´dra.

original: 'o na skyes bus byas pa nyid du rtsod pa'i gzhi ma yin pa'i bum pa la sogs pa phan tshun du rigs mi mthun pa kho na ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'o na skyes bus byas pa nyid du rtsod pa'i gzhi ma yin pa'i bum pa la sogs pa phan tshun du rigs mi mthun pa kho na ma yin nam /
translated: Well, are not pots and so on, which are not the basis of dispute over being created by a person, mutually different in type?

original: des na gal te lus la sogs pa bum pa la sogs pa dang rigs mi mthun pa nyid kyis skyes bu sngon du 'gro bar rnam par mi 'jog na /
analyzed: des na gal te lus la sogs pa bum pa la sogs pa dang rigs mi mthun pa nyid kyis skyes bu sngon du 'gro bar rnam par mi 'jog na /
translated: Therefore, if the body and so on are not posited as preceded by a person because they are different in type from pots and so on,

original: re de dag la yang phan tshun ltos nas de yod pas na de dag kyang de ltar rnam par mi 'jog par 'jug go //
analyzed: re de dag la yang phan tshun ltos nas de yod pas na de dag kyang de ltar rnam par mi 'jog par 'jug go //
translated: Moreover, since they exist in mutual dependence, they are not posited in that way.

original: gang gis de dag sde tshan gcig tu byed pa bum pa la sogs pa rtsod pa med pa rnams la ni lus la sogs pa dang thun mong ma yin pa thun mong gi chos 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: gang gis de dag sde tshan gcig tu byed pa bum pa la sogs pa rtsod pa med pa rnams la ni lus la sogs pa dang thun mong ma yin pa thun mong gi chos 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin la /
translated: There is no common property that is not shared with the body, etc., in the case of such undisputed things as pots, etc., which are made into a single class.

original: de dag sde tshan gcig tu byas pa med par lus la sogs pa shin tu rigs mi mthun par rnam par gzhag par mi 'os so //
analyzed: de dag sde tshan gcig tu byas pa med par lus la sogs pa shin tu rigs mi mthun par rnam par gzhag par mi 'os so //
translated: Without their being made into a single class, it is not appropriate to posit the body, etc., as a heterogeneous group.

original: 'di snyam du gang zhig mthong bas byed pa ma mthong yang byas pa'i blor 'gyur pa'i 'bras bu de de ni blo dang ldan pa'i rgyu can yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di snyam du gang zhig mthong bas byed pa ma mthong yang byas pa'i blor 'gyur pa'i 'bras bu de de ni blo dang ldan pa'i rgyu can yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: If you think that the effect, which is the cognition of an action even though the action is not seen, is due to an intelligent cause, not to anything else,

original: lus la sogs pa 'di dag ni 'jig rten la byas pa'i blo mi skyed de /
analyzed: lus la sogs pa 'di dag ni 'jig rten la byas pa'i blo mi skyed de /
translated: then the body, etc., do not produce the cognition of an action in the world.

original: des na blo dang ldan pa'i rgyu can nyid du rnam par mi 'jog go snyam na /
analyzed: des na blo dang ldan pa'i rgyu can nyid du rnam par mi 'jog go snyam na /
translated: Therefore, they are not posited as being due to an intelligent cause.

original: de ni bden te /
analyzed: de ni bden te /
translated: That is true,

original: byas pa'i blo ni rjes su dpag pa'i bdag nyid can yin la /üîΩrjes su dpag pa yang khyab pa grub pa la ltos shing /
analyzed: byas pa'i blo ni rjes su dpag pa'i bdag nyid can yin la / rjes su dpag pa yang khyab pa grub pa la ltos shing /
translated: but the cognition of an effect is of the nature of inference,üîΩand inference depends on the establishment of a pervasion.

original: de yang rjes su dpag pa la ltos pa na shin tu gsal bar phan tshun brten pa nyid do //
analyzed: de yang rjes su dpag pa la ltos pa na shin tu gsal bar phan tshun brten pa nyid do //
translated: And if that depends on inference, then they are clearly mutually dependent.

original: des na khyad par dang 'brel pa gzung bar mi nus pa'i phyir 'bras bu tsam kho na skyes bu sngon du 'gro bar rtogs par bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: des na khyad par dang 'brel pa gzung bar mi nus pa'i phyir 'bras bu tsam kho na skyes bu sngon du 'gro bar rtogs par bya'o zhe na /
translated: Therefore, because it is impossible to apprehend a connection with a specific effect, one should understand that a mere effect is preceded by a person.

original: 'o na gal te 'bras bu 'ga' zhig skyes bu sngon du 'gro bar mthong bas thams cad de ltar rtogs na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te 'bras bu 'ga' zhig skyes bu sngon du 'gro bar mthong bas thams cad de ltar rtogs na /
translated: But if one infers that all effects are preceded by a person because one sees that some effects are preceded by a person,

original: 'ga' @24b zhig me'i rgyu can du mthong bas na /üîΩde lta bu nyid du rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'ga' @24b zhig me'i rgyu can du mthong bas na / de lta bu nyid du rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: then because one sees that some effects are caused by fire,üîΩone would infer that all effects are caused by fire.

original: de ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: But that is not so.

original: me'i 'bras bu ni rigs gcig pa yin te /
analyzed: me'i 'bras bu ni rigs gcig pa yin te /
translated: The effect of fire is of the same type,

original: des na der rigs gzhan spangs nas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bor rtogs par nus so //
analyzed: des na der rigs gzhan spangs nas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bor rtogs par nus so //
translated: so it is possible to understand that it is the cause of that effect, having excluded other types.

original: skyes bu'i 'bras bu rnams ni rigs sna tshogs pa yin te /
analyzed: skyes bu'i 'bras bu rnams ni rigs sna tshogs pa yin te /
translated: The effects of persons are of various types.

original: de dag la khyad par du de las byung ba'i 'brel pa rtogs par nus so //
analyzed: de dag la khyad par du de las byung ba'i 'brel pa rtogs par nus so //
translated: One can understand the relation of cause and effect in terms of the specific and the general.

original: 'di ltar bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i skyes bu'i 'bras bu rnams ni nus pa sna tshogs pa dang gzugs sna tshogs pas na phan tshun rigs mi mthun pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i skyes bu'i 'bras bu rnams ni nus pa sna tshogs pa dang gzugs sna tshogs pas na phan tshun rigs mi mthun pa yin la /
translated: The effects of persons, such as pots and cloth, are of various capacities and various forms, and thus are not homogeneous.

original: 'bras bu tsam du chos mthun par dmigs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'bras bu tsam du chos mthun par dmigs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But they are observed to be similar in being effects.

original: thal ba dang sol ba dang du ba dang tshos pa la sogs pa me'i 'bras bu rnams kyang phan tshun rigs mi mthun pa kho na ma yin nam /
analyzed: thal ba dang sol ba dang du ba dang tshos pa la sogs pa me'i 'bras bu rnams kyang phan tshun rigs mi mthun pa kho na ma yin nam /
translated: But are not the effects of fire, such as ashes, charcoal, smoke, and heat, also not homogeneous?

original: des na der yang 'bras bu tsam yang med pa dang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel par rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: des na der yang 'bras bu tsam yang med pa dang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel par rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should understand that even in that case, there is no effect that is merely an effect, and one should understand the relation of cause and effect.

original: brjod pa / me'i 'bras bu rnams ni thal ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin tha dad kyang bud shing gi rnam par 'gyur ba'i bdag nyid du rigs gcig pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: brjod pa / me'i 'bras bu rnams ni thal ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin tha dad kyang bud shing gi rnam par 'gyur ba'i bdag nyid du rigs gcig pa kho na yin te /
translated: The reply is: The results of fire, although different in nature, such as ashes, etc., are of the same class in that they are of the nature of the transformation of fuel.

original: des na de'i sgo nas der 'brel pa'i blo 'byung bas na ha cang thal ba yang med la /
analyzed: des na de'i sgo nas der 'brel pa'i blo 'byung bas na ha cang thal ba yang med la /
translated: Therefore, since the cognition of their connection arises in regard to them, there is no absurd consequence.

original: tshun chad du ldog pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: tshun chad du ldog pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is there a contradiction in the exclusion of the other.

original: yang de dag la ni tshad yod pas na sde tshan gcig tu byas pa med kyang de las gzhan spangs na me dang 'brel pa rtogs pa mi 'gal ba kho na'o //
analyzed: yang de dag la ni tshad yod pas na sde tshan gcig tu byas pa med kyang de las gzhan spangs na me dang 'brel pa rtogs pa mi 'gal ba kho na'o //
translated: Moreover, since they are finite, there is no reason to make them one class, but there is no contradiction in the cognition of their connection with fire when the other is excluded.

original: yang na me dang 'bras bu cem la ni 'khrul 'gyur la /
analyzed: yang na me dang 'bras bu cem la ni 'khrul 'gyur la /
translated: Or, there would be error in regard to fire and its result,

original: skyes bu dang lhan cig de ma dmigs pas na 'gyur te /üîΩ'gyur la / skyes bu dang ltan cig de ma dmigs pas na 'gyur te /
analyzed: skyes bu dang lhan cig de ma dmigs pas na 'gyur te / 'gyur la / skyes bu dang ltan cig de ma dmigs pas na 'gyur te /
translated: but not in regard to a man and a lamp, since the latter is not observed together with the former.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tha snyad ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tha snyad ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The convention of cause and effect is based on the reason of invariable concomitance.

original: 'bras bu tsam la ni me'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu tsam la ni me'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But the mere effect does not follow the presence and absence of fire,

original: de med kyang bum pa la sogs pa la skye ba mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med kyang bum pa la sogs pa la skye ba mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because even when it is absent, the arising of a pot, etc. is seen.

original: 'o na skyes bu'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa la yang med de ;
analyzed: 'o na skyes bu'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa la yang med de ;
translated: Well, then, the presence and absence of a person is not followed by the presence and absence of grass, etc.

original: de med kyang rtsva la sogs pa la skye ba dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /üîΩma yin te /
analyzed: de med kyang rtsva la sogs pa la skye ba dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhe na / ma yin te /
translated: because even when he is absent, the arising of grass, etc. is observed.

original: de med par mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med par mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because it is not established that he is absent.

original: 'o na na bum pa la sogs pa la yang me med pa mi 'grub po zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na na bum pa la sogs pa la yang me med pa mi 'grub po zhe na /
translated: Well, then, it is not established that fire is absent in a pot, etc.

original: mi 'grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mi 'grub pa ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not not established,

original: snang rung gi bdag nyid de der mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snang rung gi bdag nyid de der mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the nature of what is suitable to appear is not perceived there.

original: de nyid kyi @25a * //
analyzed: de nyid kyi @25a * //
translated: For that very reason,

original: phyir rtsva la sogs pa yang skyes bu med pa de ci'i ci'i phyir mi 'grub /
analyzed: phyir rtsva la sogs pa yang skyes bu med pa de ci'i ci'i phyir mi 'grub /
translated: why is it not established that grass, etc. are absent when a person is absent?

original: de ni dbang po las 'das pa yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: de ni dbang po las 'das pa yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: Because that is beyond the senses.

original: dbang po las 'das pa don rnams ni ma mthong ba tsam gyis med par mi 'grub po //
analyzed: dbang po las 'das pa don rnams ni ma mthong ba tsam gyis med par mi 'grub po //
translated: But it is not established that objects beyond the range of the sense faculties do not exist merely because they are not seen.

original: dbang po las 'das pa ma yin pa'i me ni mthong ba med pa'i phyir me nyid do //
analyzed: dbang po las 'das pa ma yin pa'i me ni mthong ba med pa'i phyir me nyid do //
translated: Fire that is not beyond the range of the sense faculties is not fire because it is not seen.

original: 'o na bum pa la sogs pa la yang skyes bu dbang po las 'das pa ma yin pa kho na bya ba byed par mthong ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'o na bum pa la sogs pa la yang skyes bu dbang po las 'das pa ma yin pa kho na bya ba byed par mthong ba ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it seen that a pot and so on is an object that is not beyond the range of the sense faculties?

original: gal te de lta bur gyur pa kho na rtsva la sogs pa la sgrub na /
analyzed: gal te de lta bur gyur pa kho na rtsva la sogs pa la sgrub na /
translated: If it is established that grass and so on is like that,üîΩthen how could it be that it is not seen and it is not established that it does not exist?

original: de ma dmigs pas na med pa ji ltar ma yin snang du rung ba dang snang du mi rung bar rnam par rtog pa bsal te skyes bu tsam rgyu nyid kyi khyab byed du rtogs te /
analyzed: de ma dmigs pas na med pa ji ltar ma yin snang du rung ba dang snang du mi rung bar rnam par rtog pa bsal te skyes bu tsam rgyu nyid kyi khyab byed du rtogs te /
translated: The conception that it is suitable or not suitable to appear is eliminated. A mere person is realized as the pervader of the cause.

original: des na de ma mthong ba las med par grub pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: des na de ma mthong ba las med par grub pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it is not established that it does not exist from not seeing it.

original: me la yang tshul 'di nyid du ji ltar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: me la yang tshul 'di nyid du ji ltar mi 'gyur /
translated: Why wouldn‚Äôt this same method apply to fire?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it would not.

original: btso ba dang / sreg pa la sogs pa byed pa'i snang rung gi khyad par khon me yin pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: btso ba dang / sreg pa la sogs pa byed pa'i snang rung gi khyad par khon me yin pa'i phyir ro//
translated: because the particularities of what is suitable to appear‚Äîsuch as being cooked, being burned, and so on‚Äîare fire.

original: skyes bu ni snang rung nyid du nges pa ma yin pas na /
analyzed: skyes bu ni snang rung nyid du nges pa ma yin pas na /
translated: But a person is not ascertained to be suitable to appear,

original: snga ma dang mtshungs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: snga ma dang mtshungs pa ma yin no //
translated: so it is not the same as the previous case.

original: de'i phyir gang 'bras bu yin pa de thams cad ni skyes bu sngon du 'gro ba yin pas na /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang 'bras bu yin pa de thams cad ni skyes bu sngon du 'gro ba yin pas na /
translated: Therefore, since everything that is an effect is preceded by a person,

original: lus la sogs pa yang 'bras bu yin pa nyid kyis de lta bur gyur par 'grub po //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa yang 'bras bu yin pa nyid kyis de lta bur gyur par 'grub po //
translated: the body and so on are established as being like that, because they are effects.

original: 'di ni dam pa ma yin pa'i lta ba'i chang gis myos pas rmongs pa'i nyes par bslabs pa rnams kyi bla col yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni dam pa ma yin pa'i lta ba'i chang gis myos pas rmongs pa'i nyes par bslabs pa rnams kyi bla col yin te /
translated: This is the nonsense of those who are trained in the faults of delusion, who are intoxicated by the beer of non-Buddhist views.

original: de ltar re zhig skyes bu'i 'bras bu rab tu grub pa rnams rigs du ma yin pa'i phyir sde tshan gcig tu bya bar mi nus pas na /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig skyes bu'i 'bras bu rab tu grub pa rnams rigs du ma yin pa'i phyir sde tshan gcig tu bya bar mi nus pas na /
translated: Thus, first, since the effects of a person are established as being of many types, it is impossible to make them into a single class.

original: khyad par du 'brel pa 'dzin pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: khyad par du 'brel pa 'dzin pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir /
