translated: Therefore, it is not tenable to apprehend a specific connection.

original: 'bras bu tsam la skyes bu khyad par rtogs pa yin no zhes gang brjod pa de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu tsam la skyes bu khyad par rtogs pa yin no zhes gang brjod pa de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: But this is not correct.

original: de lta yin na lus can skyes bus kyang 'bras bu tsam la khyab par rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na lus can skyes bus kyang 'bras bu tsam la khyab par rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then even a physical person would be a cognizer of the mere effect.

original: de ltar ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar ni ma yin te /
translated: But that is not so,

original: lus nye bar mi sbyor ba de 'bras bu skye ba mthong ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: lus nye bar mi sbyor ba de 'bras bu skye ba mthong ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because one sees that the effect arises without the body being applied.

original: de ci da ni 'bras bu la lus kyis ma khyab pa kho na yin nam /
analyzed: de ci da ni 'bras bu la lus kyis ma khyab pa kho na yin nam /
translated: But is it not the case that the body does not pervade the effect?

original: de lta'o zhe na /
analyzed: de lta'o zhe na /
translated: If that is so,

original: kha cig la lus kyi byed pa rjes su dpog pa gang yin pa der mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kha cig la lus kyi byed pa rjes su dpog pa gang yin pa der mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then the body would not be inferred to be the agent in that case.

original: 'bras bu tsam la ma khyab pa yin gyi 'bras bu'i khyad par la khyab pa kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'bras bu tsam la ma khyab pa yin gyi 'bras bu'i khyad par la khyab pa kho na'o zhe na /
translated: But it is not the case that the body does not pervade the mere effect, it pervades the specific effect.

original: gang gis sde tshan gcig tu byas nas lus kyis khyab par 'gyur ba lus @25b gyis nye bar sbyor ba med pas bskyed par bya ba'i 'bras bu'i tshogs dang thun mong ma yin pa de dag la /
analyzed: gang gis sde tshan gcig tu byas nas lus kyis khyab par 'gyur ba lus @25b gyis nye bar sbyor ba med pas bskyed par bya ba'i 'bras bu'i tshogs dang thun mong ma yin pa de dag la /
translated: But the body is not applied to those effects that are not common to the collection of effects that are generated without the body being applied, and which are grouped together as one class.

original: thun mong gi chos ci zhig yod de /
analyzed: thun mong gi chos ci zhig yod de /
translated: What commonality do they have?

original: sde tshan gcig tu byas pa med pa yang khyad par du khyab pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir khyad par med pa kho nar 'gyur la /
analyzed: sde tshan gcig tu byas pa med pa yang khyad par du khyab pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir khyad par med pa kho nar 'gyur la /
translated: If they are not posited as a single class, then it is not tenable to posit them as a single class in a general way.

original: 'khrul pa yin na yang mi 'gyur ba kho na'o ;üîΩ/ ji ste lus kyi 'bras bu nyid du grub pa 'ga' kho na la /
analyzed: 'khrul pa yin na yang mi 'gyur ba kho na'o ; / ji ste lus kyi 'bras bu nyid du grub pa 'ga' kho na la /
translated: If they are mistaken, then they are not posited as a single class.

original: gcig tu lus kyis nye bar sbyor ba mthong bas na de thams cad du rnam par 'jog pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gcig tu lus kyis nye bar sbyor ba mthong bas na de thams cad du rnam par 'jog pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: If you say that it is only in the case of some established results of the body that the body is seen to be applied in a single way, and therefore it is not the case that it is posited in all cases,

original: 'on kyang gang gi rigs can la lus kyis byed pa mthong ba de'i rigs kho na la yin la /
analyzed: 'on kyang gang gi rigs can la lus kyis byed pa mthong ba de'i rigs kho na la yin la /
translated: but rather it is only in the class of beings in whom the body is seen to function that it is posited,

original: des na ha cang khyab pa ma yin no snyam na ;
analyzed: des na ha cang khyab pa ma yin no snyam na ;
translated: and therefore it is not the case that there is over-extension,

original: 'o na de lta na gang gi rigs can la blo dang ldan pa'i byed pa mthong ba de'i rigs kho na la de rnam par gzhag par bya'i /
analyzed: 'o na de lta na gang gi rigs can la blo dang ldan pa'i byed pa mthong ba de'i rigs kho na la de rnam par gzhag par bya'i /
translated: then in that case, it is only in the class of beings in whom the function of the mind is seen that it should be posited, but not in a general way.

original: khyad par med par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: khyad par med par ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that it is posited without distinction.

original: 'khrul pa yod pas na lus kyis khyab pa ni khyad par med par ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'khrul pa yod pas na lus kyis khyab pa ni khyad par med par ma yin gyi /
translated: But it is not the case that the body pervades all because error exists.

original: 'dir ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: But it is not so here.

original: 'khrul pa ma mthong ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'khrul pa ma mthong ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because error is not seen.

original: 'khrul pa mthong ngo zhes bya ba 'di tsam gyis ni khyab pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'khrul pa mthong ngo zhes bya ba 'di tsam gyis ni khyab pa ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not the case that mere seeing of error is pervasion.

original: 'on kyang 'brel pa sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma'i dbang gis yin la /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'brel pa sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma'i dbang gis yin la /
translated: But it is by the power of valid cognition that establishes the relation.

original: 'ga' zhig tu skyes bu ni gcig la 'brel pa grub pas thams cad du de grub pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu skyes bu ni gcig la 'brel pa grub pas thams cad du de grub pa ni ma yin te /
translated: And in some cases, the relation is established for one person, but it is not established for everyone.

original: 'ji ba'i rnam 'gyur gyi khyad par tsam la blo dang ldan pa'i nye bar sbyor ba mthong ba'i mkhas pa su yang snam bu la sogs pa la de'i tha snyad byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'ji ba'i rnam 'gyur gyi khyad par tsam la blo dang ldan pa'i nye bar sbyor ba mthong ba'i mkhas pa su yang snam bu la sogs pa la de'i tha snyad byed pa ma yin te /
translated: No wise person who sees the mere difference in the shape of clay is the application of the intelligent, and applies the convention of cloth, etc. to cloth, etc.

original: gzhan du na rdza mkhan gyi nye bar sbyor ba kho na rnam par gzhag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na rdza mkhan gyi nye bar sbyor ba kho na rnam par gzhag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the application of the potter alone would be established.

original: 'khrul pa mthong ba'i phyir ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'khrul pa mthong ba'i phyir ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say it is not because error is seen,

original: 'o na 'ji ba'i rnam 'gyur gyi khyad par gcig la rdza mkhan gyi nye bar sbyor ba mthong bas kyang /
analyzed: 'o na 'ji ba'i rnam 'gyur gyi khyad par gcig la rdza mkhan gyi nye bar sbyor ba mthong bas kyang /
translated: Well then, since one sees the application of the potter to a single instance of the transformation of clay,üîΩ

original: 'ji ba'i rnam 'gyur gyi khyad par gzhan la yang rnam par mi 'jog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'ji ba'i rnam 'gyur gyi khyad par gzhan la yang rnam par mi 'jog par 'gyur ro //
translated: But then, since one sees the application of the potter to a particular transformation of clay, one would not posit that particular transformation of clay.

original: 'khrul pa mthong ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'khrul pa mthong ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because one sees error.

original: 'khrul par mthong ba dang rigs mthun pa la 'khrul ba ma dmigs kyang dogs pa mi ldog pa kho na'o ;
analyzed: 'khrul par mthong ba dang rigs mthun pa la 'khrul ba ma dmigs kyang dogs pa mi ldog pa kho na'o ;
translated: Even though one does not observe error in that which is similar to what is seen as error, doubt is not eliminated.

original: / bum pa la sogs pa la phan tshun du mi mthun pas na de lta ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: / bum pa la sogs pa la phan tshun du mi mthun pas na de lta ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But a pot, etc., are not like that, because they are mutually incompatible.

original: 'o na blo dang ldan pa tsam gyi nye bar sbyor ba yang khyad par med par mi 'grub po //
analyzed: 'o na blo dang ldan pa tsam gyi nye bar sbyor ba yang khyad par med par mi 'grub po //
translated: But then the application of mere intelligence is not established without distinction.

original: 'bras bu nyid du rigs gcig pas na 'grub po zhe na /
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid du rigs gcig pas na 'grub po zhe na /
translated: But it is established because of the similarity of type in the effect.

original: de kho na bzhin du rdza mkhan gyi nye bar sbyor ba yang grub par @26a * //
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du rdza mkhan gyi nye bar sbyor ba yang grub par @26a * //
translated: In the same way, the application of the potter is established.

original: 'gyur ro // de'i phyir gang dang gang rigs mthun pa la skyes bu'i byed pa snang ba de dang de la skyes bus byas pa nyid du rnam par gzhag par bya'o zhes rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gyur ro // de'i phyir gang dang gang rigs mthun pa la skyes bu'i byed pa snang ba de dang de la skyes bus byas pa nyid du rnam par gzhag par bya'o zhes rigs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is logical to posit that whatever is similar to that which is seen to have human action is produced by humans.

original: gang zhig mthong bas byed pa ma mthong ba la yang byas pa'i blor 'gyur ba de skyes bus byas zhes bya ba yang rigs mthun pa la 'brel pa 'dzin pa'i tshad ma'i 'jug pa ston pa yin pas na phan tshun brten pa'i skyon ga la yod /
analyzed: gang zhig mthong bas byed pa ma mthong ba la yang byas pa'i blor 'gyur ba de skyes bus byas zhes bya ba yang rigs mthun pa la 'brel pa 'dzin pa'i tshad ma'i 'jug pa ston pa yin pas na phan tshun brten pa'i skyon ga la yod /
translated: If one sees that the cognition of being produced arises even when the action is not seen, then the statement ‚Äúproduced by humans‚Äù shows the engagement of the valid cognition that apprehends the relation in similar instances. Therefore, how can there be the fault of mutual dependence?

original: 'di ltar 'dir don ni gang zhig mthong bas byed pa la ma mthong ba'i rtogs pa po la yang dus gzhan na rjes su dpag pa'i bdag nyid kyis byas pa'i blo 'byung ba de ni khyab pa'i dus su de lta bus byas pa yin no zhes rtogs pa
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dir don ni gang zhig mthong bas byed pa la ma mthong ba'i rtogs pa po la yang dus gzhan na rjes su dpag pa'i bdag nyid kyis byas pa'i blo 'byung ba de ni khyab pa'i dus su de lta bus byas pa yin no zhes rtogs pa
translated: In this case, the meaning is this: If the cognition of being produced arises in the one who does not see the action when it is seen, then at another time, it arises by the nature of inference. That is produced by that which is similar to it at the time of the pervasion.

original: yin no zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: yin no zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: This is what is understood.

original: gang mthong bas byas pa'i blor 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang mthong bas byas pa'i blor 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the cognition that arises from seeing?

original: gang gi rigs can la skyes bu dang lhan cig 'brel pa grub par byed pa'i tshad ma byung bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi rigs can la skyes bu dang lhan cig 'brel pa grub par byed pa'i tshad ma byung bar gyur pa'o //
translated: It is the one in whose mind the valid cognition that establishes the connection between the person and the body, etc. has not arisen.

original: lus la sogs pa ni de lta ma yin pas na khyab pa las phyi rol kho nar gnas so //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa ni de lta ma yin pas na khyab pa las phyi rol kho nar gnas so //
translated: But the body, etc. are not like that, so they remain outside the pervasion.

original: 'dis ni kha cig gis lus la sogs pa la byas pa'i blor mi 'gyur ro zhes smra ba la /üîΩci khyab pa gzung ba la'am /
analyzed: 'dis ni kha cig gis lus la sogs pa la byas pa'i blor mi 'gyur ro zhes smra ba la / ci khyab pa gzung ba la'am /
translated: Here, someone says that the cognition of the body, etc. is not produced.üîΩIs it that the pervasion is not apprehended,

original: 'on te khyab pa ma gzung ba la yin zhes rgal zhing brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: 'on te khyab pa ma gzung ba la yin zhes rgal zhing brtag par bya ste /
translated: or is it that the pervasion is apprehended?

original: gal te phyogs dang po yin na /
analyzed: gal te phyogs dang po yin na /
translated: If it is the first,

original: de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te /
translated: that is not correct.

original: khyab par rtogs pa can gyis khyab bya mthong bas na khyab byed mi rtogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: khyab par rtogs pa can gyis khyab bya mthong bas na khyab byed mi rtogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: For one who understands the pervasion sees the pervaded, so it is not that one does not understand the pervader.

original: thams cad du mi rtogs par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad du mi rtogs par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that one would not understand anything at all.

original: gal te phyi ma ltar yin na lus la sogs pa la zhes bya ba 'di shin tu nyung ba smras pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te phyi ma ltar yin na lus la sogs pa la zhes bya ba 'di shin tu nyung ba smras pa yin te /
translated: If it is the latter, then this statement ‚Äúthe body, etc.‚Äù is extremely brief.

original: bum pa la sogs pa la yang khyab pa ma gtogs pa la byas pa'i blor mi 'gyur ba kho na'o zhes gang smras pa de yang bsal ba yin te /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa la yang khyab pa ma gtogs pa la byas pa'i blor mi 'gyur ba kho na'o zhes gang smras pa de yang bsal ba yin te /
translated: Also, the statement ‚ÄúIn the case of a pot, etc., it is impossible to have a cognition of it without apprehending the pervasion‚Äù is refuted,

original: rigs mthun pa la tshad ma ma zhugs par khyab pa 'dzin pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs mthun pa la tshad ma ma zhugs par khyab pa 'dzin pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is untenable to apprehend a pervasion without a valid cognition engaging a similar type.

original: 'o na 'dir yang rigs mthun pa la tshad ma 'jug pa yod pa kho na ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'o na 'dir yang rigs mthun pa la tshad ma 'jug pa yod pa kho na ma yin nam /
translated: Well, in this case, doesn‚Äôt a valid cognition engage a similar type?

original: rtsed mo'i ri ni ri rnams kyi rigs mthun pa yin la /
analyzed: rtsed mo'i ri ni ri rnams kyi rigs mthun pa yin la /
translated: The toy mountain is a similar type of mountain.

original: 'dra gzugs kyi lus ni lus kyi yin zhing /
analyzed: 'dra gzugs kyi lus ni lus kyi yin zhing /
translated: The body of a statue is a similar type of body.

original: brus pa'i chu klung ni chu klung gi /
analyzed: brus pa'i chu klung ni chu klung gi /
translated: The dug-up river is a similar type of river.

original: 'dir so ngal ba sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi shing ni shing rnams kyi yin zhing /
analyzed: 'dir so ngal ba sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi shing ni shing rnams kyi yin zhing /
translated: The tree with a nature of being cut down, etc., is a similar type of tree.

original: de dag kyang skyes bu'i byed pa rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed par tshad mas rtogs pa @26b kho na'o ;
analyzed: de dag kyang skyes bu'i byed pa rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed par tshad mas rtogs pa @26b kho na'o ;
translated: It is only through valid knowledge that one realizes that these are engaged by the activity of a person.

original: /'dir de dag de lta bu yin yang khyab pa mi rtogs na /
analyzed: /'dir de dag de lta bu yin yang khyab pa mi rtogs na /
translated: If one does not realize the pervasion even though they are like that,

original: 'o na 'gar yang mi rtogs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na 'gar yang mi rtogs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But then it would never be cognized.

original: 'di ni ma bslabs pa'i brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni ma bslabs pa'i brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is the statement of one who has not studied.

original: 'di ltar gal te skyes bu dang bral ba'i ri la sogs pa de las gzhan pa'i rigs mthun pa yin na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te skyes bu dang bral ba'i ri la sogs pa de las gzhan pa'i rigs mthun pa yin na /
translated: For if a mountain, etc., which is devoid of a person, is of the same class as that,

original: de dag kho na bzhin du de dag kyang bdag cag la sogs pa dang khyad par med pa'i blo dang ldan pa'i skyes bu sngon du 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag kho na bzhin du de dag kyang bdag cag la sogs pa dang khyad par med pa'i blo dang ldan pa'i skyes bu sngon du 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then just like that, it would be preceded by a person who has a mind that is not different from us, etc.

original: de lta ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ni ma yin te /
translated: But that is not the case.

original: de dag ni bdag cag la sogs pas byas par mi nus pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de dag ni bdag cag la sogs pas byas par mi nus pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because we cannot make it.

original: 'o na rigs mthun pa yin na de nyid ga las te /
analyzed: 'o na rigs mthun pa yin na de nyid ga las te /
translated: But if it is of the same class, then why is it not that?

original: gzhan du yang thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du yang thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that it is different.

original: bya bar mi nus pa yin na rigs pa gcig pa nyid du mi grub bo //
analyzed: bya bar mi nus pa yin na rigs pa gcig pa nyid du mi grub bo //
translated: If it cannot be made, then it is not established that it is of the same class.

original: rnam pa mtshungs pa nyid ni dngos po rnams kyi de nyid yin pa'i rgyu mtshan ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rnam pa mtshungs pa nyid ni dngos po rnams kyi de nyid yin pa'i rgyu mtshan ma yin gyi /
translated: Similarity of aspect is not the reason for the reality of things.

original: 'on kyang rang bzhin gzhan yang yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang rang bzhin gzhan yang yin te /
translated: But rather, it is also their nature.

original: kha cig rnam pa khyad par med kyang khyad par gzhan las rigs tha dad par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kha cig rnam pa khyad par med kyang khyad par gzhan las rigs tha dad par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Some say: Although the aspects are not different, they are seen to be different because of other differences.

original: 'di ltar autpala'i rtsa ba las dang lci ba las kyang autpala'i rtsa ba dang / 'jam  bu dang ra las kyang 'dam bu dang rtsa ba dang sa bon las kyang chu shing 'byung na /üîΩlci ba dang gzhan pa la sogs pa las skyes pa'i autpala'i rtsa ba la sogs pa rnams mtshungs pa tsam gyi rigs mthun pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar autpala'i rtsa ba las dang lci ba las kyang autpala'i rtsa ba dang / 'jam  bu dang ra las kyang 'dam bu dang rtsa ba dang sa bon las kyang chu shing 'byung na / lci ba dang gzhan pa la sogs pa las skyes pa'i autpala'i rtsa ba la sogs pa rnams mtshungs pa tsam gyi rigs mthun pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, lotus roots arise from lotus seeds, and lotus roots arise from cow dung, and reeds arise from mud and cow dung, and a plantain tree arises from a plantain seed.

original: rang bzhin tha dad par nyams su myong bas grub pa'i phyir dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bor rnam par gzhag pa 'jig par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin tha dad par nyams su myong bas grub pa'i phyir dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bor rnam par gzhag pa 'jig par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: But lotus roots that arise from cow dung and so on are not similar in type because they are established as being experienced as having different natures and because it would follow that the presentation of cause and effect would be destroyed.

original: de'i phyir gal te byas pa'i ri la sogs pa rnam pa mtshungs pa nyid kyi rgyu mtshungs pa yin na autpala'i rtsa ba la sogs pa yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te byas pa'i ri la sogs pa rnam pa mtshungs pa nyid kyi rgyu mtshungs pa yin na autpala'i rtsa ba la sogs pa yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore if a mountain pass and so on that are created are similar causes because they are similar in aspect, then lotus roots and so on would also be similar causes.

original: srog chags kyi lus la sogs pa dang 'dra gzugs kyi lus la sogs pa rnam pa mtshungs kyang de lta bu yin pa nyid kyi rgyu mtshan ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: srog chags kyi lus la sogs pa dang 'dra gzugs kyi lus la sogs pa rnam pa mtshungs kyang de lta bu yin pa nyid kyi rgyu mtshan ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The bodies of animals and so on are similar in appearance to the bodies of humans and so on, but there is no reason for them to be the same.

original: shin tu gsal bar tha dad par nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu gsal bar tha dad par nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are experienced as very different.

original: 'di ltar byis pa'i bar gyi 'jig rten 'dis rtags med cing nye bar bstan pa med par de dag tha dad par rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar byis pa'i bar gyi 'jig rten 'dis rtags med cing nye bar bstan pa med par de dag tha dad par rtogs pa yin no //
translated: In this way, the world up to the level of ordinary childish beings understands that they are different without any reason or demonstration.

original: brus pa'i chu klung la dus kyi dbang gis brus pa'i mtshan ma yal ba na /
analyzed: brus pa'i chu klung la dus kyi dbang gis brus pa'i mtshan ma yal ba na /
translated: When the signs of the water channel that has been dug disappear due to the passage of time,

original: chu klung gzhan las tha dad par mi rtogs pa kho na ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: chu klung gzhan las tha dad par mi rtogs pa kho na ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: is it not the case that it is not understood as different from another water channel?

original: de las cir 'gyur /
analyzed: de las cir 'gyur /
translated: What follows from that?

original: de dag rgyu mtshungs @27a * //üîΩpar rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de dag rgyu mtshungs @27a * // par rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: It is understood to have the same cause.üîΩIf it is said that it is understood to have the same cause,

original: brus pa yang rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brus pa yang rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: then it is understood to have been dug.

original: brus pa kha cig tu mngon sum dang 'gal ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: brus pa kha cig tu mngon sum dang 'gal ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is said that in some cases it contradicts direct perception,

original: de ci da ni 'bras bu rgyu la 'khrul pa mngon sum gyis sgrub bam /
analyzed: de ci da ni 'bras bu rgyu la 'khrul pa mngon sum gyis sgrub bam /
translated: is it now established by direct perception that the effect is mistaken with regard to the cause?

original: de lta yin na ni 'bras bu'i rtags las byas pa'i rjes dpag ma lus pa rgyun chad par thal lo //
analyzed: de lta yin na ni 'bras bu'i rtags las byas pa'i rjes dpag ma lus pa rgyun chad par thal lo //
translated: If that were so, then all inferences from effects to causes would be interrupted.

original: yun ring po nas yod pa'i chu klung dang mtsho rnams la yang rjes su dpag pa bzlog tu med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yun ring po nas yod pa'i chu klung dang mtsho rnams la yang rjes su dpag pa bzlog tu med par 'gyur ro //
translated: And it would be impossible to infer the existence of rivers and lakes that have existed for a long time.

original: khyab par ma gtogs pa na brus pa la yang 'bru ba rjes su dpag pa mi 'thad pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: khyab par ma gtogs pa na brus pa la yang 'bru ba rjes su dpag pa mi 'thad pa yin no zhe na /
translated: And it would be impossible to infer the existence of a ploughman from the existence of a plough, unless the ploughman were actually present.

original: de lta na sa bon las byung ba'i chu shing sdong bu las byung ba tha dad kyang /
analyzed: de lta na sa bon las byung ba'i chu shing sdong bu las byung ba tha dad kyang /
translated: In the same way, the trunk of a plantain tree, which grows from a seed, is different from the seed.

original: de nye bar ma mtshon pas na sa bon rjes su mi dpag pa kho na ste /
analyzed: de nye bar ma mtshon pas na sa bon rjes su mi dpag pa kho na ste /
translated: But since the seed is not perceived, it is not inferred.

original: rigs pa'i de kho na gzigs pas /
analyzed: rigs pa'i de kho na gzigs pas /
translated: The one who sees reality through reasoningüîΩdoes not infer the distant causal continuum.

original: rgyu brgyud pa ring ba rnams ni rjes su mi dpog pa nyid yin pas na 'khrul pa med do zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu brgyud pa ring ba rnams ni rjes su mi dpog pa nyid yin pas na 'khrul pa med do zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, there is no error.

original: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs la ni rtogs pa po bya bar 'gyur dgos te /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs la ni rtogs pa po bya bar 'gyur dgos te /
translated: In the case of an inference from an effect to its cause, the cognizer must be engaged in the activity.

original: de skad du shin tu rnam par phye ba'i 'bras bu ni rgyu la 'khrul pa med do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de skad du shin tu rnam par phye ba'i 'bras bu ni rgyu la 'khrul pa med do zhes bshad do //
translated: Thus it is said, ‚ÄúThe effect is not mistaken with regard to the cause.‚Äù

original: 'di snyam du khyim gyi ldum ra'i shing de las gzhan pa'i shing dang rigs mtshungs pa rnams byed pa po can du nges pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di snyam du khyim gyi ldum ra'i shing de las gzhan pa'i shing dang rigs mtshungs pa rnams byed pa po can du nges pa yin la /
translated: If you think that the tree in the garden is ascertained to have a maker because of its similarity to other trees,

original: de'i rjes su 'brangs nas de dag kyang skyes bu sngon du 'gro bar grub pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'brangs nas de dag kyang skyes bu sngon du 'gro bar grub pa yin no snyam na /
translated: and that on the basis of that it is established that it also has a person as its antecedent,

original: de yang legs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang legs pa ma yin te /
translated: that is not good.

original: de dag kyang sngon mthong ba dang khyad par med pa'i byed pa po sngon du 'gro bar thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang sngon mthong ba dang khyad par med pa'i byed pa po sngon du 'gro bar thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it follows that those also have a maker that is not different from what was seen before.

original: gang gis de bzhin du gzhan yang 'gyur ba ldum ra'i shing yang byed pa po can ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gis de bzhin du gzhan yang 'gyur ba ldum ra'i shing yang byed pa po can ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that the tree in the garden has a maker because of which it would be like the others.

original: rlung la sogs pa mtshungs pa'i skyes bu der nye bar 'tshog byed kyi rkyen tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rlung la sogs pa mtshungs pa'i skyes bu der nye bar 'tshog byed kyi rkyen tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is merely the condition of the wind and so on that assembles there.

original: des bskyed par bya ba yin na de'i 'dod pa'i rjes su byed pas na 'jim pa la sogs pa'i dbyibs bzhin du nges pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des bskyed par bya ba yin na de'i 'dod pa'i rjes su byed pas na 'jim pa la sogs pa'i dbyibs bzhin du nges pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were produced by that, then it would follow the desire of that, and therefore it is not tenable that it is like the shape of clay and so on.

original: gal te rigs mthun pa las 'brel ba sgrub pa'i tshad ma 'jug pa rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'i 'brel pa grub pa'i thabs yin na /
analyzed: gal te rigs mthun pa las 'brel ba sgrub pa'i tshad ma 'jug pa rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'i 'brel pa grub pa'i thabs yin na /
translated: If the valid knowledge that establishes the relation of a thing that is a cause and a thing that is an effect is the means of establishing the relation of a thing that is a cause and a thing that is an effect,

original: 'o na sngon du lus can gyi 'bras bur ma mthong ba las rjes su dpag par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na sngon du lus can gyi 'bras bur ma mthong ba las rjes su dpag par mi 'gyur te /
translated: then it would not be the case that one infers fire from smoke that has not been seen previously as the effect of fire,

original: 'brel pa ma bzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa ma bzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the relation would not have been apprehended.

original: 'dod pa yin pa'i phyir skyon med do //
analyzed: 'dod pa yin pa'i phyir skyon med do //
translated: There is no error because it is accepted.

original: @27b 'brel pa rtogs pa'i du ba las kyang me'i rtogs pa skye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: @27b 'brel pa rtogs pa'i du ba las kyang me'i rtogs pa skye ba ma yin no //
translated: Also, the realization of fire does not arise from the realization of the relation of smoke.

original: de'i phyir lus la sogs pa dang rigs mi mthun pa las 'brel pa grub par byed pa'i tshad ma 'jug pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir lus la sogs pa dang rigs mi mthun pa las 'brel pa grub par byed pa'i tshad ma 'jug pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore the valid knowledge that establishes the relation of a thing that is a cause and a thing that is an effect does not exist in relation to things that are not of a similar type, such as the body.

original: de'i phyir de dag la skyes bu dang 'brel pa sgrub par dka' ba yin la gzhan la ni phan tshun rigs mi mthun pas sde tshan gcig tu bya ba med par yang 'brel pa'i blo mi 'gal te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag la skyes bu dang 'brel pa sgrub par dka' ba yin la gzhan la ni phan tshun rigs mi mthun pas sde tshan gcig tu bya ba med par yang 'brel pa'i blo mi 'gal te /
translated: Therefore, it is difficult to establish a connection between those and a person. But in the case of others, since they are not of the same type, there is no contradiction in the cognition of a connection even though they are not in the same class.

original: so sor de sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so sor de sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because a valid cognition that establishes each of them individually is engaged.

original: des ni gang gis lus la sogs pa yang de ltar rtogs par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: des ni gang gis lus la sogs pa yang de ltar rtogs par 'gyur ba /
translated: By that, it is understood that the body, etc. are also like that.

original: kho bo cag gis ni 'bras bu tsam skyes bu sngon du 'gro ba can du ma rtogs so //
analyzed: kho bo cag gis ni 'bras bu tsam skyes bu sngon du 'gro ba can du ma rtogs so //
translated: We do not understand that mere effects are preceded by a person.

original: rigs gzhan la sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma zhugs pa na gzhan la 'brel pa mi rtogs pa yin du chug mod /
analyzed: rigs gzhan la sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma zhugs pa na gzhan la 'brel pa mi rtogs pa yin du chug mod /
translated: Even if it is accepted that when a valid cognition that establishes a different type is engaged, a connection with another is not understood,

original: lus la sogs pa bum pa la sogs pa las rigs gzhan yin pa nyid ga las spyod pa'i shes pa mi 'dra ba'i yul yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: lus la sogs pa bum pa la sogs pa las rigs gzhan yin pa nyid ga las spyod pa'i shes pa mi 'dra ba'i yul yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: how is it that the body, etc. are of a different type from a pot, etc.? Because they are the objects of a different type of cognition.

original: bum pa la sogs pa rnam pa gzhan kho nar rtogs la /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa rnam pa gzhan kho nar rtogs la /
translated: A pot, etc. are understood in a different way.

original: lus la sogs pa yang rnam pa gzhan kho nar ro //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa yang rnam pa gzhan kho nar ro //
translated: The body, etc. are also different in another way.

original: pha rol pos kyang 'di dag tha dad par gdon mi za bar khas blangs dgos te /
analyzed: pha rol pos kyang 'di dag tha dad par gdon mi za bar khas blangs dgos te /
translated: The opponent must certainly accept that these are different,

original: gang gi phyir 'di byed pa po med pa dang / byed pa po can du nges pa dang byed pa po can du the tshom za ba'i bye brag gi dngos po rnams phung po gsum du smra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di byed pa po med pa dang / byed pa po can du nges pa dang byed pa po can du the tshom za ba'i bye brag gi dngos po rnams phung po gsum du smra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because he maintains that things are threefold: those that are definitely without an agent, those that are definitely with an agent, and those that are doubtful with regard to an agent.

original: byed pa can du nges pa'i mtshan nyid ma tshang ba med pa ni byed pa can du the tshom za bar 'gyur ba mi 'os te /
analyzed: byed pa can du nges pa'i mtshan nyid ma tshang ba med pa ni byed pa can du the tshom za bar 'gyur ba mi 'os te /
translated: It is not right that that which is complete with the characteristics of being definitely with an agent should become doubtful with regard to an agent.

original: byed pa can du nges pa rnams kyang de lta bu'i ngo bor thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa can du nges pa rnams kyang de lta bu'i ngo bor thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow, absurdly, that those that are definitely with an agent would also have such a nature.

original: byed pa po mthong bas na lus la sogs pa byed pa po can du the tshom za ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: byed pa po mthong bas na lus la sogs pa byed pa po can du the tshom za ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the body, etc. are doubtful with regard to an agent because one sees an agent,

original: bum pa la sogs pa grub zin pa mthong ba rnams la yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa grub zin pa mthong ba rnams la yang 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would follow, absurdly, that even those that are seen to be already accomplished, such as pots, would be doubtful with regard to an agent.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not.

original: byed pa po can du mthong ba dang rigs mthun pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: byed pa po can du mthong ba dang rigs mthun pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because it is seen to be similar to the class of agents.

original: de nyid kyi phyir lus la sogs pa la yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir lus la sogs pa la yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But then it would not be the case that the body, etc.

original: de dag de'i rigs can ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de dag de'i rigs can ma yin no zhe na /
translated: are not of that class.

original: kho bo cag kyang de nyid smra ste /
analyzed: kho bo cag kyang de nyid smra ste /
translated: We also say just that.

original: de nyid kyi phyir lus la sogs pa shin tu rigs mi mthun par grub pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir lus la sogs pa shin tu rigs mi mthun par grub pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the body, etc. are established as being of a very different class.

original: gal te bum pa la sogs pa phan tshun rigs mi mthun mod kyi /
analyzed: gal te bum pa la sogs pa phan tshun rigs mi mthun mod kyi /
translated: Even though such things as pots are of different classes,

original: 'on kyang byed pa po can du nges pa nyid kyis sde tshan gcig tu byas pa rnams rigs mthun pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang byed pa po can du nges pa nyid kyis sde tshan gcig tu byas pa rnams rigs mthun pa kho na yin no //
translated: nevertheless, because they are ascertained as agents, they are all included in one class and are of the same class.

original: @28a * // lus la sogs pa ni byed pa po can du nges pa'i 'bras bu'i tshogs thams cad las phyi rol du 'gyur ba shin tu rigs mi mthun pa grub pa yin no //
analyzed: @28a * // lus la sogs pa ni byed pa po can du nges pa'i 'bras bu'i tshogs thams cad las phyi rol du 'gyur ba shin tu rigs mi mthun pa grub pa yin no //
translated: But the body, etc. are established as being of a very different class, because they are outside of all the collections of effects that are ascertained as agents.

original: 'di las kyang shin tu rigs mi mthun pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di las kyang shin tu rigs mi mthun pa yin te /
translated: This is also a very different class,

original: gang mi 'dra ba'i rgyun du 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: gang mi 'dra ba'i rgyun du 'dod pa'o //
translated: because it is asserted to be a dissimilar continuum.

original: 'di ltar bum pa la sogs pa phan tshun tha dad pa lus kyi byed pa'i stobs kyis skye ba yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar bum pa la sogs pa phan tshun tha dad pa lus kyi byed pa'i stobs kyis skye ba yin la /
translated: Thus, vases and so on are produced by the power of the body, which is different from them.

original: lus la sogs pa ni lus can ma yin pa dang ldan pa'i byin gyis brlabs pa tsam gyis yin no //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa ni lus can ma yin pa dang ldan pa'i byin gyis brlabs pa tsam gyis yin no //
translated: But the body and so on are produced by the mere blessing of the nonembodiment of the embodied.

original: de'i phyir de dag las shin tu tha dad pa ci ste ma yin /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag las shin tu tha dad pa ci ste ma yin /
translated: Therefore, why are they not utterly different from the body?

original: gal te bum pa la sogs pa'i gzugs lus kyis byed pas bsgrub par bya ba ci 'dra ba de 'dra ba kho na lus la sogs pa'i yang 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te bum pa la sogs pa'i gzugs lus kyis byed pas bsgrub par bya ba ci 'dra ba de 'dra ba kho na lus la sogs pa'i yang 'gyur na /
translated: If the form of a vase and so on were to be established by the body in the same way that it is, then the body and so on would also be like that.

original: de lta bu ma yin pa na gzugs de lus kyis bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pas na gzhan gyis yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta bu ma yin pa na gzugs de lus kyis bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pas na gzhan gyis yang ma yin te /
translated: But if it is not like that, then since that form is not established by the body, it is not established by anything else.

original: rgyu tha dad kyang ngo bo tha dad pas na mtha' dag gi ngo bo sna tshogs nyid rgyu med par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: rgyu tha dad kyang ngo bo tha dad pas na mtha' dag gi ngo bo sna tshogs nyid rgyu med par 'gyur ro ;
translated: Even if the causes are different, the essence is different. Therefore, the various essences of all things would be causeless.

original: / de'i phyir lus kyi byed pas bskyed par bya ba'i bum pa la sogs pa las lus la sogs pa des bskyed par bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyis na shin tu rigs mi mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: / de'i phyir lus kyi byed pas bskyed par bya ba'i bum pa la sogs pa las lus la sogs pa des bskyed par bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyis na shin tu rigs mi mthun pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the body, etc. are very dissimilar from such things as the pot, which are produced by the activity of the body, etc. because they are not produced by that.

original: gtan tshigs 'di dag ni bcos ma dang bcos ma yin pa'i ri la sogs pa phan tshun rigs mi mthun pa nyid kyi sgrub byed la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'di dag ni bcos ma dang bcos ma yin pa'i ri la sogs pa phan tshun rigs mi mthun pa nyid kyi sgrub byed la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: These reasons should also be applied to the proof of the mutual dissimilarity of such things as the mountain, which are natural and artificial.

original: bcos pa rnams las lus la sogs pa tha dad pa sgrub par byed pa ni bum pa la sogs pa shin tu rigs mi mthun pa nyid kyi sgrub byed du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: bcos pa rnams las lus la sogs pa tha dad pa sgrub par byed pa ni bum pa la sogs pa shin tu rigs mi mthun pa nyid kyi sgrub byed du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The proof of the difference of the body, etc. from the artificial should be seen as the proof of the great dissimilarity of such things as the pot.

original: gang dag ci zhig ltar rtogs pa gcig gi yul las kyang tha dad pa de dag de lta bur gyur pa ma yin pa dag las shin tu tha dad pa ma yin par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gang dag ci zhig ltar rtogs pa gcig gi yul las kyang tha dad pa de dag de lta bur gyur pa ma yin pa dag las shin tu tha dad pa ma yin par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How could those which are different from the object of a single cognition be not different from those which are not like that?

original: 'di snyam du re zhig bum pa dang shing rta la sogs pa skyes bus byas pa'i 'bras bu rnams kyang phan tshun rigs mi mthun par mthong ste /
analyzed: 'di snyam du re zhig bum pa dang shing rta la sogs pa skyes bus byas pa'i 'bras bu rnams kyang phan tshun rigs mi mthun par mthong ste /
translated: One might think as follows: The results of human activity, such as pots and chariots, are seen to be of different types.

original: de'i phyir lus la sogs pa yang de lta bu yin pa la 'gal ba ci yod snyam na /üîΩde ci 'di srid pa yin nam /
analyzed: de'i phyir lus la sogs pa yang de lta bu yin pa la 'gal ba ci yod snyam na / de ci 'di srid pa yin nam /
translated: Therefore, what is the contradiction in the body and so on being like that?

original: 'on te nges pa yin /
analyzed: 'on te nges pa yin /
translated: Is this possible or certain?

original: de la gal te srid pa yin na /
analyzed: de la gal te srid pa yin na /
translated: If it is possible,

original: de'i tshe nges pa med pa'i phyir khyab pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe nges pa med pa'i phyir khyab pa med pa yin te /
translated: then because it is not certain, there is no pervasion,

original: khyab pa ni de'i rgyu mtshan can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyab pa ni de'i rgyu mtshan can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the pervasion is based on the reason.

original: ji ste nges pa yin na de mi 'thad de /
analyzed: ji ste nges pa yin na de mi 'thad de /
translated: But if it is certain, that is not tenable.

original: rigs gzhan la mthong ba'i chos @28b ni gzhan la nges pa yan lag ma yin te /
analyzed: rigs gzhan la mthong ba'i chos @28b ni gzhan la nges pa yan lag ma yin te /
translated: What is seen in one type of thing is not certain in another type of thing.

original: rigs gzhan la ni rab grub pa //üîΩsgra yi ci ni mthong ba las //
analyzed: rigs gzhan la ni rab grub pa // sgra yi ci ni mthong ba las //
translated: What is well established in one type of thingüîΩis not seen in another type of thing.

original: sgrub byed mi rigs ngag la sogs //
analyzed: sgrub byed mi rigs ngag la sogs //
translated: For example, sound is not established in horns.

original: go nyid phyir na rva can bzhin //
analyzed: go nyid phyir na rva can bzhin //
translated: Because of the difference in the object, the proof is not tenable.üîΩLike horns, sound is not established in a pot.

original: zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is what is stated in the following lines:

original: re zhig 'di yod pa srid pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid bsgrub par dka' na /
analyzed: re zhig 'di yod pa srid pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid bsgrub par dka' na /
translated: If it is difficult to establish the reason for the existence of this,

original: de nges pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: de nges pa lta ci smos /
translated: then what need is there to mention ascertaining it?

original: 'di snyam du bum pa la sogs pa la skyes bu dang 'brel pa khong du chud pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di snyam du bum pa la sogs pa la skyes bu dang 'brel pa khong du chud pa yin la /
translated: If you think that a person‚Äôs relation to a pot, etc. is understood,

original: de dang rigs mi mthun pa'i phyir lus la sogs pa la mi rtogs na /
analyzed: de dang rigs mi mthun pa'i phyir lus la sogs pa la mi rtogs na /
translated: but because it is not similar to the body, etc. it is not cognized,

original: 'o na rtsva'i du ba la me dang 'brel pa rtogs pas /
analyzed: 'o na rtsva'i du ba la me dang 'brel pa rtogs pas /
translated: then the relation of fire to smoke is cognized in the smoke of grass,

original: de dang rigs mi mthun pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dang rigs mi mthun pa'i phyir /
translated: but because it is not similar to the smoke of leaves,

original: lo ma las byung ba la mi rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lo ma las byung ba la mi rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: it is not cognized in the smoke of leaves.

original: so sor rtogs par byed do zhe na /
analyzed: so sor rtogs par byed do zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is cognized individually,

original: bud shing mtha' yas pa'i phyir de'i bye brag gis du ba'i rigs kyang mtha' yas pas na /
analyzed: bud shing mtha' yas pa'i phyir de'i bye brag gis du ba'i rigs kyang mtha' yas pas na /
translated: because fuel is limitless, the types of smoke are also limitless.

original: mi tshe ring pos kyang me dang du ba'i 'brel pa rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi tshe ring pos kyang me dang du ba'i 'brel pa rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, even a person with a long life span would not cognize the relation between fire and smoke.üîΩBut if the identity of all smoke is the opposite of non-smoke,

original: ji ste du ba la yin pa las log pa'i bdag nyid du du ba thams cad rigs gcig pa yin na /
analyzed: ji ste du ba la yin pa las log pa'i bdag nyid du du ba thams cad rigs gcig pa yin na /
translated: then all smoke would be the same.

original: 'bras bu thams cad kyang 'bras bu ma yin pa la log par ci ste mi 'dod /
analyzed: 'bras bu thams cad kyang 'bras bu ma yin pa la log par ci ste mi 'dod /
translated: Why don‚Äôt you also assert that all effects are not effects?

original: de'i phyir du ba tsam la mes khyab pa yin bzhin du 'bras bu tsam la skyes bus khyab pa grub po snyam na /
analyzed: de'i phyir du ba tsam la mes khyab pa yin bzhin du 'bras bu tsam la skyes bus khyab pa grub po snyam na /
translated: Therefore, just as smoke is pervaded by fire, so too the mere effect is established as pervaded by a person.

original: 'di ltar ji lta bur bud shing gi bye brag gi rjes su byed pa'i du ba'i bye brag rnams mes khyab pa rtogs pa na 'dod pa de bzhin du 'dzi ba'i bye brag gi rjes su byed pa'i bum pa yang skyes bus khyab pa rtogs pa na spangüîΩbar bya ba kho na yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar ji lta bur bud shing gi bye brag gi rjes su byed pa'i du ba'i bye brag rnams mes khyab pa rtogs pa na 'dod pa de bzhin du 'dzi ba'i bye brag gi rjes su byed pa'i bum pa yang skyes bus khyab pa rtogs pa na spang bar bya ba kho na yin la /
translated: In the same way that you assert that when one realizes that the various types of smoke that follow after the various types of fuel are pervaded by fire, one should also realize that the various types of pot that follow after the various types of effort are pervaded by a person.

original: bum pa nyid ni du ba bzhin du dor bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: bum pa nyid ni du ba bzhin du dor bar mi rigs so //
translated: But it is not right to discard the pot just as you discard the smoke.

original: de la gal te kho bo cag du ba nyid kyang spangs nas de dang lhan cig rgyu ba'i 'bras bu nyid mes khyab par rtogs par byed na /
analyzed: de la gal te kho bo cag du ba nyid kyang spangs nas de dang lhan cig rgyu ba'i 'bras bu nyid mes khyab par rtogs par byed na /
translated: If we discard smoke and realize that the mere effect that coexists with it is pervaded by fire,

original: bum pa nyid kyang spangs nas skyes bus khyab par rtogs pa zhig na /
analyzed: bum pa nyid kyang spangs nas skyes bus khyab par rtogs pa zhig na /
translated: then we would discard the pot and realize that a person is pervaded by it.

original: de lta ma yin pas mi mtshungs so //
analyzed: de lta ma yin pas mi mtshungs so //
translated: But that is not so, therefore they are not similar.

original: gal te 'bras bu tsam la me la sogs pas khyab par mi rtogs su chug mod /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu tsam la me la sogs pas khyab par mi rtogs su chug mod /
translated: Even if one does not understand that mere effects are pervaded by fire,

original: skyes bus khyab par ci'i phyir mi rtogs pa yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: skyes bus khyab par ci'i phyir mi rtogs pa yin nam zhe na /
translated: why would one not understand that they are pervaded by a person?

original: 'brel pa 'dzin par byed pa'i tshad ma med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'brel pa 'dzin par byed pa'i tshad ma med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because there is no valid knowledge that apprehends a relation.

original: tha dad pa la ni de las byung ba'i rgyu can gyi 'brel pa yod pa yin la /
analyzed: tha dad pa la ni de las byung ba'i rgyu can gyi 'brel pa yod pa yin la /
translated: For that which is different, there is a relation that is caused by arising from that.

original: de yang tshad ma 'ga' zhig gis rtogs par bya ba yin zhing de yang gzhi med par mi 'jug pa na /üîΩ'bras bu tsam dang skyes bu rgyu dang 'bras @29a * //
analyzed: de yang tshad ma 'ga' zhig gis rtogs par bya ba yin zhing de yang gzhi med par mi 'jug pa na / 'bras bu tsam dang skyes bu rgyu dang 'bras @29a * //
translated: Moreover, that is to be understood by some valid knowledge, and that does not operate without a basis.

original: bu'i ngo bor sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma ni 'gar yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bu'i ngo bor sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma ni 'gar yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, there is no valid knowledge whatsoever that establishes mere effects and a person as cause and effect.

original: bum pa la sogs pa la 'jug pa'i tshad ma ni 'bras bu tsam skyes bu'i rgyu can yin no zhes zhen par mi byed kyi /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa la 'jug pa'i tshad ma ni 'bras bu tsam skyes bu'i rgyu can yin no zhes zhen par mi byed kyi /
translated: Valid knowledge that engages vases and so on does not ascertain that mere effects are caused by a person.

original: 'on kyang 'di 'dra ba'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de'i skyes bu'i rgyu can yin no zhes bya bar yin la /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di 'dra ba'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de'i skyes bu'i rgyu can yin no zhes bya bar yin la /
translated: But the effect is the effect of a person, because it is a product of a person.

original: thams cad rigs gcig pa yang yin pas na 'ga' zhig la skyes bu sngon du 'gro ba nyid la sgrub par byed pas ni thams cad du grub pa ma yin no //üîΩ'bras bu tsam nyid du rigs gcig pa ni rgyu'i khyad par gyi khyab par rtogs par dbang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: thams cad rigs gcig pa yang yin pas na 'ga' zhig la skyes bu sngon du 'gro ba nyid la sgrub par byed pas ni thams cad du grub pa ma yin no // 'bras bu tsam nyid du rigs gcig pa ni rgyu'i khyad par gyi khyab par rtogs par dbang ba ma yin te /
translated: And since all effects are of the same type, the proof that a person is a prerequisite for any effect is not established in all cases.

original: rgyu tsam gyis khyab pa kho na la de nye bar mkho ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu tsam gyis khyab pa kho na la de nye bar mkho ba'i phyir ro //
translated: One cannot infer that a single cause is the cause of a particular effect, because the mere cause is not necessarily the cause of that effect.

original: gal te 'bras bu skyes bu med par yang 'byung na /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu skyes bu med par yang 'byung na /
translated: If an effect occurs even without a person,

original: de'i rgyu skyes bu ma yin pas na lan cig kyang de las mi 'byung bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: de'i rgyu skyes bu ma yin pas na lan cig kyang de las mi 'byung bar 'gyur na /
translated: then since the cause is not a person, it would not produce that effect even once.

original: 'byung ba yang yin te /üîΩdes na de bskyed par bya ba yin no zhes rtogs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'byung ba yang yin te / des na de bskyed par bya ba yin no zhes rtogs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But it does produce that effect.üîΩSo how can you understand that it produces that effect?

original: 'o na de la so sor nges pa de de med par ci ltar 'byung /
analyzed: 'o na de la so sor nges pa de de med par ci ltar 'byung /
translated: If you say that the effect is produced by that cause, then how could it be produced without that cause?

original: 'byung na yang rgyu med par 'gyur te /üîΩde med par ni de yod na //
analyzed: 'byung na yang rgyu med par 'gyur te / de med par ni de yod na //
translated: If it did arise, it would be causeless.üîΩIf it existed without a cause,

original: rgyu dang ldan pa las 'das 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyu dang ldan pa las 'das 'gyur //
translated: it would be beyond having a cause.

original: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
translated: And similarly,

original: rgyu med gzhan la mi ltos phyir //
analyzed: rgyu med gzhan la mi ltos phyir //
translated: Because it is causeless and does not rely on another,

original: rtag tu yod pa'ang med par 'gyur //
analyzed: rtag tu yod pa'ang med par 'gyur //
translated: it would be both permanent and nonexistent.üîΩThings sometimes arise

original: dngos po rnams ni res 'ga' zhig /'byang ba ltos pa las yin no //üîΩzhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po rnams ni res 'ga' zhig /'byang ba ltos pa las yin no // zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: in dependence on purification.

original: de'i phyir 'bras bu dang skyes bu dag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bor grub na /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu dang skyes bu dag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bor grub na /
translated: Therefore, if the effect and the person were established as the nature of cause and effect,

original: 'bras bu skyes bu la mi 'khrul ba na du ba dang me bzhin du des khyab pa grub par 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'bras bu skyes bu la mi 'khrul ba na du ba dang me bzhin du des khyab pa grub par 'gyur na /
translated: then, when the effect is nonerroneously ascribed to the person, it would be established that it is pervaded by that, just as smoke is by fire.

original: tshul 'dis de mi rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: tshul 'dis de mi rigs pa yin te /
translated: But this method is not correct,

original: thams cad la rgyu'i khyad par gyis khyab pa grub par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad la rgyu'i khyad par gyis khyab pa grub par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that everything would be established as pervaded by a specific cause.

original: 'di ltar 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di skad du /
translated: In this way, it is said:

original: me med par 'byung ba'i 'bras bu rgyu ma yin pa'i me las me mi 'byung la /
analyzed: me med par 'byung ba'i 'bras bu rgyu ma yin pa'i me las me mi 'byung la /
translated: An effect that arises without fire is not a cause, and fire does not arise from a fire that is not a cause.

original: de la 'byung bas na des bskyed par bya ba'i rang bzhin nyid kyis de la nges pa'i phyir de med par mi 'byung /üîΩ'byung na yang rgyu med pa'i phyir rtag tu yod pa la sogs par thal lo zhes brjod par nus so //
analyzed: de la 'byung bas na des bskyed par bya ba'i rang bzhin nyid kyis de la nges pa'i phyir de med par mi 'byung / 'byung na yang rgyu med pa'i phyir rtag tu yod pa la sogs par thal lo zhes brjod par nus so //
translated: If it were to arise, it would be permanent, because it would be causeless.üîΩIf it were to arise, it would be permanent, because it would be causeless.

original: 'bras bu dang me 'brel pa grub na 'bras bu me la mi 'khrul 'khrul ba na des khyab par grub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang me 'brel pa grub na 'bras bu me la mi 'khrul 'khrul ba na des khyab par grub pa yin no //
translated: If the relation of effect to cause were established, then the effect would not be mistaken with respect to fire. If it were mistaken, then it would be established that it is pervaded by fire.

original: 'khrul pa mthong bas na de lta ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'khrul pa mthong bas na de lta ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you see a mistake, then it is not so.

original: 'brel pa grub kyang 'khrul na @29b thams cad la yid brtan du med do //
analyzed: 'brel pa grub kyang 'khrul na @29b thams cad la yid brtan du med do //
translated: If there were a mistake even though the relation were established, then nothing would be reliable.

original: ldog pa med pas na 'brel pa yang grub pa ma yin no zhe na /üîΩ'o na me las du ba zhes bya ba'i 'bras bur yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ldog pa med pas na 'brel pa yang grub pa ma yin no zhe na / 'o na me las du ba zhes bya ba'i 'bras bur yang 'gyur ro //
translated: If there were no reversal, then the relation would not be established.üîΩWell, then, smoke would be the effect of fire.üîΩIf you say that the effect of smoke is only the reversal of fire,

original: ji ste du ba'i 'bras bu la ni me'i ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: ji ste du ba'i 'bras bu la ni me'i ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa kho na'o zhe na /
translated: then fire would be the effect of smoke.

original: de'i tshe de nyid du ba gzhan bzhin du 'bras bu gzhan gyis yang ldog pa ji ltar ma yin /
analyzed: de'i tshe de nyid du ba gzhan bzhin du 'bras bu gzhan gyis yang ldog pa ji ltar ma yin /
translated: In that case, how could the effect be different from the fire, like a different smoke?

original: 'bras bu gzhan la ldog pa ma grub po zhe na /
analyzed: 'bras bu gzhan la ldog pa ma grub po zhe na /
translated: If you say that the effect is not established as different,

original: de ci da ni 'brel pa rtogs par 'dod pas gsal ba so so la ldog pa bzung dgos sam /
analyzed: de ci da ni 'brel pa rtogs par 'dod pas gsal ba so so la ldog pa bzung dgos sam /
translated: then why do you, who wish to understand the relation, have to apprehend the difference in each individual instance?

original: de ltar yin na du ba'i gsal ba mtha' yas pas na gsal ba so so la ldog pa rtogs par mi nus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar yin na du ba'i gsal ba mtha' yas pas na gsal ba so so la ldog pa rtogs par mi nus pa'i phyir /
translated: If that were the case, since there are infinitely many individual instances of smoke, it would be impossible to understand the difference in each individual instance.

original: du ba tsam yang me dang 'brel pa mi 'grub par 'gyur la /
analyzed: du ba tsam yang me dang 'brel pa mi 'grub par 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore it would be impossible to establish that mere smoke is related to mere fire.

original: 'bras bu tsam yang skyes bu dang 'brel pa sgrub par dka' bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'bras bu tsam yang skyes bu dang 'brel pa sgrub par dka' bar 'gyur te /
translated: It would be difficult to establish that mere effect is related to mere person.

original: 'bras bu'i khyad par thams cad skyes bu log par ldog pas rtogs par mi nus te /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i khyad par thams cad skyes bu log par ldog pas rtogs par mi nus te /
translated: Because it is impossible to understand all the particular effects in terms of the person,

original: rtsva la sogs pa la mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: rtsva la sogs pa la mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: it would be untenable in terms of grass and so on.

original: / snang du mi rung ba'i skyes bu med pa na de dag med par ni mi rtogs te /
analyzed: / snang du mi rung ba'i skyes bu med pa na de dag med par ni mi rtogs te /
translated: If there is no person who is not suitable to appear, it is not understood that they do not exist.

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du mi 'gyur ba de 'gar yang med par mi grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du mi 'gyur ba de 'gar yang med par mi grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not established that there is no object that is not the characteristic of the object.

original: snang du rung ba'i skyes bu med na yang med pa yin te /
analyzed: snang du rung ba'i skyes bu med na yang med pa yin te /
translated: Even if there is no person who is suitable to appear, it is not nonexistent,

original: yod pa kho na dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa kho na dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is observed to exist.

original: de'i phyir du ba'i 'bras bu gcig la mi ldog pa'i rjes su byed par grub pa'i rjes su byed par grub pa gang yin pa de nyid 'bras bu thams cad la ma yin pas na ldog pa med pas 'bras bu tsam me dang 'brel pa grub pa ji
analyzed: de'i phyir du ba'i 'bras bu gcig la mi ldog pa'i rjes su byed par grub pa'i rjes su byed par grub pa gang yin pa de nyid 'bras bu thams cad la ma yin pas na ldog pa med pas 'bras bu tsam me dang 'brel pa grub pa ji
translated: Therefore, since it is established that the effect of smoke is related to fire, and it is not established that it is related to all effects, then since it is not excluded, how can it be established that smoke is related to fire alone?

original: ltar dgag / mngon sum dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: ltar dgag / mngon sum dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is because it contradicts direct perception,

original: 'brel pa 'dzin pa'i mngon sum tshad ma yin na mngon sum gzhan dang ji ltar 'gal te /
analyzed: 'brel pa 'dzin pa'i mngon sum tshad ma yin na mngon sum gzhan dang ji ltar 'gal te /
translated: then if the direct perception that apprehends the relation is a valid knowledge, how could it contradict another direct perception?

original: de skad du /üîΩtshad ma yis ni tshad ma la //
analyzed: de skad du / tshad ma yis ni tshad ma la //
translated: As it is said:üîΩA valid knowledge does not

original: gnod pa ma yin phan 'dogs min //
analyzed: gnod pa ma yin phan 'dogs min //
translated: harm or benefit another valid knowledge.

original: gnod na tshad ma ma yin zhing //
analyzed: gnod na tshad ma ma yin zhing //
translated: If it harms, it is not a valid knowledge.

original: phan 'dogs pa ni don med nyid //
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa ni don med nyid //
translated: If it benefits, it is pointless.

original: ces so // tshad ma ma yin na yang de las du ba zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu yang me dang 'brel pa mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: ces so // tshad ma ma yin na yang de las du ba zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu yang me dang 'brel pa mi 'grub bo //
translated: Even if it is not a valid cognition, it does not establish that the effect called smoke is related to fire.

original: 'bras bu tsam me dang 'brel pa grub pa ni ma yin gyi 'bras bu'i khyad par yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'bras bu tsam me dang 'brel pa grub pa ni ma yin gyi 'bras bu'i khyad par yin no zhe na /
translated: You may say that the mere effect is not established as related to fire, but the specific effect is.

original: 'dod pa sgrub ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa sgrub ste /
translated: We accept that.

original: gal te 'di nyid dang por brjod na /
analyzed: gal te 'di nyid dang por brjod na /
translated: If you had stated that from the beginning,

original: lha rnams dga' ba nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ba yin na /üîΩde lta na yang gang du yang khyad par med par skyes bu dang 'brel pa @30a * //
analyzed: lha rnams dga' ba nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ba yin na / de lta na yang gang du yang khyad par med par skyes bu dang 'brel pa @30a * //
translated: the gods would not have been annoyed.

original: shes par byed pa dpyod pa dang ldan pa khyod kyis gnas ma yin pa shin tu 'khrul pa 'di ci yin /
analyzed: shes par byed pa dpyod pa dang ldan pa khyod kyis gnas ma yin pa shin tu 'khrul pa 'di ci yin /
translated: But even so, what is the point of this absurd and confused argument that is not relevant to the issue at hand?

original: ji ltar 'bras bu tsam me sngon du 'gro ba ma yin pa de kho na bzhin du skyes bu sngon du 'gro ba la yang yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar 'bras bu tsam me sngon du 'gro ba ma yin pa de kho na bzhin du skyes bu sngon du 'gro ba la yang yin no //
translated: Just as the mere effect is not preceded by fire, in the same way, the effect is not preceded by a person.

original: 'bras bu khyad par can kho na skyes bu 'gro ba can du rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa las nges par bzung ba yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu khyad par can kho na skyes bu 'gro ba can du rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa las nges par bzung ba yin te /
translated: The special effect is definitely ascertained by the forward and reverse pervasion that it is the goer.

original: de lta ma yin na grub zin pa'i khang pa la sogs pa mthong ba las yin pa bzhin du /üîΩmthong bas 'du byed bzhag pa'i 'jig rten la /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na grub zin pa'i khang pa la sogs pa mthong ba las yin pa bzhin du / mthong bas 'du byed bzhag pa'i 'jig rten la /
translated: Otherwise, seeing an already existing house and so on,üîΩthe cognition that it is the effect of an agent would arise.

original: lus dang shing dang ri dang rgya mtsho la sogs pa mthong ba las skyes bus byas pa'i blo skye bar thal ba bzlog par dka'o //
analyzed: lus dang shing dang ri dang rgya mtsho la sogs pa mthong ba las skyes bus byas pa'i blo skye bar thal ba bzlog par dka'o //
translated: It would be difficult to reverse the consequence that the cognition that it is the effect of an agent would arise from seeing the world that is posited by seeing the body, trees, mountains, oceans and so on.

original: rmongs pas na de lta ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rmongs pas na de lta ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not so because of confusion,

original: rmongs pa cis byas yin /
analyzed: rmongs pa cis byas yin /
translated: what is the cause of confusion?

original: byed pa ma dmigs pa'i rgyu mtshan can yin no zhe na /
analyzed: byed pa ma dmigs pa'i rgyu mtshan can yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is the reason that the agent is not observed,

original: byed pa mthong ba thams cad la 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: byed pa mthong ba thams cad la 'gyur bas na /
translated: then it would apply to all cases of seeing an agent.

original: 'di ni gyi na'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gyi na'o //
translated: This is nonsense.

original: gang yang gal te 'bras bu skyes bu med par 'byung na rgyu ma yin pa'i skyes bu las lan cig kyang mi 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa de yang snying po med pa yin te /
analyzed: gang yang gal te 'bras bu skyes bu med par 'byung na rgyu ma yin pa'i skyes bu las lan cig kyang mi 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa de yang snying po med pa yin te /
translated: If an effect arose without a person, then it would not arise even once from a non-cause, a person.üîΩBut that statement is pointless.

original: gal te 'bras bu ji 'dra ba zhig skyes bu las skyes pa mthong ba de kho na lta bu zhig de med par 'byung na /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu ji 'dra ba zhig skyes bu las skyes pa mthong ba de kho na lta bu zhig de med par 'byung na /
translated: If an effect that arises from a person were seen to arise in the absence of a person, just like that,

original: 'dir 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: 'dir 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: then this would be the case.

original: de ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But that is not so.

original: de lta ma yin na de las gzhan las 'bras bu 'byung bar mthong ba na me la sogs pa las kyang 'di mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na de las gzhan las 'bras bu 'byung bar mthong ba na me la sogs pa las kyang 'di mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were, then when an effect is seen to arise from something other than that, it would also arise from fire and so on.

original: skyes bu'i 'ga' zhig ji lta bur mthong ba 'bras bu thams cad 'bras bu nyid kyis de lta bu yin pas /üîΩskyes bus byas pa nyid khyad par du rnam par gzhag par mi 'os so zhe na /
analyzed: skyes bu'i 'ga' zhig ji lta bur mthong ba 'bras bu thams cad 'bras bu nyid kyis de lta bu yin pas / skyes bus byas pa nyid khyad par du rnam par gzhag par mi 'os so zhe na /
translated: Since all effects are effects in the same way that an effect seen to arise from a person is,üîΩit is not suitable to posit that it is produced by a person as a distinguishing feature.

original: 'o na mi la sogs pas byas pa yang khyad par du rnam par gzhag par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'o na mi la sogs pas byas pa yang khyad par du rnam par gzhag par mi bya'o //
translated: But then the production by a human and so on should not be posited as a distinguishing feature.

original: 'khrul pas rnam par mi 'jog na gzhan la yang 'khrul pa med do zhes bya ba gang las /
analyzed: 'khrul pas rnam par mi 'jog na gzhan la yang 'khrul pa med do zhes bya ba gang las /
translated: If error does not occur in regard to that, then error does not occur in regard to anything else.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because they are the nature of cause and effect.

original: de ni rgyu mtshan ma yin pa nyid ma yin nam ste /
analyzed: de ni rgyu mtshan ma yin pa nyid ma yin nam ste /
translated: Isn‚Äôt that not a reason?

original: de yod kyang me la sogs pa la 'khrul pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yod kyang me la sogs pa la 'khrul pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because even though that exists, error is seen in regard to fire, etc.

original: ldog pa med pas na de dag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ldog pa med pas na de dag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Because there is no reversal, they are not the nature of cause and effect.

original: 'di la brjod zin to //
analyzed: 'di la brjod zin to //
translated: This has already been explained.

original: gzhan yang gal te me la sogs pa med par yang 'bras bu mthong bas na 'bras bu tsam mes byas par mi 'dod na /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te me la sogs pa med par yang 'bras bu mthong bas na 'bras bu tsam mes byas par mi 'dod na /
translated: Moreover, if you do not assert that the mere effect is produced by fire because the effect is seen even in the absence of fire,

original: 'ga' zhig skyes bu med par yang 'byung ba mthong @30b bas na ;
analyzed: 'ga' zhig skyes bu med par yang 'byung ba mthong @30b bas na ;
translated: then because the effect is seen even in the absence of a person,

original: des byas par yang ci phyir 'dod /
analyzed: des byas par yang ci phyir 'dod /
translated: why do you assert that it is produced by a person?

original: 'ga' yang skyes bu med par mi 'grub po zhe na /
analyzed: 'ga' yang skyes bu med par mi 'grub po zhe na /
translated: It is not established that anything is produced without a person.

original: ma mthong ba yin bzhin du ji ltar mi 'grub /
analyzed: ma mthong ba yin bzhin du ji ltar mi 'grub /
translated: How is it not established in the absence of being seen?

original: ma mthong ba tsam tshad ma ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ma mthong ba tsam tshad ma ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Mere non-seeing is not a valid means of knowledge.

original: 'o na de las bsgrub par bya ba med la thams cad du ldog pa yang mi 'grub po //
analyzed: 'o na de las bsgrub par bya ba med la thams cad du ldog pa yang mi 'grub po //
translated: But if it is not established that it is to be accomplished from that, then it is not established that it is to be eliminated from that.

original: de las me la sogs pa med pa yang ji ltar yin zhes brjod dgos so //
analyzed: de las me la sogs pa med pa yang ji ltar yin zhes brjod dgos so //
translated: And it must be said how it is that fire, etc. are not from that.

original: snang rung ma mthong ba de la tshad ma kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: snang rung ma mthong ba de la tshad ma kho na'o zhe na /
translated: If it is said that it is a valid cognition in regard to that which is suitable to appear but is not seen,

original: skyes bu yang snang rung yin pa'i phyir de med pa na ci'i phyir mi 'dod /
analyzed: skyes bu yang snang rung yin pa'i phyir de med pa na ci'i phyir mi 'dod /
translated: then why is it not accepted that a person is not when he is suitable to appear?

original: snang rung gi skyes bu med pa la 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: snang rung gi skyes bu med pa la 'gyur gyi /
translated: It would be in regard to the non-existence of a person suitable to appear,

original: skyes bu tsam med pa la ni ma yin no zhes bya bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes bu tsam med pa la ni ma yin no zhes bya bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: but not in regard to the non-existence of a mere person.

original: me ni snang rung kho na yin no zhe na /
analyzed: me ni snang rung kho na yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is said that fire is only suitable to appear,

original: skyes bu snang du rung ba ci'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: skyes bu snang du rung ba ci'i phyir ma yin /
translated: why is a person not suitable to appear?

original: 'di snang du mi rung ba yod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'di snang du mi rung ba yod do zhe na /
translated: If it is said that he exists but is not suitable to appear,

original: re zhig 'bras bu dang 'brel par rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni snang du rung ba yin no //
analyzed: re zhig 'bras bu dang 'brel par rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni snang du rung ba yin no //
translated: then whatever is related to an effect is understood to be suitable to appear.

original: de las gzhan pa 'bras bu la nye bar sbyor ba ma gtogs pa gang yin pa de ni yod dam med kyang rung ste /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa 'bras bu la nye bar sbyor ba ma gtogs pa gang yin pa de ni yod dam med kyang rung ste /
translated: Whatever is other than that, whether it exists or not, is excluded from being related to an effect.

original: de ci bya /
analyzed: de ci bya /
translated: What is to be done about that?

original: snang du rung ba dang snang du mi rung ba'i rnam par rtog pa la mi ltos par skyes bu tsam kho na rgyu nyid kyis khyab byed du rtogs so zhe na /
analyzed: snang du rung ba dang snang du mi rung ba'i rnam par rtog pa la mi ltos par skyes bu tsam kho na rgyu nyid kyis khyab byed du rtogs so zhe na /
translated: It is understood that a mere person is pervaded by being a cause without depending on the conception of being suitable or not suitable to appear.

original: me tsam yang rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: me tsam yang rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Fire is also understood.

original: me snang du mi rung ba med do zhe na /
analyzed: me snang du mi rung ba med do zhe na /
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúThere is no fire that is not suitable to appear.‚Äù

original: skyes bu yang snang du mi rung ba med do zhes smra ba gang gi yang kha yon por mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes bu yang snang du mi rung ba med do zhes smra ba gang gi yang kha yon por mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúThere is no person that is not suitable to appear.‚Äù No one‚Äôs mouth is crooked.

original: dpyod par byed pa la grub mtha' dang 'gal ba skyon ma yin te /
analyzed: dpyod par byed pa la grub mtha' dang 'gal ba skyon ma yin te /
translated: It is not a fault for the one who analyzes to contradict tenets.

original: thog tu phebs pa ni rigs las 'ong ba nyid kyis dor bar mi rigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: thog tu phebs pa ni rigs las 'ong ba nyid kyis dor bar mi rigs pa'i phyir /
translated: It is not right to reject what comes from reasoning.

original: me snang du mi rung ba yod du chug mod /
analyzed: me snang du mi rung ba yod du chug mod /
translated: It is allowed that there is fire that is not suitable to appear.

original: 'bras bu dang 'brel pa grub pa de ni snang rung kho na yin pas 'ga' zhig tu mthong ba las de med par rtogs so zhe na /
analyzed: 'bras bu dang 'brel pa grub pa de ni snang rung kho na yin pas 'ga' zhig tu mthong ba las de med par rtogs so zhe na /
translated: Since the establishment of the connection with the effect is only suitable to appear, it is understood that it does not exist in some places because it is seen.

original: skyes bu la yang tshur de kho na'o //
analyzed: skyes bu la yang tshur de kho na'o //
translated: The same applies to a person.

original: 'bras bu rgyu las mi 'khrul pas na rjes su dpag pas grub pa'i skyes bu ma mthong bas med par mi 'grub po zhe na /
analyzed: 'bras bu rgyu las mi 'khrul pas na rjes su dpag pas grub pa'i skyes bu ma mthong bas med par mi 'grub po zhe na /
translated: Therefore, since the effect is not mistaken with regard to the cause, the person who is established by inference is not established as nonexistent by not seeing him.

original: me la yang tshul 'di kho na'o //
analyzed: me la yang tshul 'di kho na'o //
translated: This is exactly the same for fire.

original: ji ste me snang du mi rung ba med cing skyes bu kho na de lta bur 'gyur ba yin du chug mod /
analyzed: ji ste me snang du mi rung ba med cing skyes bu kho na de lta bur 'gyur ba yin du chug mod /
translated: Now, suppose someone said that it is not the case that fire is not suitable to appear and that the person alone is like that.

original: 'on kyang skyes bu tsam gyis khyab pa sgrub par mi nus te /
analyzed: 'on kyang skyes bu tsam gyis khyab pa sgrub par mi nus te /
translated: However, it is not possible to establish the pervasion by the person alone.

original: gang gi phyir yod pa yin zhes pa tsam gyis ni khyab par byed pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir yod pa yin zhes pa tsam gyis ni khyab par byed pa ma yin gyi /
translated: This is because the mere statement ‚ÄúIt exists‚Äù is not a proof of the pervasion.

original: 'on kyang 'bras bu dang 'brel pa grub pa kho na yin na /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'bras bu dang 'brel pa grub pa kho na yin na /
translated: However, if it is established that it is related to the effect,

original: skyes bu tsam ni 'bras bu dang 'brel par mi rtogs te /
analyzed: skyes bu tsam ni 'bras bu dang 'brel par mi rtogs te /
translated: then the person alone is not understood to be related to the effect.

original: de ni snang rung kho na la rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni snang rung kho na la rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is understood only in relation to what is suitable to appear.

original: snang rung @31a * //
analyzed: snang rung @31a * //
translated: What is suitable to appear

original: gi khyad par ma lus pa spangs nas /
analyzed: gi khyad par ma lus pa spangs nas /
translated: is completely devoid of all the features of a universal.

original: spyi dang 'brel pa rtogs par 'gyur ba yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: spyi dang 'brel pa rtogs par 'gyur ba yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not logical that it is understood to be related to a universal.

original: snang rung nyid las ma 'das pa'i khyad par gyi tshogs kyi spyod yul nyid de'i 'brel pa can nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩdu ba las me khyad par med pas khyad par rtogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: snang rung nyid las ma 'das pa'i khyad par gyi tshogs kyi spyod yul nyid de'i 'brel pa can nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir ro // du ba las me khyad par med pas khyad par rtogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: because it is the domain of the special collection of causes that do not transcend the possibility of appearance, and because it is realized to be related to that.

original: thog dang glog las byung ba me yin yang khyab pa las phyi rol du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thog dang glog las byung ba me yin yang khyab pa las phyi rol du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not that fire is realized as a special effect of smoke, because fire arises from lightning and thunderbolts, and it is outside the pervasion.

original: gal te snang du rung ba spangs nas skyes bu tsam khyab byed du rtogs na /
analyzed: gal te snang du rung ba spangs nas skyes bu tsam khyab byed du rtogs na /
translated: If one realizes that mere person is the pervader, having abandoned the possibility of appearance,

original: skyes bu spangs nas rgyu tsam ci'i phyir mi rtogs /
analyzed: skyes bu spangs nas rgyu tsam ci'i phyir mi rtogs /
