translated: why does one not realize that mere cause is the pervader, having abandoned the person?

original: 'on te de ltar mi byed na de'i tshe 'bras bu dang 'brel pa grub pa blo dang ldan pa de lta bu kho na khyab byed du rtogs dgos la /
analyzed: 'on te de ltar mi byed na de'i tshe 'bras bu dang 'brel pa grub pa blo dang ldan pa de lta bu kho na khyab byed du rtogs dgos la /
translated: But if one does not do it that way, then it is necessary to realize that only the intelligent one who is established as related to the effect is the pervader.

original: de la yang 'khrul pa bzlog par dka' ste /
analyzed: de la yang 'khrul pa bzlog par dka' ste /
translated: And in that case, it is difficult to avert error,

original: de med kyang rtsva la sogs pa skye ba mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med kyang rtsva la sogs pa skye ba mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because even though he does not exist, one sees the arising of grass and so on.

original: 'khrul pa dmigs pa med kyang mi 'khrul par mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: 'khrul pa dmigs pa med kyang mi 'khrul par mi 'grub ste /
translated: Even though the nonapprehension of error is not established, it is not the case that nonerror is not established.

original: 'bras bu'i spyi rgyu'i khyad par la nges pa med pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: 'bras bu'i spyi rgyu'i khyad par la nges pa med pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because there is no certainty about the general cause of the effect.

original: / gang gi phyir gal te 'bras bu tsam rgyu'i khyad par la nges pa yin na me la sogs pa med par mi 'byung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: / gang gi phyir gal te 'bras bu tsam rgyu'i khyad par la nges pa yin na me la sogs pa med par mi 'byung bar 'gyur la /
translated: If the mere effect is certain with regard to the particular cause, then it would not occur without fire, etc.

original: 'gyur bas na bdag nyid rgyu'i khyad par la ma nges par gsal bar byed la /
analyzed: 'gyur bas na bdag nyid rgyu'i khyad par la ma nges par gsal bar byed la /
translated: Since it does occur, it is clear that it is not certain with regard to the particular cause.

original: de lta na yang 'khrul pa ma mthong na yang skyes bu zhes bya ba rgyu'i khyad par la ma nges par grub po //
analyzed: de lta na yang 'khrul pa ma mthong na yang skyes bu zhes bya ba rgyu'i khyad par la ma nges par grub po //
translated: Even so, if error is not seen, then the so-called person is established as not certain with regard to the particular cause.

original: rgyu'i khyad par mtha' dag la 'khrul pa'i 'bras bu rgyu med par 'gyur ro zhe na /üîΩma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu'i khyad par mtha' dag la 'khrul pa'i 'bras bu rgyu med par 'gyur ro zhe na / ma yin te /
translated: If the effect of error is not certain with regard to all particular causes, then it would be causeless.

original: rgyu tsam la mi 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu tsam la mi 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because it is not uncertain with regard to the mere cause.

original: rgyu tsam kho na 'bras bu tsam po'i skyed byed du rtogs kyi khyad par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu tsam kho na 'bras bu tsam po'i skyed byed du rtogs kyi khyad par ni ma yin no //
translated: Only the mere cause is understood to be the producer of the mere effect, not the particular.

original: 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa ni rgyu tsam po la ltos pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa ni rgyu tsam po la ltos pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because the presentation of the effect depends on the mere cause.

original: / gang gi tshe rtogs pa po khyad par dang yang 'brel pa rtogs par 'dod pa de'i tshe 'bras bu'i yang khyad par gyi rjes su 'brang ba kho na ste /
analyzed: / gang gi tshe rtogs pa po khyad par dang yang 'brel pa rtogs par 'dod pa de'i tshe 'bras bu'i yang khyad par gyi rjes su 'brang ba kho na ste /
translated: When the one who understands wishes to understand the connection with a particular, then only the connection with a particular of the effect is followed.

original: du ba me dang 'brel pa grub pa na me'i khyad par dang 'brel pa rtogs par 'dod pa bzhin te /
analyzed: du ba me dang 'brel pa grub pa na me'i khyad par dang 'brel pa rtogs par 'dod pa bzhin te /
translated: For example, when the connection of smoke with fire is established, one wishes to understand the connection of the particular of fire with it.

original: gtan tshigs kyi khyad par ma bzung na /
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi khyad par ma bzung na /
translated: If the particular of the reason is not apprehended,

original: bsgrub pa'i khyad par dang 'brel pa 'dzin pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgrub pa'i khyad par dang 'brel pa 'dzin pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is not tenable to apprehend the connection with the particular of the probandum.

original: 'bras bu tsam na sems pa dang bcas pa dang sems pa med pa'i tshogs pa thun mong pa yin pas na sems pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'i khyad par la shin tu gsal bar 'khrul pa srid pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'bras bu tsam na sems pa dang bcas pa dang sems pa med pa'i tshogs pa thun mong pa yin pas na sems pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'i khyad par la shin tu gsal bar 'khrul pa srid pa'i phyir te /
translated: When it is merely the effect, it is common to the collection of the conscious and the unconscious, and therefore, it is very clear that error is possible with regard to the particular called ‚Äúconscious.‚Äù

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: de la @31b khyad par ma bstan par //
analyzed: de la @31b khyad par ma bstan par //
translated: There, without teaching the particular,

original: 'bras bu'i spyi ni mthong ba las //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i spyi ni mthong ba las //
translated: from seeing the universal of the effect,

original: gtan tshigs gang dag spros byed pa //
analyzed: gtan tshigs gang dag spros byed pa //
translated: those who elaborate the reason

original: de dag thams cad 'khrul pa yin //
analyzed: de dag thams cad 'khrul pa yin //
translated: are all in error.

original: zhes so // de nyid kyi phyir thams cad 'bras bu nyid du mtshungs kyang 'bras bu 'ga' zhig mthong ba las lus kyi byed pa rjes su dpag pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes so // de nyid kyi phyir thams cad 'bras bu nyid du mtshungs kyang 'bras bu 'ga' zhig mthong ba las lus kyi byed pa rjes su dpag pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, although all effects are similar in being effects, the activity of the body is inferred from seeing some effects.

original: 'bras bu tsam skyes bu tsam dang 'brel pa rtogs pa na byed pa ma mthong ba'i lha khang la sogs pa mthong ba las lag pa la sogs pa'i byed pa bzhin du skyes bu rjes su dpog pa gang yin pa der mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu tsam skyes bu tsam dang 'brel pa rtogs pa na byed pa ma mthong ba'i lha khang la sogs pa mthong ba las lag pa la sogs pa'i byed pa bzhin du skyes bu rjes su dpog pa gang yin pa der mi 'gyur ro //
translated: When one understands that the mere effect is related to the mere person, then, just as the activity of the hand, etc., is inferred from seeing the house, etc., which are not seen to have an activity, the person is inferred.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar 'bras bu rnams 'bras bu nyid kyi de dang 'dra ba yin yang lus kyi byed pas khyab pa rnam par phye ba can yin pa de bzhin du skyes bu tsam dang yin pa la 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar 'bras bu rnams 'bras bu nyid kyi de dang 'dra ba yin yang lus kyi byed pas khyab pa rnam par phye ba can yin pa de bzhin du skyes bu tsam dang yin pa la 'gal ba med do //
translated: Therefore, just as effects are distinguished by being pervaded by the activity of the body, although they are similar in being effects, there is no contradiction in the mere person being pervaded by the mere activity.

original: 'jig rten yang rnam par phye nas khyab pa rtogs par byed de /
analyzed: 'jig rten yang rnam par phye nas khyab pa rtogs par byed de /
translated: And the world understands the pervasion after distinguishing.

original: rnam par ma phye bar rtogs na lus la sogs pa la yang lus kyi byed pa rjes su dpog par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par ma phye bar rtogs na lus la sogs pa la yang lus kyi byed pa rjes su dpog par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If one understands without differentiation, then it follows that one would infer the activity of the body, etc., in regard to the body, etc.

original: de'i phyir dngos po nyid tsam bzhin du 'bras bu tsam du rigs gcig pa nyid ni 'dir khyab pa rtogs pa la nye bar mkho ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po nyid tsam bzhin du 'bras bu tsam du rigs gcig pa nyid ni 'dir khyab pa rtogs pa la nye bar mkho ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, just as with the mere entity, mere effect is not the required pervasion in the understanding of the single class.

original: 'o na de las mi rtag pa nyid rjes su dpag par yang mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: 'o na de las mi rtag pa nyid rjes su dpag par yang mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: Well, then, impermanence would not be inferred from that.

original: 'dod pa yin te /üîΩ'jig la 'bras dang yod nyid bzhin //
analyzed: 'dod pa yin te / 'jig la 'bras dang yod nyid bzhin //
translated: That is accepted.üîΩAs it is said,

original: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúLike effect and existence.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar bum pa la sogs pa la 'bras bu nyid la mi rtag pas khyab par mthong bas na sa la sogs pa la yang de rjes su dpog par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar bum pa la sogs pa la 'bras bu nyid la mi rtag pas khyab par mthong bas na sa la sogs pa la yang de rjes su dpog par byed pa yin no //
translated: Thus, since impermanence is seen to pervade the effect, etc., in a pot, etc., one infers it in earth, etc.

original: gal te de ltar rigs gcig pa nyid skyes bu rtogs pa la nye bar mi mkho na nges par 'di mi rtag pa nyid shes pa la nye bar mi mkho ste /
analyzed: gal te de ltar rigs gcig pa nyid skyes bu rtogs pa la nye bar mi mkho na nges par 'di mi rtag pa nyid shes pa la nye bar mi mkho ste /
translated: If the single class is not required for the understanding of the person, then certainly it is not required for the understanding of impermanence.

original: 'gar ni nye bar ni nye bar mkho'o //
analyzed: 'gar ni nye bar ni nye bar mkho'o //
translated: and in some cases it is not.

original: 'gar ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam par dbye ba 'di cis byas pa yin /
analyzed: 'gar ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam par dbye ba 'di cis byas pa yin /
translated: What is the basis for this distinction?

original: 'dir brjod pa mi rtag pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba la 'bras bu nyid ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin la /
analyzed: 'dir brjod pa mi rtag pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba la 'bras bu nyid ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin la /
translated: Here, impermanence is the probandum, and being a product is the natural reason.

original: de la des khyab pa yang 'gar yang lhan cig mthong ba tsam la rag las pa ma yin no ;
analyzed: de la des khyab pa yang 'gar yang lhan cig mthong ba tsam la rag las pa ma yin no ;
translated: And the pervasion by that is not based on merely seeing it in some cases.

original: / gsal ba mtha' dag la khyab pa ma yin pa sa las byung ba dang lcags kyis gzhog par bya ba la sogs pa'i chos rnams de'i rigs can las 'jug pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / gsal ba mtha' dag la khyab pa ma yin pa sa las byung ba dang lcags kyis gzhog par bya ba la sogs pa'i chos rnams de'i rigs can las 'jug pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the property of being a product is seen to apply to things that are not pervasive of all instances of the property, such as the property of arising from earth and the property of being cut by an iron blade.

original: 'on kyang bzlog pa la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma'i rgyu can gyi de'i bdag nyid du grub pa'i gzhan dbang can yin @32a * //
analyzed: 'on kyang bzlog pa la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma'i rgyu can gyi de'i bdag nyid du grub pa'i gzhan dbang can yin @32a * //
translated: However, the pervasion is based on the fact that the opposite is undermined by valid knowledge, and that it is dependent on the establishment of its nature.

original: la ; de yang nang gi khyad par la ltos pa med pa thams cad bsdus pa'i che ba ma tshang ba med par bum pa la sogs pa la 'jug pas na 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: la ; de yang nang gi khyad par la ltos pa med pa thams cad bsdus pa'i che ba ma tshang ba med par bum pa la sogs pa la 'jug pas na 'gal ba med do //
translated: Moreover, since the universal of entity pervades all entities without exception, it is not contradictory for it to be present in all entities that are not related to internal distinctions, such as pots.

original: skyes bu bsgrub par bya ba la ni 'gal ba'i gtan tshigs yin zhing rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo yang mi dmigs pa'i sgrub byed can yin la /
analyzed: skyes bu bsgrub par bya ba la ni 'gal ba'i gtan tshigs yin zhing rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo yang mi dmigs pa'i sgrub byed can yin la /
translated: However, in the proof of a person, it is a contradictory reason, and the nature of cause and effect is a nonobservation proof.

original: de dag kyang khyad par med par mi 'jug pas na mi mtshungs so //
analyzed: de dag kyang khyad par med par mi 'jug pas na mi mtshungs so //
translated: Since those do not apply without distinctions, they are not similar.

original: de'i phyir 'bras bu zhes bya ba 'di ni khyab pa med pas na ma nges pa'i gtan tshigs ltar snang ba kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu zhes bya ba 'di ni khyab pa med pas na ma nges pa'i gtan tshigs ltar snang ba kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, since this so-called effect is not a pervader, it is only a seeming reason of nonobservation.

original: 'o na 'khrul pa dang ldan na ma nges pa zhes bya ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'o na 'khrul pa dang ldan na ma nges pa zhes bya ba ma yin nam /
translated: If it is mistaken, is it not called indefinite?

original: 'di ni de lta bu ma yin pas na ji ltar ma nges par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ni de lta bu ma yin pas na ji ltar ma nges par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Since this is not like that, how could it be indefinite?

original: 'di ci la 'khrul pa med par nges pa yin nam /
analyzed: 'di ci la 'khrul pa med par nges pa yin nam /
translated: Is it definite that this is not mistaken?

original: 'on te srid pa yin /
analyzed: 'on te srid pa yin /
translated: Or is it possible?

original: phyogs dang po la gal te nges pa med mod /
analyzed: phyogs dang po la gal te nges pa med mod /
translated: In the first case, if it is not definite,

original: re zhig dogs pa bzlog pa med na /
analyzed: re zhig dogs pa bzlog pa med na /
translated: If the possibility of error is not eliminated,

original: de ji ltar 'khrul pa med pa yin /
analyzed: de ji ltar 'khrul pa med pa yin /
translated: how can it be nonerroneous?

original: gal te 'khrul pa mi dmigs pa tsam gyis gtan tshigs go bar byed pa yin na /üîΩgang gi 'khrul pa khyad du bsad nas de mi dmigs pa go bar byed par 'dod pa /
analyzed: gal te 'khrul pa mi dmigs pa tsam gyis gtan tshigs go bar byed pa yin na / gang gi 'khrul pa khyad du bsad nas de mi dmigs pa go bar byed par 'dod pa /
translated: If the reason is understood merely by the nonobservation of error,üîΩthen why would one who disregards error assert that it is understood by the nonobservation of that?

original: de ci 'khrul pa dmigs pa la /
analyzed: de ci 'khrul pa dmigs pa la /
translated: What is it? Is it the observation of error?

original: 'jigs pa'i 'khrul pa la ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'jigs pa'i 'khrul pa la ma yin nam /
translated: Or is it the nonobservation of error?

original: de'i tshe de don dam par 'khrul pa yod pa dang med pa la ltos pa med par bsgrub bya'i go bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe de don dam par 'khrul pa yod pa dang med pa la ltos pa med par bsgrub bya'i go bar byed pa yin no //
translated: At that time, it would be the reason that establishes the probandum without relying on whether or not error exists ultimately.

original: gang gis 'khrul par the tshom za bar go bar byed par 'dod na /
analyzed: gang gis 'khrul par the tshom za bar go bar byed par 'dod na /
translated: If one asserts that it is understood by the doubt of error,

original: ci de 'ga' zhig tu 'khrul pa yod kyang go bar byed pa yin nam /
analyzed: ci de 'ga' zhig tu 'khrul pa yod kyang go bar byed pa yin nam /
translated: is it that it is understood even if error exists in some cases?

original: de lta na 'khrul pa med pa gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta na 'khrul pa med pa gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid ma yin te /
translated: In that case, nonerror is not the definition of a reason,

original: 'khrul pa yod kyang nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa yod kyang nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is possible for error to exist.

original: de lta na yang ji ltar 'khrul pa yod par dogs kyang the tshom za ba khas blangs nas go bar byed par 'dod de /
analyzed: de lta na yang ji ltar 'khrul pa yod par dogs kyang the tshom za ba khas blangs nas go bar byed par 'dod de /
translated: In that case, even though one doubts that there is error, one must accept that there is understanding.

original: the tshom za ba khas blangs pa na 'jug pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: the tshom za ba khas blangs pa na 'jug pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For if one doubts that there is understanding, it is not reasonable to engage in debate.

original: de bzhin du 'khrul pa dmigs pa na go bar byed pa ma yin par 'dod par gyis shig /'khrul na nus pa med pa nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'khrul pa dmigs pa na go bar byed pa ma yin par 'dod par gyis shig /'khrul na nus pa med pa nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: In the same way, you should accept that when error is observed, there is no understanding, because if there were error, it would be powerless.

original: gal te de lta na 'khrul pa dang bral bar gtan lam phab na bsgrub par bya ba go bar byed par mi 'os so //
analyzed: gal te de lta na 'khrul pa dang bral bar gtan lam phab na bsgrub par bya ba go bar byed par mi 'os so //
translated: If that were so, then if one were certain that there were no error, it would be unreasonable to understand the proposition.

original: gzhan yang gal te gtan tshigs ldog pa la the tshom za yang go bar byed pa yin na /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te gtan tshigs ldog pa la the tshom za yang go bar byed pa yin na /
translated: Moreover, if one understands the proposition even though one doubts the pervasion,

original: phyogs kyi chos la the tshom za ba yang ci'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos la the tshom za ba yang ci'i phyir ma yin /
translated: why would one not understand it even though one doubts the property of the subject?

original: de lta na yang ldog pa la the tshom za ba bzhin du chos can dang 'brel bar the @32b tshom za ba yang go bar byed pa la kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang ldog pa la the tshom za ba bzhin du chos can dang 'brel bar the @32b tshom za ba yang go bar byed pa la kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, just as one doubts the pervasion, one would also doubt the relation to the subject, and it would be just as unreasonable to understand the proposition.

original: ji ste chos can dang 'brel par nges pa rtags kyi shes byed kyi yan lag tu 'dod na /
analyzed: ji ste chos can dang 'brel par nges pa rtags kyi shes byed kyi yan lag tu 'dod na /
translated: If you assert that the certainty of the relation to the subject is a part of the proof of the reason,

original: ldog pa yang ci'i phyir mi 'dod /
analyzed: ldog pa yang ci'i phyir mi 'dod /
translated: then why do you not assert the contrapositive?

original: phyogs kyi chos la the tshom za ba ni skyon yin la ldog pa la the tshom za ba skyon ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni gsal bar rgyal po'i bka' yin no //
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos la the tshom za ba ni skyon yin la ldog pa la the tshom za ba skyon ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni gsal bar rgyal po'i bka' yin no //
translated: The fault is that there is doubt about the property of the subject, but there is no fault in doubting the contrapositive. This is clearly the king‚Äôs decree.

original: gal te phyogs gnyis pa la brten na /
analyzed: gal te phyogs gnyis pa la brten na /
translated: If you rely on the second position,

original: de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: de yang mi rigs te /
translated: that also is not correct.

original: ji srid du bsgrub bya la 'brel pa ma grub pa de srid du ldog pa la gtan tshigs 'jug par dogs pa kho nar 'gyur la /
analyzed: ji srid du bsgrub bya la 'brel pa ma grub pa de srid du ldog pa la gtan tshigs 'jug par dogs pa kho nar 'gyur la /
translated: As long as the relation to the probandum is not established, there is only the doubt that the reason is present where the probandum is absent.

original: 'di la 'brel pa sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma yang med pas na mi mthun phyogs la 'jug pa'i dogs pa bzlog pa'i rgyu med do //
analyzed: 'di la 'brel pa sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma yang med pas na mi mthun phyogs la 'jug pa'i dogs pa bzlog pa'i rgyu med do //
translated: And since there is no valid cognition that establishes the relation, there is no cause for the elimination of the doubt that the reason is present where the probandum is absent.

original: ma mthong ba kho nar de bzlog par lhur byed do zhe na /
analyzed: ma mthong ba kho nar de bzlog par lhur byed do zhe na /
translated: If you say that you are only concerned with eliminating that doubt, even though you have not seen the relation,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: rang gi ma mthong ba na 'khrul pa'i phyir dang / thams cad kyi ma mthong ba ni the tshom za ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rang gi ma mthong ba na 'khrul pa'i phyir dang / thams cad kyi ma mthong ba ni the tshom za ba'i phyir /
translated: When one does not see one's mother, one is mistaken; and when one does not see all mothers, one is in doubt.

original: gzhan yang de skad du smra ba'i lha rnams dga' ba la rjes su dpag pa thams cad rgyun chad par thal te /
analyzed: gzhan yang de skad du smra ba'i lha rnams dga' ba la rjes su dpag pa thams cad rgyun chad par thal te /
translated: Moreover, for those who say this, all inference is cut off, since the gods are pleased.

original: ji ltar ma mthong ba 'khrul pa med par sgrub pa de bzhin du bsgrub par bya ba yang sgrub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar ma mthong ba 'khrul pa med par sgrub pa de bzhin du bsgrub par bya ba yang sgrub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as one proves the non-mistakenness of what is not seen, so one proves the probandum.

original: de la de tshad ma ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de la de tshad ma ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that is not a valid cognition,

original: gzhan du tshad ma ma yin pa der tshad ma yin pa ga las /
analyzed: gzhan du tshad ma ma yin pa der tshad ma yin pa ga las /
translated: how can what is not a valid cognition elsewhere be a valid cognition there?

original: mngon sum gyis gnod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis gnod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is because it is contradicted by perception,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: 'jug pa'i sngon du med pa'i phyir dang / phyis 'byung bar dogs pa yang sa bon med par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i sngon du med pa'i phyir dang / phyis 'byung bar dogs pa yang sa bon med par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not exist prior to engagement, and because it is not tenable that what arises later is without a seed.

original: zhugs pa la res 'ga' dmigs pa sa bon yin no zhe na /
analyzed: zhugs pa la res 'ga' dmigs pa sa bon yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the seed is the occasional apprehension of what is engaged,

original: 'o na de la ji ltar de la sngar ma zhugs kyang mngon sum gyis gnod pa 'byung bar mthong ba de bzhin du gzhan du yang da ltam zhugs pa'i phyir ci'i phyir mi dogs /
analyzed: 'o na de la ji ltar de la sngar ma zhugs kyang mngon sum gyis gnod pa 'byung bar mthong ba de bzhin du gzhan du yang da ltam zhugs pa'i phyir ci'i phyir mi dogs /
translated: Well then, just as one sees that even though one did not previously engage in the activity of direct perception, it is still possible for it to be undermined, in the same way, one should also doubt that it is possible for the other to undermine it, because one has not yet engaged in the activity of direct perception.

original: de lta na yang mngon sum gyis gnod par dogs pa'i ma mthong bas gtan tshigs kyi ldog pa ji ltar nges par byed /
analyzed: de lta na yang mngon sum gyis gnod par dogs pa'i ma mthong bas gtan tshigs kyi ldog pa ji ltar nges par byed /
translated: Even so, how can one ascertain the pervasion of the reason by the predicate, since one has not seen that it is undermined by direct perception?

original: des na yang bsgrub bya ldog pa yang nges par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nges pa yin no //üîΩgzhan yang me la sogs pa'i rjes su dpag par bya ba'i yul can gyi ma mthong ba mngon sum gyis gnod pas na tshad ma la yin du chug mod /
analyzed: des na yang bsgrub bya ldog pa yang nges par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nges pa yin no // gzhan yang me la sogs pa'i rjes su dpag par bya ba'i yul can gyi ma mthong ba mngon sum gyis gnod pas na tshad ma la yin du chug mod /
translated: Therefore, it is certain that the predicate is ascertained as being the contrapositive of the reason.

original: mig la sogs pa rtag tu lkog tu gyur pa'i yul can la ni mngon sum gyis gnod pa mi srid pas na tshad ma kho na yin pas na de med par thal ba bzlog par dka' bar 'gyur ro //üîΩde @33a * //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa rtag tu lkog tu gyur pa'i yul can la ni mngon sum gyis gnod pa mi srid pas na tshad ma kho na yin pas na de med par thal ba bzlog par dka' bar 'gyur ro //üîΩde @33a * //
translated: Moreover, it is true that in the case of inferring fire and so on, the object is undermined by direct perception, but in the case of the eye and so on, the object is always hidden, and it is impossible for it to be undermined by direct perception. Therefore, since it is a valid means of knowledge, it is difficult to avoid the absurd consequence that it does not exist.

original: yang rjes su dpag pas gnod pas na tshad ma ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: yang rjes su dpag pas gnod pas na tshad ma ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that it is not a valid cognition because it is undermined by inference,

original: 'o na ma mthong ba ldog pa grub pa'i rtags la rag las nas skyes pa'i rjes su dpag pas 'di tshad ma ma yin par ston na bdag nyid kyang ston pa yin te /
analyzed: 'o na ma mthong ba ldog pa grub pa'i rtags la rag las nas skyes pa'i rjes su dpag pas 'di tshad ma ma yin par ston na bdag nyid kyang ston pa yin te /
translated: then you are teaching that inference arising in dependence on a reason that establishes a negative phenomenon is not a valid cognition.

original: de tshad ma ma yin na de'i rgyun can gyi rtags kyi ldog pa ma grub par thal ba'i phyir dang / ldog pa ma grub pa yang yang dag pa'i shes pa bskyed par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de tshad ma ma yin na de'i rgyun can gyi rtags kyi ldog pa ma grub par thal ba'i phyir dang / ldog pa ma grub pa yang yang dag pa'i shes pa bskyed par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But if it is not a valid cognition, then it follows that the reason that is its basis is not established, because it is untenable that a nonestablished reason generates a correct consciousness.

original: ldog pa sgrub pa la mthong ba tshad ma kho na yin la /
analyzed: ldog pa sgrub pa la mthong ba tshad ma kho na yin la /
translated: But if you say that it is only direct perception that is a valid cognition that establishes a negative phenomenon,

original: bsgrub par bya ba med pa la ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba med pa la ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: then it is not the case that the object of negation does not exist.

original: mtshan nyid mtshungs pa la 'dod dgur spyod pa 'di ga las thob /
analyzed: mtshan nyid mtshungs pa la 'dod dgur spyod pa 'di ga las thob /
translated: Where is it obtained that you can act as you please with regard to something that has the same characteristics?

original: mtshan nyid kyi mtshungs pa la yang de nyid brjod par bya'i /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi mtshungs pa la yang de nyid brjod par bya'i /
translated: You should say that it is the same in the case of having the same characteristics.

original: gnod pa dper brjod pas ci bya /
analyzed: gnod pa dper brjod pas ci bya /
translated: What is the point of citing an undermining example?

original: tshad ma'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i ma mthong ba las su dpag pas gnod par mi nus te /
analyzed: tshad ma'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i ma mthong ba las su dpag pas gnod par mi nus te /
translated: But it cannot be invalidated by an inference from the non-perception of what is pervaded by a valid cognition.

original: tshad ma la ched mas gnod pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma la ched mas gnod pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not tenable that a valid cognition can be invalidated by a special [cognition].

original: srid pa yin na ni rjes su dpag pa yang de'i gnod bya nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srid pa yin na ni rjes su dpag pa yang de'i gnod bya nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And if it were possible, then it would follow, absurdly, that an inference could be invalidated by it.

original: de'i phyir ma mthong ba gtan tshigs mi mthun phyogs la 'jug par dogs pa sel bar nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma mthong ba gtan tshigs mi mthun phyogs la 'jug par dogs pa sel bar nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, non-perception cannot possibly remove the doubt that the reason is present in the dissimilar class.

original: 'di snyam du 'dir dogs pa 'di drungs na 'byin pa'i bzlog pa la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma yod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du 'dir dogs pa 'di drungs na 'byin pa'i bzlog pa la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma yod pa yin te /
translated: If you think that here there is a valid cognition that invalidates the reversal of this doubt,

original: 'di ltar 'bras bu nyid la ni bum pa la sogs pa la res 'ga'i rgyu nye bas khyab pa grub la /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'bras bu nyid la ni bum pa la sogs pa la res 'ga'i rgyu nye bas khyab pa grub la /
translated: then it is established that the mere presence of an effect is pervaded by the presence of a cause in some cases, as in the case of a pot.

original: des na lus la sogs pa la yang de dmigs pa na rang gi khyab byed 'dren par byed do //
analyzed: des na lus la sogs pa la yang de dmigs pa na rang gi khyab byed 'dren par byed do //
translated: Therefore, when it is observed in the body, etc., it draws along its own pervaded [property].

original: res 'ga' ba'i rgyu ni nye ba 'di byed pa med par ni mi 'thad de /
analyzed: res 'ga' ba'i rgyu ni nye ba 'di byed pa med par ni mi 'thad de /
translated: It is not tenable that the cause is present without the presence of this action.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las de byed pa po'i bya ba rag lus par nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las de byed pa po'i bya ba rag lus par nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is ascertained that the activity of the agent depends on the activity of going and coming.

original: byed pa po yod kyang de rtag pa yin pa'i phyir res 'ga' ba'i rgyu nye bar ci ltar zhen /
analyzed: byed pa po yod kyang de rtag pa yin pa'i phyir res 'ga' ba'i rgyu nye bar ci ltar zhen /
translated: Even if the agent exists, how could it be the cause of the occasional, since it is permanent?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it could not,

original: de ni ma mthong ba yongs su smin pa la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni ma mthong ba yongs su smin pa la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is seen that it depends on the maturation of something unseen.üîΩWell then, it is just that which is the cause of the occasional.

original: 'o na de nyid nye ba'i rgyu yin mod ce na ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na de nyid nye ba'i rgyu yin mod ce na ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not,

original: de ni sems pa med pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: de ni sems pa med pa'i phyir la /
translated: because that is not a conscious agent.

original: sems pa med pas kyang rgyu nye bar bya ba mi nus te /
analyzed: sems pa med pas kyang rgyu nye bar bya ba mi nus te /
translated: And that which is not conscious cannot be the cause of the occasional,

original: nus na yang bum pa la sogs pa la yang byed pa po ldog par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nus na yang bum pa la sogs pa la yang byed pa po ldog par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because if it could, then it would follow that even a pot and so on would be an agent.

original: des na 'bras bu 'di khyab byed mi dmigs pas bsgrub bya las zlog par byed pas na /
analyzed: des na 'bras bu 'di khyab byed mi dmigs pas bsgrub bya las zlog par byed pas na /
translated: Therefore, this effect is refuted by the nonobservation of the omnipresent, and so the probandum is reversed.

original: de la ji ltar dogs par 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar dogs par 'gyur snyam na /
translated: How could it be doubted in that case?

original: 'di yang ma brtags pa'i smra ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di yang ma brtags pa'i smra ba yin te /
translated: This is also a statement made without analysis.

original: @33b gal te rgyu nye ba thams cad byed pa po'i bya ba sngon du 'gro ba nyid du grub na /
analyzed: @33b gal te rgyu nye ba thams cad byed pa po'i bya ba sngon du 'gro ba nyid du grub na /
translated: If it were established that all causes that are close are preceded by the activity of the agent,

original: 'dir 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: 'dir 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: then that would be the case.

original: 'on kyang rgyu nye ba ci 'dra ba zhig byed pa po'i bya ba yod pa dang / med pa'i rjes su byed par mthong ba de 'dra ba kho na de ltar 'gyur ba 'grub pa zhig na /
analyzed: 'on kyang rgyu nye ba ci 'dra ba zhig byed pa po'i bya ba yod pa dang / med pa'i rjes su byed par mthong ba de 'dra ba kho na de ltar 'gyur ba 'grub pa zhig na /
translated: But it is seen that whatever type of cause that is close is seen to conform with the activity of the agent, whether it exists or does not exist, that very type of cause that is close is established as the agent.

original: rgyu nye ba thams cad rigs gcig pa nyid du ni mthong ba'am 'dod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu nye ba thams cad rigs gcig pa nyid du ni mthong ba'am 'dod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But it is not seen or accepted that all causes that are close are of the same type.

original: rigs gcig pa yin na lag pa la sogs pa'i bya ba yang nges par 'dren par thal ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: rigs gcig pa yin na lag pa la sogs pa'i bya ba yang nges par 'dren par thal ba'i phyir te /
translated: If they were of the same type, it would follow that the activity of the hand and so on would definitely be drawn to the mind,

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las de rgyu nye ba la nye bar sbyor bar mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las de rgyu nye ba la nye bar sbyor bar mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is seen that the mind is applied to the cause that is close through conformity and reversal.

original: rigs sna tshogs pa yin pa na yang 'ga' zhig tu sems pa can nye ba'i rgyu yin la gzhan du sems pa med par yin no zhes bya ba la mi 'thad pa ci yang med do //
analyzed: rigs sna tshogs pa yin pa na yang 'ga' zhig tu sems pa can nye ba'i rgyu yin la gzhan du sems pa med par yin no zhes bya ba la mi 'thad pa ci yang med do //
translated: But if they are of various types, there is no fault in saying that in some cases the mind is the cause that is close and in other cases the mind is not.

original: rlung yang sa bon la sogs pa nye ba'i rgyu dmigs pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: rlung yang sa bon la sogs pa nye ba'i rgyu dmigs pa kho na yin te /
translated: Also, wind is the observed object that is the substantial cause of seeds and so on.

original: de'i phyir sems pa med pa de lta bu yin pa ji ltar dgag par nus /
analyzed: de'i phyir sems pa med pa de lta bu yin pa ji ltar dgag par nus /
translated: Therefore, how can you refute that which is like that, which is not consciousness?

original: de yang rlung nye ba'i rgyu ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de yang rlung nye ba'i rgyu ma yin gyi /
translated: Also, wind is not the substantial cause of seeds and so on.

original: 'on kyang skyes bu yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang skyes bu yin no zhe na /
translated: However, a person is.

original: 'di ni aa ru ra la brten nas lhas 'khru bar byed do zhes bya ba'i tshul yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni aa ru ra la brten nas lhas 'khru bar byed do zhes bya ba'i tshul yin no //
translated: This is like the statement, ‚ÄúThe god purifies by relying on myrobalan.‚Äù

original: gal te de ltar rtog na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar rtog na /
translated: If you imagine that,

original: mtshon dang sman gyi 'brel pa las //
analyzed: mtshon dang sman gyi 'brel pa las //
translated: then the relationship of a weapon and medicine

original: nag pa'i rma dang 'drubs yin na //
analyzed: nag pa'i rma dang 'drubs yin na //
translated: is like a wound and a bandage.

original: 'brel med sdong dum ci'i phyir //
analyzed: 'brel med sdong dum ci'i phyir //
translated: Why is a stump unrelated?

original: rgyu nyid du ni rtogs mi byed //üîΩdes na mi mthun phyogs la ma grub pa'i khyab byed mi dmigs pa 'di /
analyzed: rgyu nyid du ni rtogs mi byed // des na mi mthun phyogs la ma grub pa'i khyab byed mi dmigs pa 'di /
translated: Do not imagine that it is a cause.

original: de la gtan tshigs yod par dogs pa ji ltar sel /
analyzed: de la gtan tshigs yod par dogs pa ji ltar sel /
translated: Therefore, how can this nonobservation of a pervader that is not established with respect to discordant classes eliminate the doubt that a reason exists there?

original: khyab byed mi dmigs pa 'dis ni byed pa po'i rtag pa'i byed pa'i rjes su byed pa kho na dgag par rigs te byed pa po rtag pa la rag lus pa ni res 'ga' bar mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyab byed mi dmigs pa 'dis ni byed pa po'i rtag pa'i byed pa'i rjes su byed pa kho na dgag par rigs te byed pa po rtag pa la rag lus pa ni res 'ga' bar mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This non-apprehension of the pervader is logically a negation only of the activity of the permanent agent following after, because it is not tenable that the permanent agent is dependent on something else.

original: de 'grub pa ma mthong ba yongs su smin pa la rag lus par smra ba ni /
analyzed: de 'grub pa ma mthong ba yongs su smin pa la rag lus par smra ba ni /
translated: The assertion that the ripening of the seed is dependent on the moisture, etc.,

original: bsngags par 'os pa'i shes rab can lha rnams dga' ba yin te /
analyzed: bsngags par 'os pa'i shes rab can lha rnams dga' ba yin te /
translated: is the delight of the gods, the praiseworthy wisdom.

original: de la rag lus pa de yang res 'ga' med pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la rag lus pa de yang res 'ga' med pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And that dependence is not impossible at some times.

original: kho bo cag la dogs pa ldog pa'i rgyu med du chug mod /
analyzed: kho bo cag la dogs pa ldog pa'i rgyu med du chug mod /
translated: We may admit that there is no cause for the cessation of our doubt,

original: khyod la yang 'jug pa'i rgyu ci yod ce na /
analyzed: khyod la yang 'jug pa'i rgyu ci yod ce na /
translated: but what is the cause for your engagement?

original: 'brel pa ma grub pa dang 'gal ba ma mthong ba dang / ma nges pa'i rgyu can du rigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa ma grub pa dang 'gal ba ma mthong ba dang / ma nges pa'i rgyu can du rigs pa'o //
translated: It is logical that the cause is the non-establishment of the relation, the non-perception of the contradiction, and the uncertainty.

original: 'bras bu tsam ni rgyu'i khyad par skyes bu la 'brel pa ma grub po //
analyzed: 'bras bu tsam ni rgyu'i khyad par skyes bu la 'brel pa ma grub po //
translated: The mere effect is not established as related to the particular cause, the person.

original: gal te 'bras bu 'ga' zhig skyes bu'i rgyu can du mthong ba de lta na yang de las @34a * //
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu 'ga' zhig skyes bu'i rgyu can du mthong ba de lta na yang de las @34a * //
translated: Even if one sees some effects as having a person as their cause,

original: gzhan pa 'bras bu yang yin la /
analyzed: gzhan pa 'bras bu yang yin la /

original: skyes bus byas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la 'gal ba mi snang ngo //
analyzed: skyes bus byas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la 'gal ba mi snang ngo //

analyzed: 'bras bu rnams ni ma nges pa'i rgyu can du snang ste /

original: 'di ltar kha cig ni me'i rgyu can yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar kha cig ni me'i rgyu can yin la /

original: kha cig chu'i rgyu can yin zhing /
analyzed: kha cig chu'i rgyu can yin zhing /

original: kha cig rlung gi rgyu can yin te /
analyzed: kha cig rlung gi rgyu can yin te /

analyzed: des na kha cig skyes bus byas pa la de bzhin du thams cad yin no zhes sa ltar rtogs par mi nus so //

original: des mi mthun phyogs la 'jug par dogs pa'i 'bras bu nyid 'di ldog pa la the tshom za ba zhes bya ba'i ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: des mi mthun phyogs la 'jug par dogs pa'i 'bras bu nyid 'di ldog pa la the tshom za ba zhes bya ba'i ma nges pa yin no //
translated: This is called ‚Äúindeterminate‚Äù because it is uncertain whether this effect, which is suspected of being the cause of the opposite, is reversed.

original: ma nges pa las ni 'dod pa grub par mi rigs te /
analyzed: ma nges pa las ni 'dod pa grub par mi rigs te /

original: 'jim pa'i rnam 'gyur las kyang rdza mkhan grub par thal ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'jim pa'i rnam 'gyur las kyang rdza mkhan grub par thal ba'i phyir te /
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that a potter is established from the transformation of clay.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /

analyzed: dbyibs sogs ci 'dra byin rlob po //

original: yod med rjes 'jug can grub pa //
analyzed: yod med rjes 'jug can grub pa //

original: de la rjes su dpog gang yin //
analyzed: de la rjes su dpog gang yin //

analyzed: de ni rigs pa nyid yin no //

original: tha dad dngos la rab grub pa //
analyzed: tha dad dngos la rab grub pa //

analyzed: sgra mtshungs pas tha dad med pas //

original: rjes dpog rigs pa ma yin te //
analyzed: rjes dpog rigs pa ma yin te //

original: skye bo'i rdzas la me bzhin no //
analyzed: skye bo'i rdzas la me bzhin no //

original: de lta min na rdza mkhan gyi //üîΩbum pa la sogs 'jim pa yi //
analyzed: de lta min na rdza mkhan gyi // bum pa la sogs 'jim pa yi //
translated: If it were not so,üîΩbecause of the transformation of clay

analyzed: rnam 'gyur 'ga' zhig byed pa'i phyir // grog mkhar yang des byas grub 'gyur //

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //

analyzed: grog mkhar la rdza mkhan rjes su dpog pa ma yin no zhes kyang bsam par mi bya ste /
translated: it should not be thought that the anthill is inferred from the transformation of clay that is mistaken.

analyzed: rdza mkhan dang grog mkhar la mi dang mi ma yin pas byas pa'i 'ji ba'i rnam 'gyur mtshon pa lhur byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro ;

analyzed: / gang yang kha cig gis mngon sum dang 'gal ba'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, some say that because it contradicts direct perception,

analyzed: grog mkhar la 'ji ba'i rnam 'gyur rjes su dpog pa ma yin no zhes smras pa de yang /

original: chu klung 'bru ba rjes su dpog pa mngon sum dang 'gal ba'i sgo nas bshad zin pa yin no //üîΩgzhan yang ci khyab pa grub pa la gnod pa yin nam /
analyzed: chu klung 'bru ba rjes su dpog pa mngon sum dang 'gal ba'i sgo nas bshad zin pa yin no // gzhan yang ci khyab pa grub pa la gnod pa yin nam /
translated: But that has already been explained by the contradiction with direct perception in the inference of the river being the D·πõ·π£advatƒ´.üîΩMoreover, is the contradiction with direct perception in the establishment of the pervasion,

analyzed: 'on te ma grub pa la yin no // de la phyogs dang po ni ma yin te /

original: gnod pa med na mi 'byung ba 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnod pa med na mi 'byung ba 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The first is not the case because it is contradictory that it does not occur when there is no contradiction.

original: med na mi 'byung ba ni bsgrub par bya ba yod pa kho na na yod pa yin na /
analyzed: med na mi 'byung ba ni bsgrub par bya ba yod pa kho na na yod pa yin na /

analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid can de chos can la gtan tshigs yod cing /
translated: Therefore the property of the subject is the existence of the reason in the subject that has that as its definition.

analyzed: de @34b la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos med par ji ltar 'gyur /

analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la gnod par zhugs pa'i mngon sum ni chos can de las ldog par byed la /

analyzed: de yod pa kho na yod pa'i gtan tshigs de chos can de la 'jug pa na /

analyzed: kye ma dngos po shin tu mi bde bar gnas par gyur to //

analyzed: gzhan du bsgrub par bya ba'i chos med na gtan tshigs mi 'byung ba yin gyi /

analyzed: chos can la ni ma yin no zhe na /

original: de ci nyon mongs 'di ma ning la spyad pas bu tshol lam zhes bya ba la sogs pa gtan tshigs thigs pa ji lta ba bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de ci nyon mongs 'di ma ning la spyad pas bu tshol lam zhes bya ba la sogs pa gtan tshigs thigs pa ji lta ba bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: In response to this, one should state the argument of the Drop of Reasons just as it is: ‚ÄúIs this affliction practiced by a neuter, or is it seeking a son?‚Äù and so on.

analyzed: gnyis pa la yang khyab pa ma grub pa nyid brjod par bya'i /
translated: In the second case, one should state that the pervasion is not established.

original: gnod par bsgrags pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: gnod par bsgrags pas ci zhig bya /

analyzed: khyab pa yang mngon sum gyis grub pa na /

analyzed: de ma grub par su zhig brjod par spro /

analyzed: khyab par sgrub par byed pa'i mngon sum de nyid la gnod do zhe na /
translated: If you say that the perception which establishes the pervasion is contradicted,

original: de lta na bum pa la sogs pa la yang rdza mkhan rjes su mi dpog par 'gyur te ;
analyzed: de lta na bum pa la sogs pa la yang rdza mkhan rjes su mi dpog par 'gyur te ;
translated: then it would follow, absurdly, that a potter could not be inferred in the case of a pot, etc.

original: sgrub par byed pa tshad ma ma yin na bsgrub par bya ba ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa tshad ma ma yin na bsgrub par bya ba ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the proof, the valid cognition, is not established, since the probandum is not established.

original: tshad ma la ni gzhan gyis gnon pa ma yin te /
analyzed: tshad ma la ni gzhan gyis gnon pa ma yin te /
translated: But a valid cognition cannot be contradicted by another,

original: thams cad du yid brtan du med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad du yid brtan du med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because in all cases it cannot be trusted.

original: 'jim pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba ci 'dra ba zhig rdza mkhan gyi 'bras bur mthong ba de 'dra ba kho na gal te med par 'byung na /
analyzed: 'jim pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba ci 'dra ba zhig rdza mkhan gyi 'bras bur mthong ba de 'dra ba kho na gal te med par 'byung na /
translated: If the shape of the clay were to appear without the potter's being seen,

original: de rgyu rdza mkhan ma yin pas na de de las lan cig kyang mi 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rgyu rdza mkhan ma yin pas na de de las lan cig kyang mi 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then since it would not be the cause of the potter, it would not arise even once from it.

original: 'on te gzhan 'dra ba yin na de'i tshe 'ji ba'i rnam 'gyur tsam la ma khyab pa'i khyad par ni grog mkhar la ma grub po zhes bya ba 'di nyid brjod par mi rigs kyi /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan 'dra ba yin na de'i tshe 'ji ba'i rnam 'gyur tsam la ma khyab pa'i khyad par ni grog mkhar la ma grub po zhes bya ba 'di nyid brjod par mi rigs kyi /
translated: But if it were similar to the other, then it would be incorrect to say that the mere shape of the clay is not pervaded by the potter, but that the particular is not established in the anthill.

original: rigs pa can rnams kyi don med par 'brel pa med pa brjod pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: rigs pa can rnams kyi don med par 'brel pa med pa brjod pas ci zhig bya /
translated: What is the point of the logicians‚Äô statement of a reason that is not related to the proposition?

original: sgrub par byed pa lhag ma gnyis ma nges pa la yang tshul 'di nyid ji ltar 'byor pa sbyor bar bya'o //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa lhag ma gnyis ma nges pa la yang tshul 'di nyid ji ltar 'byor pa sbyor bar bya'o //
translated: This same method should be applied to the other two inconclusive reasons.

original: ji ste skye ba dang ldan pa la sogs pa la ni yul dang dus dang / rang bzhin nges pas khyab pa yin la /
analyzed: ji ste skye ba dang ldan pa la sogs pa la ni yul dang dus dang / rang bzhin nges pas khyab pa yin la /
translated: But if something has arising, etc., then it is necessarily restricted to a specific place, time, and nature.

original: gal te blo dang ldan pa med par yang yod na yul la sogs pa so sor nges par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te blo dang ldan pa med par yang yod na yul la sogs pa so sor nges par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it existed even without an intelligent being, then it would not be restricted to a specific place, etc.

original: des na khyab byed mi dmigs pas mi mthun phyogs las ldog pa na 'di blo dang ldan pa'i rgyu can nyid la gnas pa na des khyab pa grub pas na ma nges pa ma yin no zhes bya bar 'dod /
analyzed: des na khyab byed mi dmigs pas mi mthun phyogs las ldog pa na 'di blo dang ldan pa'i rgyu can nyid la gnas pa na des khyab pa grub pas na ma nges pa ma yin no zhes bya bar 'dod /
translated: Therefore, since the evidence is not observed to be absent from the dissimilar class, it is not inconclusive.

original: de yang mi bden te /üîΩblo dang ldan pa'i byed pa med kyang yul la sogs @35a * //
analyzed: de yang mi bden te / blo dang ldan pa'i byed pa med kyang yul la sogs @35a * //
translated: This is not correct.

original: pa nges pa 'thad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: pa nges pa 'thad pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is tenable that a specific place, etc., is restricted even without the activity of an intelligent being.

original: yul la sogs pa so sor nges pa ni rgyu tsam la rag las pa yin gyi /
analyzed: yul la sogs pa so sor nges pa ni rgyu tsam la rag las pa yin gyi /
translated: The determination of objects and so on depends on mere causes.

original: rgyu'i khyad par la rag las pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu'i khyad par la rag las pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It does not depend on the specific cause.

original: de'i phyir blo dang ldan pa med kyang yul la sogs pa gang du rgyu yod pa dang med pa yin pa de kho nar 'bras bu yang yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir blo dang ldan pa med kyang yul la sogs pa gang du rgyu yod pa dang med pa yin pa de kho nar 'bras bu yang yin la /
translated: Therefore, even without an intelligent being, the effect exists only where the cause exists and does not exist where the cause does not exist.üîΩAnd since the effect is only that nature which the cause is able to generate, how can it be said to be indeterminate?

original: rgyus ngo bo gang bskyed par nus pa 'bras bu yang de'i ngo bo kho na yin pas ma nges pa zhes bya ba ji ltar yin rgyu med pa yin na 'dir 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyus ngo bo gang bskyed par nus pa 'bras bu yang de'i ngo bo kho na yin pas ma nges pa zhes bya ba ji ltar yin rgyu med pa yin na 'dir 'gyur te /
translated: If it is causeless, it would be as follows.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: rgyu med pa nyid yin na ni yul dang dus dang rang bzhin so sor nges pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyu med pa nyid yin na ni yul dang dus dang rang bzhin so sor nges pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: If it were causeless, it would not be tenable that objects, time, and nature are determined individually.

original: blo dang ldan pa'i byin gyis rlob pa po med na rgyu'i yul la sogs pa so sor nges pa ci ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: blo dang ldan pa'i byin gyis rlob pa po med na rgyu'i yul la sogs pa so sor nges pa ci ltar yin zhe na /
translated: If there is no intelligent being who empowers it, how can the cause be determined individually with respect to objects and so on?

original: yul la sogs pa khyad par can kho nar rang bzhin khyad par can nyid du de'i rang gi rgyu las skyes pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: yul la sogs pa khyad par can kho nar rang bzhin khyad par can nyid du de'i rang gi rgyu las skyes pa'i phyir la /
translated: Because the special object and so on is born from its own special cause.

original: de'i so sor nges pa de yang rang gi rgyu las yin pas na /
analyzed: de'i so sor nges pa de yang rang gi rgyu las yin pas na /
translated: And its individual determination is from its own cause.

original: rgyu brgyud pa la thog ma med pa'i phyir gzhan gyis sun 'byin pa'i skabs med do //
analyzed: rgyu brgyud pa la thog ma med pa'i phyir gzhan gyis sun 'byin pa'i skabs med do //
translated: Since the continuum of causes is beginningless, there is no opportunity for refutation by others.

original: 'o na yul gzhan du skyes pa'i rgyu las yul gzhan du 'bras bur mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na yul gzhan du skyes pa'i rgyu las yul gzhan du 'bras bur mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But if the cause is born in one place, the effect will not be born in another place.

original: 'gyur te rgyu nye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gyur te rgyu nye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It will be born in another place because the cause is proximate.

original: blo dang ldan pa ma rtogs pa 'ga' yang sems pa med pa rnams kyi nye ba'i rgyur mi 'thad pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: blo dang ldan pa ma rtogs pa 'ga' yang sems pa med pa rnams kyi nye ba'i rgyur mi 'thad pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it untenable that the intelligent are the proximate cause of the mindless?

original: gang gi phyir 'di dag skyes pa'i yul las gzhan du 'gro ba ni blo dang ldan pa'i byed pa med par mi srid do zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di dag skyes pa'i yul las gzhan du 'gro ba ni blo dang ldan pa'i byed pa med par mi srid do zhe na /
translated: Because it is impossible for these to go to another place from where they are born without the activity of the intelligent.

original: mi srid pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mi srid pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not impossible.

original: rlung gis khyer ba rnams dang / smin nas yu ba lhod pa'i 'bras bu ltung ba dang / chu klung dang nye ba na gnas pa rnams chu rgyun gyis khyer ba rnams yul gzhan du phyin pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rlung gis khyer ba rnams dang / smin nas yu ba lhod pa'i 'bras bu ltung ba dang / chu klung dang nye ba na gnas pa rnams chu rgyun gyis khyer ba rnams yul gzhan du phyin pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because one sees that some are carried by the wind, some fall like fruit whose stalk has rotted, and some are carried by the current of a river or stream to another place.

original: blo sngon du gtang ba ma yin yang rgyu nye bar byed pa blo dang ldan pa rnams la snang ste /
analyzed: blo sngon du gtang ba ma yin yang rgyu nye bar byed pa blo dang ldan pa rnams la snang ste /
translated: Even though they are not preceded by an awareness, they appear to those who are aware of the cause.

original: ji ltar bya rnams kyis zos pa'i 'bras bu'i sa bon skyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar bya rnams kyis zos pa'i 'bras bu'i sa bon skyur ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, the seeds of fruit eaten by birds.

original: des na de lta bu'i nye bar byed pa yang sems pa med pa'i nye bar byed pa las khyad par med do //
analyzed: des na de lta bu'i nye bar byed pa yang sems pa med pa'i nye bar byed pa las khyad par med do //
translated: Thus, such a cause is not different from a cause that is not awareness.

original: kho bo cag gis yul gzhan du 'gro ba'i rgyu ji tsam zhig 'gro bar nus te /
analyzed: kho bo cag gis yul gzhan du 'gro ba'i rgyu ji tsam zhig 'gro bar nus te /
translated: How much can we, who are the cause of going to another place, go?

original: re zhig skyes bu'i byed pa med kyang sems pa med kyang sems pa med pa rnams yul gzhan du phyin pa dmigs la /
analyzed: re zhig skyes bu'i byed pa med kyang sems pa med kyang sems pa med pa rnams yul gzhan du phyin pa dmigs la /
translated: Even without the activity of a person, one sees that things that are not aware go to another place.

original: des na 'dis rjes su dpog pa mi 'thad pa kho na'o //
analyzed: des na 'dis rjes su dpog pa mi 'thad pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not at all tenable to infer that from that.

original: gzhan yang yul dang dus so sor nges pa skyes bu la rag las pa yin du chug mod /
analyzed: gzhan yang yul dang dus so sor nges pa skyes bu la rag las pa yin du chug mod /
translated: Moreover, it is certainly the case that the determination of specific places and times depends on the person.

original: rgyu rnams @35b 'ga' zhig kho nar res 'ga'i tshe kho na nye bas na skyes bu la brten nas yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu rnams @35b 'ga' zhig kho nar res 'ga'i tshe kho na nye bas na skyes bu la brten nas yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But some causes are only sometimes close, and so they exist in dependence on the person.

original: rang bzhin so sor nges pa de la rag lus pa ji ltar yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin so sor nges pa de la rag lus pa ji ltar yin te /
translated: How could the determination of specific natures depend on the person?

original: 'bras bu ngo bo khyad par can du byed pa'i nus pas stong pa na /
analyzed: 'bras bu ngo bo khyad par can du byed pa'i nus pas stong pa na /
translated: If the effect is empty of the capacity to create a specific nature,

original: skyes bu'i byin gyi rlabs yod kyang sems pa med pa rnams 'bras bu khyad par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: skyes bu'i byin gyi rlabs yod kyang sems pa med pa rnams 'bras bu khyad par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: then even if the person‚Äôs blessing exists, those things that lack intention do not create a specific effect.

original: de med kyang de dang ldan pa na de dag de'i rang bzhin sgrub par byed pa mi 'gal ba kho na'o //
analyzed: de med kyang de dang ldan pa na de dag de'i rang bzhin sgrub par byed pa mi 'gal ba kho na'o //
translated: Even if that is nonexistent, it is not contradictory that those things that possess it establish its nature.

original: ri la sogs pa'i yul dang dus dang rang bzhin nges pa 'di yang gzhan gyis 'dod pa'i skyes bu'i gzhan dbang du mi 'thad de /
analyzed: ri la sogs pa'i yul dang dus dang rang bzhin nges pa 'di yang gzhan gyis 'dod pa'i skyes bu'i gzhan dbang du mi 'thad de /
translated: This determination of specific places, such as mountains, and times is not tenable as the other-dependence of the person asserted by others.

original: 'di ltar skyes bu ni lus med pa dang rtag par gzhan 'dod la /
analyzed: 'di ltar skyes bu ni lus med pa dang rtag par gzhan 'dod la /
translated: This is because others assert that the person is without body and is permanent.

original: lus med pas ni yul gzhan na gnas pa'i rgyu rnams bsog par mi nus te /
analyzed: lus med pas ni yul gzhan na gnas pa'i rgyu rnams bsog par mi nus te /
translated: Since it is bodiless, it cannot accumulate causes that exist in other places.

original: skyes bu'i 'dod pa na yang lag pa la sogs pa'i byed pa med par de dag nye ba nyid mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu'i 'dod pa na yang lag pa la sogs pa'i byed pa med par de dag nye ba nyid mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even if it were the desire of the person, it would not be tenable that they approach without the activity of hands, etc.

original: rdza mkhan la sogs pa'i 'dod pa tsam gyis ni 'jim gong dang dbyu gu dang chu dang skud pa la sogs par mi snang la /
analyzed: rdza mkhan la sogs pa'i 'dod pa tsam gyis ni 'jim gong dang dbyu gu dang chu dang skud pa la sogs par mi snang la /
translated: The lump of clay, the stick, the water, the thread, etc. do not appear as the effect of the potter, etc. merely through the desire of the potter, etc.

original: sogs par mi byed na yang yul gyi khyad par du 'bras bu skyed par mi nus so //
analyzed: sogs par mi byed na yang yul gyi khyad par du 'bras bu skyed par mi nus so //
translated: If they do not perform the activity, they are not able to generate the effect as a particular object.

original: rtag pas dus kyi khyad par du 'bras bu skyed par mi 'thad de /
analyzed: rtag pas dus kyi khyad par du 'bras bu skyed par mi 'thad de /
translated: It is not tenable that the permanent generates an effect at a particular time,

original: de las snga ba dang phyi nas kyang byed pa po'i rang bzhin du gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las snga ba dang phyi nas kyang byed pa po'i rang bzhin du gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the same in nature as the agent before and after.

original: 'di lhan cig byed pa ma tshang bas res 'ga' mi byed pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di lhan cig byed pa ma tshang bas res 'ga' mi byed pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is also not the case that it sometimes does not act due to the incompleteness of the assemblage of causes,

original: de la rag lus nas skye ba de dag yul dang dus su yang ma tshang ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la rag lus nas skye ba de dag yul dang dus su yang ma tshang ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not tenable that those that arise in dependence on it are incomplete with regard to place and time.

original: gnas pa ma yin pa la zhen pas chog go //
analyzed: gnas pa ma yin pa la zhen pas chog go //
translated: Since it is not tenable that it endures, it is sufficient to refute it.

original: de'i phyir de ltar 'brel pa ma grub pas na bzlog pa la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar 'brel pa ma grub pas na bzlog pa la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma med pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, since the relation is not established in that way, the reversal is not established, and there is no valid cognition that refutes it.

original: 'bras bu nyid la sogs pa ni khyab pa med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid la sogs pa ni khyab pa med pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, such things as being an effect are not pervasions at all.

original: 'di kho nas rang rtsom par byed pa'i yan lag bkod pa'i khyad par la sogs pa yang bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di kho nas rang rtsom par byed pa'i yan lag bkod pa'i khyad par la sogs pa yang bshad pa yin no //
translated: This alone explains the difference in the arrangement of the parts of the composition.

original: de ste 'di dag la khyab pa med pas ma nges pa yin du chug / khyad par dang 'gal ba ni bzlog par nus te /
analyzed: de ste 'di dag la khyab pa med pas ma nges pa yin du chug / khyad par dang 'gal ba ni bzlog par nus te /
translated: If you say that these are not pervasions and therefore are not established, then the reversal of the contradiction with the distinction is possible.

original: 'di ltar 'bras bu nyid la sogs pa 'di dag ni res 'ga' ba nyid kyis khyab par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'bras bu nyid la sogs pa 'di dag ni res 'ga' ba nyid kyis khyab par bya ba yin la /
translated: Thus, such things as being an effect are pervaded by being occasional.

original: byed pa po rtag pa mi srid pa res 'ga' ba de ni de las ldog pa na rang gi khyab bya rnams kyang ldog par byed do //
analyzed: byed pa po rtag pa mi srid pa res 'ga' ba de ni de las ldog pa na rang gi khyab bya rnams kyang ldog par byed do //
translated: The permanent agent, which is impossible, is occasional. When it is reversed, its pervaded properties are also reversed.

original: des na rtag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi byed pa pa'o khyad par med par byed pa 'di dag khyad par dang mi 'gal bar ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: des na rtag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi byed pa pa'o khyad par med par byed pa 'di dag khyad par dang mi 'gal bar ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, how could these actions, which are the agent of the characteristic of permanence, be non-contradictory with the particularities?
Here,

original: las kyang khyad par dang 'gal ba yin te /
analyzed: las kyang khyad par dang 'gal ba yin te /
translated: there is also contradiction with the particularities.

original: byed pa po'i khyad par lus can ma yin ba'i ngo bo yang 'gog par byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: byed pa po'i khyad par lus can ma yin ba'i ngo bo yang 'gog par byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The particularity of the agent is also refuted, that is, the nature of the non-embodiment.

original: gal te de dag la lus kyis ma khyab pa de lta na yang ri la sogs pa la de sprul par nus pa'i byed pa po nye bar 'jog pa rnams kyis lus dang 'brel pa rjes su sgrub par byed de /
analyzed: gal te de dag la lus kyis ma khyab pa de lta na yang ri la sogs pa la de sprul par nus pa'i byed pa po nye bar 'jog pa rnams kyis lus dang 'brel pa rjes su sgrub par byed de /
translated: Even if those are not pervaded by the body, those who posit the agent as capable of emanating in the mountains, etc., establish the connection with the body,

original: lus dang bral ba la de sprul pa'i nus pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus dang bral ba la de sprul pa'i nus pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the capacity to emanate that is separate from the body is not tenable.

original: 'o na rtsol ba dang lus la 'du ba'i bya ba rnams su mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na rtsol ba dang lus la 'du ba'i bya ba rnams su mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, the activities of exertion and gathering in the body would not occur.

original: 'gyur ba kho na ste /
analyzed: 'gyur ba kho na ste /
translated: They would occur,

original: de la 'dod pa tsam gyis nus pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa tsam gyis nus pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the capacity is seen merely by desire.

original: 'o na ri la sogs pa la yang de kho na bzhin du lus kyi byed pa med kyang yod par ci'i phyir mi 'gyur /
analyzed: 'o na ri la sogs pa la yang de kho na bzhin du lus kyi byed pa med kyang yod par ci'i phyir mi 'gyur /
translated: Well, then, why is it not the case that mountains, etc. are also like that, i.e., that they exist without the body‚Äôs activity?

original: de'i 'bras bu skyed pa la lus phan mi 'dogs pa kho na yin nam /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu skyed pa la lus phan mi 'dogs pa kho na yin nam /
translated: Is it not the case that the body does not help at all in the production of its effect?

original: de lta yin na bum pa la sogs pa yang de la mi ltos par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na bum pa la sogs pa yang de la mi ltos par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were the case, then pots, etc. would not be dependent on it.

original: rgyu rnams kyis nye ba dang tshogs pa rnams 'bras bu skyed pa de yang skyes bu'i kun du rtog pa tsam gyis 'byung ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu rnams kyis nye ba dang tshogs pa rnams 'bras bu skyed pa de yang skyes bu'i kun du rtog pa tsam gyis 'byung ba ni ma yin no //
translated: The production of the effect by the causes that are present and assembled does not occur by the mere conception of a person.

original: des na phyi rol gyi 'bras bu'i bdag nyid ri la sogs pa 'di dag kyang bum pa la sogs pa bzhin du lus kyi byed pa med par skye ba mi thob pas na lus la de sprul pa'i nus pa sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: des na phyi rol gyi 'bras bu'i bdag nyid ri la sogs pa 'di dag kyang bum pa la sogs pa bzhin du lus kyi byed pa med par skye ba mi thob pas na lus la de sprul pa'i nus pa sgrub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, these external effects, such as mountains, etc., like pots, etc., are not obtained without the body‚Äôs activity. Thus, the body establishes the capacity to emanate them.

original: de lta na yang khyab byed ma yin pa'i khyad par ji ltar 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta na yang khyab byed ma yin pa'i khyad par ji ltar 'grub par 'gyur /
translated: Even so, how can a non-pervading particular be established?

original: 'di khyab byed yin pas grub pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di khyab byed yin pas grub pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not that it is established because it is a pervader.

original: 'on kyang gzhi grub mtha'i tshul gyis yin na /
analyzed: 'on kyang gzhi grub mtha'i tshul gyis yin na /
translated: But if it is established by a philosophical system,

original: des na brgal zhing brtag pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: des na brgal zhing brtag pa ci yod ce na /
translated: then what is the point of debate and analysis?

original: 'di snyam du lus kyi byed pa med par yang rtsva la sogs pa skye bar snang la /
analyzed: 'di snyam du lus kyi byed pa med par yang rtsva la sogs pa skye bar snang la /
translated: You may think, ‚ÄúIt appears that grass and so on grows without the action of a body.

original: de la lus rjes su dpog pa mngon sum gyis gnod pas na /
analyzed: de la lus rjes su dpog pa mngon sum gyis gnod pas na /
translated: Since the body is undermined by direct perception,

original: dus las thal ba brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: dus las thal ba brjod pa yin la /
translated: the consequence of the body being a nonthing is stated.

original: gzhan du ni de nyid kyis 'khrul pa dang bcas pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: gzhan du ni de nyid kyis 'khrul pa dang bcas pa yin no snyam na /
translated: Otherwise, it would be erroneous.üîΩ‚Äù

original: de ni mi bden te /
analyzed: de ni mi bden te /
translated: That is not correct.

original: gang gi ma mthong bas med par 'gyur ba lus gdon mi za bar snang du rung ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi ma mthong bas med par 'gyur ba lus gdon mi za bar snang du rung ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Without seeing it, it is not the case that the body is necessarily seen.

original: lus yin pa nyid kyis snang du rung ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: lus yin pa nyid kyis snang du rung ba yin no zhe na /
translated: You may say, ‚ÄúIt is suitable to be seen because it is a body.‚Äù

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: sha za la sogs pa'i lus kyis ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sha za la sogs pa'i lus kyis ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not definite by the body of a flesh-eater and so on.

original: de ni 'dod kyang ldog pa la the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni 'dod kyang ldog pa la the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though that is asserted, there is doubt about the reversal.

original: snang du mi rung ba la ni mngon sum gyi gnod pa mi srid de /
analyzed: snang du mi rung ba la ni mngon sum gyi gnod pa mi srid de /
translated: It is impossible for direct perception to undermine what is not suitable to appear.

original: de ni de ltar spyi'i sgo nas ni khyab pa med la /
analyzed: de ni de ltar spyi'i sgo nas ni khyab pa med la /
translated: It is not pervaded in that way in general.

original: khyab na yang 'gal ba @36b yin no zhes gnas so //
analyzed: khyab na yang 'gal ba @36b yin no zhes gnas so //
translated: If it were pervaded, it would be contradictory.

original: ji ste 'bras bu la sogs pa'i ngo bo ji 'dra ba zhig la skyes bus khyab pa de 'dra ba gtan tshigs nyid du 'god do zhe na /
analyzed: ji ste 'bras bu la sogs pa'i ngo bo ji 'dra ba zhig la skyes bus khyab pa de 'dra ba gtan tshigs nyid du 'god do zhe na /
translated: But if you were to posit as the reason the mere nature of the effect, etc., which is pervaded by a person,

original: de'i tshe shin tu gsal bar ma grub pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe shin tu gsal bar ma grub pa yin te /
translated: then it would be very clearly unestablished.

original: phyogs su byas pa rnams la de mi dmigs pa'i phyir dang / dmigs pa'i khyad par la 'gal ba spang bar mi nus pa'i phyir dang / byed pa po can du nges pa dang rigs mi mthun par sngar nyid du bsgrubs zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs su byas pa rnams la de mi dmigs pa'i phyir dang / dmigs pa'i khyad par la 'gal ba spang bar mi nus pa'i phyir dang / byed pa po can du nges pa dang rigs mi mthun par sngar nyid du bsgrubs zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not observed in the subjects, because it is not possible to avoid contradiction in the observation of a particular, and because it has already been established that it is ascertained as an agent and that it is not of a homogeneous type.

original: gzhan yang 'bras bu nyid la sogs pa 'di dag gis blo dang ldan pa tsam sgrub bam /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'bras bu nyid la sogs pa 'di dag gis blo dang ldan pa tsam sgrub bam /
translated: Moreover, do these, such as the effect, etc., establish mere intelligence?

original: rtag pa la sogs pa yon tan gyi rten blo dang ldan pa'i khyad par sgrub grang de la phyogs dang po la ni grub pa bsgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: rtag pa la sogs pa yon tan gyi rten blo dang ldan pa'i khyad par sgrub grang de la phyogs dang po la ni grub pa bsgrub pa yin te /
translated: Or do they establish the particular of an intelligent being, the substratum of such qualities as permanence? In the first case, it is the establishment of what is already established.

original: sems pa'i mtshan nyid dge ba dang mi dge ba zhes bya ba thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa'i las blo dang ldan pas lus la sogs pa sprul pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sems pa'i mtshan nyid dge ba dang mi dge ba zhes bya ba thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa'i las blo dang ldan pas lus la sogs pa sprul pa'i phyir te /
translated: The definition of intention is virtuous or nonvirtuous karma, because the wise emanate bodies and so on that are common or uncommon.

original: las las 'jig rten sna tshogs skyes //
analyzed: las las 'jig rten sna tshogs skyes //
translated: The world‚Äôs variety arises from karma.

original: de ni sems pa dang nges byas //
analyzed: de ni sems pa dang nges byas //
translated: It is created by intention and volition.

original: sems pa yid kyi las yin no //üîΩdes skyed lus dang ngag gi las //
analyzed: sems pa yid kyi las yin no // des skyed lus dang ngag gi las //
translated: Intention is mental karma.

original: zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Karma of body and speech are generated by that.

original: gnyis pa la ni de lta bu dang rjes su 'gro ba ma grub pas na de la bsgrub bya ma tshang zhing gtan tshigs kyi khyab pa ma grub pas ma nges pa nyid do //
analyzed: gnyis pa la ni de lta bu dang rjes su 'gro ba ma grub pas na de la bsgrub bya ma tshang zhing gtan tshigs kyi khyab pa ma grub pas ma nges pa nyid do //
translated: In the second, since it is not established that it is concomitant with that, the probandum is incomplete and the pervasion of the reason is not established. Therefore it is indefinite.

original: 'o na byed pa po can du nges pa rnams la blo dang ldan pa nye bar len pa la sogs pa spyod par byed pa'i byed pa bo ji lta bur gyur pa zhig grub pa de lta bur gyur pa kho na lus la sogs pa la sgrub pa
analyzed: 'o na byed pa po can du nges pa rnams la blo dang ldan pa nye bar len pa la sogs pa spyod par byed pa'i byed pa bo ji lta bur gyur pa zhig grub pa de lta bur gyur pa kho na lus la sogs pa la sgrub pa
translated: Well then, in regard to those who are ascertained to be agents, what kind of agent is established as the one who engages in the appropriation of the wise and so on? That kind alone is established in regard to the body and so on.

original: yin la / des na grub pa sgrub pa ma yin zhing rjes su 'gro ba med pa yang ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: yin la / des na grub pa sgrub pa ma yin zhing rjes su 'gro ba med pa yang ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that the proof is established or that there is no pervasion.

original: 'o na nye bar len pa la sogs pa rtogs par byed pa dpe la mthong ba na /
analyzed: 'o na nye bar len pa la sogs pa rtogs par byed pa dpe la mthong ba na /
translated: If you say that the example of the realization of appropriation, etc.üîΩis seen,

original: phyogs la yang de lta bur gyur pa kho na sgrub na /
analyzed: phyogs la yang de lta bur gyur pa kho na sgrub na /
translated: then the proof of the position is just like that.

original: des lus dang ldan pa yang yin pas na de lta bur gyur pa yang 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des lus dang ldan pa yang yin pas na de lta bur gyur pa yang 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it is also related to the body, that is also established.

original: de la 'dod rgyal la rag las pa'i lus ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la 'dod rgyal la rag las pa'i lus ni ma yin te /
translated: The body is not dependent on chance,

original: 'bras bu de'i rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa'i rjes su 'jug par mthong ba'i phyir dang / lus kyi nye bar sbyor ba med par yang 'ga' zhig mthong bas na de bsgrub par mi bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'bras bu de'i rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa'i rjes su 'jug par mthong ba'i phyir dang / lus kyi nye bar sbyor ba med par yang 'ga' zhig mthong bas na de bsgrub par mi bya'o zhe na /
translated: because the result is seen to follow and reverse from that, and because some are seen without the application of the body, it is not to be established.

original: gnyid log pa bla ba la sogs pa dpyod par byed pa yang mthong bas na /
analyzed: gnyid log pa bla ba la sogs pa dpyod par byed pa yang mthong bas na /
translated: Since it is also seen that one who is asleep or drunk analyzes,

original: dpyod par byed pa yang sgrub byed du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dpyod par byed pa yang sgrub byed du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: analysis is not to be established as the proof.

original: de ni rigs mi mthun pa kho na yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de ni rigs mi mthun pa kho na yin no zhe na /
translated: It is only of a dissimilar type.

original: lus @37a * //
analyzed: lus @37a * //
translated: BodyüîΩüîΩ

original: kyi byed pa med par yang 'byung ba na ci'i phyir rigs mi mthun pa yin /
analyzed: kyi byed pa med par yang 'byung ba na ci'i phyir rigs mi mthun pa yin /
translated: If it arises without the operation of the body, why is it not heterogeneous?

original: rigs gcig pa yin na lus kyis nye bar sbyor ba rnam par phye nas rnam par gzhag par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs gcig pa yin na lus kyis nye bar sbyor ba rnam par phye nas rnam par gzhag par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is homogeneous, then it is not tenable to posit it as distinguished by the operation of the body.

original: ji ste gal te lus nye bar sbyor ba dang ldan par snang ba de lta na yang de khyad par byed pa nyid du mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: ji ste gal te lus nye bar sbyor ba dang ldan par snang ba de lta na yang de khyad par byed pa nyid du mi 'grub ste /
translated: If it appears to be associated with the operation of the body, even so, it is not established as the differentiator,

original: mthu phul du byung ba dang ldan pa lus med pa yang kun tu rtogs pa tsam gyis bya ba byed pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthu phul du byung ba dang ldan pa lus med pa yang kun tu rtogs pa tsam gyis bya ba byed pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is possible that something without a body, endowed with extraordinary power, performs its function by mere intention.

original: 'o na de'i tshe gal te dpyod pa nye bar sbyor ba snang ba de lta na yang de khyab par byed pa nyid du mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: 'o na de'i tshe gal te dpyod pa nye bar sbyor ba snang ba de lta na yang de khyab par byed pa nyid du mi 'grub ste /
