translated: If it is seen to be associated with the operation of the mind, even so, it is not established as the differentiator,

original: mthu phul du byung ba dang ldan pa spyod par mi byed pa yang yod pa tsam gyis bya ba byed par srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthu phul du byung ba dang ldan pa spyod par mi byed pa yang yod pa tsam gyis bya ba byed par srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is possible that something without operation, endowed with extraordinary power, performs its function by mere existence.

original: mang po ni dus gcig gi tshe dpyad par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mang po ni dus gcig gi tshe dpyad par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: Many cannot be analyzed at one time,

original: dpyod pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir dang / de yang rnam par brtag par bya ba gcig la nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpyod pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir dang / de yang rnam par brtag par bya ba gcig la nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because analysis is of the nature of discursive thought, and that is restricted to the analysis of one thing.

original: de skad du /üîΩrnam rtog gnyis ni cig car du ;
analyzed: de skad du / rnam rtog gnyis ni cig car du ;
translated: Thus it is said:

original: / mthong min zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: / mthong min zhes gsungs so //
translated: Two discursive thoughts do not occur simultaneously.üîΩTherefore, since one result cannot analyze the appropriator, etc.,

original: de'i phyir na 'bras bu gcig gis yang nye bar len pa la sogs pa lan cig gi tshe dpyad par mi nus na /
analyzed: de'i phyir na 'bras bu gcig gis yang nye bar len pa la sogs pa lan cig gi tshe dpyad par mi nus na /
translated: at one time,

original: de ci 'di du ma la yin nam /
analyzed: de ci 'di du ma la yin nam /
translated: how could many?

original: de lta na yang cig car du 'bras bu rigs du mar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: de lta na yang cig car du 'bras bu rigs du mar mi 'gyur la /
translated: Even so, the result would not be of many kinds simultaneously.

original: 'gyur na yang byed pa po du ma can kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gyur na yang byed pa po du ma can kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: And if it were, the agent would have many.

original: de'i lhag ma ni blo dang ldan pa tsam bsgrub par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: de'i lhag ma ni blo dang ldan pa tsam bsgrub par bya ba yin la /
translated: The rest is to be established by mere intelligence,

original: de la yang grub pa sgrub pa la lan gdab tu med pa yin no //
analyzed: de la yang grub pa sgrub pa la lan gdab tu med pa yin no //
translated: and there is no reply to the establishment of that.

original: 'on te gal te de las gzhan la don du ma'i yul can gyi rnam par rtog pa med pa de lta na yang 'jig rten thams cad la phul du byung ba'i nus pa can gyi dbang phyug la de mi srid pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gal te de las gzhan la don du ma'i yul can gyi rnam par rtog pa med pa de lta na yang 'jig rten thams cad la phul du byung ba'i nus pa can gyi dbang phyug la de mi srid pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the creator is not a conceptual thought that has as its object a multiplicity of things, then it is not impossible that the creator is God, who is the most powerful being in the world.

original: re zhig de ltar dmigs pa ni med do //
analyzed: re zhig de ltar dmigs pa ni med do //
translated: But that is not perceived.

original: de lta na yang de la rtog par byed na /
analyzed: de lta na yang de la rtog par byed na /
translated: If you imagine that God is the creator,üîΩwhy does he not create without analysis?

original: dpyod pa med par yang ci'i phyir mi rtog / de lta na yang de kho na bzhin du dpyod par mi byed pa'i las kyi sems pas 'bras bu rnams bskyed do zhes bya ba la mi 'thad pa ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: dpyod pa med par yang ci'i phyir mi rtog / de lta na yang de kho na bzhin du dpyod par mi byed pa'i las kyi sems pas 'bras bu rnams bskyed do zhes bya ba la mi 'thad pa ma mthong ngo //
translated: But if you say that he creates effects without analysis, we do not see that this is not tenable.

original: gzhan yang byed pa po blo dang ldan pa grub tu chug mod /üîΩde thams cad du gcig yin no zhes bya ba 'di la tshad ma ci yang med do //
analyzed: gzhan yang byed pa po blo dang ldan pa grub tu chug mod / de thams cad du gcig yin no zhes bya ba 'di la tshad ma ci yang med do //
translated: Moreover, suppose that you establish that the creator is intelligent.üîΩBut there is no evidence at all for the claim that he is one.

original: 'di ltar 'bras bu rigs gcig pa thams cad kyang byed pa po gcig pa can du mi snang ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'bras bu rigs gcig pa thams cad kyang byed pa po gcig pa can du mi snang ste /
translated: For all effects of the same type do not appear to have the same creator.

original: bum pa la sogs par rigs gcig @37b pa rnams kyang rdza mkhan du mngon du 'gro bar mthong ba'i phyir dang / khang bzangs la sogs pa 'bras bu gcig kyang byed pa po du ma can du dmigs te /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs par rigs gcig @37b pa rnams kyang rdza mkhan du mngon du 'gro bar mthong ba'i phyir dang / khang bzangs la sogs pa 'bras bu gcig kyang byed pa po du ma can du dmigs te /
translated: Also, because it is seen that many potters produce the same type of pot, and many people are observed to produce the same house, etc.

original: de la skyes bu du ma'i nye bar sbyor ba mngon sum du grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la skyes bu du ma'i nye bar sbyor ba mngon sum du grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is directly established that many people are involved in producing them.

original: des na lus dang shing dang ri dang rgya mtsho la sogs pa rigs kyi bye brag dang bsal ba'i bye brag gis tha dad pa 'di dag blo dang ldan pa'i rgyu can du sems pa dang bcas pa su brjod par spro /
analyzed: des na lus dang shing dang ri dang rgya mtsho la sogs pa rigs kyi bye brag dang bsal ba'i bye brag gis tha dad pa 'di dag blo dang ldan pa'i rgyu can du sems pa dang bcas pa su brjod par spro /
translated: Therefore, who would be so bold as to claim that the body, trees, mountains, oceans, etc., which are different by type and by individual, are produced by the intelligent being?

original: de'i phyir byed pa po gcig tu sgrub pa na gtan tshigs 'khrul pa dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir byed pa po gcig tu sgrub pa na gtan tshigs 'khrul pa dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, when establishing a single agent, the reason is fallacious.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i nyes pa yis //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i nyes pa yis //
translated: Because of the faults explained above,

original: sgrub byed skyon can ma yin mod //
analyzed: sgrub byed skyon can ma yin mod //
translated: the proof is not faulty.

original: 'on kyang 'khrul pa dmigs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'khrul pa dmigs pa'i phyir //
translated: However, because error is observed,

original: byed pa po ni gcig nyid min //
analyzed: byed pa po ni gcig nyid min //
translated: the agent is not a single entity.

original: zhes gang bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gang bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is what is being said.

original: byed pa po sgrub pa ni 'dod pa'i bsgrub bya la ltos nas ldog pa la the tshom za ba yin te /
analyzed: byed pa po sgrub pa ni 'dod pa'i bsgrub bya la ltos nas ldog pa la the tshom za ba yin te /
translated: The proof of the agent is that the reversal of the probandum is doubted in dependence on the desire to prove.

original: byed pa po ni thams cad shes par 'dod pa grub par 'dod pa yin la /
analyzed: byed pa po ni thams cad shes par 'dod pa grub par 'dod pa yin la /
translated: The agent is one who is known to desire to establish the probandum.

original: 'di'i thams cad shes pa nyid ni tshad ma gzhan gyis bsgrub par bya ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di'i thams cad shes pa nyid ni tshad ma gzhan gyis bsgrub par bya ba ma yin gyi /
translated: His omniscience is not established by another valid cognition.

original: 'on kyang gang kho na las byed pa po nyid du grub pa kho na las de yang yin la /
analyzed: 'on kyang gang kho na las byed pa po nyid du grub pa kho na las de yang yin la /
translated: However, he is omniscient in virtue of the very fact that he is an agent.

original: de lta na yang byed pa po thams cad shes pa nyid grub pa gcig la ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang byed pa po thams cad shes pa nyid grub pa gcig la ma yin no //
translated: But even so, he is not omniscient in virtue of establishing the agent.

original: gal te de 'bras bu ma lus pa'i yul can yin zhing /
analyzed: gal te de 'bras bu ma lus pa'i yul can yin zhing /
translated: If he is the object of all results

original: 'bras bu ma lus pa'i byed pa po yin na /
analyzed: 'bras bu ma lus pa'i byed pa po yin na /
translated: and the agent of all results,

original: de'i nye bar len pa la sogs pa rtogs pa'i thams cad shes pa gcig nges par grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i nye bar len pa la sogs pa rtogs pa'i thams cad shes pa gcig nges par grub pa ma yin te /
translated: then it is not the case that his omniscience is established by the ascertainment of his appropriation and so on.

original: byed pa po du ma yin yang gang zhig ji snyed la byed pa po yin pa de de snyed la thams cad shes pa yin pa na /
analyzed: byed pa po du ma yin yang gang zhig ji snyed la byed pa po yin pa de de snyed la thams cad shes pa yin pa na /
translated: Even though there are many agents, if someone is an agent in regard to some things, he is not an agent in regard to all things.

original: byed pa po'i sgrub par byed pa las thams cad shes pa nyid du mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: byed pa po'i sgrub par byed pa las thams cad shes pa nyid du mi 'grub bo //
translated: Therefore, the proof of the agent does not prove omniscience.

original: rang gi 'bras bu tsam gyi nye bar len pa la sogs pa shes pa ni thams cad shes pa zhes bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi 'bras bu tsam gyi nye bar len pa la sogs pa shes pa ni thams cad shes pa zhes bya ba ma yin te /
translated: The knowledge of the mere appropriated aggregates that are the effects of the self is not called omniscience.

original: rdza mkhan la sogs pa yang de yin par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdza mkhan la sogs pa yang de yin par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that potters and so on would be omniscient.

original: rdul gnyis la sogs pa dbang po las 'das pa byed pas na thams cad byed pa ma yin yang gzugs la sogs pa rigs pa thams cad shes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rdul gnyis la sogs pa dbang po las 'das pa byed pas na thams cad byed pa ma yin yang gzugs la sogs pa rigs pa thams cad shes pa ma yin te /
translated: Even though two atoms and so on are not agents because they are beyond the senses, they are not omniscient because they do not know all the types of form and so on.

original: kho bo cag la ltos nas ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kho bo cag la ltos nas ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not established in relation to us.

original: rdul phra rab phyogs su byed na grub mtha' dang 'gal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdul phra rab phyogs su byed na grub mtha' dang 'gal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If you say that they are agents in terms of the partless particle, you contradict your tenets.

original: dbang po las 'das @38a * //
analyzed: dbang po las 'das @38a * //
translated: Because the partless particle is beyond the senses.

original: pa cung zad cig mthong bas des thams cad mthong ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: pa cung zad cig mthong bas des thams cad mthong ba ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not that they see all by seeing a small part.

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams la yang phan tshun ltos pas khyad par du 'phags pa dang dman pa dang ldan pa srid pa na ma nges pa bzlog tu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams la yang phan tshun ltos pas khyad par du 'phags pa dang dman pa dang ldan pa srid pa na ma nges pa bzlog tu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since it is possible that yogins are superior or inferior in relation to each other, it is impossible to avoid the fallacy of uncertainty.

original: gal te byed pa po mang po yod na rang dbang yod pa nyid kyis phan tshun 'gal bar 'jug par gyur pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te byed pa po mang po yod na rang dbang yod pa nyid kyis phan tshun 'gal bar 'jug par gyur pa ma yin nam /
translated: If there are many agents, wouldn‚Äôt they operate in mutual contradiction because they are independent?

original: de lta na yang gcig gis bya ba gzhan gyis 'joms par 'gyur na de yang yod pa ma yin pas na byed pa po gcig yin zhing de dang mnyam du grub pa thams cad shes pa yin no zhes bya bar nges she na /
analyzed: de lta na yang gcig gis bya ba gzhan gyis 'joms par 'gyur na de yang yod pa ma yin pas na byed pa po gcig yin zhing de dang mnyam du grub pa thams cad shes pa yin no zhes bya bar nges she na /
translated: Even if that were the case, the activity of one would not be destroyed by the activity of another. Since that is not the case, it is certain that there is one agent and that all phenomena are known by him.

original: de ni mi rigs te ;
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te ;
translated: That is illogical.

original: gal te 'dod chags dang bral ba de dag mang po yod kyang phan tshun 'gal bar ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te 'dod chags dang bral ba de dag mang po yod kyang phan tshun 'gal bar ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: Even if there are many who are free of attachment, how could they be mutually contradictory?

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba tsam gyis thams cad shes par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba tsam gyis thams cad shes par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: Merely being free of attachment does not mean that they know all.

original: de der 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de der 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not related to that.

original: de las gzhan pa'i skye bo dam pa 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa yang rnam par dpyod pa yul du byung ba dang ldan pa rang bzhin gyi snying rje la sogs pa'i yon tan dang rjes su mthun pa'i sems can rnams bzhin du phan tshun 'gal
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i skye bo dam pa 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa yang rnam par dpyod pa yul du byung ba dang ldan pa rang bzhin gyi snying rje la sogs pa'i yon tan dang rjes su mthun pa'i sems can rnams bzhin du phan tshun 'gal
translated: But other people who are not holy, who are full of desire and so on, are not mutually exclusive, like sentient beings who are the objects of the compassion that is natural to those who are in accord with the virtues of the bodhisattva.

original: bar ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: bar ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How can they be mutually exclusive?

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i rgyal po rnams skye dgu skyong ba bzhin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i rgyal po rnams skye dgu skyong ba bzhin te /
translated: Kings who are full of desire and so on protect the people.

original: rang gi bgo skal dang mthun par gnas shing phan tshun 'joms par mi byed do //
analyzed: rang gi bgo skal dang mthun par gnas shing phan tshun 'joms par mi byed do //
translated: They remain in their own lot and do not destroy each other.

original: de la gnod pa byed pa yang dmigs so zhe na /
analyzed: de la gnod pa byed pa yang dmigs so zhe na /
translated: But we see that they harm each other.

original: 'dir yang ci'i phyir mi dmigs te /
analyzed: 'dir yang ci'i phyir mi dmigs te /
translated: Why do we not see that here?

original: de ltar mngon par mtho ba la brten pa yang slar ngan song dang mngon par mtho ba dang mi ldan pa yang slar mngon par mtho ba dang ldan par snang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar mngon par mtho ba la brten pa yang slar ngan song dang mngon par mtho ba dang mi ldan pa yang slar mngon par mtho ba dang ldan par snang ngo //
translated: Thus, those who are elevated fall again into evil destinies, and those who are not elevated become elevated again.

original: de la 'di skad du gcig gis de dag la phun sum tshogs pa dang rgud par skyed pa yin la /
analyzed: de la 'di skad du gcig gis de dag la phun sum tshogs pa dang rgud par skyed pa yin la /
translated: One might say this: ‚ÄúOne can conceive that they are the cause of the flourishing and decline of the other,

original: gzhan gyi rgud pa dang phun sum tshogs par drangs pa yin no zhes brtag par nus so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rgud pa dang phun sum tshogs par drangs pa yin no zhes brtag par nus so //
translated: and that the other is the cause of the flourishing and decline of them.‚Äù

original: rtog pa 'di ni rigs pa dang ldan pa yang yin te /
analyzed: rtog pa 'di ni rigs pa dang ldan pa yang yin te /
translated: This conception is also reasonable.

original: phan btags pa la glo bur du tshar gcod pa dang tshar gcod pa la phan 'dogs pa la ni sems rnal du gnas pas byed par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: phan btags pa la glo bur du tshar gcod pa dang tshar gcod pa la phan 'dogs pa la ni sems rnal du gnas pas byed par mi 'thad do //
translated: It is not tenable that one who is in a normal state of mind would destroy one who has benefited him or would benefit one whom he has destroyed.

original: phan gdags par bya ba dang tshar gcad par bya ba dag chos dang chos ma yin pa byed du bcug pa yang slar chos ma yin pa dang chos gzhan la 'jug pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: phan gdags par bya ba dang tshar gcad par bya ba dag chos dang chos ma yin pa byed du bcug pa yang slar chos ma yin pa dang chos gzhan la 'jug pa yang ma yin no //
translated: And it is not the case that those who are benefited or destroyed engage in what is moral and immoral in return.

original: gal te byed pa po gcig tu @38b rtogs na rtogs par sla ba'i phyir dang / du ma ma bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir byed pa po gcig tu rtogs pa kho nar rigs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te byed pa po gcig tu @38b rtogs na rtogs par sla ba'i phyir dang / du ma ma bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir byed pa po gcig tu rtogs pa kho nar rigs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If one conceives of the agent as one, it is reasonable to conceive of the agent as one alone because it is easy to conceive of it as one and because it is not refuted as one.

original: 'di la tshad ma'i byed pa ni med do //
analyzed: 'di la tshad ma'i byed pa ni med do //
translated: But there is no operation of a valid cognition here.

original: sla'o zhes bya ba kho nas ni rtogs pa tshad ma dang ldan pa ma yin zhing dka'o zhes bya bas kyang bral ba ma yin te /
analyzed: sla'o zhes bya ba kho nas ni rtogs pa tshad ma dang ldan pa ma yin zhing dka'o zhes bya bas kyang bral ba ma yin te /
translated: You are not a valid cognizer just because you say it is easy, nor are you a valid cognizer just because you say it is difficult.

original: byed pa ma mthong ba'i bum pa la sogs pa la gzhan du mthong bas na /
analyzed: byed pa ma mthong ba'i bum pa la sogs pa la gzhan du mthong bas na /
translated: Because you see other things in a pot that is not seen,

original: rtogs par sla ba la chags pa khyod kyis byed pa po gcig tu brtag par bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtogs par sla ba la chags pa khyod kyis byed pa po gcig tu brtag par bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: you are attached to the easy to understand, and you should investigate the one who is the agent.

original: brda sprod pa'i mdor byas pa kho na dka' ba dang / zor yang pa'i bsam pa 'thad pa yin na khyed ni sngar ma byung ba'i tshad ma ba yin no //
analyzed: brda sprod pa'i mdor byas pa kho na dka' ba dang / zor yang pa'i bsam pa 'thad pa yin na khyed ni sngar ma byung ba'i tshad ma ba yin no //
translated: If the thought that the grammar of Panini is difficult and light is correct, then you are a new kind of valid cognizer.

original: 'dir yang de la gces su byed pas na ci zhig smrar yod /
analyzed: 'dir yang de la gces su byed pas na ci zhig smrar yod /
translated: Here, what can be said about you, who are so fond of that?

original: tha dad pa sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma med pa yang brtag par sla bas bshad zin to //
analyzed: tha dad pa sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma med pa yang brtag par sla bas bshad zin to //
translated: Also, it is easy to investigate the nonexistence of a valid cognition that establishes difference, so I have already explained it.

original: de'i phyir byed pa po gcig tu nges pa la thabs ci yang med cing /
analyzed: de'i phyir byed pa po gcig tu nges pa la thabs ci yang med cing /
translated: Therefore, there is no method at all for ascertaining the one who is the agent.

original: de ma nges par yang 'dod pas yul du byas pa'i thams cad shes pa nyid mi nges pas na /
analyzed: de ma nges par yang 'dod pas yul du byas pa'i thams cad shes pa nyid mi nges pas na /
translated: Also, without ascertaining that, since all objects of desire are not ascertained to be consciousness,

original: byed pa po'i sgrub byed thams cad ni 'dod pa'i bsgrub bya la ltos nas ldog pa la the tshom za ba yin no //
analyzed: byed pa po'i sgrub byed thams cad ni 'dod pa'i bsgrub bya la ltos nas ldog pa la the tshom za ba yin no //
translated: all proofs of the creator are uncertain with respect to the probandum of the opponent.

original: de'i phyir de ltar gzhan gyis rab tu sbyar ba'i dbang phyug gi sgrub byed rnams la kho bo cag 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba 'god pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar gzhan gyis rab tu sbyar ba'i dbang phyug gi sgrub byed rnams la kho bo cag 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba 'god pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, we do not posit an unmistaken contradiction with respect to the proofs of ƒ™≈õvara that are set forth by others.

original: 'on kyang sgrub byed sun 'byin pa kho na ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang sgrub byed sun 'byin pa kho na ste /
translated: However, we do refute the proofs.

original: mang du smra bas chog go //
analyzed: mang du smra bas chog go //
translated: Enough with much verbiage.

original: de'i phyir 'di sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma med cing gnod par byed pa ni kha na ma tho ba med par yod pas na 'dus byas byed pa po med par grub pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma med cing gnod par byed pa ni kha na ma tho ba med par yod pas na 'dus byas byed pa po med par grub pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, since there is no valid knowledge that proves this and there is no fault in refuting it, it is established that there is no creator of the produced.

original: de skad du yang /üîΩdbang phyug stsogs min rim stsogs phyir //
analyzed: de skad du yang / dbang phyug stsogs min rim stsogs phyir //
translated: As it has been said:

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because of sequence and so on, ƒ™≈õvara and so forth are not the cause.

original: 'on te ji ltar mdo sde pa rnams kyi rnam pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa don yul can yin pa de bzhin du 'di dag gi ltar na yang yin nam /
analyzed: 'on te ji ltar mdo sde pa rnams kyi rnam pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa don yul can yin pa de bzhin du 'di dag gi ltar na yang yin nam /
translated: Or, just as Sautrantikas assert that consciousness with aspects has objects as its domain, do they also assert this?

original: de lta ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang /üîΩrnam pa med pa'i dbang sku blos //üîΩrdul phran bsags pa dngos su rig / dbang po ste dbang byed pa rnams las skyes pa'i blo mngon sum zhes bya ba'i blo gros yul gyi rnam pa med pas /
analyzed: de lta ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang / rnam pa med pa'i dbang sku blos // rdul phran bsags pa dngos su rig / dbang po ste dbang byed pa rnams las skyes pa'i blo mngon sum zhes bya ba'i blo gros yul gyi rnam pa med pas /
translated: They do not assert this, but ratherüîΩthe mind that arises from the sense facultyüîΩdirectly cognizes the aggregation of atoms.

original: de dag gi bzhin rnam pas bar du tshod pa btags pa ltar ma yin par dngos su rdul phran te rdul phra rab bsags pa phung po'i rig ste shes pa yin gyi /üîΩgzhan gyi bzhin @39a * //
analyzed: de dag gi bzhin rnam pas bar du tshod pa btags pa ltar ma yin par dngos su rdul phran te rdul phra rab bsags pa phung po'i rig ste shes pa yin gyi / gzhan gyi bzhin @39a * //
translated: The mind that arises from the sense faculty, the dominant condition, is called direct perception. The mind that lacks the aspect of the object directly cognizes the aggregation of atoms, the object.

original: du yan lag can ni ma yin te /
analyzed: du yan lag can ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not like the mind of others that is blocked by the aspect of the object.üîΩIt is not like the mind of others that is blocked by the aspect of the object.

original: rdul phra rab rnams ni dbang po las 'das pa yin na ji ltar de dag snang du rung zhe na /
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams ni dbang po las 'das pa yin na ji ltar de dag snang du rung zhe na /
translated: If the mind directly cognizes the aggregation of atoms, how can it cognize the whole, since the mind and the whole are different?üîΩIf the mind directly cognizes the aggregation of atoms, how can it cognize the whole, since the mind and the whole are different?

original: de dag re re ba ni dbang po las 'das pa yin la rigs mthun pa gzhan dang lhan cig pa ni dbang po'i spyod yul du gyur pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de dag re re ba ni dbang po las 'das pa yin la rigs mthun pa gzhan dang lhan cig pa ni dbang po'i spyod yul du gyur pa kho na'o //
translated: Each of these is beyond the sense faculties, but when they are combined with other homogeneous things, they are then the domain of the sense faculties.

original: so sor snang du mi rung ba gang yin pa de dag 'dus kyang snang du mi rung ba'i nges pa ni med de /üîΩskra la sogs pa gram pa rnams thag ring po nas mi mthong ba yang /
analyzed: so sor snang du mi rung ba gang yin pa de dag 'dus kyang snang du mi rung ba'i nges pa ni med de / skra la sogs pa gram pa rnams thag ring po nas mi mthong ba yang /
translated: There is no certainty that what is not suitable to appear individually will not appear when combined.

original: sbam pa dmigs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩkha che bye brag smra ba'i gzhung //üîΩde ltar blo dang ldan rnams bzhed //
analyzed: sbam pa dmigs pa'i phyir ro // kha che bye brag smra ba'i gzhung // de ltar blo dang ldan rnams bzhed //
translated: For example, from a distance one does not see the individual hairs, but when they are combined, one sees the patch.üîΩAnd from a distance one does not see the individual sesame seeds, but when they are combined, one sees the pile.

original: kha che ba rnams kyi gzhung ste //üîΩmngon pa de lta de lta bu'i ngo bor blo dang ldan pa mkhas pa rnams bzhed de /
analyzed: kha che ba rnams kyi gzhung ste // mngon pa de lta de lta bu'i ngo bor blo dang ldan pa mkhas pa rnams bzhed de /
translated: The Kashmiri VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas assert that.

original: 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa yin no //
translated: The Kashmiri VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas assert that the nature of the elements is just as it appears to the mind.

original: 'o na mdo sde pa rnams kyi grub mtha' gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na mdo sde pa rnams kyi grub mtha' gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the SautrƒÅntika philosophical position?

original: rang gi rnam can shes skyes pa'i //
analyzed: rang gi rnam can shes skyes pa'i //
translated: The SautrƒÅntikas assert that the object is the cause of the arising of consciousness that has the aspect of that object.

original: dbang po spyod yul snang rung min //
analyzed: dbang po spyod yul snang rung min //
translated: The object is not the domain of the sense faculties.

original: mig la sogs pa dbang po rnams kyi spyod yul te gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams snang rung ste /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa dbang po rnams kyi spyod yul te gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams snang rung ste /
translated: The objects of the sense faculties such as the eyes, such as form, are suitable to appear.

original: rang bzhin ngo bos mthong du rung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin ngo bos mthong du rung ba ma yin no //
translated: They are not suitable to be seen by nature or essence.

original: gang gi phyir de dag ni rang dang 'dra ba'i rnam pa gang la yod pa shes pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag ni rang dang 'dra ba'i rnam pa gang la yod pa shes pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they exist in the aspect that is similar to consciousness.

original: de dag dbang po'i spyod yul ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: de dag dbang po'i spyod yul ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: How are they objects of the sense faculties?

original: de lta bur gyur pa yin pa na dbang po'i spyod yul nyid du tha snyad 'dogs so ;üîΩ/ mdo sde pa ltar bye brag tu smra ba'i rang bzhin du shes pa rnam pa med pa la gzugs la sogs pa gsal ba yin te /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa yin pa na dbang po'i spyod yul nyid du tha snyad 'dogs so ; / mdo sde pa ltar bye brag tu smra ba'i rang bzhin du shes pa rnam pa med pa la gzugs la sogs pa gsal ba yin te /
translated: When they become like that, they are designated as objects of the sense faculties.

original: de dag rang nyid gsal ba'i ngo bo ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag rang nyid gsal ba'i ngo bo ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Like Sautrantikas, Vaibhasikas assert that consciousness without aspect is clear with regard to form and so on because they are not by nature clear.

original: de'i ngo bo yin na ni sngon po nyid la sogs pa bzhin du shes pa la mi ltos par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo yin na ni sngon po nyid la sogs pa bzhin du shes pa la mi ltos par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If they were by nature clear, it would follow that they would not rely on consciousness, like blue and so on.

original: skad cig ma nyid ma yin na de'i bdag nyid ni de dag nyid bzhin du shes pas byed pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang / don gzhan byed na yang de dag gi gnas skabs de yin pas snga mkho bzhin du gsal ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid ma yin na de'i bdag nyid ni de dag nyid bzhin du shes pas byed pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang / don gzhan byed na yang de dag gi gnas skabs de yin pas snga mkho bzhin du gsal ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were not momentary, then, since it would be the same as those, it would be untenable that it is produced by consciousness, and if it were to produce another object, then, since it would be the state of those, it would be untenable that it is clear as before.

original: skad cig ma yin na yang rtogs pa po thams cad thun mong bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma yin na yang rtogs pa po thams cad thun mong bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And if it were momentary, then all cognizers would be common.

original: de'i phyir mi gsal ba kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi gsal ba kho na'o //
translated: Therefore it is not clear.

original: phyi rol gyi sngon po la sogs pa ni shes pa 'di nyid sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam par gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi sngon po la sogs pa ni shes pa 'di nyid sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam par gsal ba yin no //
translated: External blue and so on are the clarity of this consciousness in the aspect of blue and so on.

original: gal te gsal ba shes pa kho na yin na de'i tshe phyi rol gyi don yod do zhes bya ba ga las she na /
analyzed: gal te gsal ba shes pa kho na yin na de'i tshe phyi rol gyi don yod do zhes bya ba ga las she na /
translated: If clarity is consciousness alone, then at that time how could it be said that external objects exist?

original: phyi rol ldog @39b pa las grub 'gyur //
analyzed: phyi rol ldog @39b pa las grub 'gyur //
translated: It is established by the exclusion of external objects.üîΩBecause the aspect of blue and so on is not always and everywhere apparent,

original: gang gi phyir sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa ni thams cad du thams cad kyi tshe snang ba ma yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa ni thams cad du thams cad kyi tshe snang ba ma yin la /
translated: and because it is not always and everywhere apparent, it is not external.

original: rang gi nye bar len pa tsam gyi stobs kyis 'byung ba yin pa 'di mi 'thad do //
analyzed: rang gi nye bar len pa tsam gyi stobs kyis 'byung ba yin pa 'di mi 'thad do //
translated: It is not tenable that they arise by the power of their own appropriation.

original: de'i phyir gang gi stobs kyis 'ga' zhig tu 'ga' zhig gi tshe 'gyur ba 'di dag la mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen las tha dad pa cung zad cig yod pa yin no zhes nges par nus pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang gi stobs kyis 'ga' zhig tu 'ga' zhig gi tshe 'gyur ba 'di dag la mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen las tha dad pa cung zad cig yod pa yin no zhes nges par nus pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is possible to ascertain that these transformations, which occur in some places and at some times by the power of some things, are not different from the condition as the equivalent and immediate antecedent.

original: ci ste ci 'di dag gi ltar na snga ma rnams kyi bzhin du 'dus ma byas yod pa yin nam /
analyzed: ci ste ci 'di dag gi ltar na snga ma rnams kyi bzhin du 'dus ma byas yod pa yin nam /
translated: But if, like the former, they exist as unconditioned,

original: med de / 'di ltar 'di dag gi ltar na //
analyzed: med de / 'di ltar 'di dag gi ltar na //
translated: then, according to you,

original: nam mkha' mo gsham bu bzhin te //
analyzed: nam mkha' mo gsham bu bzhin te //
translated: space is like the barren woman‚Äôs son,

original: 'gog pa gnyis ni nam mkha' 'dra //
analyzed: 'gog pa gnyis ni nam mkha' 'dra //
translated: and the two cessations are like space.

original: nam mkha' ni yod pa ma yin pa nyid kyis mo gsham gyi bu dang mtshungs shing /
analyzed: nam mkha' ni yod pa ma yin pa nyid kyis mo gsham gyi bu dang mtshungs shing /
translated: Space is like the barren woman‚Äôs son because it does not exist.

original: 'gog pa gnyis kyang de lta bu'i nam mkha' dang 'dra zhing bsgres pa yin te /
analyzed: 'gog pa gnyis kyang de lta bu'i nam mkha' dang 'dra zhing bsgres pa yin te /
translated: The two cessations are like space, which is like the barren woman‚Äôs son.

original: de dag kyang med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dag kyang med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they do not exist.

original: thogs pa dang bcas pa'i rdzas med pa tsam nam mkha' yin gyi nam mkha' zhes bya ba ci yang med do //
analyzed: thogs pa dang bcas pa'i rdzas med pa tsam nam mkha' yin gyi nam mkha' zhes bya ba ci yang med do //
translated: Space is the mere absence of obstructive contact, but it is not anything at all called ‚Äúspace.‚Äù

original: gang na thogs pa dang bcas pa'i rdzas yod pa der ni nam mkha' go mi 'byed la /
analyzed: gang na thogs pa dang bcas pa'i rdzas yod pa der ni nam mkha' go mi 'byed la /
translated: Where there is obstructive contact, space does not pervade.

original: gang na med par ni de med pa nyid kyis 'byed ba grub pas na /
analyzed: gang na med par ni de med pa nyid kyis 'byed ba grub pas na /
translated: Where there is no obstructive contact, space is established by the absence of obstructive contact.

original: nam mkha' gang du go 'byed par byed /
analyzed: nam mkha' gang du go 'byed par byed /
translated: So where does space pervade?

original: des na de yod pa thams cad la thams cad du go skabs yod par 'gyur la /
analyzed: des na de yod pa thams cad la thams cad du go skabs yod par 'gyur la /
translated: If it did, then space would pervade everything, everywhere.

original: de yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But that is not the case.

original: de bas na nam mkha' med pa nyid do zhes bya bar khong du chud do //
analyzed: de bas na nam mkha' med pa nyid do zhes bya bar khong du chud do //
translated: Therefore, understand that space does not exist.

original: so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa yang dpyad na mi 'thad do //
analyzed: so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa yang dpyad na mi 'thad do //
translated: The refutation of the nonanalytical cessation

original: de ni nyon mongs pa 'gog par 'dod la /
analyzed: de ni nyon mongs pa 'gog par 'dod la /
translated: You assert that the nonanalytical cessation is the cessation of the afflictions.

original: skyes pa rnams kyi gzhan gyis 'jig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: skyes pa rnams kyi gzhan gyis 'jig pa ma yin te /
translated: But it is not destroyed by other conditions,

original: de'i rgyu med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has no cause.

original: rgyu dang ldan pa yin yang lam kho na rgyu yin la /
analyzed: rgyu dang ldan pa yin yang lam kho na rgyu yin la /
translated: Even if it had a cause, the path alone would be its cause.

original: de kho na nyon mongs pa 'gog pa yin pas na de zhog cig / ma skyes pa rnams kyi yang rgyu tshang ba yin na skyes pa'i gegs ga la yod /
analyzed: de kho na nyon mongs pa 'gog pa yin pas na de zhog cig / ma skyes pa rnams kyi yang rgyu tshang ba yin na skyes pa'i gegs ga la yod /
translated: If the causes of those afflictions that have not yet arisen are complete, how could there be an obstruction to their arising?

original: de lta yin yang gegs byed pa na so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa thams cad kyi tshe yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta yin yang gegs byed pa na so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa thams cad kyi tshe yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Even though that is so, if there is an obstruction, then since it exists at all times when there is analytical cessation,

original: nam yang nyon mongs pa mi skyes pa'i phyir 'khor ba med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nam yang nyon mongs pa mi skyes pa'i phyir 'khor ba med par 'gyur ro //
translated: samsara would not exist because afflictions would never arise.

original: rgyu ma tshang na yang nyes pa rnams rang nyid mi 'byung bas na de la 'gog pas ci byed /
analyzed: rgyu ma tshang na yang nyes pa rnams rang nyid mi 'byung bas na de la 'gog pas ci byed /
translated: If the causes are incomplete, then faults do not arise by themselves, so what is the point of cessation?

original: de nyid kyi rgyu ma tshang ba yin na 'das ma thag pa'i thal ba yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi rgyu ma tshang ba yin na 'das ma thag pa'i thal ba yin no //
translated: If the causes of that are incomplete, then the consequence is that they have just passed.

original: @40a * // 'di ni so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: @40a * // 'di ni so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is the explanation of nonanalytical cessation.

original: ci 'di dag gi ltar na snga ma rnams kyis bzhin du mtshungs par mi ldan pa'i 'du byed yod dam /üîΩrigs min 'du byed yod ma yin //
analyzed: ci 'di dag gi ltar na snga ma rnams kyis bzhin du mtshungs par mi ldan pa'i 'du byed yod dam / rigs min 'du byed yod ma yin //
translated: Do they have nonassociated formative factors as the past masters did?üîΩThey do not have nonassociated formative factors.

original: rigs min te rtogs pa'i ngo bo ma yin /
analyzed: rigs min te rtogs pa'i ngo bo ma yin /
translated: They are not rational, not the nature of realization.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba las ma gtogs pa /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba las ma gtogs pa /
translated: Apart from mind and mental factors,

original: thob pa dang ma thob pa dang skal ba dang mnyam pa nyid dang ming gi tshogs la sogs pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: thob pa dang ma thob pa dang skal ba dang mnyam pa nyid dang ming gi tshogs la sogs pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: there is no attainment, nonattainment, similarity of lot, collection of names, and so on.

original: rigs min zhes bshad pas na tshor ba la sogs par mtshungs par ldan pa rnams mi dgag ste /
analyzed: rigs min zhes bshad pas na tshor ba la sogs par mtshungs par ldan pa rnams mi dgag ste /
translated: Since it is explained that they are not logical, concomitant states such as feeling are not refuted.üîΩFeeling, intention, discernment,

original: tshor dang sems pa 'du shes dang ; /'dun dang reg dang blo gros dran //
analyzed: tshor dang sems pa 'du shes dang ; /'dun dang reg dang blo gros dran //
translated: attention, contact, and volition,üîΩresolve, mindfulness,

original: yid la byed mo mos pa dang // ting 'dzin sems can thams cad la //üîΩzhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: yid la byed mo mos pa dang // ting 'dzin sems can thams cad la // zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: concentration, and wisdom exist for all minds.

original: thob pa la sogs pa'i sun 'byin pa ni bstan bcos gzhan las khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: thob pa la sogs pa'i sun 'byin pa ni bstan bcos gzhan las khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: The refutation of attainment and so on should be understood from other treatises.

original: gzhung mangs pas 'jigs pas 'dir ni mi bri'o //
analyzed: gzhung mangs pas 'jigs pas 'dir ni mi bri'o //
translated: I will not write about them here for fear of being too verbose.

original: ci 'di dag gi ltar na thams cad yod par smra ba rnams kyi chos ma 'ongs pa'i dus nas 'phos nas da ltar gyi dus su 'ong la da ltar nas 'das par ro zhes rnam par 'jog pa na bu yin nam /üîΩma yin te /
analyzed: ci 'di dag gi ltar na thams cad yod par smra ba rnams kyi chos ma 'ongs pa'i dus nas 'phos nas da ltar gyi dus su 'ong la da ltar nas 'das par ro zhes rnam par 'jog pa na bu yin nam / ma yin te /
translated: Are they not sons of the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas?

original: dus rjes su ma rjes su 'jug pa med //
analyzed: dus rjes su ma rjes su 'jug pa med //
translated: The past and future do not exist in the same way as the present.

original: ma 'ongs pa la sogs pa ni dus gsum yin la /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa la sogs pa ni dus gsum yin la /
translated: The past and future are the three times.

original: de'i rjes su 'jug pa ste /üîΩdngos po rnams rjes su 'gro ba de dag gi ltar na yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'jug pa ste / dngos po rnams rjes su 'gro ba de dag gi ltar na yod pa ma yin te /
translated: They follow the past and future,

original: skad cig mar 'jig pas dngos po thams cad la khyab pa'i phyir dang / dus su 'pho ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig mar 'jig pas dngos po thams cad la khyab pa'i phyir dang / dus su 'pho ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: but according to them, things do not exist in the past and future because they are pervaded by momentary destruction and because there is no transference to another time.

original: gang yang bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyis rnam par rig byed ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i gzugs bcu gcig pa 'dod de /üîΩg-yengs dang sems med pa la yang //
analyzed: gang yang bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyis rnam par rig byed ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i gzugs bcu gcig pa 'dod de / g-yengs dang sems med pa la yang //
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas assert an eleventh type of form called nonindicative form.üîΩIt is the virtue and nonvirtue

original: dge dang mi dge rjes 'brel gang //
analyzed: dge dang mi dge rjes 'brel gang //
translated: that follow the distracted and mindless.

original: 'byung ba che rnams rgyur byas pa //
analyzed: 'byung ba che rnams rgyur byas pa //
translated: It is derived from the great elements.

original: de ni rnam rig byed min brjod //
analyzed: de ni rnam rig byed min brjod //
translated: That is called non-revealing form.

original: ces bya ba de yang 'di dag gi ltar na yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ces bya ba de yang 'di dag gi ltar na yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But according to them, that does not exist because:

original: thogs pa med pa'i gzugs yod min //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: thogs pa med pa'i gzugs yod min // zhes gsungs so //
translated: Form without obstruction does not exist.

original: thogs pa ste rang gi yul du gzhan 'byung ba'i gegs byed pa rnam par rig byed ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i gzugs gang la med pa de yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: thogs pa ste rang gi yul du gzhan 'byung ba'i gegs byed pa rnam par rig byed ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i gzugs gang la med pa de yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Obstruction is the prevention of the arising of another object in its place. Form without obstruction does not exist.

original: med pa yin la /
analyzed: med pa yin la /
translated: It does not exist.

original: 'di'i yang sun 'byin pa gzhan du @40b btsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di'i yang sun 'byin pa gzhan du @40b btsal bar bya'o //
translated: The refutation of that should be sought elsewhere.

original: skad cig ma nyid dang bdag nyid med pa nyid dang byed pa po med par rdul phran bsags pa'i gzugs te /
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid dang bdag nyid med pa nyid dang byed pa po med par rdul phran bsags pa'i gzugs te /
translated: Form is the accumulation of atoms, which is momentary, without self and without an agent.

original: ma bkag pa gang yin pa de ni 'di dag kyang 'dod pa kho na yin te /üîΩgzhan gyi tshig ma bkag pa ni /
analyzed: ma bkag pa gang yin pa de ni 'di dag kyang 'dod pa kho na yin te / gzhan gyi tshig ma bkag pa ni /
translated: That which is not refuted is accepted by them.

original: 'dod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rigs pa yin no /
analyzed: 'dod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rigs pa yin no /
translated: It is logical to accept that which is not refuted by the words of others.

original: de ltar mdo sde'i sgo nas spyod pa'i mdo sde rnams kyis rtogs te shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar mdo sde'i sgo nas spyod pa'i mdo sde rnams kyis rtogs te shes pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is understood through the sutras, the sutras of the Bodhisattvas.

original: ji ste rnal 'byor spyod pa rnams ci ltar brjod ce na /
analyzed: ji ste rnal 'byor spyod pa rnams ci ltar brjod ce na /
translated: But what do the Yogacaras say?

original: brjod pa yan lag can zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: brjod pa yan lag can zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The Yogacaras say that the expression ‚Äúpossessing parts‚Äù is a conventional expression.

original: yod min rdul phran rnams kyang med //
analyzed: yod min rdul phran rnams kyang med //
translated: The parts do not exist, nor do the partless things.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa rnams ni khams gsum pa 'di rnam par rig pa tsam yin la phyi rol gyi don ni nam mkha'i padma'i rang bzhin can yin no zhes smra'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa rnams ni khams gsum pa 'di rnam par rig pa tsam yin la phyi rol gyi don ni nam mkha'i padma'i rang bzhin can yin no zhes smra'o //
translated: The Yogacaras say that the three realms are mind only, and that external objects are like the nature of a sky flower.

original: phyi rol gyi don yang gzhan gyi yon tan dang rdzas la sogs pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa mang por brtags pa yin la /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don yang gzhan gyi yon tan dang rdzas la sogs pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa mang por brtags pa yin la /
translated: External objects are also imagined to be manifold by the differences of the qualities, substances, etc.

original: de la yon tan la sogs pa chos rnams kyi rten rdzas yin te /üîΩde bkag pa nyid kyis de dag drungs phyung bar 'gyur bas na gud du sun dbyung bas brtag par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de la yon tan la sogs pa chos rnams kyi rten rdzas yin te / de bkag pa nyid kyis de dag drungs phyung bar 'gyur bas na gud du sun dbyung bas brtag par mi bya'o //
translated: Among them, substance is the basis of the qualities, etc.üîΩSince the refutation of that will eradicate them, it is not necessary to refute them separately.

original: du ba can med na 'du ba yod pa ma yin pas na de'i sun 'byung ba yang rjes su mi bya'o //
analyzed: du ba can med na 'du ba yod pa ma yin pas na de'i sun 'byung ba yang rjes su mi bya'o //
translated: Since there is no smoke without fire, the refutation of that is not undertaken.

original: rdzas kyang sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha' dang dus dang phyogs dang bdag dang yid ces bya ba rnam pa dgu yin no //
analyzed: rdzas kyang sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha' dang dus dang phyogs dang bdag dang yid ces bya ba rnam pa dgu yin no //
translated: direction, self, and mind.

original: de la bdag ni sngar nyid du bkag zin to //
analyzed: de la bdag ni sngar nyid du bkag zin to //
translated: The self has already been refuted.

original: nam mkha' ni sgra'i yon tan can du 'dod la /
analyzed: nam mkha' ni sgra'i yon tan can du 'dod la /
translated: Space is held to be the quality of sound.

original: de yang gcig yin pas na yul mtshungs pa'i phyir sgra thams cad bye brag tu thos par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang gcig yin pas na yul mtshungs pa'i phyir sgra thams cad bye brag tu thos par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But since it is one, all sounds would be heard distinctly, because of the similarity of the object.

original: de'i phyir yul thag nye ba bzhin du yul thag ring bar 'dod pas kyang thos pa'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir yul thag nye ba bzhin du yul thag ring bar 'dod pas kyang thos pa'am /
translated: Therefore, even if one wishes to hear a distant sound as if it were near,

original: yang na gzhan nas kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: yang na gzhan nas kyang ma yin no //
translated: it would not be heard from another place.

original: phyogs dang dus kyang gcig yin pa'i phyir snga ma dang phyi ma la sogs pa'i rtogs pa mi 'thad do //
analyzed: phyogs dang dus kyang gcig yin pa'i phyir snga ma dang phyi ma la sogs pa'i rtogs pa mi 'thad do //
translated: And because direction and time are one, the understanding of earlier and later, etc., is not tenable.

original: khyad par du byed pa'i bye brag gis rtogs pa'i dbye ba 'di yin no zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par du byed pa'i bye brag gis rtogs pa'i dbye ba 'di yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the distinction of understanding is due to the distinction of the qualifier,

original: ci khyad par du byed pa rnams kyi snga ma dang phyi ma rang las yin nam /
analyzed: ci khyad par du byed pa rnams kyi snga ma dang phyi ma rang las yin nam /
translated: is the earlier and later of the qualifiers from itself or from another?

original: 'on te gzhan las yin phyogs dang po la de nyid las rtogs pa de grub pa'i phyir de dag don med do //
analyzed: 'on te gzhan las yin phyogs dang po la de nyid las rtogs pa de grub pa'i phyir de dag don med do //
translated: But if it is from another, then the first position is that it is from itself, because that is established.

original: gnyis pa la ni gal te de de dag nyid las yin na /
analyzed: gnyis pa la ni gal te de de dag nyid las yin na /
translated: In the second position, if it is from those very things,

original: de gcig yin pa'i phyir de dag mi srid do //
analyzed: de gcig yin pa'i phyir de dag mi srid do //
translated: then they are not possible, because it is one.

original: gzhan las yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan las yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is from another,

original: de dag don med pa gnas skabs de nyid yin no //
analyzed: de dag don med pa gnas skabs de nyid yin no //
translated: then those are meaningless.

original: bdag @41a * //
analyzed: bdag @41a * //
translated: The self is like the pervasion.

original: khyab pa bzhin du 'di dag khyab pa nyid dgag par bya'o //
analyzed: khyab pa bzhin du 'di dag khyab pa nyid dgag par bya'o //
translated: These pervasions should be refuted.

original: nam mkha' dang phyogs 'di dag gcig yin zhing /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang phyogs 'di dag gcig yin zhing /
translated: These directions and space are one,

original: lhan cig byed pa tshang ba dang ma tshang ba dag gi tshe yang rang bzhin khyad par med pa yin na /
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa tshang ba dang ma tshang ba dag gi tshe yang rang bzhin khyad par med pa yin na /
translated: and when the complete and incomplete collections of cooperating conditions are present, the nature is without distinction.

original: 'ga' zhig kho na'i tshe 'bras bu skyed par ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig kho na'i tshe 'bras bu skyed par ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: How could it be that it generates an effect at some point?

original: de ltar yang /üîΩde dag nus dang nus med pa //
analyzed: de ltar yang / de dag nus dang nus med pa //
translated: In that case,üîΩwhat is the nature of space

original: ngo bo nyid kyi gnas pa gang //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi gnas pa gang //
translated: that is inherently present as able or unable?

original: rtag phyir bsgyur du med pa la //
analyzed: rtag phyir bsgyur du med pa la //
translated: Since it is permanent, it cannot be changed.

original: gang gis de ni dgag par nus //
analyzed: gang gis de ni dgag par nus //
translated: By what is it possible to refute it?

original: zhe'o // yid smra ba rnams kyi yid ni gcig shes pa mi skye bas rjes su dpag par bya ba yin na /
analyzed: zhe'o // yid smra ba rnams kyi yid ni gcig shes pa mi skye bas rjes su dpag par bya ba yin na /
translated: The mind of the mind-talkers is inferred from the non-arising of a cognition of one thing.

original: gar mkhan la lta ba la sogs pa'i cig car ba'i shes pa ni nyams su myong ba kho na yin la /
analyzed: gar mkhan la lta ba la sogs pa'i cig car ba'i shes pa ni nyams su myong ba kho na yin la /
translated: But the simultaneous cognition of seeing a dancer, etc. is experienced.

original: de yod na ni 'di nam yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de yod na ni 'di nam yang mi 'thad do //
translated: And if that exists, this is never tenable.

original: des na nam mkha' la sogs pa ni med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: des na nam mkha' la sogs pa ni med pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, space, etc. are non-existent.

original: sa la sogs pa lhag lus pa yin la /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa lhag lus pa yin la /
translated: The remaining elements, earth, etc.

original: de dag kyang yan lag can dang rdul phra rab kyi bye brag rnam pa gnyis su 'dod do //
analyzed: de dag kyang yan lag can dang rdul phra rab kyi bye brag rnam pa gnyis su 'dod do //
translated: are asserted to be twofold, as wholes and as atoms.

original: de la rdul gnyis pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis rdul phra rab rnams kyis brtsams pa'i bum pa la sogs pa'i yan lag can gang yin pa de ni yod min te /
analyzed: de la rdul gnyis pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis rdul phra rab rnams kyis brtsams pa'i bum pa la sogs pa'i yan lag can gang yin pa de ni yod min te /
translated: Among them, the whole, such as a pot, etc. which is composed of atoms, beginning with a dyad, does not exist.

original: med pa nyid de /
analyzed: med pa nyid de /
translated: It is non-existent.

original: de dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the non-apprehension of its apprehension-mark.

original: de lta de ltar bkod pa yis //
analyzed: de lta de ltar bkod pa yis //
translated: Thus,

original: cha rnams nyid ni snang ba yin //
analyzed: cha rnams nyid ni snang ba yin //
translated: the parts themselves appear.

original: de dang ldan pa cha med pa //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa cha med pa //
translated: But the partless one possessing that is not perceived.

original: gzhan ni snang ba ma yin nyid //
analyzed: gzhan ni snang ba ma yin nyid //
translated: The other is not perceived either.

original: yan lag gcig kha bsgyur ba'am g-yo ba na /
analyzed: yan lag gcig kha bsgyur ba'am g-yo ba na /
translated: If one part is changed or moved,

original: de la 'dus pa de la de dag med pas na de la yang kham bsgyur ba dang g-yo ba med par dmigs par 'gyur zhing yod na gzhan la yang kha bsgyur ba dang g-yo ba dang bcas par dmigs par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la 'dus pa de la de dag med pas na de la yang kham bsgyur ba dang g-yo ba med par dmigs par 'gyur zhing yod na gzhan la yang kha bsgyur ba dang g-yo ba dang bcas par dmigs par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: then the composite would be perceived as not having that, and if it were, then it would follow that the other would be perceived as having that change or movement.

original: yan lag gcig bsgribs pa na de la yang ma bsgribs par dmigs par thal zhing /
analyzed: yan lag gcig bsgribs pa na de la yang ma bsgribs par dmigs par thal zhing /
translated: If one part is obstructed, then it would follow that it would be perceived as not obstructed.

original: bsgribs na gzhan la yang mi dmigs par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgribs na gzhan la yang mi dmigs par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were obstructed, then it would follow that the other would not be perceived.

original: bye brag pa rnams kyi ltar na de dag rtsom par byed pa dang / bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi lta ba ltar na dngos su dbang po'i spyod yul yin pa dang / mdo sde pa rnams kyi ltar na rang gi rnam pa 'jog par byed pa'i rdul phran gang yin pa de dag kyang med do //
analyzed: bye brag pa rnams kyi ltar na de dag rtsom par byed pa dang / bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi lta ba ltar na dngos su dbang po'i spyod yul yin pa dang / mdo sde pa rnams kyi ltar na rang gi rnam pa 'jog par byed pa'i rdul phran gang yin pa de dag kyang med do //
translated: The Vaiseikas say that the atoms are the cause of the arising of the cognition of the composite, the Vaibhasikas say that the atoms are the actual object of the sense faculties, and the Sautrantikas say that the atoms are the cause of the arising of the cognition that posits its own aspect.

original: rdul phra rab ni gcig tu grub pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rdul phra rab ni gcig tu grub pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But an atom cannot be established as one,

original: steng 'og dang phyogs bzhi dbus na gnas pa'i rdul phran de nges par @41b cha drug tu 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: steng 'og dang phyogs bzhi dbus na gnas pa'i rdul phran de nges par @41b cha drug tu 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that atom located above, below, in the four directions, and in the middle would definitely have six parts.

original: 'di'i shar gyi rdul phran la nye ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de nyid rdul phran gzhan la nye ba mi 'thad de /
analyzed: 'di'i shar gyi rdul phran la nye ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de nyid rdul phran gzhan la nye ba mi 'thad de /
translated: The nature of being near to the eastern atom is not tenable as being near to another atom,

original: de dag yul gcig tu 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag yul gcig tu 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they would be in the same place.

original: de ltar na shar gyi rdul phran la nye ba'i rang bzhin gyis gal te rdul phran gzhan la nye na de yang de na yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na shar gyi rdul phran la nye ba'i rang bzhin gyis gal te rdul phran gzhan la nye na de yang de na yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, if the nature of being near to the eastern atom is near to another atom, then that would also exist there.

original: 'byar ba med kyang mngon du phyogs pa tsam la yang tshul 'di nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'byar ba med kyang mngon du phyogs pa tsam la yang tshul 'di nyid yin no //
translated: Even if they are not joined, this method is the same for mere facing.

original: des na gong bu rdul phra rab tsam du 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: des na gong bu rdul phra rab tsam du 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, the mass would become the size of an atom.üîΩEven if joined, they would occupy different places,

original: 'byar yang yul gzhan gnas pa dang // bar med rnam par gnas kyang rung //
analyzed: 'byar yang yul gzhan gnas pa dang // bar med rnam par gnas kyang rung //
translated: or they would be situated without interstice.

original: dbus gnas rdul phran rdul gcig la //
analyzed: dbus gnas rdul phran rdul gcig la //
translated: The atom in the middle would be

original: lta ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa //
analyzed: lta ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa //
translated: What is the nature of the view?

original: rang bzhin gzhan la lta ba yang //
analyzed: rang bzhin gzhan la lta ba yang //
translated: The view is not the nature of another.

original: gal te de nyid yin rtogs na //üîΩde lta yin na ri la sogs //
analyzed: gal te de nyid yin rtogs na // de lta yin na ri la sogs //
translated: If it is realized to be just that,üîΩthen it is not reasonable that a mountain, etc.

original: bsags pa rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bsags pa rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: is an aggregation.

original: zhes gang bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gang bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is what is explained.

original: de'i phyir gdon mi za bar de dag rang bzhin tha dad par khas blangs dgos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gdon mi za bar de dag rang bzhin tha dad par khas blangs dgos so //
translated: Therefore, one must accept that they are necessarily different in nature.

original: de dag ji lta ba de kho na bzhin du byang dang / lho dang / steng dang / 'og gi rdul phra rab nye ba'i rang bzhin rnams tha dad pas na /
analyzed: de dag ji lta ba de kho na bzhin du byang dang / lho dang / steng dang / 'og gi rdul phra rab nye ba'i rang bzhin rnams tha dad pas na /
translated: Just as they are, the eastern, southern, upper, and lower subtle particles that are proximate are different in nature.

original: rdul phra rab cha drug nyid nan gyis thob po //
analyzed: rdul phra rab cha drug nyid nan gyis thob po //
translated: Therefore, one is forced to accept that the subtle particle has six parts.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: drug gis cig car sbyar ba na //
analyzed: drug gis cig car sbyar ba na //
translated: When six are simultaneously joined,

original: phra rab rdul cha drug tu 'gyur //
analyzed: phra rab rdul cha drug tu 'gyur //
translated: the subtle particle has six parts.

original: drug po go gcig yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: drug po go gcig yin pa'i phyir //
translated: Because the six are in one place,

original: gong bu rdul phran tsam du 'gyur //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gong bu rdul phran tsam du 'gyur // zhes gsungs so //
translated: the aggregate is just the size of a subtle particle.

original: gcig ma grub pa na du ma 'grub pa ma yin pas na /
analyzed: gcig ma grub pa na du ma 'grub pa ma yin pas na /
translated: Since one is not established, many are not established.

original: rdul phra rab rnams med pa yin no //
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, subtle particles do not exist.

original: spyod pa pa rnams rdul phra rab nges par 'dod pa ma yin pas na /
analyzed: spyod pa pa rnams rdul phra rab nges par 'dod pa ma yin pas na /
translated: Since the proponents of perceptual parity do not assert the existence of partless particles,

original: rdul phra rab sun phyung pa tsam gyis yan lag can bkag pa yin pas na gud du de sun 'byin pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: rdul phra rab sun phyung pa tsam gyis yan lag can bkag pa yin pas na gud du de sun 'byin pa med pa yin no //
translated: the mere refutation of partless particles also refutes the existence of wholes.

original: gal te phyi rol gyi don med na /
analyzed: gal te phyi rol gyi don med na /
translated: If external objects do not exist,

original: 'o na snang ba 'di ci'i yul can yin zhe na /üîΩsnang ba dmigs pa med pa yin /
analyzed: 'o na snang ba 'di ci'i yul can yin zhe na / snang ba dmigs pa med pa yin /
translated: what is the object of this appearance?üîΩThis appearance is devoid of an object.

original: snang ba 'di ni yul dang bral ba yin te /
analyzed: snang ba 'di ni yul dang bral ba yin te /
translated: This appearance is devoid of an object.

original: 'di'i yul la brgal zhing brtag pa ci yod /
analyzed: 'di'i yul la brgal zhing brtag pa ci yod /
translated: What is there to investigate and analyze in its object?

original: yul med na blo skye bar mi 'dod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: yul med na blo skye bar mi 'dod pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it the case that you do not assert that cognition arises in the absence of an object?

original: de na snang ba 'di dmigs pa med par mi rigs so zhe na /
analyzed: de na snang ba 'di dmigs pa med par mi rigs so zhe na /
translated: So it is illogical for this appearance to be devoid of an object.

original: mi rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mi rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not illogical.

original: yul yod pa na dmigs pa dang bcas par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: yul yod pa na dmigs pa dang bcas par 'gyur zhing /
translated: If an object exists, then it would have to be observed.

original: de yang yan lag can nam rdul phran bsags pa yin dgos na /
analyzed: de yang yan lag can nam rdul phran bsags pa yin dgos na /
translated: Moreover, it would have to be either a whole or a collection of particles.

original: de gnyi ga yang bshad ma thag pa'i gnod @42a * //
analyzed: de gnyi ga yang bshad ma thag pa'i gnod @42a * //
translated: Both of these have been refuted as just explained.

original: byed kyi tshad mas gzung ba'i lus can yin pas nam mkha'i padma dang khyad par med do //
analyzed: byed kyi tshad mas gzung ba'i lus can yin pas nam mkha'i padma dang khyad par med do //
translated: Because it is a body that is grasped by a valid cognition, it is not different from a lotus in the sky.

original: des na rnam par shes pa yul med pa nyid 'di nan gyis 'ongs pas na mi 'dod pas bzlog par mi nus so //
analyzed: des na rnam par shes pa yul med pa nyid 'di nan gyis 'ongs pas na mi 'dod pas bzlog par mi nus so //
translated: Therefore, since this non-objectivity of consciousness is forcefully imposed, it cannot be averted by those who do not accept it.

original: 'di yi phyir yang snang ba 'di //
analyzed: 'di yi phyir yang snang ba 'di //
translated: For this reason, this appearance

original: dmigs pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa yin te /
translated: is also without an object,

original: rmi lam nyams su myong dang mtshungs //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rmi lam nyams su myong dang mtshungs // zhes gsungs so //
translated: like the experience of a dream.

original: rmi lam ni gnyid yin la /
analyzed: rmi lam ni gnyid yin la /
translated: A dream is sleep,

original: der sngon po la sogs pa'i rtog pa nyams su myong ba gang yin pa de dang snang ba 'di mtshungs shing 'dra ba yin na /
analyzed: der sngon po la sogs pa'i rtog pa nyams su myong ba gang yin pa de dang snang ba 'di mtshungs shing 'dra ba yin na /
translated: and whatever experience of the conception of blue, etc. there is, that is similar to this appearance.

original: don med pa ci ltar ma yin /
analyzed: don med pa ci ltar ma yin /
translated: How is it not without an object?

original: rnam par shes pa bye brag med par dmigs pa la nges pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa bye brag med par dmigs pa la nges pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not ascertained that consciousness without distinction has an object,

original: rmi lam gyi shes pas 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi shes pas 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the consciousness of a dream is mistaken.

original: rmi lam gyi shes pa dmigs pa med par rigs pa kho na yin la /
analyzed: rmi lam gyi shes pa dmigs pa med par rigs pa kho na yin la /
translated: It is only reasonable that the consciousness of a dream is without an object.

original: rmi lam dang / sad pa'i myong ba la khyad par 'ga' yang med de /
analyzed: rmi lam dang / sad pa'i myong ba la khyad par 'ga' yang med de /
translated: There is no difference at all between the experience of dreams and the experience of the waking state,

original: rnam pa thams cad du chos mthun par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du chos mthun par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because in every way they are seen to be similar.

original: dmigs pa med pa las khyad par mthong ba'i rnam par shes pa ni dmigs pa dang 'brel par mi rigs so //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa las khyad par mthong ba'i rnam par shes pa ni dmigs pa dang 'brel par mi rigs so //
translated: And it is not reasonable that a consciousness that is seen to be different from the non-existent object is related to an object.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig dmigs pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa las khyad par med pa de ni dmigs pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig dmigs pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa las khyad par med pa de ni dmigs pa med pa yin te /
translated: The application is this: that which is not different from a consciousness that has no object does not have an object,

original: dper na nam mkha'i skra shad mthong ba gcig las gnyis pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha'i skra shad mthong ba gcig las gnyis pa bzhin no //
translated: just like the second vision of the hair-net in the sky is not different from the first.

original: rtsod pa'i gzhi sad pa'i rnam par shes pa yang dmigs pa med pa'i rmi lam gyi shes pa dang khyad par med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: rtsod pa'i gzhi sad pa'i rnam par shes pa yang dmigs pa med pa'i rmi lam gyi shes pa dang khyad par med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The basis of the dispute is that the waking consciousness is not different from the dream consciousness that has no object. This is the natural argument.

original: ji ste rmi lam la sogs pa'i shes pa'i yang dmigs pa dang bcas pa kho na ste /
analyzed: ji ste rmi lam la sogs pa'i shes pa'i yang dmigs pa dang bcas pa kho na ste /
translated: But if you say that even the consciousness of dreams and so on has an object,

original: yul gzhan la sogs par mthong ba des shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul gzhan la sogs par mthong ba des shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the object is seen in another place and so on.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: rmi lam la sogs shes pa la //
analyzed: rmi lam la sogs shes pa la //
translated: ‚ÄúThe consciousness of dreams and so on

original: phyi rol med par yod mi 'dod //
analyzed: phyi rol med par yod mi 'dod //
translated: is not accepted as existing without an external object.

original: kun tu dmigs pa phyi rol te //
analyzed: kun tu dmigs pa phyi rol te //
translated: The object of perception is external,

original: yul dus gzhan gyis bdag nyid can //üîΩzhes gang smras pa yin no //
analyzed: yul dus gzhan gyis bdag nyid can // zhes gang smras pa yin no //
translated: having the nature of being in another place and time.‚Äù

original: des na khyad par ma grub pa'i phyir 'di ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs yin zhing /
analyzed: des na khyad par ma grub pa'i phyir 'di ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs yin zhing /
translated: Therefore, since the distinction is not established, this is a reason that is not established.

original: dpe yang bsgrub bya sgrub byed kyi chos ma tshang ba yin no snyam na /
analyzed: dpe yang bsgrub bya sgrub byed kyi chos ma tshang ba yin no snyam na /
translated: And the example is incomplete with respect to the property to be established and the property that establishes.

original: de ni mi bden te /
analyzed: de ni mi bden te /
translated: That is not correct,

original: rmi lam la sogs pa shes pa'i dmigs pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'di ltar 'dzin pa'i ngo bo 'am /
analyzed: rmi lam la sogs pa shes pa'i dmigs pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro // 'di ltar 'dzin pa'i ngo bo 'am /
translated: because the object of perception of consciousness in dreams and so on is untenable.

original: dran pa'i ngo bo yin grang na /
analyzed: dran pa'i ngo bo yin grang na /
translated: In this regard, is it the nature of the apprehender or the nature of memory?

original: de la re zhig 'dzin pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig 'dzin pa ni ma yin te /
translated: First, it is not the nature of the apprehender,

original: 'dzin pa ni sngon gzung ba la mi @42b ltos pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dzin pa ni sngon gzung ba la mi @42b ltos pa'i phyir /
translated: because the apprehender does not depend on a prior object.

original: sngon mthong ba'i yul 'dzin pa'i nges pa med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sngon mthong ba'i yul 'dzin pa'i nges pa med par 'gyur te /
translated: There would be no certainty that the object seen previously is apprehended,

original: mthong ba gzhan bzhin no //
analyzed: mthong ba gzhan bzhin no //
translated: just as it is seen in another way.

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir dang / da ltar byung ba'i yul can yin pa'i phyir dang / gsal bar snang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir dang / da ltar byung ba'i yul can yin pa'i phyir dang / gsal bar snang ba'i phyir /
translated: Because it is nonconceptual, because it has present objects and because it is clear.üîΩ

original: 'di dran pa'i ngo bor yang brtag pa rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di dran pa'i ngo bor yang brtag pa rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable to consider it to be memory, because it is nonconceptual, because it has a present object, and because it is a clear appearance.

original: de'i phyir 'di ji ltar yul gzhan la sogs par mthong ba'i dngos po'i yul can yin zhes bya ba mi shes so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ji ltar yul gzhan la sogs par mthong ba'i dngos po'i yul can yin zhes bya ba mi shes so //
translated: Therefore, how can it be said that it has as its object a thing that is seen elsewhere?

original: gzhan yang rnam par shes pa thams cad dmigs pa dang bcas pa yin na 'ga' yang tshad ma yin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam par shes pa thams cad dmigs pa dang bcas pa yin na 'ga' yang tshad ma yin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, if all consciousnesses have an object, then none of them can be a valid cognition.

original: rnam pa gzhan du 'dzin pas na tshad ma ma yin pa yin no zhe na ;
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du 'dzin pas na tshad ma ma yin pa yin no zhe na ;
translated: If you say that it is not a valid cognition because it apprehends in a different way,

original: gal te rang gi ngo bor gzung na ji ltar rnam pa gzhan du yin /
analyzed: gal te rang gi ngo bor gzung na ji ltar rnam pa gzhan du yin /
translated: then if it apprehends its own nature, how can it be a different way?

original: 'on te gzhan gyi ngo bor 'dzin na gzhan gyi ngo bo snang bas ni gzhan kho na 'dzin pa yin gyis /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan gyi ngo bor 'dzin na gzhan gyi ngo bo snang bas ni gzhan kho na 'dzin pa yin gyis /
translated: But if it apprehends another nature, then it is only the appearance of another nature that is apprehended.

original: de ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni ma yin no //
translated: That is not so.

original: gzhan gyi ngo bo 'dzin pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan gyi ngo bo 'dzin pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not that it apprehends another nature,

original: gzhan gyi tshul du'o zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshul du'o zhe na /
translated: but it is as if it were another.

original: gal te de rang gi ngo bo snang ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te de rang gi ngo bo snang ba yin na /
translated: If it is the appearance of its own entity,

original: de 'o na gzhan gyi tshul du ci ltar yin /
analyzed: de 'o na gzhan gyi tshul du ci ltar yin /
translated: then how could it be in the manner of another?

original: ci ste ma yin na 'di de'i yin par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: ci ste ma yin na 'di de'i yin par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: If it is not, then how could it be that of that?

original: yul dang dus gzhan du rang gi ngo bo 'dzin pa nyid rnam pa gzhan 'dzin pa yin gyi /
analyzed: yul dang dus gzhan du rang gi ngo bo 'dzin pa nyid rnam pa gzhan 'dzin pa yin gyi /
translated: If it is the apprehension of its own entity in another place and time, it is the apprehension of another aspect.

original: gzhan gyi ngo bo ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi ngo bo ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: It is not the apprehension of another entity.

original: de mi rigs te /
analyzed: de mi rigs te /
translated: That is illogical.

original: dngos po 'di yul dang dus gang dang 'brel pa'i ngo bo yin pa yul dang dus de dang 'brel pa kho nar gzung bar bya bar 'gyur la de lta na yang de yul dang dus gzhan du yongs su gcod par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: dngos po 'di yul dang dus gang dang 'brel pa'i ngo bo yin pa yul dang dus de dang 'brel pa kho nar gzung bar bya bar 'gyur la de lta na yang de yul dang dus gzhan du yongs su gcod par ga la 'gyur /
translated: If this entity is related to a place and time, it is related to that place and time alone and must be apprehended. But if that is so, how could it be ascertained in another place and time?

original: de med na yang rnam par shes pa thams cad ji ltar gnas pa'i dngos po'i 'dzin pa yin pas na tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa'i rnam par dbye ba zhig par 'gyur ro//
analyzed: de med na yang rnam par shes pa thams cad ji ltar gnas pa'i dngos po'i 'dzin pa yin pas na tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa'i rnam par dbye ba zhig par 'gyur ro//
translated: If it is not, then since all consciousnesses are the apprehension of an existent thing, the distinction between valid knowledge and invalid knowledge would be destroyed.

original: gzhan yang yul dang dus gang du rmi lam la sogs pa'i shes pas don rtogs pa'i yul dang dus de na ni med la gang na yod pa der ni ma rtogs pas na 'di dmigs pa dang 'brel par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan yang yul dang dus gang du rmi lam la sogs pa'i shes pas don rtogs pa'i yul dang dus de na ni med la gang na yod pa der ni ma rtogs pas na 'di dmigs pa dang 'brel par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: Moreover, the object realized by the consciousness of a dream, etc. is not in the place and time of the dream, etc. and it is not realized in the place where it is. Therefore, how could it be related to its object?

original: snang ba kho na yul yin par rigs na mi snang ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: snang ba kho na yul yin par rigs na mi snang ba ni ma yin te /
translated: If it is logical that the appearance itself is the object, it is not the nonappearance.

original: de yang dmigs pa yin na dmigs pa nges pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang dmigs pa yin na dmigs pa nges pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, if it is the object, it is not tenable that the object is ascertained.

original: snang ba kho na yul yin mod kyi gzhan du ni yin no zhe na /üîΩci gang du snang ba de gzhan du yin nam /
analyzed: snang ba kho na yul yin mod kyi gzhan du ni yin no zhe na / ci gang du snang ba de gzhan du yin nam /
translated: If you say that the appearance itself is the object, but it is different,üîΩis it the case that what appears is different?

original: 'on te mi snang ba zhig yin /üîΩde la re zhig de na gzhan yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: 'on te mi snang ba zhig yin / de la re zhig de na gzhan yod pa ma yin la /
translated: Or is it the case that it is not an appearance?üîΩFirst, it is not that it exists as different.

original: de ltar yin na rnam pa gzhan du snang ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar yin na rnam pa gzhan du snang ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If that were the case, it would not be tenable that it appears in another aspect.

original: @43a * // snang ba lus med pa ni gang la yang brten pa ma yin te /
analyzed: @43a * // snang ba lus med pa ni gang la yang brten pa ma yin te /
translated: The appearance that is without a body does not depend on anything,

original: lus can 'gro ba'i gegs ni rten yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lus can 'gro ba'i gegs ni rten yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because the obstruction of the body of migrating beings is a basis.

original: nam yang rten gzhan dang 'brel pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nam yang rten gzhan dang 'brel pa ma yin te /
translated: It is never related to another basis,

original: thams cad du bdag nyid rten yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad du bdag nyid rten yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is always the basis itself.

original: yul dang dus gzhan rten yin yang yul de'i cir yang ma yin pas na /
analyzed: yul dang dus gzhan rten yin yang yul de'i cir yang ma yin pas na /
translated: Even if the object and time were the basis, since it is not anything in that place,

original: rang gi yul dang dus na gnas pa kho na snang bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: rang gi yul dang dus na gnas pa kho na snang bar 'gyur la /
translated: it would appear only in its own place and time.

original: de lta na yang rnam pa gzhan du snang ba ci ltar yin /
