analyzed: de lta na yang rnam pa gzhan du snang ba ci ltar yin /
translated: But how can it appear in another aspect?

original: de ltar ma yin na med pa snang ba kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na med pa snang ba kho na yin gyi /
translated: If it were not so, it would be only nonexistence that appears,

original: rnam pa gzhan du snang ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du snang ba ma yin no //
translated: but it would not appear in another aspect.

original: rnam pa gzhan du snang ba 'dod pas kyang nges par med pa snang ba khas blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du snang ba 'dod pas kyang nges par med pa snang ba khas blang bar bya ste /
translated: Even if you assert that it appears in another aspect, you must definitely accept that nonexistence appears,

original: rnam pa thams cad du yod pa snang na rnam pa gzhan du snang ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du yod pa snang na rnam pa gzhan du snang ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because if existence appears in every way, it is not tenable that it appears in another aspect.

original: yul dang dus gzhan dang 'brel pa med kyang snang ngo zhe na /
analyzed: yul dang dus gzhan dang 'brel pa med kyang snang ngo zhe na /
translated: If you say that it appears even though it is not related to another place and time,

original: gal te 'di srid pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'di srid pa yin na /
translated: if this were possible,

original: 'brel pa can yang med pa snang ba yin mod /
analyzed: 'brel pa can yang med pa snang ba yin mod /
translated: then even if the related object does not exist, it would appear.

original: de lta na 'jig rten gyi rtogs pa dang yang mthun pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta na 'jig rten gyi rtogs pa dang yang mthun pa yin te /
translated: In that case, it is also in accord with mundane knowledge.

original: 'jig rten ni 'brel pa can med pa kho na rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten ni 'brel pa can med pa kho na rtogs pa yin te /
translated: The world knows that what is related does not exist,

original: dper na smig rgyu la med pa'i chu bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na smig rgyu la med pa'i chu bzhin no //
translated: like water in a mirage.

original: med pa ni gsal ba ma yin te /
analyzed: med pa ni gsal ba ma yin te /
translated: What does not exist is not manifest,

original: gang gi phyir nam mkha'i me tog mi mthong ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir nam mkha'i me tog mi mthong ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because one does not see a sky flower.

original: 'brel pa yang med pa snang bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'brel pa yang med pa snang bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: What is unrelated does not appear,

original: de lta na rnam pa gzhan du snang bar yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: de lta na rnam pa gzhan du snang bar yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: and if it did, it would not appear in another aspect.

original: de la yang nam mkha' me tog snang bar thal ba bzlog par dka' ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de la yang nam mkha' me tog snang bar thal ba bzlog par dka' ba'i phyir te /
translated: And it is difficult to avoid the consequence that a sky flower would appear,

original: rnam pa gzhan du snang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du snang ba ma yin te /
translated: because it is not manifest in another aspect.üîΩOne can say that,

original: gang gi phyir nam mkha'i me tog mi snang ba'i phyir ro zhes de skad du brjod par nus pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir nam mkha'i me tog mi snang ba'i phyir ro zhes de skad du brjod par nus pa yin no //
translated: because a sky flower is not manifest.

original: gzhan yang de nyid med par snang bar 'gyur ba 'brel pa na bzlog pa dang ldan par snang ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan yang de nyid med par snang bar 'gyur ba 'brel pa na bzlog pa dang ldan par snang ba ma yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, what is unrelated does not appear as related,

original: 'brel pa can de nyid yul dang dus gzhan la brten par snang ba yin la /
analyzed: 'brel pa can de nyid yul dang dus gzhan la brten par snang ba yin la /
translated: It is the very thing that is related that appears to be in another place and time.

original: de yang de lta bur med pas na de med pa kho na snang bar rigs pa yin na /
analyzed: de yang de lta bur med pas na de med pa kho na snang bar rigs pa yin na /
translated: And since it does not exist in that way, it is reasonable that it appears to be nonexistent.

original: su zhig gis de bzlog par nus /
analyzed: su zhig gis de bzlog par nus /
translated: Who can turn that around?

original: 'di las kyang med par snang ba bzlog par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di las kyang med par snang ba bzlog par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, the appearance of the nonexistent should not be turned around,

original: gang smig rgyu la sogs pa la chu la sogs pa'i shes pa zhugs pa na chu la sogs pa mi thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang smig rgyu la sogs pa la chu la sogs pa'i shes pa zhugs pa na chu la sogs pa mi thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because when the cognition of water, etc. engages with a mirage, etc., water, etc. is not obtained.

original: yod pa snang ba yin na 'di chu'i shes pa kho na yin pa na de la zhugs pa slu bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yod pa snang ba yin na 'di chu'i shes pa kho na yin pa na de la zhugs pa slu bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the existent appears, then this is just the cognition of water, and the engagement with it is not deceptive.

original: yul dang dus der nye ba mi 'thob pa yin no @43b zhe na ;
analyzed: yul dang dus der nye ba mi 'thob pa yin no @43b zhe na ;
translated: If you say that it is not obtained because it is not near in that place and time,

original: 'o na mthong bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na mthong bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then it is not seen.

original: de yul dang dus gzhan na yod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de yul dang dus gzhan na yod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not seen because it exists in another place and time,

original: thob par yang ci'i phyir mi 'gyur /
analyzed: thob par yang ci'i phyir mi 'gyur /
translated: then why is it not obtained?

original: yul dang dus gzhan du thob par mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: yul dang dus gzhan du thob par mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not possible to obtain it in another place and time,

original: mthong ba yang ji ltar nus /
analyzed: mthong ba yang ji ltar nus /
translated: then how is it possible to see it?

original: 'on te mthong bar nus na thob par ji ltar mi nus /
analyzed: 'on te mthong bar nus na thob par ji ltar mi nus /
translated: But if it can be seen, then why can‚Äôt it be obtained?

original: ji ltar thob pa dngos po yod pa'i rgyu mtshan can yin pa de bzhin du mthong ba yang yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar thob pa dngos po yod pa'i rgyu mtshan can yin pa de bzhin du mthong ba yang yin no //
translated: Just as obtaining has a reason for existing, so too does seeing.

original: de'i phyir mthong ba la ltos nas yod na thob pa la ltos nas ci'i phyir med /
analyzed: de'i phyir mthong ba la ltos nas yod na thob pa la ltos nas ci'i phyir med /
translated: Therefore, if it exists in dependence on seeing, why wouldn‚Äôt it exist in dependence on obtaining?

original: ji ste yod na ci'i phyir ma thob /
analyzed: ji ste yod na ci'i phyir ma thob /
translated: If it exists, why isn‚Äôt it obtained?

original: 'on te med na ci'i phyir snang /
analyzed: 'on te med na ci'i phyir snang /
translated: If it doesn‚Äôt exist, why does it appear?

original: gzhan du yod pa thob pa ma mthong ngo zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan du yod pa thob pa ma mthong ngo zhe na /
translated: If you say that what exists elsewhere is not seen,

original: mthong ba yang ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: mthong ba yang ma mthong ngo //
translated: then seeing is not seen.

original: da lta kho na snang ngo zhe na /
analyzed: da lta kho na snang ngo zhe na /
translated: If you say that it appears only in the present,

original: thob pa yang ci'i phyir mi snang /
analyzed: thob pa yang ci'i phyir mi snang /
translated: then why doesn‚Äôt obtaining appear?

original: thob bya med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: thob bya med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that it doesn‚Äôt appear because there is nothing to be obtained,

original: blta bya yang mthong bya'i don las gzhan ma yin pas na de yod pa na de med pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: blta bya yang mthong bya'i don las gzhan ma yin pas na de yod pa na de med pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir /
translated: then the object of seeing is not different from the object of seeing, and if it exists, it is not tenable that it does not exist.

original: 'o na mthong ba yang mi snang ste /
analyzed: 'o na mthong ba yang mi snang ste /
translated: If you say that seeing does not appear,

original: gang gzu lums kyi 'dod pa la zhen pas chog go //
analyzed: gang gzu lums kyi 'dod pa la zhen pas chog go //
translated: then that is enough of this attachment to the whims of desire.

original: de'i phyir 'di na med pa snang ba kho na yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di na med pa snang ba kho na yin la /
translated: Therefore, it is only nonexistent things that appear.

original: med pa snang ba ni dmigs pa dang bcas par mi 'thad la /
analyzed: med pa snang ba ni dmigs pa dang bcas par mi 'thad la /
translated: It is untenable that an appearance that does not exist has an object.

original: de lta na yang gtan tshigs la sogs pa ma grub pa la sogs pa'i skyon ga la yod /
analyzed: de lta na yang gtan tshigs la sogs pa ma grub pa la sogs pa'i skyon ga la yod /
translated: So how can there be faults such as the reason and so on not being established?

original: 'on te gal te snang ba dmigs pa med pa yin na de yul la sogs pa nges par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'on te gal te snang ba dmigs pa med pa yin na de yul la sogs pa nges par mi 'gyur la /
translated: But if an appearance has no object, it would not ascertain an object and so on,

original: rgyu du ma thun mong bar mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: rgyu du ma thun mong bar mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: it would not be a common locus of many causes,

original: bya ba byed pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: bya ba byed pa yang ma yin te /
translated: and it would not perform a function.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: gal te rnam rig don min na //
analyzed: gal te rnam rig don min na //
translated: If cognition has no object,

original: yul dang dus la nges med cing //
analyzed: yul dang dus la nges med cing //
translated: it would not be ascertained with respect to object and time,

original: sems kyang nges med ma yin la //
analyzed: sems kyang nges med ma yin la //
translated: and it would not be ascertained with respect to mind,

original: bya ba byed pa 'ang mi rigs 'gyur //üîΩzhes gang bshad pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: bya ba byed pa 'ang mi rigs 'gyur // zhes gang bshad pa yin no zhe na /
translated: and it would not be suitable to perform a function.

original: de ni mi bden te /
analyzed: de ni mi bden te /
translated: That is not correct.

original: gang gi phyir /üîΩrmi lam nyams su myong dang mtshungs //
analyzed: gang gi phyir / rmi lam nyams su myong dang mtshungs //
translated: Because:üîΩIt is similar to the experience of a dream.

original: snang ba zhes bya bar snyegs so //
analyzed: snang ba zhes bya bar snyegs so //
translated: It is similar to the experience of a dream.

original: don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: snang ba 'di ni rmi lam gyi nyams su myong ba dang mtshungs par don med pa yin la /
analyzed: snang ba 'di ni rmi lam gyi nyams su myong ba dang mtshungs par don med pa yin la /
translated: This appearance is like the experience of a dream in that it is devoid of objects.

original: des na de dang mtshungs par yul dang dus nges pa la sogs pa mi 'thad pa med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: des na de dang mtshungs par yul dang dus nges pa la sogs pa mi 'thad pa med pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, there is no inconsistency in the determination of place, time, and so on.

original: 'di ltar yul la sogs pa nges pa'i phyi'i dngos po med kyang rmi lam gyi nyams su myong bas yul la sogs pa nges par myong ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar yul la sogs pa nges pa'i phyi'i dngos po med kyang rmi lam gyi nyams su myong bas yul la sogs pa nges par myong ba yin no //
translated: Even though external things such as place do not exist, the experience of a dream is the experience of a determined place and so on.

original: de yang brgyud nas phyi rol kho na rgyu mtshan yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de yang brgyud nas phyi rol kho na rgyu mtshan yin no zhe na /
translated: And that is only indirectly a reason for external things.

original: de rgyu mtshan yin du chug mod /
analyzed: de rgyu mtshan yin du chug mod /
translated: Even if that is a reason,

original: yul la sogs pa nges pa ni de'i @44a * //
analyzed: yul la sogs pa nges pa ni de'i @44a * //
translated: the determination of place and so on

original: rgyu mtshan can du bsgrub par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan can du bsgrub par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: cannot be established as having that as a reason.

original: gal te phyi rol yul la sogs pa gang du nye ba de nyid du rmi lam na de snang ba 'di nges pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa zhig na /
analyzed: gal te phyi rol yul la sogs pa gang du nye ba de nyid du rmi lam na de snang ba 'di nges pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa zhig na /
translated: If the reason for the determination of the appearance of a place and so on in a dream is the proximity of an external place and so on,

original: de lta ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ni ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: ma 'khrul ba nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'khrul ba nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that it is nonerroneous.

original: de stong yang 'ga' zhig kho nar de snang ba na des nges pa'i rgyu mtshan can du rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de stong yang 'ga' zhig kho nar de snang ba na des nges pa'i rgyu mtshan can du rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: But if it is empty, and it appears to some as that, it is not reasonable to have a reason for ascertaining it.

original: gal te de bdag nyid kyis stong par snang ba bskyed na khyad par med pa'i phyir gar rung rung du bskyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de bdag nyid kyis stong par snang ba bskyed na khyad par med pa'i phyir gar rung rung du bskyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it generates the appearance of being empty by itself, then it would generate it anywhere, because there is no distinction.

original: dngos po thun mong ba med kyang sems thun mong dmigs te /
analyzed: dngos po thun mong ba med kyang sems thun mong dmigs te /
translated: Even though there is no common object, the mind is common.

original: gang gi tshe gnyis mtshungs par rmi lam rmi ba na'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe gnyis mtshungs par rmi lam rmi ba na'o //
translated: When two people have the same dream.

original: rmi lam smos pa ni shes pa 'khrul pa mtshon pa yin te /
analyzed: rmi lam smos pa ni shes pa 'khrul pa mtshon pa yin te /
translated: The mention of dreams illustrates mistaken consciousness.

original: zla ba gnyis su snang ba la sogs pa 'khrul pa'i shes pa gzhan la /
analyzed: zla ba gnyis su snang ba la sogs pa 'khrul pa'i shes pa gzhan la /
translated: In other mistaken consciousnesses, such as the appearance of two moons,

original: sems nges pa med par mthong ba nyid do //
analyzed: sems nges pa med par mthong ba nyid do //
translated: the mind is seen to be without any certainty.

original: der zla ba gcig la sogs pa'i ngo bo'i don kho na thun mong ba yod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: der zla ba gcig la sogs pa'i ngo bo'i don kho na thun mong ba yod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: In that case, the object that has the nature of a single moon and so on is common.

original: zla ba la sogs pa yod mod /
analyzed: zla ba la sogs pa yod mod /
translated: The moon and so on exist.

original: re zhig gnyis la sogs pa'i ngo bo ni med la /
analyzed: re zhig gnyis la sogs pa'i ngo bo ni med la /
translated: But the nature of two and so on does not exist.

original: de yang 'dir dbang po'i nyes pa mtshungs pa'i rgyud can gyi nges pa med par myong na /
analyzed: de yang 'dir dbang po'i nyes pa mtshungs pa'i rgyud can gyi nges pa med par myong na /
translated: Moreover, if one experiences the absence of a definite cause for the fault of the sense organ,

original: zla ba gcig la sogs pa yod par brjod pa des ci zhig bya /
analyzed: zla ba gcig la sogs pa yod par brjod pa des ci zhig bya /
translated: what is the use of saying that it exists for one month and so on?

original: gang la don dang 'brel pa'i dri yang med par skra shad la sogs pa snang ba der thabs ci zhig yod /
analyzed: gang la don dang 'brel pa'i dri yang med par skra shad la sogs pa snang ba der thabs ci zhig yod /
translated: What method is there for the appearance of floating hair and so on in the absence of a smell related to the object?

original: de bzhin du phyi rol med kyang rmi lam na bya ba byed pa snang ba nyid de /
analyzed: de bzhin du phyi rol med kyang rmi lam na bya ba byed pa snang ba nyid de /
translated: Likewise, external objects do not exist, but the performance of functions appears in dreams.

original: ji ltar sad pa'i gnas skabs na chu'i rgyu mtshan can gyi btung ba dang / rkyal pa la sogs pa dang de dang 'brel pa'i skom pa zhi ba la sogs pa'i don bya ba dngos su byed pa de kho na bzhin du rmi lam gyi gnas skabs na yang yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar sad pa'i gnas skabs na chu'i rgyu mtshan can gyi btung ba dang / rkyal pa la sogs pa dang de dang 'brel pa'i skom pa zhi ba la sogs pa'i don bya ba dngos su byed pa de kho na bzhin du rmi lam gyi gnas skabs na yang yin no //
translated: Just as in the waking state, the performance of the function of drinking water, swimming, and so on, which are the causes of water, and the function of quenching thirst and so on, which are related to them, are real, so too they are real in the dream state.

original: des na ji ltar na rmi lam na phyi rol med par yul nges pa la sogs par 'gyur ba de bzhin du sad pa'i gnas skabs na yang yin pa la 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: des na ji ltar na rmi lam na phyi rol med par yul nges pa la sogs par 'gyur ba de bzhin du sad pa'i gnas skabs na yang yin pa la 'gal ba med do //
translated: Therefore, just as in a dream, in the absence of external objects, the ascertainment of objects and so on occurs, so too in the waking state there is no contradiction.

original: rmi lam gyi gnas skabs na chu'i 'byung ba de dag med pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rmi lam gyi gnas skabs na chu'i 'byung ba de dag med pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But in the waking state, those elements of water do not exist.

original: de las cir 'gyur /
analyzed: de las cir 'gyur /
translated: What follows from that?

original: bden pa rnams de dang chos mthun par mi 'grub po zhe na /
analyzed: bden pa rnams de dang chos mthun par mi 'grub po zhe na /
translated: The truths are not established as being similar to that.

original: mi bden pa dang / khyad par med pa ji ltar bden pa yin /
analyzed: mi bden pa dang / khyad par med pa ji ltar bden pa yin /
translated: If they are not non-deceptive, how can they be true?

original: rmi lam na snang ba rnams mi bden pa nyid kyang ga las sad pa'i shes pas gnod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rmi lam na snang ba rnams mi bden pa nyid kyang ga las sad pa'i shes pas gnod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because the appearances in a dream are not true, they are undermined by the consciousness of the waking state.

original: gnod pa zhes bya ba 'di ci yin /
analyzed: gnod pa zhes bya ba 'di ci yin /
translated: What is this so-called undermining?

original: mi bden par shes par byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: mi bden par shes par byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: It is the knowledge that they are not true.

original: rang @44b gi yul bsgrub pa ni shes pa chos yin la /
analyzed: rang @44b gi yul bsgrub pa ni shes pa chos yin la /
translated: The dharma of the wise is to establish their own domain.

original: gzhan gyi yul 'phrog pa ni mi'i bdag po rnams kyi chos yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi yul 'phrog pa ni mi'i bdag po rnams kyi chos yin no //
translated: The dharma of the lords of men is to take away the domain of others.

original: des na sad pa'i shes pa 'dis rmi lam gyi gnas skabs kyi yul med pa ji ltar sgrub par byed /
analyzed: des na sad pa'i shes pa 'dis rmi lam gyi gnas skabs kyi yul med pa ji ltar sgrub par byed /
translated: So how does this consciousness of the waking state establish the nonexistence of the objects of the dream state?

original: de skad du /üîΩgal te gzhan gyi yul med par //
analyzed: de skad du / gal te gzhan gyi yul med par //
translated: As it is said:üîΩIf you assert that it is the consciousness

original: shes par byed pa yin 'dod na //
analyzed: shes par byed pa yin 'dod na //
translated: that establishes the nonexistence of the other object,

original: rang don 'jug ldan shes pa yis //
analyzed: rang don 'jug ldan shes pa yis //
translated: then the consciousness that engages with its own object

original: med par ji ltar shes par byed //üîΩces bshad do //
analyzed: med par ji ltar shes par byed // ces bshad do //
translated: How can it be known that it does not exist?

original: des mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: des mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is because it is the nature of non-apprehension,

original: 'o na rmi lam gyi shes pas kyang sad pa'i mthong ba la snang ba rnams med par sgrub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na rmi lam gyi shes pas kyang sad pa'i mthong ba la snang ba rnams med par sgrub par 'gyur te /
translated: then the consciousness in a dream would establish the non-existence of what is seen when awake,

original: de dag kyang des mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang des mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because those [objects seen when awake] are also of the nature of non-apprehension by that [dream consciousness].

original: ji ltar sad pa'i shes pa rang gi yul la dmigs pa 'ba' zhig tu zad pa de kho na bzhin du rmi lam gyis shes pa rnams kyang yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar sad pa'i shes pa rang gi yul la dmigs pa 'ba' zhig tu zad pa de kho na bzhin du rmi lam gyis shes pa rnams kyang yin no //
translated: Just as the consciousness when awake only apprehends its own objects, so too are the consciousnesses in a dream.

original: ji ste rmi lam du rmis pa rnams sad na dmigs pa rnams la med pas mi shes pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ji ste rmi lam du rmis pa rnams sad na dmigs pa rnams la med pas mi shes pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that when one awakens from a dream, one does not know the objects seen in the dream because they do not exist,

original: 'di ni blun pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni blun pa nyid yin no //
translated: that is just foolishness.

original: 'gro ba la sogs pa la gegs mi byed pa yin pas na /
analyzed: 'gro ba la sogs pa la gegs mi byed pa yin pas na /
translated: Because it does not obstruct going and so on,

original: bya ba nyid kyis med par bsgrubs pa gtso bo yin na /
analyzed: bya ba nyid kyis med par bsgrubs pa gtso bo yin na /
translated: if the absence of action itself establishes non-existence,

original: rnam par rtog pas bsgrub par bya ba gzhan gyis ci bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pas bsgrub par bya ba gzhan gyis ci bya ste /
translated: what need is there for another to be established by conceptual thought?

original: bshad pa mdzad pas /
analyzed: bshad pa mdzad pas /
translated: The author of the commentary explains:

original: des na 'di dag med nyid du //
analyzed: des na 'di dag med nyid du //
translated: Therefore, they are shown to be nonexistent

original: bya ba nyid kyis bstan pa yin //
analyzed: bya ba nyid kyis bstan pa yin //
translated: by the very fact that they are objects of activity.üîΩThey exist for those who are not obstructed

original: de dag 'gro sogs gegs med pa //üîΩde dag la ni yod pa yin //üîΩzhes gang gsungs pa yin no //üîΩsad pa na snang ba dang rung ba nyid du mtshungs pa ma yin pa'i gnyid log pa na snang ba'i dmigs pas de dag med par sgrub par mi nus so zhe na /
analyzed: de dag 'gro sogs gegs med pa // de dag la ni yod pa yin // zhes gang gsungs pa yin no // sad pa na snang ba dang rung ba nyid du mtshungs pa ma yin pa'i gnyid log pa na snang ba'i dmigs pas de dag med par sgrub par mi nus so zhe na /
translated: from going and so on.üîΩIf you say that it is not the same in the case of waking consciousness, because the objects of waking consciousness are similar to the objects of dreams in being nonexistent, but are not similar to the objects of dreams in being perceptible, we reply that it is not possible to establish the nonexistence of the objects of dreams on the ground that they are not perceptible.

original: sad pa la snang du rang ba'i mthong bas kyang rmi lam na snang ba rnams med par mi sgrub bo //
analyzed: sad pa la snang du rang ba'i mthong bas kyang rmi lam na snang ba rnams med par mi sgrub bo //
translated: The objects of waking consciousness, which are perceptible, do not establish the nonexistence of the objects of dreams.

original: 'khrul pa'i shes pas ma gzung yang sad pa la snang ba rnams med pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i shes pas ma gzung yang sad pa la snang ba rnams med pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the objects of waking consciousness exist, because they are perceived by nonerroneous consciousnesses, but the objects of dreams do not exist, because they are perceived by erroneous consciousnesses,

original: gnyid log pa rnams kyang de ltar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyid log pa rnams kyang de ltar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: we reply that the same would not be true of those who are asleep.

original: sad pa'i shes pa ma 'khrul ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: sad pa'i shes pa ma 'khrul ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the consciousness of the waking state is nonerroneous,üîΩwe reply that it is not.
